Filing Status
documents.text:
There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every individual...
a tax determined in accordance with the following table
documents.code:
input filing_status:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Enum(FilingStatus)
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: "Tax filing status determining applicable rate schedule"

# 26 USC Section 1 - Tax Imposed (Ordinary Income Tax)
#
text: """
There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every individual...
a tax determined in accordance with the following table
"""

# Federal income tax bracket thresholds - 26 USC 1(a)-(d), indexed per 1(f)
# Base values from TCJA (P.L. 115-97), indexed amounts from IRS Rev. Proc.

parameter bracket_thresholds_single:
  description: "Income tax bracket thresholds for single filers"
  indexed_by: statute/26/1/f
  values:
    2018: [0, 9_525, 38_700, 82_500, 157_500, 200_000, 500_000]
    2019: [0, 9_700, 39_475, 84_200, 160_725, 204_100, 510_300]
    2020: [0, 9_875, 40_125, 85_525, 163_300, 207_350, 518_400]
    2021: [0, 9_950, 40_525, 86_375, 164_925, 209_425, 523_600]
    2022: [0, 10_275, 41_775, 89_075, 170_050, 215_950, 539_900]
    2023: [0, 11_000, 44_725, 95_375, 182_100, 231_250, 578_125]
    2024: [0, 11_600, 47_150, 100_525, 191_950, 243_725, 609_350]

parameter bracket_thresholds_married_filing_jointly:
  description: "Income tax bracket thresholds for married filing jointly"
  indexed_by: statute/26/1/f
  values:
    2018: [0, 19_050, 77_400, 165_000, 315_000, 400_000, 600_000]
    2019: [0, 19_400, 78_950, 168_400, 321_450, 408_200, 612_350]
    2020: [0, 19_750, 80_250, 171_050, 326_600, 414_700, 622_050]
    2021: [0, 19_900, 81_050, 172_750, 329_850, 418_850, 628_300]
    2022: [0, 20_550, 83_550, 178_150, 340_100, 431_900, 647_850]
    2023: [0, 22_000, 89_450, 190_750, 364_200, 462_500, 693_750]
    2024: [0, 23_200, 94_300, 201_050, 383_900, 487_450, 731_200]

parameter bracket_thresholds_married_filing_separately:
  description: "Income tax bracket thresholds for married filing separately"
  indexed_by: statute/26/1/f
  values:
    2018: [0, 9_525, 38_700, 82_500, 157_500, 200_000, 300_000]
    2019: [0, 9_700, 39_475, 84_200, 160_725, 204_100, 306_175]
    2020: [0, 9_875, 40_125, 85_525, 163_300, 207_350, 311_025]
    2021: [0, 9_950, 40_525, 86_375, 164_925, 209_425, 314_150]
    2022: [0, 10_275, 41_775, 89_075, 170_050, 215_950, 323_925]
    2023: [0, 11_000, 44_725, 95_375, 182_100, 231_250, 346_875]
    2024: [0, 11_600, 47_150, 100_525, 191_950, 243_725, 365_600]

parameter bracket_thresholds_head_of_household:
  description: "Income tax bracket thresholds for head of household filers"
  indexed_by: statute/26/1/f
  values:
    2018: [0, 13_600, 51_800, 82_500, 157_500, 200_000, 500_000]
    2019: [0, 13_850, 52_850, 84_200, 160_700, 204_100, 510_300]
    2020: [0, 14_100, 53_700, 85_500, 163_300, 207_350, 518_400]
    2021: [0, 14_200, 54_200, 86_350, 164_900, 209_400, 523_600]
    2022: [0, 14_650, 55_900, 89_050, 170_050, 215_950, 539_900]
    2023: [0, 15_700, 59_850, 95_350, 182_100, 231_250, 578_100]
    2024: [0, 16_550, 63_100, 100_500, 191_950, 243_700, 609_350]

parameter bracket_thresholds_qualifying_widow:
  description: "Income tax bracket thresholds for qualifying surviving spouse"
  indexed_by: statute/26/1/f
  values:
    # Same as married filing jointly per 26 USC 1(a)
    2018: [0, 19_050, 77_400, 165_000, 315_000, 400_000, 600_000]
    2019: [0, 19_400, 78_950, 168_400, 321_450, 408_200, 612_350]
    2020: [0, 19_750, 80_250, 171_050, 326_600, 414_700, 622_050]
    2021: [0, 19_900, 81_050, 172_750, 329_850, 418_850, 628_300]
    2022: [0, 20_550, 83_550, 178_150, 340_100, 431_900, 647_850]
    2023: [0, 22_000, 89_450, 190_750, 364_200, 462_500, 693_750]
    2024: [0, 23_200, 94_300, 201_050, 383_900, 487_450, 731_200]

parameter bracket_rates:
  description: "Marginal tax rates for each income bracket"
  values:
    # Statutory rates from TCJA, effective 2018-2025
    2018: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]
    2019: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]
    2020: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]
    2021: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]
    2022: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]
    2023: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]
    2024: [0.10, 0.12, 0.22, 0.24, 0.32, 0.35, 0.37]

# Composite brackets parameter for use in formulas
parameter brackets:
  description: "Federal income tax brackets (composite)"
  values:
    thresholds_by_filing_status:
      SINGLE: bracket_thresholds_single
      JOINT: bracket_thresholds_married_filing_jointly
      SEPARATE: bracket_thresholds_married_filing_separately
      HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD: bracket_thresholds_head_of_household
      QUALIFYING_WIDOW: bracket_thresholds_qualifying_widow
    rates: bracket_rates

variable income_tax_before_credits:
  imports:
    - 26/63/a#taxable_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Income Tax Before Credits"
  description: "Federal income tax on ordinary income before credits per 26 USC Section 1"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if taxable_income <= 0:
        return 0
    return marginal_agg(taxable_income, brackets, threshold_by=filing_status)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, zero taxable income"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer, negative taxable income (capped at 0)"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -5_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer, $10k in 10% bracket"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 10_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # All $10k at 10%: $10,000 * 0.10 = $1,000
      expect: 1000
    - name: "Single filer, $30k spanning 10% and 12% brackets"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 30_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $20,475 at 12%: $2,457.00
      # Total: $3,409.50
      expect: 3409.50
    - name: "Single filer, $50k spanning multiple brackets"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 50_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $29,175 at 12%: $3,501.00
      # $11,300 at 22%: $2,486.00
      # Total: $6,939.50
      expect: 6939.50
    - name: "Single filer, high income in top bracket"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 600_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # Progressive calculation across all brackets
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $29,175 at 12%: $3,501.00
      # $43,800 at 22%: $9,636.00
      # $75,000 at 24%: $18,000.00
      # $42,500 at 32%: $13,600.00
      # $300,000 at 35%: $105,000.00
      # $100,000 at 37%: $37,000.00
      # Total: $187,689.50
      expect: 187689.50
    - name: "Married filing jointly, zero taxable income"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 0
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing jointly, $40k in 10% bracket"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 40_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      # All $40k at 10%: $40,000 * 0.10 = $4,000
      expect: 4000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, $100k spanning 10% and 12%"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 100_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      # $19,050 at 10%: $1,905.00
      # $58,350 at 12%: $7,002.00
      # $22,600 at 22%: $4,972.00
      # Total: $13,879.00
      expect: 13879.00
    - name: "Married filing jointly, high income"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 500_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      # Progressive calculation across all brackets
      # $19,050 at 10%: $1,905.00
      # $58,350 at 12%: $7,002.00
      # $87,600 at 22%: $19,272.00
      # $150,000 at 24%: $36,000.00
      # $85,000 at 32%: $27,200.00
      # $200,000 at 35%: $70,000.00
      # Total: $161,379.00
      expect: 161379.00
    - name: "Head of household, $25k in lower brackets"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 25_000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      # $13,600 at 10%: $1,360.00
      # $11,400 at 12%: $1,368.00
      # Total: $2,728.00
      expect: 2728.00
    - name: "Head of household, $60k spanning brackets"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 60_000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      # $13,600 at 10%: $1,360.00
      # $38,200 at 12%: $4,584.00
      # $8,200 at 22%: $1,804.00
      # Total: $7,748.00
      expect: 7748.00
    - name: "Married filing separately, $25k"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 25_000
        filing_status: SEPARATE
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $15,475 at 12%: $1,857.00
      # Total: $2,809.50
      expect: 2809.50
    - name: "Married filing separately, high income"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 250_000
        filing_status: SEPARATE
      # Progressive calculation across all brackets
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $29,175 at 12%: $3,501.00
      # $43,800 at 22%: $9,636.00
      # $75,000 at 24%: $18,000.00
      # $42,500 at 32%: $13,600.00
      # $50,000 at 35%: $17,500.00
      # Total: $63,189.50
      expect: 63189.50
    - name: "Qualifying widow, $80k"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 80_000
        filing_status: QUALIFYING_WIDOW
      # Same brackets as married filing jointly
      # $19,050 at 10%: $1,905.00
      # $58,350 at 12%: $7,002.00
      # $2,600 at 22%: $572.00
      # Total: $9,479.00
      expect: 9479.00
    - name: "Single filer at bracket boundary (threshold)"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 9_525
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # Exactly at 10% bracket ceiling: $9,525 * 0.10 = $952.50
      expect: 952.50
    - name: "Single filer just over bracket boundary"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 9_526
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $1 at 12%: $0.12
      # Total: $952.62
      expect: 952.62
    - name: "Joint filer at second bracket boundary"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 77_400
        filing_status: JOINT
      # $19,050 at 10%: $1,905.00
      # $58,350 at 12%: $7,002.00
      # Total: $8,907.00
      expect: 8907.00
    - name: "Single filer, $1 taxable income"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # $1 at 10%: $0.10
      expect: 0.10
    - name: "Very high income single filer (top bracket)"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 1_000_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # Progressive calculation across all 7 brackets
      # $9,525 at 10%: $952.50
      # $29,175 at 12%: $3,501.00
      # $43,800 at 22%: $9,636.00
      # $75,000 at 24%: $18,000.00
      # $42,500 at 32%: $13,600.00
      # $300,000 at 35%: $105,000.00
      # $500,000 at 37%: $185,000.00
      # Total: $335,689.50
      expect: 335689.50

variable income_tax_before_credits_vectorized:
  imports:
    - 26/63/a#taxable_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Income Tax Before Credits (Vectorized)"
  description: "Vectorized implementation for microsimulation"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return marginal_agg(taxable_income, brackets, threshold_by=filing_status)
  default: 0

variable total_federal_income_tax:
  imports:
    - 26/1#income_tax_before_credits
    - 26/1/h#capital_gains_tax
    - 26/55/a#alternative_minimum_tax
    - 26/1411/a#niit
    - 26/1401/a#self_employment_social_security_tax
    - 26/1401/b/1#self_employment_medicare_tax
    - 26/3101/b/2#additional_medicare_tax
    - 26/26#total_nonrefundable_credits
    - 26/6401/a#total_refundable_credits
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Federal Income Tax"
  description: "Final federal income tax liability (negative = refund) per 26 USC Section 1"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Self-employment tax aggregated from Person level
    se_ss_tax = sum(Person.self_employment_social_security_tax)
    se_medicare_tax = sum(Person.self_employment_medicare_tax)
    return (
        income_tax_before_credits
        + capital_gains_tax
        + alternative_minimum_tax
        + niit
        + se_ss_tax
        + se_medicare_tax
        + additional_medicare_tax
    )
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Ordinary income only, no other taxes or credits"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 5_000
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Ordinary income with capital gains"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 6_000
        capital_gains_tax: 1_500
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Ordinary income with self-employment tax"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 3_000
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 2_300
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 5300
    - name: "Ordinary income with net investment income tax"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 8_000
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 400
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 8400
    - name: "Ordinary income with additional Medicare tax"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 10_000
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 2000
        additional_medicare_tax: 145
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 12145
    - name: "All tax components combined"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 15_000
        capital_gains_tax: 2000
        alternative_minimum_tax: 500
        net_investment_income_tax: 400
        self_employment_tax: 3_000
        additional_medicare_tax: 200
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 21100
    - name: "High income with multiple tax components"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 50_000
        capital_gains_tax: 5_000
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 2000
        self_employment_tax: 5_000
        additional_medicare_tax: 450
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 62450
    - name: "Ordinary income with nonrefundable credits reducing tax"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 8_000
        capital_gains_tax: 1_000
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 3_000
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      # Tax before credits: $8,000 + $1,000 = $9,000
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $9,000 - $3,000 = $6,000
      expect: 6000
    - name: "Ordinary income with refundable credits"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 4_000
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 1_500
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 2000
        total_refundable_credits: 2000
      # Tax before credits: $4,000 + $1,500 = $5,500
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $5,500 - $2,000 = $3,500
      # Less refundable credits: $3,500 - $2,000 = $1,500
      expect: 1500
    - name: "Refundable credits exceed tax (negative refund)"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 2000
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 1_000
        total_refundable_credits: 3_000
      # Tax before credits: $2,000
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $2,000 - $1,000 = $1,000
      # Less refundable credits: $1,000 - $3,000 = -$2,000 (refund)
      expect: -2000
    - name: "Zero income, no taxes"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 0
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Zero income with refundable credits only"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 0
        capital_gains_tax: 0
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 1_500
      # Full refundable credit results in refund
      expect: -1500
    - name: "Capital gains with preferential rate and ordinary income"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 7_500
        capital_gains_tax: 1_000
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 0
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      expect: 8500
    - name: "Very high income with alternative minimum tax"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 100_000
        capital_gains_tax: 10_000
        alternative_minimum_tax: 5_000
        net_investment_income_tax: 3_000
        self_employment_tax: 8_000
        additional_medicare_tax: 500
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 5_000
        total_refundable_credits: 0
      # Total before credits: $100,000 + $10,000 + $5,000 + $3,000 + $8,000 + $500 = $126,500
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $126,500 - $5,000 = $121,500
      expect: 121500
    - name: "Married couple with pass-through income and SE tax"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 18_000
        capital_gains_tax: 2000
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 500
        self_employment_tax: 4_500
        additional_medicare_tax: 250
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 1_500
        total_refundable_credits: 2000
      # Total before credits: $18,000 + $2,000 + $0 + $500 + $4,500 + $250 = $25,250
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $25,250 - $1,500 = $23,750
      # Less refundable credits: $23,750 - $2,000 = $21,750
      expect: 21750
    - name: "Edge case: Credits exceed all tax components"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 3_000
        capital_gains_tax: 500
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 2000
        total_refundable_credits: 3_000
      # Total tax: $3,500
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $3,500 - $2,000 = $1,500
      # Less refundable credits: $1,500 - $3,000 = -$1,500 (refund)
      expect: -1500
    - name: "Single filer, moderate income, realistic mix"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 6_940
        capital_gains_tax: 750
        alternative_minimum_tax: 0
        net_investment_income_tax: 0
        self_employment_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_tax: 0
        total_nonrefundable_credits: 500
        total_refundable_credits: 500
      # Total before credits: $6,940 + $750 = $7,690
      # Less nonrefundable credits: $7,690 - $500 = $7,190
      # Less refundable credits: $7,190 - $500 = $6,690
      expect: 6690

documents.title: Long-Term Capital Gains
documents.code:
#
# Provides preferential tax rates for net capital gain and qualified dividend income.
# Three-tier rate structure: 0%, 15%, and 20% based on taxable income brackets.

text: """
(h) Maximum capital gains rate.--
(1) In general.--If a taxpayer has a net capital gain for any taxable year, the tax imposed
by this section for such taxable year shall not exceed the sum of--
(A) a tax computed at the rates and in the same manner as if this subsection had not been
enacted on the greater of--
(i) taxable income reduced by the net capital gain; or
(ii) the lesser of-- (I) the amount of taxable income taxed at a rate below 25 percent; or
(II) taxable income reduced by the adjusted net capital gain;
(B) 0 percent of so much of the adjusted net capital gain (or, if less, taxable income) as
does not exceed the excess (if any) of-- (i) the amount of taxable income which would
(without regard to this paragraph) be taxed at a rate below 25 percent, over
(ii) the taxable income reduced by the adjusted net capital gain;
(C) 15 percent of the lesser of-- (i) so much of the adjusted net capital gain (or, if less,
taxable income) as exceeds the amount on which a tax is determined under subparagraph (B), or
(ii) the excess of-- (I) the amount of taxable income which would (without regard to this
paragraph) be taxed at a rate below 39.6 percent, over (II) the sum of the amounts on which
a tax is determined under subparagraphs (A) and (B),
(D) 20 percent of the adjusted net capital gain (or, if less, taxable income) in excess of
the amount on which tax is determined under subparagraphs (B) and (C),
...
(11) Dividends taxed as net capital gain.--
(A) In general.--For purposes of this subsection, the term "net capital gain" means net
capital gain (determined without regard to this paragraph) increased by qualified dividend income.
"""

# === INPUTS ===

input long_term_capital_gains:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Long-Term Capital Gains"
  description: "Net long-term capital gains from sale of assets held more than one year"
  default: 0

input short_term_capital_gains:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Short-Term Capital Gains"
  description: "Net short-term capital gains from sale of assets held one year or less"
  default: 0

input qualified_dividends:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Dividends"
  description: "Qualified dividend income eligible for preferential rates per Section 1(h)(11)"
  default: 0

# === PARAMETERS ===
# Capital gains brackets - similar structure to ordinary income brackets in Section 1
# Base TCJA 2018 values - indexed annually per 1(h)(1)

parameter capital_gains_brackets:
  description: "Capital gains rate brackets by filing status"
  indexed_by: statute/26/1/h
  values:
    # TCJA base thresholds (2018)
    # First threshold is where 0% ends, second is where 15% ends
    thresholds:
      single: [0, 38_600, 425_800]
      married_filing_jointly: [0, 77_200, 479_000]
      married_filing_separately: [0, 38_600, 239_500]
      head_of_household: [0, 51_700, 452_400]
      qualifying_widow: [0, 77_200, 479_000]
    # Rates: 0% up to first threshold, 15% up to second, 20% above
    rates: [0.00, 0.15, 0.20]

# === VARIABLES ===

variable net_capital_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Capital Gain"
  description: "Net long-term capital gains after netting with short-term losses per 26 USC 1_222"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Net capital gain = LTCG - STCL, but cannot be negative here
    # Short-term gains are taxed as ordinary income, not preferential
    return max(0, long_term_capital_gains)
  default: 0

variable adjusted_net_capital_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Net Capital Gain"
  description: "Net capital gain plus qualified dividends per Section 1(h)(11)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 1(h)(11)(A): net capital gain increased by qualified dividend income
    return net_capital_gain + qualified_dividends
  default: 0

variable ordinary_income_for_cap_gains:
  imports:
    - 26/63/a#taxable_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Ordinary Income for Bracket Positioning"
  description: "Taxable income minus adjusted net capital gain, used to determine bracket starting position"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Ordinary income = taxable income - preferential income
    # Capital gains "stack" on top of ordinary income for bracket purposes
    return max(0, taxable_income - adjusted_net_capital_gain)
  default: 0

variable capital_gains_tax:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Capital Gains Tax"
  description: "Federal income tax on net capital gain and qualified dividends at preferential rates per 26 USC 1(h)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 1(h): Capital gains "stack" on top of ordinary income
    # Use marginal_agg with start_from to begin at ordinary income position
    if adjusted_net_capital_gain <= 0:
        return 0
    return marginal_agg(
        adjusted_net_capital_gain,
        capital_gains_brackets,
        threshold_by=filing_status,
        start_from=ordinary_income_for_cap_gains
    )
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, $30k taxable income, $10k LTCG, fully in 0% bracket"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 30_000
        long_term_capital_gains: 10_000
        qualified_dividends: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # Ordinary = $30k - $10k = $20k. Start at $20k in brackets.
      # 0% bracket goes to $38,600. Room = $18,600.
      # All $10k fits in 0% bracket. Tax = $0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer, $50k taxable income, $20k LTCG, spans 0% and 15%"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 50_000
        long_term_capital_gains: 20_000
        qualified_dividends: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # Ordinary = $50k - $20k = $30k. Start at $30k.
      # 0% bracket goes to $38,600. Room = $8,600 at 0%.
      # Remaining $11,400 at 15%.
      # Tax = $0 + $11,400 * 0.15 = $1,710
      expect: 1710
    - name: "Joint filer, $500k taxable income, $50k ANCG, spans 15% and 20%"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 500_000
        long_term_capital_gains: 30_000
        qualified_dividends: 20_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      # Ordinary = $500k - $50k = $450k. Start at $450k.
      # 0% threshold joint = $77,200 (already passed)
      # 15% threshold joint = $479,000
      # Room at 15%: $479,000 - $450,000 = $29,000
      # At 15%: $29,000. At 20%: $50,000 - $29,000 = $21,000
      # Tax = $29,000 * 0.15 + $21,000 * 0.20 = $4,350 + $4,200 = $8,550
      expect: 8550
    - name: "Head of household, $60k taxable income, $20k ANCG"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 60_000
        long_term_capital_gains: 15_000
        qualified_dividends: 5_000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      # Ordinary = $60k - $20k = $40k. Start at $40k.
      # 0% threshold HOH = $51,700. Room = $11,700 at 0%.
      # Remaining $8,300 at 15%.
      # Tax = $0 + $8,300 * 0.15 = $1,245
      expect: 1245
    - name: "MFS, $250k taxable income, $20k LTCG, spans 15% and 20%"
      period: 2018-01
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 250_000
        long_term_capital_gains: 20_000
        qualified_dividends: 0
        filing_status: SEPARATE
      # Ordinary = $250k - $20k = $230k. Start at $230k.
      # 15% threshold MFS = $239,500. Room = $9,500 at 15%.
      # Remaining $10,500 at 20%.
      # Tax = $9,500 * 0.15 + $10,500 * 0.20 = $1,425 + $2,100 = $3,525
      expect: 3525

variable qualified_dividend_tax:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Dividend Tax"
  description: "Federal income tax on qualified dividend income at preferential rates per Section 1(h)(11)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Pro-rate the preferential tax between cap gains and qualified dividends
    if adjusted_net_capital_gain > 0:
        return capital_gains_tax * (qualified_dividends / adjusted_net_capital_gain)
    return 0
  default: 0

variable net_capital_gain_tax:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Capital Gain Tax"
  description: "Federal income tax on net capital gain (excluding qualified dividends) at preferential rates"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Pro-rate the preferential tax between cap gains and qualified dividends
    if adjusted_net_capital_gain > 0:
        return capital_gains_tax * (net_capital_gain / adjusted_net_capital_gain)
    return 0
  default: 0

documents.title: Qualified Dividend Income
documents.code:
# Qualified dividends are taxed at the same preferential rates as long-term capital gains.

text: """
(11) Dividends taxed as net capital gain.--
(A) In general.--For purposes of this subsection, the term "net capital gain" means net
capital gain (determined without regard to this paragraph) increased by qualified dividend income.
(B) Qualified dividend income.--For purposes of this paragraph--
(i) In general.--The term "qualified dividend income" means dividends received during
the taxable year from--
(I) domestic corporations, and
(II) qualified foreign corporations.
(ii) Certain dividends excluded.--Such term shall not include--
(I) any dividend from a corporation which for the taxable year of the corporation
in which the distribution is made, or the preceding taxable year, is a corporation
exempt from tax under section 501 or 521,
(II) any amount allowed as a deduction under section 591 (relating to deduction
for dividends paid by mutual savings banks, etc.), and
(III) any dividend described in section 404(k).
(iii) Coordination with section 246(c).--Such term shall not include any dividend
on any share of stock-- (I) with respect to which the holding period requirements of
section 246(c) are not met...
"""

# Parameters for holding period requirement

parameter min_holding_days:
  description: "Minimum holding period in days to qualify for preferential rate on dividends"
  unit: days
  values:
    2003-01-01: 60

parameter holding_period_window:
  description: "Window period around ex-dividend date for measuring holding period"
  unit: days
  values:
    2003-01-01: 121

# Variable: qualified_dividend_income
# This is an alias for the input qualified_dividends defined in h.rac
# For microsimulation, we use direct input rather than dividend-by-dividend tracking

variable qualified_dividend_income:
  imports:
    - 26/1/h#qualified_dividends
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Dividend Income"
  description: "Total qualified dividend income eligible for preferential capital gains rates per 26 USC 1(h)(11)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # In microsimulation, qualified dividends are provided as direct input
    # Full implementation would aggregate is_qualified_dividend for each dividend payment
    return qualified_dividends
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Pass-through of qualified dividends input"
      inputs:
        qualified_dividends: 5_000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Zero qualified dividends"
      inputs:
        qualified_dividends: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Amount Realized
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from capital_gains.rac ----

# 26 USC Sections 1001-1016 - Capital Gains and Losses (Primary Calculation)
#

text: """
Section 1001(a): "The gain from the sale or other disposition of property shall
be the excess of the amount realized therefrom over the adjusted basis...
Section 1001(c): "Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, the entire
exchange shall be recognized.
"""

input amount_realized:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Amount Realized"
  description: "Cash and FMV of property received in exchange, net of transaction costs"
  default: 0

input adjusted_basis:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Adjusted Basis"
  description: "Original basis adjusted for improvements, depreciation, and other adjustments"
  default: 0

input property_type:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Property Type"
  description: "1=Stock, 2=Real Property, 3=Collectible, 4=Other"
  default: 4

variable capital_gains:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Realized Gain or Loss"
  description: "Amount realized minus adjusted basis under IRC 1_001(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Gain = amount realized - adjusted basis
    # If negative, it's a loss
    return amount_realized - adjusted_basis
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Stock sold at gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 15_000
        adjusted_basis: 10_000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Stock sold at loss"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 8_000
        adjusted_basis: 10_000
      expect: -2000
    - name: "Stock sold at cost (no gain or loss)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 10_000
        adjusted_basis: 10_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Real property large gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 500_000
        adjusted_basis: 250_000
        property_type: 2
      expect: 250000
    - name: "Real property loss on sale"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 180_000
        adjusted_basis: 200_000
        property_type: 2
      expect: -20000
    - name: "Collectible small gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 5_500
        adjusted_basis: 5_000
        property_type: 3
      expect: 500
    - name: "Zero amount realized (asset abandoned)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 0
        adjusted_basis: 10_000
      expect: -10000
    - name: "Large gain on appreciated asset"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 1_000_000
        adjusted_basis: 100_000
      expect: 900000
    - name: "Basis exceeds amount realized"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 25_000
        adjusted_basis: 75_000
      expect: -50000
    - name: "Minimal gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        amount_realized: 10_001
        adjusted_basis: 10_000
      expect: 1


# ---- Merged from holding_period.rac ----

# 26 USC Section 1223 - Holding Period Rules
#

parameter long_term_holding_days:
  description: "Days held for long-term capital gain treatment (more than one year)"
  unit: days
  values:
    1900-01-01: 366

input acquisition_date:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Date Acquired"
  description: "Date of acquisition as integer (YYYYMMDD format)"
  default: 0

input disposition_date:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Date Sold/Disposed"
  description: "Date of sale or other disposition as integer (YYYYMMDD format)"
  default: 0

input is_inherited_property:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Inherited Property"
  description: "Property acquired by bequest or inheritance"
  default: False

input is_gifted_property:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Gifted Property"
  description: "Property received as a gift"
  default: False

input is_like_kind_exchange:
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Like-Kind Exchange"
  description: "Property acquired in a like-kind exchange under IRC 1_031"
  default: False

variable holding_period:
  imports:
    - 26/1001/capital_gains#is_inherited_property
    - 26/1001/capital_gains#is_gifted_property
    - 26/1031/like_kind_exchange#is_like_kind_exchange
  entity: Asset
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Held Long-Term (Over 1 Year)"
  description: "Property held for more than 1 year for long-term capital gain treatment"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Calculate days between acquisition and disposition
    # Note: Day of acquisition is excluded, day of disposition is included
    # More than 366 days = long-term (to accommodate leap years)
    # For inherited property, holding period is always long-term per IRC 1223(11)
    # For gifted property, holding period includes donor's holding period per IRC 1223(2)
    days_held = 0
    if acquisition_date > 0 and disposition_date > 0:
      days_held = disposition_date - acquisition_date
    if is_inherited_property:
      return True
    return days_held > long_term_holding_days
  default: False
  tests:
    - name: "Stock held less than 1 year (short-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_115
        disposition_date: 20_241_010
      expect: false
    - name: "Stock held exactly 1 year plus 1 day (long-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_115
        disposition_date: 20_250_116
      expect: true
    - name: "Stock held 2 years (long-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_220_115
        disposition_date: 20_240_115
      expect: true
    - name: "Stock held 6 months (short-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_101
        disposition_date: 20_240_701
      expect: false
    - name: "Inherited property (always long-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_231_215
        disposition_date: 20_240_101
        is_inherited_property: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Gifted property, short holding period by donee"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_115
        disposition_date: 20_241_010
        is_gifted_property: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Property held from Jan 1 to Dec 31 same year (short-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_101
        disposition_date: 20_241_231
      expect: false
    - name: "Property held 1 year exactly (no gains long-term status)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_101
        disposition_date: 20_250_101
      expect: false
    - name: "Property held just over 1 year (366 days, long-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_101
        disposition_date: 20_250_102
      expect: true
    - name: "Like-kind exchange property acquisition"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_115
        disposition_date: 20_241_010
        is_like_kind_exchange: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Stock held 3 years (clearly long-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_210_301
        disposition_date: 20_240_305
      expect: true
    - name: "Stock held 10 months (short-term)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        acquisition_date: 20_240_115
        disposition_date: 20_241_115
      expect: false


# ---- Merged from netting.rac ----

# 26 USC Sections 1211-1212, 1222 - Capital Gain/Loss Netting Rules
#

input short_term_capital_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Short-Term Capital Gains"
  description: "Net capital gain from assets held 1 year or less"
  default: 0

input short_term_capital_loss:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Short-Term Capital Losses"
  description: "Net capital loss from assets held 1 year or less"
  default: 0

input long_term_capital_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Long-Term Capital Gains"
  description: "Net capital gain from assets held over 1 year"
  default: 0

input long_term_capital_loss:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Long-Term Capital Losses"
  description: "Net capital loss from assets held over 1 year"
  default: 0

input short_term_capital_loss_carryover:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Short-Term Capital Loss Carryover"
  description: "Unused short-term capital loss from prior years"
  default: 0

input long_term_capital_loss_carryover:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Long-Term Capital Loss Carryover"
  description: "Unused long-term capital loss from prior years"
  default: 0

variable netting:
  imports:
    - 26/1001/capital_gains#short_term_capital_gain
    - 26/1001/capital_gains#short_term_capital_loss
    - 26/1001/capital_gains#long_term_capital_gain
    - 26/1001/capital_gains#long_term_capital_loss
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/1212/carryover#short_term_capital_loss_carryover
    - 26/1212/carryover#long_term_capital_loss_carryover
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Capital Gain or Loss"
  description: "Taxable capital gain or loss after netting gains and losses per IRC 1_211-1_212"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Include carryover losses from prior years per IRC 1212
    # Netting order per IRC 1222: ST gains/losses first, then LT gains/losses
    total_st_loss = short_term_capital_loss + short_term_capital_loss_carryover
    net_st = short_term_capital_gain - total_st_loss

    total_lt_loss = long_term_capital_loss + long_term_capital_loss_carryover
    net_lt = long_term_capital_gain - total_lt_loss

    # Combine for total net capital gain/loss
    net_capital = net_st + net_lt
    return net_capital
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Only short-term gains"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 5_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 0
        long_term_capital_gain: 0
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Only short-term losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 0
        short_term_capital_loss: 3_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 0
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
      expect: -3000
    - name: "Only long-term gains"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 0
        short_term_capital_loss: 0
        long_term_capital_gain: 10_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
      expect: 10000
    - name: "Only long-term losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 0
        short_term_capital_loss: 0
        long_term_capital_gain: 0
        long_term_capital_loss: 7_000
      expect: -7000
    - name: "Short-term gains exceed losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 10_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 3_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 0
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
      expect: 7000
    - name: "Short-term losses exceed gains"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 2000
        short_term_capital_loss: 8_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 0
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
      expect: -6000
    - name: "Long-term gains exceed losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 0
        short_term_capital_loss: 0
        long_term_capital_gain: 25_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 10_000
      expect: 15000
    - name: "Combined gains exceed combined losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 5_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 2000
        long_term_capital_gain: 20_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 8_000
      expect: 15000
    - name: "Combined losses exceed combined gains"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 3_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 10_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 5_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 12_000
      expect: -14000
    - name: "With short-term carryover loss"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 5_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 2000
        long_term_capital_gain: 10_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
        short_term_capital_loss_carryover: 8_000
      expect: -5000
    - name: "With long-term carryover loss"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 5_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 0
        long_term_capital_gain: 10_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 5_000
        long_term_capital_loss_carryover: 15_000
      expect: -5000
    - name: "Both carryover losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 8_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 3_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 8_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 3_000
        short_term_capital_loss_carryover: 3_000
        long_term_capital_loss_carryover: 5_000
      expect: 2000
    - name: "All zero (no gains or losses)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 0
        short_term_capital_loss: 0
        long_term_capital_gain: 0
        long_term_capital_loss: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Large gain offset by large loss"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 100_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 50_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 50_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 100_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Multiple asset sales with complex netting"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        short_term_capital_gain: 12_000
        short_term_capital_loss: 4_000
        long_term_capital_gain: 35_000
        long_term_capital_loss: 20_000
      expect: 23000


# ---- Merged from preferential_rates.rac ----

# 26 USC Section 1(h) - Preferential Capital Gains Rates (Integration)
#

text: """
Section 1(h) provides three-tier preferential rates for "net capital gain":
0% rate (for qualified gains within lower rate brackets)
15% rate (for most taxpayers)
20% rate (for high-income taxpayers)
Special rates for collectibles (28%) and Section 1250 property (25%)
"""

input net_capital_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Net Capital Gain"
  description: "Taxable capital gain after netting gains and losses"
  default: 0

input filing_status:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: "1=Single, 2=MFJ, 3=MFS, 4=HOH, 5=QW"
  default: 1

input ordinary_income_before_gains:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Ordinary Income Before Capital Gains"
  description: "Taxable income before including capital gains"
  default: 0

input collectibles_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Collectibles Gain"
  description: "Portion of capital gain from collectibles under IRC 1(h)(5)"
  default: 0

input section_1250_unrecaptured_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Section 1_250 Unrecaptured Gain"
  description: "Unrecaptured section 1_250 gain under IRC 1(h)(6)"
  default: 0

variable preferential_rates:
  imports:
    - 26/1001/netting#net_capital_gain
    - 26/1001/special_assets#collectibles_gain
    - 26/1001/special_assets#section_1250_unrecaptured_gain
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "Preferential Capital Gains Tax Rate"
  description: "Weighted average tax rate on capital gains under IRC 1(h)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # IRC 1(h) preferential rates (2024):
    # 0% rate: Single up to $47,025, MFJ up to $94,050
    # 15% rate: next bracket
    # 20% rate: above threshold
    # 28% rate: collectibles and section 1202 gains
    # 25% rate: section 1250 unrecaptured depreciation

    if net_capital_gain <= 0:
      return 0.0

    # Determine brackets by filing status
    if filing_status == 2:  # MFJ
      zero_bracket = 94_050
      fifteen_bracket = 583_750
    elif filing_status == 1:  # Single
      zero_bracket = 47_025
      fifteen_bracket = 518_900
    elif filing_status == 4:  # HOH
      zero_bracket = 62_900
      fifteen_bracket = 551_350
    else:
      # MFS, QW - use conservative single rate
      zero_bracket = 47_025
      fifteen_bracket = 518_900

    # Tax calculation (simplified - should use graduated brackets)
    # Collectibles taxed at 28%
    collectibles_tax = collectibles_gain * 0.28

    # Section 1250 unrecaptured depreciation taxed at 25%
    section_1250_tax = section_1250_unrecaptured_gain * 0.25

    # Remaining gain after collectibles and 1250 property
    remaining_gain = net_capital_gain - collectibles_gain - section_1250_unrecaptured_gain

    # Allocate remaining gain to brackets
    if ordinary_income_before_gains + remaining_gain <= zero_bracket:
      # All in zero bracket
      return 0.0
    elif ordinary_income_before_gains >= fifteen_bracket:
      # All in 20% bracket
      return 0.20
    else:
      # Blended rate between brackets
      return 0.15
  default: 0.0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, all gains in 0% bracket"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 40_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 0
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.0
    - name: "Single filer, all gains in 15% bracket"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 100_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 50_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.15
    - name: "Single filer, all gains in 20% bracket"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 100_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 600_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.20
    - name: "MFJ, all gains in 0% bracket"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 2
        net_capital_gain: 80_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 0
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.0
    - name: "MFJ, all gains in 15% bracket"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 2
        net_capital_gain: 100_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 100_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.15
    - name: "MFJ, all gains in 20% bracket"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 2
        net_capital_gain: 100_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 700_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.20
    - name: "Collectibles gain (28% rate)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 50_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 100_000
        collectibles_gain: 50_000
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.28
    - name: "Section 1_250 unrecaptured gain (25% rate)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 50_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 100_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 50_000
      expect: 0.25
    - name: "Mixed gains: collectibles and ordinary"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 100_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 50_000
        collectibles_gain: 30_000
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.28
    - name: "Head of household filer"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 4
        net_capital_gain: 50_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 60_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.15
    - name: "No capital gains"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: 0
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 100_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.0
    - name: "Loss position (negative gain)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: 1
        net_capital_gain: -50_000
        ordinary_income_before_gains: 100_000
        collectibles_gain: 0
        section_1250_unrecaptured_gain: 0
      expect: 0.0

documents.title: Tax-Exempt Interest Income
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Exclusion.—Gross income does not include interest on any State or
local bond.
§32(i)(2)(B): "tax-exempt interest received or accrued during the taxable
year".
"""
input tax_exempt_interest:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Tax-Exempt Interest Income"
  description: "Interest from state and local bonds excluded from gross income under 26 USC §103, but counted for EITC investment income test"
  default: 0

documents.title: Entity Type
documents.text:
(a) Corporations in general.—A tax is hereby imposed for each taxable year
on the taxable income of every corporation.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Corporations in general.—A tax is hereby imposed for each taxable year
on the taxable income of every corporation.
"""

input entity_type:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Enum(EntityType)
  label: "Entity Type"
  description: "Legal entity type (C_CORPORATION, S_CORPORATION, PARTNERSHIP, etc.)"

variable tax_imposed:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Subject to Corporate Income Tax"
  description: "Whether entity is subject to tax under 26 USC 11"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only C corporations are subject to corporate income tax
    # S corporations: exempt per 26 USC 1363(a)
    # Partnerships: exempt per 26 USC 701
    # Sole proprietorships: taxed at individual level
    return entity_type == C_CORPORATION
  tests:
    - name: "C corporation is subject to corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        entity_type: C_CORPORATION
      expect: true

    - name: "S corporation is exempt from corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        entity_type: S_CORPORATION
      expect: false

    - name: "Partnership is exempt from corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        entity_type: PARTNERSHIP
      expect: false

    - name: "Sole proprietorship is exempt from corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        entity_type: SOLE_PROPRIETORSHIP
      expect: false

    - name: "LLC taxed as C corp is subject to corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        entity_type: C_CORPORATION
      expect: true

    - name: "LLC taxed as partnership is exempt from corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        entity_type: PARTNERSHIP
      expect: false

documents.title: Corporate Taxable Income
documents.code:
text: """
(b) Amount of tax.—The amount of the tax imposed by subsection (a) shall be
21 percent of taxable income.
Pre-TCJA (1993-2017): Graduated rates from 15% to 35% with "bubble" rates
"""

input taxable_income:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Corporate Taxable Income"
  description: "Corporation's taxable income"
  default: 0

input is_subject_to_corporate_tax:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Subject to Corporate Tax"
  description: "Whether the entity is a C corporation subject to corporate income tax"
  default: false

input tax_year:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Tax Year"
  description: "The tax year being calculated"
  default: 2024

parameter flat_rate:
  description: "Post-TCJA flat corporate income tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2018-01-01: 0.21

parameter tcja_effective_year:
  description: "Year when TCJA flat corporate rate took effect"
  unit: year
  values:
    2017-01-01: 2018

parameter graduated_brackets:
  description: "Pre-TCJA graduated corporate tax brackets"
  values:
    1993-01-01:
      thresholds: [0, 50_000, 75_000, 100_000, 335_000, 10_000_000, 15_000_000, 18_333_333]
      rates: [0.15, 0.25, 0.34, 0.39, 0.34, 0.35, 0.38, 0.35]

variable tax_amount:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Corporate Income Tax"
  description: "Federal corporate income tax under 26 USC 11"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only C corporations pay corporate income tax
    if not is_subject_to_corporate_tax: return 0
    # No tax on zero or negative income
    if taxable_income <= 0: return 0
    # Post-TCJA: flat 21% rate
    if tax_year >= tcja_effective_year: return taxable_income * flat_rate
    # Pre-TCJA: graduated rates with bubbles
    return compute_graduated_tax(taxable_income, graduated_brackets)
  tests:
    - name: "Not subject to corporate tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: false
        taxable_income: 500_000
        tax_year: 2024
      expect: 0

    - name: "Zero taxable income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        taxable_income: 0
        tax_year: 2024
      expect: 0

    - name: "Negative taxable income (loss)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        taxable_income: -100_000
        tax_year: 2024
      expect: 0

    - name: "Post-TCJA flat 21% rate - small corporation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        taxable_income: 100_000
        tax_year: 2024
      expect: 21_000  # 100,000 * 0.21

    - name: "Post-TCJA flat 21% rate - large corporation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        taxable_income: 10_000_000
        tax_year: 2024
      expect: 2_100_000  # 10,000,000 * 0.21

    - name: "Pre-TCJA graduated rates - 15% bracket"
      period: 2017
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        taxable_income: 40_000
        tax_year: 2017
      expect: 6_000  # 40,000 * 0.15

documents.title: Corporate Income Tax (with Section 1_201 consideration)
documents.text:
(a) GENERAL RULE.—If for any taxable year a corporation has a net capital gain
and any rate of tax imposed by section 11, 511, or 831(a) or (b) (whichever is
applicable) exceeds 35 percent, then, in lieu of any such tax, there is hereby
imposed a tax... computed as provided in paragraph (1), (2), or (3).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) GENERAL RULE.—If for any taxable year a corporation has a net capital gain
and any rate of tax imposed by section 11, 511, or 831(a) or (b) (whichever is
applicable) exceeds 35 percent, then, in lieu of any such tax, there is hereby
imposed a tax... computed as provided in paragraph (1), (2), or (3).
"""
variable alternative_tax:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Corporate Income Tax (with Section 1_201 consideration)"
  description: "Final corporate tax applying Section 1_201 if beneficial"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only C corporations can use Section 1201
    if not is_subject_to_corporate_tax:
        return False
    # Must have net capital gain
    if net_capital_gain <= 0:
        return False
    # Post-TCJA: Regular rate (21%) is always lower than alternative (35%)
    if tax_year >= tcja_effective_year:
        return False
    # Pre-TCJA: Compare regular tax vs Section 1201 tax
    regular_tax = compute_regular_tax()
    section_1201_tax = compute_section_1201_tax()
    return section_1201_tax < regular_tax
  tests:
    - name: "Post-TCJA C corporation - Section 1_201 never applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        net_capital_gain: 500_000
        tax_year: 2024
        tcja_effective_year: 2018
      expect: false

    - name: "Non-corporate entity - Section 1_201 does not apply"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: false
        net_capital_gain: 100_000
        tax_year: 2024
        tcja_effective_year: 2018
      expect: false

    - name: "Corporation with no capital gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        net_capital_gain: 0
        tax_year: 2024
        tcja_effective_year: 2018
      expect: false

    - name: "Corporation with capital loss - Section 1_201 does not apply"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        net_capital_gain: -50_000
        tax_year: 2024
        tcja_effective_year: 2018
      expect: false

    - name: "Pre-TCJA corporation with large capital gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        net_capital_gain: 1_000_000
        tax_year: 2016
        tcja_effective_year: 2018
      expect: true

    - name: "TCJA transition year - regular rate applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_subject_to_corporate_tax: true
        net_capital_gain: 250_000
        tax_year: 2018
        tcja_effective_year: 2018
      expect: false

documents.title: Years Owned
documents.text:
Gross income shall not include gain from the sale or exchange of property if,
during the 5-year period ending on the date of the sale or exchange, such
property has been owned and used by the taxpayer as the taxpayer's principal
residence for periods aggregating 2 years or more.
documents.code:
text: """
Gross income shall not include gain from the sale or exchange of property if,
during the 5-year period ending on the date of the sale or exchange, such
property has been owned and used by the taxpayer as the taxpayer's principal
residence for periods aggregating 2 years or more.
"""

parameter ownership_required:
  description: "Years of ownership required in 5-year lookback period"
  unit: years
  values:
    1997-05-07: 2

parameter use_required:
  description: "Years of use as principal residence required in 5-year lookback period"
  unit: years
  values:
    1997-05-07: 2

input years_owned:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Decimal
  label: "Years Owned"
  description: "Number of years property was owned by taxpayer in 5-year lookback"
  default: 0

input years_used_as_residence:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Decimal
  label: "Years Used as Residence"
  description: "Number of years property was used as principal residence in 5-year lookback"
  default: 0

variable meets_ownership_test:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  description: "Whether taxpayer meets 2-year ownership requirement per 121(a)"
  formula: return years_owned >= ownership_required
  tests:
    - name: "Exactly 2 years owned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_owned: 2
      expect: true
    - name: "More than 2 years owned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_owned: 5
      expect: true
    - name: "Less than 2 years owned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_owned: 1
      expect: false
    - name: "No years owned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_owned: 0
      expect: false
    - name: "Just under 2 years (1.99 years)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_owned: 1.99
      expect: false
    - name: "Much longer than 2 years"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_owned: 10
      expect: true

variable meets_use_test:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  description: "Whether taxpayer meets 2-year use requirement per 121(a)"
  formula: return years_used_as_residence >= use_required
  tests:
    - name: "Exactly 2 years used as residence"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_used_as_residence: 2
      expect: true
    - name: "More than 2 years used as residence"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_used_as_residence: 3
      expect: true
    - name: "Less than 2 years used as residence"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_used_as_residence: 1
      expect: false
    - name: "No years used as residence"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_used_as_residence: 0
      expect: false
    - name: "Rented out during tenure (0.5 years used)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_used_as_residence: 0.5
      expect: false
    - name: "Long ownership but only 1 year as residence"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        years_used_as_residence: 1
      expect: false

variable meets_full_requirements:
  imports:
    - 26/121/b#meets_frequency_test
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  description: "Whether taxpayer fully qualifies for exclusion per 121(a) and 121(b)"
  formula: return meets_ownership_test and meets_use_test and meets_frequency_test
  tests:
    - name: "All requirements met"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Fails ownership test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_ownership_test: false
        meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Fails use test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: false
        meets_frequency_test: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Fails frequency test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Fails all tests"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_ownership_test: false
        meets_use_test: false
        meets_frequency_test: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Fails ownership and use tests"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_ownership_test: false
        meets_use_test: false
        meets_frequency_test: true
      expect: false

variable principal_residence_exclusion:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/121/b#applicable_exclusion_limit
    - 26/121/d#excludable_gain
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Principal Residence Gain Exclusion"
  description: "Amount of gain from sale of principal residence excluded from gross income per 26 USC 121"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # The exclusion is the lesser of:
    # 1. The applicable exclusion limit (based on filing status and full requirements met)
    # 2. The excludable gain (gain minus depreciation recapture)
    return min(applicable_exclusion_limit, excludable_gain)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, full requirements met, gain within limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 250_000
        excludable_gain: 200_000
      expect: 200000
    - name: "Single filer, full requirements met, gain exceeds limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 250_000
        excludable_gain: 400_000
      expect: 250000
    - name: "Single filer, does not meet requirements"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        meets_full_requirements: false
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 0
        excludable_gain: 200_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing jointly, full requirements met, gain within limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 500_000
        excludable_gain: 400_000
      expect: 400000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, full requirements met, gain exceeds limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 500_000
        excludable_gain: 600_000
      expect: 500000
    - name: "Married filing separately, reduced exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        meets_full_requirements: false
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 125_000
        excludable_gain: 100_000
      expect: 100000
    - name: "Head of household, full requirements met"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 250_000
        excludable_gain: 180_000
      expect: 180000
    - name: "Zero gain excludable (depreciation recapture equals gain)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 250_000
        excludable_gain: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Negative excludable gain (all depreciation)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        meets_full_requirements: true
        applicable_exclusion_limit: 250_000
        excludable_gain: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Prior Exclusion Claimed
documents.text:
(1) In general - The amount of gain excluded from gross income under
subsection (a) with respect to any sale or exchange shall not exceed $250,000.

(2) Special rules for joint returns - In the case of a husband and wife who
make a joint return for the taxable year of the sale or exchange of the
property... the limitation shall be $500,000.

(3) Application to only 1 sale or exchange every 2 years - Subsection (a)
shall not apply to any sale or exchange by the taxpayer if, during the 2-year
period ending on the date of such sale or exchange, there was any other sale
or exchange by the taxpayer to which subsection (a) applied.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) In general - The amount of gain excluded from gross income under
subsection (a) with respect to any sale or exchange shall not exceed $250,000.

(2) Special rules for joint returns - In the case of a husband and wife who
make a joint return for the taxable year of the sale or exchange of the
property... the limitation shall be $500,000.

(3) Application to only 1 sale or exchange every 2 years - Subsection (a)
shall not apply to any sale or exchange by the taxpayer if, during the 2-year
period ending on the date of such sale or exchange, there was any other sale
or exchange by the taxpayer to which subsection (a) applied.
"""

parameter single_limit:
  description: "Maximum exclusion for single taxpayer or married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1997-05-07: 250_000

parameter joint_limit:
  description: "Maximum exclusion for married filing jointly"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1997-05-07: 500_000

parameter waiting_period:
  description: "Years since prior exclusion claimed (once-every-2-years limitation)"
  unit: years
  values:
    1997-05-07: 2

input prior_exclusion_claimed:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Prior Exclusion Claimed"
  description: "Whether taxpayer claimed Section 121 exclusion in prior 2 years"
  default: false

input years_since_last_exclusion:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Decimal
  label: "Years Since Last Exclusion"
  description: "Years elapsed since prior Section 121 exclusion claim (if applicable)"
  default: 3

input spouse_meets_use_test:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Spouse Meets Use Test"
  description: "Whether spouse meets 2-year use requirement (married filing jointly)"
  default: false

input spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Spouse Prior Exclusion Claimed"
  description: "Whether spouse claimed Section 121 exclusion in prior 2 years"
  default: false

variable meets_frequency_test:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  description: "Whether taxpayer meets once-every-2-years limitation per 121(b)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if not prior_exclusion_claimed:
      return true
    return years_since_last_exclusion >= waiting_period
  tests:
    - name: "No prior exclusion claimed"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
        years_since_last_exclusion: 0
      expect: true
    - name: "Prior exclusion claimed, exactly 2 years since"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 2
      expect: true
    - name: "Prior exclusion claimed, more than 2 years since"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 3
      expect: true
    - name: "Prior exclusion claimed, less than 2 years since"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 1
      expect: false
    - name: "Prior exclusion claimed, 0 years since (just claimed)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 0
      expect: false
    - name: "Long time since prior exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 10
      expect: true

variable qualifies_for_joint_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/121/a#meets_ownership_test
    - 26/121/a#meets_use_test
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  description: "Whether married filing jointly qualifies for $500,000 limit per 121(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status != JOINT:
      return false
    # Either spouse meets ownership (we assume primary taxpayer's ownership)
    either_spouse_owns = meets_ownership_test
    # Both spouses must meet use test
    both_spouses_used = meets_use_test and spouse_meets_use_test
    # Neither spouse used exclusion in prior 2 years
    neither_used_recently = meets_frequency_test and not spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed
    return either_spouse_owns and both_spouses_used and neither_used_recently
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer (not married filing jointly)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        spouse_meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Married filing jointly, all conditions met"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        spouse_meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Married filing jointly, primary spouse fails ownership"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_ownership_test: false
        meets_use_test: true
        spouse_meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Married filing jointly, primary spouse fails use test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: false
        spouse_meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Married filing jointly, spouse fails use test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        spouse_meets_use_test: false
        meets_frequency_test: true
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Married filing jointly, primary spouse failed frequency test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        spouse_meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: false
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Married filing jointly, spouse claimed exclusion recently"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        meets_ownership_test: true
        meets_use_test: true
        spouse_meets_use_test: true
        meets_frequency_test: true
        spouse_prior_exclusion_claimed: true
      expect: false

variable applicable_exclusion_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/121/c#reduced_exclusion_fraction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  description: "Maximum exclusion available based on filing status and requirements per 121(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Determine base limit per 121(b)(1) and 121(b)(2)
    if qualifies_for_joint_limit:
      base_limit = joint_limit
    else:
      base_limit = single_limit
    # Apply reduced exclusion fraction if not fully meeting requirements per 121(c)
    return base_limit * reduced_exclusion_fraction
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, full exclusion (100%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: false
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 1.0
      expect: 250000
    - name: "Single filer, 50% exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: false
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 0.5
      expect: 125000
    - name: "Single filer, no exclusion (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: false
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 0.0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing jointly, full exclusion (100%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: true
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 1.0
      expect: 500000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, 50% exclusion (unforeseen circumstances)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: true
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 0.5
      expect: 250000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, 25% exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: true
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 0.25
      expect: 125000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, no exclusion (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: true
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 0.0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer, 75% exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        qualifies_for_joint_limit: false
        reduced_exclusion_fraction: 0.75
      expect: 187500

documents.title: Qualifies for Reduced Exclusion
documents.text:
(1) In general - In the case of a sale or exchange to which this subsection
applies, the amount of gain excluded from gross income under subsection (a)
shall not exceed the amount which bears the same ratio to the amount which
would be so excluded if the taxpayer met the ownership and use requirements
of subsection (a) and the frequency requirements of subsection (b)(3) as the
shorter of (A) the aggregate periods during which such requirements are met,
or (B) the period after the date of the most recent prior sale or exchange by
the taxpayer to which subsection (a) applied, bears to 2 years.

(2) Applies to sales or exchanges by reason of a change in place of employment,
health, or unforeseen circumstances.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) In general - In the case of a sale or exchange to which this subsection
applies, the amount of gain excluded from gross income under subsection (a)
shall not exceed the amount which bears the same ratio to the amount which
would be so excluded if the taxpayer met the ownership and use requirements
of subsection (a) and the frequency requirements of subsection (b)(3) as the
shorter of (A) the aggregate periods during which such requirements are met,
or (B) the period after the date of the most recent prior sale or exchange by
the taxpayer to which subsection (a) applied, bears to 2 years.

(2) Applies to sales or exchanges by reason of a change in place of employment,
