health, or unforeseen circumstances.
"""

input qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Qualifies for Reduced Exclusion"
  description: "Whether taxpayer qualifies for partial exclusion under 121(c) (unforeseen circumstances)"
  default: false

variable reduced_exclusion_fraction:
  imports:
    - 26/121/a#meets_full_requirements
    - 26/121/a#years_owned
    - 26/121/a#ownership_required
    - 26/121/a#years_used_as_residence
    - 26/121/a#use_required
    - 26/121/b#prior_exclusion_claimed
    - 26/121/b#years_since_last_exclusion
    - 26/121/b#waiting_period
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  description: "Fraction of full exclusion available under 121(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if meets_full_requirements:
      return 1.0
    if not qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion:
      return 0.0
    # Fraction = shorter of (ownership/use time) or (time since last exclusion)
    # divided by required period (2 years)
    # Ownership fraction
    ownership_fraction = min(years_owned / ownership_required, 1.0)
    # Use fraction
    use_fraction = min(years_used_as_residence / use_required, 1.0)
    # Frequency fraction (if applicable)
    if prior_exclusion_claimed:
      frequency_fraction = min(years_since_last_exclusion / waiting_period, 1.0)
    else:
      frequency_fraction = 1.0
    # Take the minimum of all applicable fractions
    return min(ownership_fraction, use_fraction, frequency_fraction)
  tests:
    - name: "Meets full requirements (100% exclusion)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: true
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: false
        years_owned: 2
        years_used_as_residence: 2
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Does not qualify for reduced exclusion (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: false
        years_owned: 1
        years_used_as_residence: 1
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: 0.0
    - name: "1 year of ownership and use (50% of 2 years required)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: true
        years_owned: 1
        years_used_as_residence: 1
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "1.5 years of ownership and use (75% of 2 years)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: true
        years_owned: 1.5
        years_used_as_residence: 1.5
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: 0.75
    - name: "1 year ownership, 1.5 years use (ownership is limiting at 50%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: true
        years_owned: 1
        years_used_as_residence: 1.5
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "1 year since last exclusion (50% of 2 year waiting period)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: true
        years_owned: 2
        years_used_as_residence: 2
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 1
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Unforeseen circumstances: 0.5 years owned and used"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: true
        years_owned: 0.5
        years_used_as_residence: 0.5
        prior_exclusion_claimed: false
      expect: 0.25
    - name: "All factors limiting (1 year own, 0.5 use, 1 year since)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        meets_full_requirements: false
        qualifies_for_reduced_exclusion: true
        years_owned: 1
        years_used_as_residence: 0.5
        prior_exclusion_claimed: true
        years_since_last_exclusion: 1
      expect: 0.25

documents.title: Realized Gain on Residence
documents.text:
(6) Recognition of gain attributable to depreciation - Subsection (a) shall
not apply to so much of the gain from the sale of any property as does not
exceed the portion of the depreciation adjustments (as defined in section
1250(b)(3)) attributable to periods after May 6, 1997, in respect of such
property.
documents.code:
text: """
(6) Recognition of gain attributable to depreciation - Subsection (a) shall
not apply to so much of the gain from the sale of any property as does not
exceed the portion of the depreciation adjustments (as defined in section
1250(b)(3)) attributable to periods after May 6, 1997, in respect of such
property.
"""

input realized_gain_on_residence:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Realized Gain on Residence"
  description: "Amount of gain realized on sale or exchange of principal residence"
  default: 0

input depreciation_after_1997:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Depreciation After May 6, 1997"
  description: "Amount of depreciation deductions taken after May 6, 1997 (Section 1250 property)"
  default: 0

variable excludable_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  description: "Gain eligible for exclusion per 121(d)(6) (realized gain minus depreciation recapture)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Depreciation taken after May 6, 1997 is not excludable
    # It is taxed as unrecaptured Section 1250 gain (25% rate)
    return max(0, realized_gain_on_residence - depreciation_after_1997)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No gain realized"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 0
        depreciation_after_1997: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Gain with no depreciation"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 200_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 0
      expect: 200000
    - name: "Gain exceeds depreciation recapture"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 300_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 50_000
      expect: 250000
    - name: "Depreciation equals realized gain (no excludable gain)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 100_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 100_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Depreciation exceeds realized gain (capped at 0)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 50_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 150_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Large gain with moderate depreciation"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 500_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 75_000
      expect: 425000
    - name: "Rental property converted to primary residence"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 400_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 125_000
      expect: 275000
    - name: "Small depreciation on large gain"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 600_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 10_000
      expect: 590000
    - name: "Depreciation before 1997 (not recaptured)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        realized_gain_on_residence: 200_000
        depreciation_after_1997: 0
      expect: 200000

documents.title: Capital Gain Net Income
documents.text:
The term 'capital gain net income' means the excess of the gains from
sales or exchanges of capital assets over the losses from such sales
or exchanges.
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'capital gain net income' means the excess of the gains from
sales or exchanges of capital assets over the losses from such sales
or exchanges.
"""
input capital_gain_net_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Capital Gain Net Income"
  description: "Net capital gains (gains minus losses) per 26 USC §1_222(11), counted for EITC investment income test"
  default: 0

documents.title: DCAP Taxable Amount
documents.text:
(a) EXCLUSION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Gross income of an employee does not include amounts paid
or incurred by the employer for dependent care assistance provided to such
employee if the assistance is furnished pursuant to a program which is
described in subsection (d).
(2) LIMITATION. -- The amount which may be excluded under paragraph (1) for
dependent care assistance with respect to dependent care services provided
during a taxable year shall not exceed $5,000 ($2,500 in the case of a
separate return by a married individual).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) EXCLUSION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Gross income of an employee does not include amounts paid
or incurred by the employer for dependent care assistance provided to such
employee if the assistance is furnished pursuant to a program which is
described in subsection (d).
(2) LIMITATION. -- The amount which may be excluded under paragraph (1) for
dependent care assistance with respect to dependent care services provided
during a taxable year shall not exceed $5,000 ($2,500 in the case of a
separate return by a married individual).
"""

parameter exclusion_limit:
  description: "Maximum DCAP exclusion for most filing statuses"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 5_000
    1981-01-01: 5_000

parameter exclusion_limit_mfs:
  description: "Maximum DCAP exclusion for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2_500
    1981-01-01: 2_500

variable dcap_taxable_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/21/e#num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals
    - 26/129/b#dcap_earned_income_limit
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/129/a#dcap_benefits_received
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "DCAP Taxable Amount"
  description: "Dependent care assistance benefits that exceed the exclusion and are taxable"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No benefits received = nothing taxable
    if dcap_benefits_received == 0:
        return 0
    # No qualifying individuals = full amount is taxable (no exclusion allowed)
    if num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals == 0:
        return dcap_benefits_received
    # Determine statutory exclusion limit based on filing status
    # MFS gets half the limit per 129(a)(2)
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
        statutory_limit = exclusion_limit_mfs
    else:
        statutory_limit = exclusion_limit
    # 129(b): Earned income limit applies - lesser of statutory limit and earned income limit
    applicable_limit = min(statutory_limit, dcap_earned_income_limit)
    # Taxable amount = benefits received minus the allowed exclusion
    return max(0, dcap_benefits_received - applicable_limit)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No benefits received - zero taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 0
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 50_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "No qualifying individuals - full amount taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 3_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 50_000
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Single filer - benefits below limit - zero taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 3_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 40_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single filer - benefits at limit - zero taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 40_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single filer - benefits exceed limit - excess is taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 7_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 40_000
      expect: 2_500

    - name: "Married filing jointly - benefits below limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 4_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 60_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Married filing jointly - benefits exceed limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 8_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 60_000
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Married filing separately - half limit applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 30_000
      expect: 2_500

    - name: "Married filing separately - benefits at reduced limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 2_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 30_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Married filing separately - benefits below reduced limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 1_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 30_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Head of household - full limit applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 6_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 35_000
      expect: 1_500

    - name: "Earned income limit binding - low earner"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 3_000
      expect: 2_000

    - name: "Earned income limit binding - married low earner spouse"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 4_000
      expect: 1_000

    - name: "MFS with earned income limit more restrictive"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 2_000
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Zero earned income - full benefits taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 0
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Large benefits - significant excess"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 10_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 75_000
      expect: 5_000

input dcap_benefits_received:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "DCAP Benefits Received"
  description: "Employer-provided dependent care assistance received during the year"
  default: 0

variable dcap_exclusion_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/21/e#num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals
    - 26/129/b#dcap_earned_income_limit
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/129/a#dcap_benefits_received
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "DCAP Exclusion Amount"
  description: "Amount of DCAP benefits that can be excluded from gross income"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No benefits received = no exclusion
    if dcap_benefits_received == 0:
        return 0
    # No qualifying individuals = no exclusion allowed
    if num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals == 0:
        return 0
    # Determine statutory exclusion limit based on filing status
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
        statutory_limit = exclusion_limit_mfs
    else:
        statutory_limit = exclusion_limit
    # 129(b): Earned income limit applies
    applicable_limit = min(statutory_limit, dcap_earned_income_limit)
    # Exclusion = lesser of benefits received and applicable limit
    return min(dcap_benefits_received, applicable_limit)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No benefits received - zero exclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 0
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 50_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "No qualifying individuals - zero exclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 50_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single filer - benefits below limit - full exclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 3_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 40_000
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Single filer - benefits at limit - full exclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 40_000
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Single filer - benefits exceed limit - capped exclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 7_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 40_000
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Married filing jointly - benefits at limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 60_000
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Married filing jointly - benefits exceed limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 8_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 60_000
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Married filing separately - reduced limit applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 30_000
      expect: 2_500

    - name: "Married filing separately - benefits below reduced limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 1_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 30_000
      expect: 1_500

    - name: "Head of household - full limit applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 6_500
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 35_000
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Earned income limit binding - low earner"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 3_000
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Earned income limit binding - married couple"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 4_000
      expect: 4_000

    - name: "MFS with earned income more restrictive than statutory"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 2_000
      expect: 2_000

    - name: "Zero earned income - zero exclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 5_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Large benefits - exclusion capped at limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_benefits_received: 10_000
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        dcap_earned_income_limit: 75_000
      expect: 5_000

documents.title: DCAP Earned Income Limit
documents.text:
(b) EARNED INCOME LIMITATION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- The amount excluded from the gross income of an employee
under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed --
(A) in the case of an employee who is not married at the close of such
taxable year, the earned income of such employee for such taxable year, or
(B) in the case of an employee who is married at the close of such taxable
year, the lesser of --
(i) the earned income of such employee for such taxable year, or
(ii) the earned income of the spouse of such employee for such taxable year.
(2) SPECIAL RULE FOR CERTAIN SPOUSES. -- For purposes of paragraph (1), in
the case of a spouse who is a student or is incapable of caring for himself,
the spouse is deemed to have earned income of not less than --
(A) $250 per month during which such spouse is a full-time student..., or
(B) $500 per month during which such spouse is incapable of caring for himself
documents.code:
text: """
(b) EARNED INCOME LIMITATION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- The amount excluded from the gross income of an employee
under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed --
(A) in the case of an employee who is not married at the close of such
taxable year, the earned income of such employee for such taxable year, or
(B) in the case of an employee who is married at the close of such taxable
year, the lesser of --
(i) the earned income of such employee for such taxable year, or
(ii) the earned income of the spouse of such employee for such taxable year.
(2) SPECIAL RULE FOR CERTAIN SPOUSES. -- For purposes of paragraph (1), in
the case of a spouse who is a student or is incapable of caring for himself,
the spouse is deemed to have earned income of not less than --
(A) $250 per month during which such spouse is a full-time student..., or
(B) $500 per month during which such spouse is incapable of caring for himself
"""

parameter imputed_monthly_one:
  description: "Monthly imputed income for student/disabled spouse with 1 qualifying individual"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 250
    1981-01-01: 250

parameter imputed_monthly_two:
  description: "Monthly imputed income for student/disabled spouse with 2+ qualifying individuals"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 500
    1981-01-01: 500

parameter qualifying_individuals_higher_imputed_threshold:
  description: "Number of qualifying individuals at which higher imputed income applies"
  unit: count
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2
    1981-01-01: 2

parameter months_per_year:
  description: "Months in a year for annualizing monthly amounts"
  unit: count
  values:
    2024-01-01: 12

variable earned_income_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/21/e#num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "DCAP Earned Income Limit"
  description: "Earned income limitation on dependent care assistance exclusion per 26 USC 129(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Calculate earned income for head and spouse
    # Filter earned income by role, then sum
    head_income = members.earned_income * members.is_tax_unit_head
    spouse_income = members.earned_income * members.is_tax_unit_spouse
    head_earned = sum(members, head_income)
    spouse_actual_earned = sum(members, spouse_income)
    # For single/HoH filers: use the head's earned income
    if filing_status == SINGLE or filing_status == HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD:
        return head_earned
    # For married filers: use lesser of two spouses' earned income
    # But first apply the special rule for student/disabled spouse
    # Check if spouse is student or disabled
    # Filter by spouse status, then check any
    spouse_student_flag = members.is_full_time_student * members.is_tax_unit_spouse
    spouse_disabled_flag = members.is_disabled * members.is_tax_unit_spouse
    spouse_is_student = any(members, spouse_student_flag)
    spouse_is_disabled = any(members, spouse_disabled_flag)
    # Determine imputed income for student/disabled spouse
    # Imputed for 12 months (annual amount)
    imputed_monthly = imputed_monthly_two if num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals >= qualifying_individuals_higher_imputed_threshold else imputed_monthly_one
    imputed_annual = imputed_monthly * months_per_year
    # If spouse is student or disabled, use higher of actual or imputed income
    spouse_earned = max(spouse_actual_earned, imputed_annual) if (spouse_is_student or spouse_is_disabled) else spouse_actual_earned
    return min(head_earned, spouse_earned)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer - earned income limit equals head income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        earned_income: [45_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false]
        is_full_time_student: [false]
        is_disabled: [false]
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
      expect: 45_000

    - name: "Head of household - earned income limit equals head income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        earned_income: [52_000, 0]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, false]
        is_full_time_student: [false, false]
        is_disabled: [false, false]
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
      expect: 52_000

    - name: "Married filing jointly - lesser of two spouses earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [75_000, 35_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
        is_full_time_student: [false, false]
        is_disabled: [false, false]
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
      expect: 35_000

    - name: "Married - student spouse with 1 qualifying individual gets $250/month imputed"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [50_000, 0]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
        is_full_time_student: [false, true]
        is_disabled: [false, false]
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
      # $250/month * 12 months = $3,000 imputed income
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Married - disabled spouse with 2+ qualifying individuals gets $500/month imputed"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [60_000, 0]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
        is_full_time_student: [false, false]
        is_disabled: [false, true]
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
      # $500/month * 12 months = $6,000 imputed income
      expect: 6_000

    - name: "Student spouse actual income exceeds imputed - use actual"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [80_000, 15_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
        is_full_time_student: [false, true]
        is_disabled: [false, false]
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
      # Actual $15,000 > imputed $3,000, so use $15,000
      expect: 15_000

documents.title: Ownership Percentage
documents.code:
text: """
(d) DEPENDENT CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- For purposes of this section a dependent care assistance
program is a separate written plan of an employer for the exclusive
benefit of his employees to provide such employees with dependent care
assistance which meets the requirements of paragraphs (2) through (8)
of this subsection.
(2) DISCRIMINATION. -- The contributions or benefits provided under the
plan shall not discriminate in favor of employees who are highly
compensated employees (within the meaning of section 414(q)) or their
dependents.
(3) ELIGIBILITY. -- The program shall benefit employees who qualify under
a classification set up by the employer and found by the Secretary
not to be discriminatory in favor of employees described in paragraph (2),
or their dependents.
(4) PRINCIPAL SHAREHOLDERS OR OWNERS. -- Not more than 25 percent of the
amounts paid or incurred by the employer for dependent care assistance
during the year may be provided for the class of individuals who are
shareholders or owners (or their spouses or dependents), each of whom
(on any day of the year) owns more than 5 percent of the stock or of
the capital or profits interest in the employer.
(5) NO FUNDING REQUIRED. -- A program referred to in paragraph (1) is not
required to be funded.
(6) NOTIFICATION OF ELIGIBLE EMPLOYEES. -- Reasonable notification of the
availability and terms of the program shall be provided to eligible employees.
(7) STATEMENT OF EXPENSES. -- The plan shall furnish to an employee, on or
before January 31, a written statement showing the amounts paid or
expenses incurred by the employer in providing dependent care assistance
to such employee during the previous calendar year.
(8) BENEFITS. -- --
(A) IN GENERAL. -- The term 'dependent care assistance' means the
payment of, or provision of, those services which if paid for by
the employee would be considered employment-related expenses under
section 21(b)(2).
Note: The definition of "dependent care assistance" in 129(e)(1) references
section 21(b)(1) for the definition of "qualifying individual":
(e) DEFINITIONS AND SPECIAL RULES. --
(1) DEPENDENT CARE ASSISTANCE. -- The term 'dependent care assistance'
means the payment of, or provision of, those services which if paid
for by the employee would be considered employment-related expenses
under section 21(b)(2) (relating to expenses for household and
dependent care services necessary for gainful employment).
"""

# Parameters for Section 129(d)(4) - Principal shareholders/owners limitation

parameter max_shareholder_benefit_share:
  description: "Maximum share of DCAP benefits that can go to 5%+ shareholders/owners"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 0.25

parameter shareholder_ownership_threshold:
  description: "Ownership threshold above which shareholder limitation applies"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 0.05

# Variable to determine if someone is a principal shareholder/owner per 129(d)(4)

input ownership_percentage:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "Ownership Percentage"
  description: "Person's ownership percentage (stock, capital, or profits interest) in the employer"
  default: 0

variable is_principal_shareholder:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Principal Shareholder/Owner"
  description: "Whether person owns more than 5% of employer per 26 USC 129(d)(4)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Principal shareholder is anyone owning more than 5% of stock/capital/profits
    return ownership_percentage > shareholder_ownership_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "No ownership - not a principal shareholder"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ownership_percentage: 0
      expect: false

    - name: "4% ownership - not a principal shareholder (below threshold)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ownership_percentage: 0.04
      expect: false

    - name: "5% ownership - not a principal shareholder (at threshold, not above)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ownership_percentage: 0.05
      expect: false

    - name: "6% ownership - is a principal shareholder (above threshold)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ownership_percentage: 0.06
      expect: true

    - name: "10% ownership - is a principal shareholder"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ownership_percentage: 0.10
      expect: true

    - name: "100% ownership - is a principal shareholder (sole owner)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ownership_percentage: 1.0
      expect: true

# Variable to check if DCAP passes the 25% shareholder limitation test

input total_dcap_benefits_paid:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "Total DCAP Benefits Paid"
  description: "Total dependent care assistance benefits paid by employer during the year"
  default: 0

input dcap_benefits_to_shareholders:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  label: "DCAP Benefits to Principal Shareholders"
  description: "Amount of DCAP benefits paid to 5%+ shareholders, their spouses, and dependents"
  default: 0

variable dcap_shareholder_benefit_share:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "DCAP Shareholder Benefit Share"
  description: "Share of DCAP benefits provided to principal shareholders (5%+ owners) per 26 USC 129(d)(4)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Avoid division by zero - if no benefits paid, share is 0
    if total_dcap_benefits_paid == 0:
        return 0
    return dcap_benefits_to_shareholders / total_dcap_benefits_paid
  tests:
    - name: "No benefits paid - zero share"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        total_dcap_benefits_paid: 0
        dcap_benefits_to_shareholders: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "No shareholder benefits - zero share"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        total_dcap_benefits_paid: 100_000
        dcap_benefits_to_shareholders: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "10% to shareholders - below limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        total_dcap_benefits_paid: 100_000
        dcap_benefits_to_shareholders: 10_000
      expect: 0.10

    - name: "25% to shareholders - at limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        total_dcap_benefits_paid: 200_000
        dcap_benefits_to_shareholders: 50_000
      expect: 0.25

    - name: "40% to shareholders - above limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        total_dcap_benefits_paid: 50_000
        dcap_benefits_to_shareholders: 20_000
      expect: 0.40

variable dcap_passes_shareholder_test:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "DCAP Passes Shareholder Test"
  description: "Whether DCAP satisfies 25% limit on benefits to principal shareholders per 26 USC 129(d)(4)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Pass test if shareholder share is at or below 25% limit
    return dcap_shareholder_benefit_share <= max_shareholder_benefit_share
  tests:
    - name: "No benefits paid - passes test"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_shareholder_benefit_share: 0
      expect: true

    - name: "10% to shareholders - passes test"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_shareholder_benefit_share: 0.10
      expect: true

    - name: "24% to shareholders - passes test (just under limit)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_shareholder_benefit_share: 0.24
      expect: true

    - name: "25% to shareholders - passes test (at limit)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_shareholder_benefit_share: 0.25
      expect: true

    - name: "26% to shareholders - fails test (just over limit)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_shareholder_benefit_share: 0.26
      expect: false

    - name: "50% to shareholders - fails test (well over limit)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dcap_shareholder_benefit_share: 0.50
      expect: false

documents.title: Net Self-Employment Earnings
documents.text:
26 USC 1401(a) - Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance

(a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance.
In addition to other taxes, there shall be imposed for each taxable year,
on the self-employment income of every individual, a tax equal to 12.4 percent
of the amount of the self-employment income for such taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC 1401(a) - Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance

(a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance.
In addition to other taxes, there shall be imposed for each taxable year,
on the self-employment income of every individual, a tax equal to 12.4 percent
of the amount of the self-employment income for such taxable year.
"""

# Self-Employment Tax - OASDI Component
# Per 26 USC 1401(a) - 12.4% on self-employment income up to wage base

# OASDI tax rate for self-employment
parameter se_oasdi_rate:
  values:
    1984-01-01: 0.124  # 12.4% combined employer + employee share

# Social Security wage base
# Per 26 USC 3121(a)(1), as adjusted annually
parameter social_security_wage_base:
  values:
    2023-01-01: 160_200
    2024-01-01: 168_600
    2025-01-01: 176_100

input net_self_employment_earnings:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Self-Employment Earnings"
  description: "Net earnings from self-employment per 26 USC 1402"
  default: 0

input irs_employment_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employment Income"
  description: "Wages subject to FICA taxes"
  default: 0

variable se_income_subject_to_oasdi:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SE Income Subject to OASDI"
  description: "Self-employment income subject to OASDI tax (limited by wage base minus wages)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 26 USC 1401(a) and 3121(a)(1):
    # SE income subject to OASDI is limited by wage base minus FICA wages
    remaining_wage_base = max(0, social_security_wage_base - irs_employment_income)
    return min(net_self_employment_earnings, remaining_wage_base)
  tests:
    - name: "Full SE income subject when no wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 50000
        irs_employment_income: 0
        social_security_wage_base: 168600
      expect: 50000
    - name: "SE income limited by remaining wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 50000
        irs_employment_income: 150000
        social_security_wage_base: 168600
      expect: 18600
    - name: "No SE income subject when wages exceed base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 50000
        irs_employment_income: 200000
        social_security_wage_base: 168600
      expect: 0
    - name: "High SE income capped at wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 200000
        irs_employment_income: 0
        social_security_wage_base: 168600
      expect: 168600

variable self_employment_social_security_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employment OASDI Tax"
  description: "Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance tax per 26 USC 1401(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 26 USC 1401(a): 12.4% of self-employment income up to wage base
    return se_income_subject_to_oasdi * se_oasdi_rate
  tests:
    - name: "Standard OASDI calculation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_oasdi: 50000
        se_oasdi_rate: 0.124
      expect: 6200
    - name: "Maximum OASDI at wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_oasdi: 168600
        se_oasdi_rate: 0.124
      expect: 20906.40
    - name: "Zero SE tax when no SE income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_oasdi: 0
        se_oasdi_rate: 0.124
      expect: 0
    - name: "Partial SE income after wage offset"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_oasdi: 18600
        se_oasdi_rate: 0.124
      expect: 2306.40

documents.title: Self-Employment Medicare Tax
documents.text:
26 USC 1401(b)(1) - Hospital Insurance

(b) Hospital insurance.—
(1) In general.
In addition to the tax imposed by the preceding subsection, there shall be
imposed for each taxable year, on the self-employment income of every
individual, a tax equal to 2.9 percent of the amount of the self-employment
income for such taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC 1401(b)(1) - Hospital Insurance

(b) Hospital insurance.—
(1) In general.
In addition to the tax imposed by the preceding subsection, there shall be
imposed for each taxable year, on the self-employment income of every
individual, a tax equal to 2.9 percent of the amount of the self-employment
income for such taxable year.
"""

# Self-Employment Tax - Hospital Insurance (Medicare) Base Component
# Per 26 USC 1401(b)(1) - 2.9% on all self-employment income (no wage base cap)

imports:
  - 26/1401/a#net_self_employment_earnings

# Hospital Insurance (Medicare) tax rate for self-employment
parameter se_hospital_insurance_rate:
  values:
    1984-01-01: 0.029  # 2.9% combined employer + employee share

variable self_employment_medicare_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employment Medicare Tax"
  description: "Hospital Insurance tax per 26 USC 1401(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 26 USC 1401(b)(1): 2.9% of all self-employment income
    # Unlike OASDI, there is no wage base cap for Medicare
    return net_self_employment_earnings * se_hospital_insurance_rate
  tests:
    - name: "Standard Medicare calculation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 50000
        se_hospital_insurance_rate: 0.029
      expect: 1450
    - name: "High earner Medicare (no cap)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 500000
        se_hospital_insurance_rate: 0.029
      expect: 14500
    - name: "Zero Medicare tax when no SE income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 0
        se_hospital_insurance_rate: 0.029
      expect: 0
    - name: "Moderate SE income Medicare tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        net_self_employment_earnings: 100000
        se_hospital_insurance_rate: 0.029
      expect: 2900

documents.title: Additional Medicare Tax
documents.text:
26 USC 1401(b)(2) - Additional Tax

(2) Additional tax.—
In addition to the tax imposed by paragraph (1), there shall be imposed for
each taxable year, on the self-employment income of every individual, a tax
equal to 0.9 percent of so much of the self-employment income (as defined
in section 1402(b)) as exceeds—
(A) in the case of a joint return, $250,000,
(B) in the case of a married individual (as defined in section 7703)
filing a separate return, 1/2 of the dollar amount determined under
subparagraph (A), and
(C) in any other case, $200,000.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC 1401(b)(2) - Additional Tax

(2) Additional tax.—
In addition to the tax imposed by paragraph (1), there shall be imposed for
each taxable year, on the self-employment income of every individual, a tax
equal to 0.9 percent of so much of the self-employment income (as defined
in section 1402(b)) as exceeds—
(A) in the case of a joint return, $250,000,
(B) in the case of a married individual (as defined in section 7703)
filing a separate return, 1/2 of the dollar amount determined under
subparagraph (A), and
(C) in any other case, $200,000.
"""

# Additional Medicare Tax - 26 USC 1401(b)(2)
# 0.9% on SE income above thresholds (effective for tax years after 2012)

imports:
  - 26/1401/a#net_self_employment_earnings
  - 26/1401/a#irs_employment_income

# Additional Medicare Tax rate
parameter additional_medicare_rate:
  values:
    2013-01-01: 0.009  # 0.9% additional rate

# Threshold for joint returns
parameter additional_medicare_threshold_joint:
  values:
    2013-01-01: 250_000

# Threshold for married filing separately
parameter additional_medicare_threshold_separate:
  values:
    2013-01-01: 125_000

# Threshold for single, HOH, surviving spouse
parameter additional_medicare_threshold_single:
  values:
    2013-01-01: 200_000

variable additional_medicare_tax:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Medicare Tax"
  description: "0.9% additional Medicare tax on self-employment income and wages above threshold per 26 USC 1401(b)(2)"
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Aggregate wage and SE income across household
    return self_employment_additional_medicare_tax
  default: 0

variable combined_medicare_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Combined Medicare Income"
  description: "Combined wages and SE income for Additional Medicare Tax threshold"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    total_wages = sum(members, irs_employment_income)
    total_se = sum(members, net_self_employment_earnings)
    return total_wages + total_se
  tests:
    - name: "Single individual with wages and SE income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 100_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 50_000
      expect: 150000
    - name: "Two individuals in household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 120_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 40_000
          - irs_employment_income: 80_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 30_000
      expect: 270000
    - name: "Only SE income, no wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 0
            net_self_employment_earnings: 75_000
      expect: 75000

variable additional_medicare_tax_threshold:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Medicare Tax Threshold"
  description: "Income threshold for Additional Medicare Tax based on filing status"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # (A) Joint return = $250k
    # (B) Married filing separately = $125k
    # (C) Any other case = $200k (Single, HOH, Surviving Spouse)
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        return additional_medicare_threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == SEPARATE:
        return additional_medicare_threshold_separate
    else:
        return additional_medicare_threshold_single
  tests:
    - name: "Joint return threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        additional_medicare_threshold_joint: 250000
        additional_medicare_threshold_separate: 125000
        additional_medicare_threshold_single: 200000
      expect: 250000
    - name: "Married filing separately threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SEPARATE
        additional_medicare_threshold_joint: 250000
        additional_medicare_threshold_separate: 125000
        additional_medicare_threshold_single: 200000
      expect: 125000
    - name: "Single filer threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        additional_medicare_threshold_joint: 250000
        additional_medicare_threshold_separate: 125000
        additional_medicare_threshold_single: 200000
      expect: 200000
    - name: "Head of household threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        additional_medicare_threshold_joint: 250000
        additional_medicare_threshold_separate: 125000
        additional_medicare_threshold_single: 200000
      expect: 200000

variable se_income_subject_to_additional_medicare_tax:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SE Income Subject to Additional Medicare Tax"
  description: "Self-employment income subject to 0.9% additional tax per 1_401(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    total_se = sum(members, net_self_employment_earnings)
    total_wages = sum(members, irs_employment_income)
    threshold = additional_medicare_tax_threshold
    # Case 1: Wages already exceed threshold - all SE income is subject
    # Case 2: Wages below threshold - only SE income above (threshold - wages) is subject
    wages_under_threshold = max(0, threshold - total_wages)
    se_above_remaining_threshold = max(0, total_se - wages_under_threshold)
    return se_above_remaining_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Wages exceed threshold - all SE income subject"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 260_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 50_000
        additional_medicare_tax_threshold: 250_000
      expect: 50000
    - name: "Wages below threshold - partial SE income subject"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 200_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 60_000
        additional_medicare_tax_threshold: 250_000
      expect: 10000
    - name: "Wages and SE both below threshold - no SE income subject"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 150_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 40_000
        additional_medicare_tax_threshold: 250_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "No wages, only SE income - portion above threshold subject"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 0
            net_self_employment_earnings: 280_000
        additional_medicare_tax_threshold: 200_000
      expect: 80000
    - name: "Married filing separately lower threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 100_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 50_000
        additional_medicare_tax_threshold: 125_000
      expect: 25000
    - name: "Household with two earners, combined exceeds threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 160_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 40_000
          - irs_employment_income: 60_000
            net_self_employment_earnings: 30_000
        additional_medicare_tax_threshold: 250_000
      expect: 40000

variable self_employment_additional_medicare_tax:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Medicare Tax (Self-Employment)"
  description: "0.9% additional Medicare tax on SE income above threshold per 26 USC 1401(b)(2)"
  formula: return additional_medicare_rate * se_income_subject_to_additional_medicare_tax
  tests:
    - name: "0.9% tax on SE income above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_additional_medicare_tax: 50000
        additional_medicare_rate: 0.009
      expect: 450
    - name: "No tax when SE income below threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_additional_medicare_tax: 0
        additional_medicare_rate: 0.009
      expect: 0
    - name: "High earner with substantial SE above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_additional_medicare_tax: 100000
        additional_medicare_rate: 0.009
      expect: 900
    - name: "Moderate additional Medicare tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        se_income_subject_to_additional_medicare_tax: 25000
        additional_medicare_rate: 0.009
      expect: 225

documents.title: Net Earnings from Self-Employment
documents.text:
The term 'net earnings from self-employment' means the gross income derived
by an individual from any trade or business carried on by such individual,
less the deductions allowed by this subtitle which are attributable to such
trade or business...
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'net earnings from self-employment' means the gross income derived
by an individual from any trade or business carried on by such individual,
less the deductions allowed by this subtitle which are attributable to such
trade or business...
"""
input net_earnings_self_employment:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Earnings from Self-Employment"
  description: "Gross self-employment income less attributable business deductions"
  default: 0

documents.title: Filing Status
documents.code:
# https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=granuleid:USC-prelim-title26-section1411

text: |
  26 USC 1411 - Imposition of tax

  (a) In general
    (1) Application to individuals
    In the case of an individual, there shall be imposed (in addition to any other
    tax imposed by this subtitle) for each taxable year a tax equal to 3.8 percent
    of the lesser of—
      (A) net investment income for such taxable year, or
      (B) the excess (if any) of—
        (i) the modified adjusted gross income for such taxable year, over
        (ii) the threshold amount.

  (b) Threshold amount
    For purposes of this chapter, the term "threshold amount" means—
      (1) in the case of a taxpayer making a joint return under section 6013 or
          a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)), $250,000,
      (2) in the case of a married taxpayer (as defined in section 7703) filing
          a separate return, $125,000, and
      (3) in any other case, $200,000.

  (c) Net investment income
    For purposes of this chapter—
      (1) In general
      The term "net investment income" means the excess (if any) of—
        (A) the sum of—
          (i) gross income from interest, dividends, annuities, royalties, and rents,
              other than such income which is derived in the ordinary course of a
              trade or business not described in paragraph (2),
          (ii) other gross income derived from a trade or business described in
               paragraph (2), and
          (iii) net gain (to the extent taken into account in computing taxable
                income) attributable to the disposition of property other than
                property held in a trade or business not described in paragraph (2), over
        (B) the deductions allowed by this subtitle which are properly allocable
            to such gross income or net gain.

  (d) Modified adjusted gross income
    For purposes of this chapter, the term "modified adjusted gross income" means
    adjusted gross income increased by the excess of—
      (1) the amount excluded from gross income under section 911(a)(1), over
      (2) the amount of any deductions (taken into account in computing adjusted
          gross income) or exclusions disallowed under section 911(d)(6) with
          respect to the amounts described in paragraph (1).

# 26 USC 1411(a)(1) - NIIT rate
parameter niit_rate:
  description: "Net Investment Income Tax rate per 26 USC 1411(a)(1)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2013-01-01: 0.038

# 26 USC 1411(b)(1) - Joint return threshold
parameter niit_threshold_joint:
  description: "NIIT threshold for joint returns and surviving spouses"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 250_000

# 26 USC 1411(b)(2) - Married filing separately threshold
parameter niit_threshold_separate:
  description: "NIIT threshold for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 125_000

# 26 USC 1411(b)(3) - Other threshold (single, HOH)
parameter niit_threshold_other:
  description: "NIIT threshold for single filers and heads of household"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 200_000

input filing_status:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Enum
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: "Tax filing status (SINGLE, JOINT, SEPARATE, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD, SURVIVING_SPOUSE)"
  default: SINGLE

input adjusted_gross_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Gross Income"
  description: "AGI per 26 USC 62"
  default: 0

input foreign_earned_income_exclusion:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Foreign Earned Income Exclusion"
  description: "Amount excluded under 26 USC 911(a)(1)"
  default: 0

input net_investment_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Investment Income"
  description: "Net investment income per 26 USC 1411(c)"
  default: 0

variable niit_standalone:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Investment Income Tax"
  description: "3.8% surtax on investment income for high-income taxpayers per 26 USC 1411(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 1411(d): Modified AGI = AGI + foreign earned income exclusion
    magi = adjusted_gross_income + foreign_earned_income_exclusion
    # Section 1411(b): Determine threshold based on filing status
    # (1) Joint return or surviving spouse: $250,000
    # (2) Married filing separately: $125,000 (half of joint)
    # (3) Any other case (single, HOH): $200,000
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        threshold = niit_threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == SURVIVING_SPOUSE:
        threshold = niit_threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == SEPARATE:
        threshold = niit_threshold_separate
    else:
        threshold = niit_threshold_other
    # Section 1411(a)(1)(B): Excess of MAGI over threshold
    excess_magi = max(0, magi - threshold)
    # Section 1411(a)(1): Tax is rate (3.8%) times lesser of:
    # (A) net investment income, or
    # (B) excess of MAGI over threshold
    taxable_amount = min(net_investment_income, excess_magi)
    return niit_rate * taxable_amount
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ========================================
    # Basic cases - income below threshold
    # ========================================
    - name: "Single filer below threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 175_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 40_000
      # MAGI $175k < threshold $200k, no excess MAGI
      expect: 0

    # ========================================
    # Above threshold cases
    # ========================================
    - name: "Single filer above threshold - NII is limiting factor"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 350_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 60_000
      # MAGI excess: $350k - $200k = $150k
      # NII: $60k (limiting factor since $60k < $150k)
      # Tax: $60,000 * 0.038 = $2,280
      expect: 2_280

    - name: "Joint filers above threshold - excess MAGI is limiting factor"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 290_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 100_000
      # MAGI excess: $290k - $250k = $40k (limiting factor since $40k < $100k)
      # NII: $100k
      # Tax: $40,000 * 0.038 = $1,520
      expect: 1_520

    # ========================================
    # Filing status with lower threshold
    # ========================================
    - name: "Married filing separately - lower $125k threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SEPARATE
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 55_000
      # MFS uses $125k threshold (half of joint)
      # MAGI excess: $200k - $125k = $75k
      # NII: $55k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $55,000 * 0.038 = $2,090
      expect: 2_090

    # ========================================
    # Foreign earned income exclusion case
    # ========================================
    - name: "FEIE adds to MAGI pushing over threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 160_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 80_000
        net_investment_income: 25_000
      # MAGI: $160k AGI + $80k FEIE = $240k
      # MAGI excess: $240k - $200k = $40k
      # NII: $25k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $25,000 * 0.038 = $950
      expect: 950

    # ========================================
    # Edge case - exactly at threshold
    # ========================================
    - name: "Joint filers exactly at threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 250_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 75_000
      # MAGI $250k = threshold $250k, excess = $0
      # No tax regardless of NII amount
      expect: 0

documents.title: Net Investment Income Tax
documents.text:
(a) In general. - In the case of an individual, there shall be imposed
(in addition to any other tax imposed by this subtitle) for each taxable year
a tax equal to 3.8 percent of the lesser of -
(A) net investment income for such taxable year, or
(B) the excess (if any) of -
(i) modified adjusted gross income for such taxable year, over
(ii) the threshold amount.
(b) Threshold amount. - For purposes of this chapter, the term 'threshold amount' means -
(1) in the case of a taxpayer making a joint return under section 6013 or
a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)), $250,000,
(2) in the case of a married taxpayer (as defined in section 7703) filing a
separate return, one-half of the dollar amount determined under paragraph (1), and
(3) in any other case, $200,000.
(d) Modified adjusted gross income. - For purposes of this chapter, the term
'modified adjusted gross income' means adjusted gross income increased by the
excess of -
(1) the amount excluded from gross income under section 911(a)(1), over
(2) the amount of any deductions (taken into account in computing adjusted
gross income) or exclusions disallowed under section 911(d)(6) with respect
to the amounts described in paragraph (1).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) In general. - In the case of an individual, there shall be imposed
(in addition to any other tax imposed by this subtitle) for each taxable year
a tax equal to 3.8 percent of the lesser of -
(A) net investment income for such taxable year, or
(B) the excess (if any) of -
(i) modified adjusted gross income for such taxable year, over
(ii) the threshold amount.
(b) Threshold amount. - For purposes of this chapter, the term 'threshold amount' means -
(1) in the case of a taxpayer making a joint return under section 6013 or
a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)), $250,000,
(2) in the case of a married taxpayer (as defined in section 7703) filing a
separate return, one-half of the dollar amount determined under paragraph (1), and
(3) in any other case, $200,000.
(d) Modified adjusted gross income. - For purposes of this chapter, the term
'modified adjusted gross income' means adjusted gross income increased by the
excess of -
(1) the amount excluded from gross income under section 911(a)(1), over
(2) the amount of any deductions (taken into account in computing adjusted
gross income) or exclusions disallowed under section 911(d)(6) with respect
to the amounts described in paragraph (1).
"""

# Parameters from Section 1411(a) and (b)
parameter niit_rate:
  description: "Net Investment Income Tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2013-01-01: 0.038

parameter threshold_joint:
  description: "NIIT threshold for joint filers and surviving spouses"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 250_000

parameter threshold_separate:
  description: "NIIT threshold for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 125_000

parameter threshold_other:
  description: "NIIT threshold for single and head of household filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 200_000

variable niit:
  imports:
    - 26/1411/c#net_investment_income
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/911/a#foreign_earned_income_exclusion
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Investment Income Tax"
  description: "3.8% surtax on investment income for high-income taxpayers per Section 1_411(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 1411(d): Modified AGI = AGI + foreign earned income exclusion
    magi = adjusted_gross_income + foreign_earned_income_exclusion
    # Section 1411(b): Determine threshold based on filing status
    # (1) Joint return or surviving spouse: $250,000
    # (2) Married filing separately: $125,000 (half of joint)
    # (3) Any other case (single, HOH): $200,000
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        threshold = threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == SURVIVING_SPOUSE:
        threshold = threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == SEPARATE:
        threshold = threshold_separate
    else:
        threshold = threshold_other
    # Section 1411(a)(1)(B): Excess of MAGI over threshold
    excess_magi = max(0, magi - threshold)
    # Section 1411(a)(1): Tax is rate (3.8%) times lesser of:
    # (A) net investment income, or
    # (B) excess of MAGI over threshold
    taxable_amount = min(net_investment_income, excess_magi)
    return niit_rate * taxable_amount
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ========================================
    # Basic cases - income below threshold
    # ========================================
    - name: "Single filer below threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 30_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI $150k < threshold $200k, no excess MAGI
      expect: 0

    - name: "Joint filers below threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 240_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 50_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # MAGI $240k < threshold $250k, no excess MAGI
      expect: 0

    - name: "Zero income - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 0
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      expect: 0

    # ========================================
    # Basic cases - income above threshold
    # ========================================
    - name: "Single filer above threshold - NII limiting"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 300_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 50_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI excess: $300k - $200k = $100k
      # NII: $50k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $50,000 * 0.038 = $1,900
      expect: 1_900

    - name: "Single filer above threshold - excess MAGI limiting"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 250_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 100_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI excess: $250k - $200k = $50k (limiting factor)
      # NII: $100k
      # Tax: $50,000 * 0.038 = $1,900
      expect: 1_900

    - name: "Joint filers above threshold - NII limiting"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 400_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 75_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # MAGI excess: $400k - $250k = $150k
      # NII: $75k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $75,000 * 0.038 = $2,850
      expect: 2_850

    - name: "Joint filers above threshold - excess MAGI limiting"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 300_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 200_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # MAGI excess: $300k - $250k = $50k (limiting factor)
      # NII: $200k
      # Tax: $50,000 * 0.038 = $1,900
      expect: 1_900

    # ========================================
    # Edge cases - at threshold
    # ========================================
    - name: "Single filer exactly at threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 50_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI excess: $200k - $200k = $0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single filer $1 over threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_001
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 50_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI excess: $200,001 - $200k = $1 (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $1 * 0.038 = $0.038
      expect: 0.038

    - name: "Joint filers exactly at threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 250_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 100_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # MAGI excess: $250k - $250k = $0
      expect: 0

    # ========================================
    # Filing status variations
    # ========================================
    - name: "Head of household above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        adjusted_gross_income: 280_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 60_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # HOH uses $200k threshold (same as single)
      # MAGI excess: $280k - $200k = $80k
      # NII: $60k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $60,000 * 0.038 = $2,280
      expect: 2_280

    - name: "Married filing separately above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SEPARATE
        adjusted_gross_income: 175_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 40_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_separate: 125_000
      # MFS uses $125k threshold (half of joint)
      # MAGI excess: $175k - $125k = $50k
      # NII: $40k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $40,000 * 0.038 = $1,520
      expect: 1_520

    - name: "Married filing separately below threshold - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SEPARATE
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 25_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_separate: 125_000
      # MAGI $100k < threshold $125k
      expect: 0

    - name: "Surviving spouse above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SURVIVING_SPOUSE
        adjusted_gross_income: 350_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 80_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # Surviving spouse uses joint threshold ($250k)
      # MAGI excess: $350k - $250k = $100k
      # NII: $80k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $80,000 * 0.038 = $3,040
      expect: 3_040

    # ========================================
    # Zero investment income cases
    # ========================================
    - name: "High income but zero investment income - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 500_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 0
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # NII is $0, so min(0, excess) = $0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Joint very high income but zero investment income - no NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 1_000_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 0
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # NII is $0, so no tax
      expect: 0

    # ========================================
    # Foreign earned income exclusion cases
    # ========================================
    - name: "FEIE pushes MAGI above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 180_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 50_000
        net_investment_income: 30_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI: $180k + $50k = $230k
      # MAGI excess: $230k - $200k = $30k
      # NII: $30k (equal to excess)
      # Tax: $30,000 * 0.038 = $1,140
      expect: 1_140

    - name: "FEIE included but still below threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 140_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 40_000
        net_investment_income: 25_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI: $140k + $40k = $180k < $200k threshold
      expect: 0

    - name: "Joint with FEIE above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 100_000
        net_investment_income: 60_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # MAGI: $200k + $100k = $300k
      # MAGI excess: $300k - $250k = $50k (limiting factor)
      # NII: $60k
      # Tax: $50,000 * 0.038 = $1,900
      expect: 1_900

    # ========================================
    # High income scenarios
    # ========================================
    - name: "Very high income single - large NIIT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 1_000_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 500_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI excess: $1M - $200k = $800k
      # NII: $500k (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $500,000 * 0.038 = $19,000
      expect: 19_000

    - name: "Very high income joint - NII equals excess MAGI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        adjusted_gross_income: 750_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 500_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_joint: 250_000
      # MAGI excess: $750k - $250k = $500k
      # NII: $500k (equal to excess)
      # Tax: $500,000 * 0.038 = $19,000
      expect: 19_000

    - name: "Multi-millionaire single filer"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000_000
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
        net_investment_income: 3_000_000
        niit_rate: 0.038
        threshold_other: 200_000
      # MAGI excess: $5M - $200k = $4.8M
      # NII: $3M (limiting factor)
      # Tax: $3,000,000 * 0.038 = $114,000
      expect: 114_000

documents.title: Net Investment Income
documents.text:
(c) Net investment income. - For purposes of this chapter -
(1) In general. - The term 'net investment income' means the excess (if any) of -
(A) the sum of -
(i) gross income from interest, dividends, annuities, royalties, and rents,
other than such income which is derived in the ordinary course of a trade
or business not described in paragraph (2),
(ii) other gross income derived from a trade or business described in paragraph (2), and
(iii) net gain (to the extent taken into account in computing taxable income)
attributable to the disposition of property other than property held in a
trade or business not described in paragraph (2), over
(B) the deductions allowed by this subtitle which are properly allocable to such
gross income or net gain.
(2) Passive activity income. - A trade or business is described in this paragraph if -
(A) such trade or business is a passive activity (within the meaning of section 469)
with respect to the taxpayer, or
(B) such trade or business consists of trading in financial instruments or commodities.
documents.code:
text: """
(c) Net investment income. - For purposes of this chapter -
(1) In general. - The term 'net investment income' means the excess (if any) of -
(A) the sum of -
(i) gross income from interest, dividends, annuities, royalties, and rents,
other than such income which is derived in the ordinary course of a trade
or business not described in paragraph (2),
(ii) other gross income derived from a trade or business described in paragraph (2), and
(iii) net gain (to the extent taken into account in computing taxable income)
attributable to the disposition of property other than property held in a
trade or business not described in paragraph (2), over
(B) the deductions allowed by this subtitle which are properly allocable to such
gross income or net gain.
(2) Passive activity income. - A trade or business is described in this paragraph if -
(A) such trade or business is a passive activity (within the meaning of section 469)
with respect to the taxpayer, or
(B) such trade or business consists of trading in financial instruments or commodities.
"""
variable net_investment_income:
  imports:
    - 26/32/i/2/C#rental_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Investment Income"
  description: "Net investment income for NIIT purposes per Section 1_411(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 1411(c)(1)(A)(i): Investment income from interest, dividends, annuities, royalties, rents
    # Note: Uses taxable interest only (excludes tax-exempt muni bond interest per Section 103)
    investment_income = (
        sum(members, taxable_interest_income) +
        sum(members, dividend_income) +
        sum(members, rental_income) +
        sum(members, royalty_income) +
        sum(members, annuity_income)
    )
    # Section 1411(c)(1)(A)(iii): Net capital gains (loss-limited)
    # loss_limited_net_capital_gains is already at TaxUnit level
    capital_gains_component = loss_limited_net_capital_gains
    # Section 1411(c)(2): Passive business income
    passive_component = sum(members, passive_business_income)
    # Total NII before deductions
    gross_nii = investment_income + capital_gains_component + passive_component
    # Section 1411(c)(1)(B): Deductions properly allocable to NII
    # This is a simplified calculation - full implementation would include
    # investment interest expense, margin interest, and other allocable deductions
    # TODO: Add allocable_investment_deductions when available
    return max(0, gross_nii)
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ========================================
    # Basic investment income aggregation
    # ========================================
    - name: "Interest and dividends only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_interest_income: 5_000
        dividend_income: 3_000
        rental_income: 0
        royalty_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        loss_limited_net_capital_gains: 0
        passive_business_income: 0
      # NII = $5,000 + $3,000 = $8,000
      expect: 8_000

    - name: "All investment income types"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_interest_income: 10_000
        dividend_income: 8_000
        rental_income: 12_000
        royalty_income: 5_000
        annuity_income: 6_000
        loss_limited_net_capital_gains: 0
        passive_business_income: 0
      # NII = $10k + $8k + $12k + $5k + $6k = $41,000
      expect: 41_000

    - name: "Zero investment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        rental_income: 0
        royalty_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        loss_limited_net_capital_gains: 0
        passive_business_income: 0
      expect: 0

    # ========================================
    # Capital gains component
    # ========================================
    - name: "Capital gains with investment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_interest_income: 2_000
        dividend_income: 4_000
        rental_income: 0
        royalty_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        loss_limited_net_capital_gains: 25_000
        passive_business_income: 0
      # Investment income: $2k + $4k = $6k
      # Capital gains: $25k
      # NII = $6k + $25k = $31,000
      expect: 31_000

    - name: "Capital gains only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
