        taxable_interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        rental_income: 0
        royalty_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        loss_limited_net_capital_gains: 50_000
        passive_business_income: 0
      # NII = $50,000 (capital gains only)
      expect: 50_000

    # ========================================
    # Passive business income component
    # ========================================
    - name: "Passive income with other investment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_interest_income: 3_000
        dividend_income: 2_000
        rental_income: 8_000
        royalty_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        loss_limited_net_capital_gains: 10_000
        passive_business_income: 15_000
      # Investment income: $3k + $2k + $8k = $13k
      # Capital gains: $10k
      # Passive: $15k
      # NII = $13k + $10k + $15k = $38,000
      expect: 38_000

documents.title: Personal Exemption
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of deductions.-- In the case of an individual, the
exemptions provided by this section shall be allowed as deductions
in computing taxable income.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Allowance of deductions.-- In the case of an individual, the
exemptions provided by this section shall be allowed as deductions
in computing taxable income.
"""

documents.title: Is Qualifying Child under §152(c)
documents.text:
(c) Qualifying child.—For purposes of this section—
(1) In general.—The term 'qualifying child' means, with respect to any
taxpayer for any taxable year, an individual—
(A) who bears a relationship to the taxpayer described in paragraph (2),
(B) who has the same principal place of abode as the taxpayer for more
than one-half of such taxable year,
(C) who meets the age requirements of paragraph (3), and
(D) who has not provided over one-half of such individual's own support
for the calendar year in which the taxable year of the taxpayer begins.
documents.code:
text: """
(c) Qualifying child.—For purposes of this section—
(1) In general.—The term 'qualifying child' means, with respect to any
taxpayer for any taxable year, an individual—
(A) who bears a relationship to the taxpayer described in paragraph (2),
(B) who has the same principal place of abode as the taxpayer for more
than one-half of such taxable year,
(C) who meets the age requirements of paragraph (3), and
(D) who has not provided over one-half of such individual's own support
for the calendar year in which the taxable year of the taxpayer begins.
"""

parameter age_limit_general:
  description: "Age limit for qualifying child (general)"
  unit: years
  values:
    2018-01-01: 19

parameter age_limit_student:
  description: "Age limit for qualifying child who is a student"
  unit: years
  values:
    2018-01-01: 24

variable is_qualifying_child:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Qualifying Child under §152(c)"
  description: "Meets all requirements of 26 USC §152(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # (A) has not attained the age of 19 as of the close of the calendar year
    under_19 = age < age_limit_general
    # (B) is a student who has not attained the age of 24
    student_under_24 = is_student and age < age_limit_student
    # (C) is permanently and totally disabled at any time during such calendar year
    disabled = is_permanently_disabled
    return under_19 or student_under_24 or disabled
  tests:
    - name: "Child under 19 qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 15
        is_student: false
        is_permanently_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Child at age 18 qualifies (under 19)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 18
        is_student: false
        is_permanently_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Non-student age 19 does not qualify"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 19
        is_student: false
        is_permanently_disabled: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Student under 24 qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 21
        is_student: true
        is_permanently_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Student at age 24 does not qualify"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 24
        is_student: true
        is_permanently_disabled: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Disabled individual qualifies regardless of age"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 45
        is_student: false
        is_permanently_disabled: true
      expect: true

documents.title: Self-Employed Health Insurance Premiums Paid
documents.text:
(l) Special rules for health insurance costs of self-employed individuals.—
(1) Allowance of deduction.—In the case of an individual who is an
employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), there shall be
allowed as a deduction under this section an amount equal to the
amount paid during the taxable year for insurance which constitutes
medical care for the taxpayer, his spouse, and dependents.
(2) Limitations.—
(A) Dollar amount.—No deduction shall be allowed under paragraph (1)
to the extent that the amount of such deduction exceeds the
taxpayer's earned income derived by the taxpayer from the trade
or business with respect to which the plan providing the medical
care coverage is established.
documents.code:
text: """
(l) Special rules for health insurance costs of self-employed individuals.—
(1) Allowance of deduction.—In the case of an individual who is an
employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), there shall be
allowed as a deduction under this section an amount equal to the
amount paid during the taxable year for insurance which constitutes
medical care for the taxpayer, his spouse, and dependents.
(2) Limitations.—
(A) Dollar amount.—No deduction shall be allowed under paragraph (1)
to the extent that the amount of such deduction exceeds the
taxpayer's earned income derived by the taxpayer from the trade
or business with respect to which the plan providing the medical
care coverage is established.
"""

input self_employed_health_insurance_premiums:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Health Insurance Premiums Paid"
  description: "Amount paid for health insurance by a self-employed individual"
  default: 0

input self_employment_earned_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employment Earned Income"
  description: "Earned income from trade or business for which health plan is established"
  default: 0

variable self_employed_health_insurance:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Health Insurance Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for health insurance costs of self-employed individuals, limited to earned income from self-employment"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No deduction if no premiums paid
    if self_employed_health_insurance_premiums <= 0:
        return 0
    # No deduction if no self-employment income
    if self_employment_earned_income <= 0:
        return 0
    # Deduction is the lesser of premiums paid or self-employment earned income
    return min(self_employed_health_insurance_premiums, self_employment_earned_income)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No premiums paid"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 0
        self_employment_earned_income: 50_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "No self-employment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 12_000
        self_employment_earned_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Premiums less than earned income (full deduction)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 15_000
        self_employment_earned_income: 75_000
      expect: 15_000
    - name: "Premiums exceed earned income (limited deduction)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 25_000
        self_employment_earned_income: 18_000
      expect: 18_000
    - name: "Premiums equal earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 30_000
        self_employment_earned_income: 30_000
      expect: 30_000
    - name: "Low-income self-employed with family coverage"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 24_000
        self_employment_earned_income: 10_000
      expect: 10_000

documents.title: Interest Deduction
documents.text:
(a) General rule.-- There shall be allowed as a deduction all interest
paid or accrued within the taxable year on indebtedness.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) General rule.-- There shall be allowed as a deduction all interest
paid or accrued within the taxable year on indebtedness.
"""
variable interest_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/163/h#qualified_residence_interest
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Interest Deduction"
  description: "Total deductible interest for itemized deductions per 26 USC 163"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Deductible interest consists of:
    # 1. Qualified residence interest (mortgage interest within limits)
    # 2. Investment interest (limited to net investment income)
    # 3. Mortgage points (if meeting requirements)
    total = qualified_residence_interest + deductible_investment_interest + mortgage_points
    return total
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Mortgage interest only - under limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        mortgage_interest_paid: 15_000
        acquisition_debt: 400_000
        deductible_investment_interest: 0
        mortgage_points: 0
      expect: 15_000

    - name: "Mortgage interest with points"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        mortgage_interest_paid: 18_000
        acquisition_debt: 600_000
        deductible_investment_interest: 0
        mortgage_points: 3_000
      expect: 21_000

    - name: "All interest types combined"

    - name: "Investment interest without mortgage"

documents.title: Investment Interest Carryforward
documents.text:
(1) In general.-- In the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation,
the amount allowed as a deduction under this chapter for investment
interest for any taxable year shall not exceed the net investment
income of the taxpayer for the taxable year.
(2) Carryforward of disallowed interest.-- The amount not allowed as a
deduction for any taxable year by reason of paragraph (1) shall be
treated as investment interest paid or accrued by the taxpayer in
the succeeding taxable year.
(3) Investment interest.-- For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.-- The term 'investment interest' means any interest
allowable as a deduction under this chapter... which is paid or
accrued on indebtedness properly allocable to property held for
investment.
(4) Net investment income.-- For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.-- The term 'net investment income' means the excess
of--
(i) investment income, over
(ii) investment expenses.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) In general.-- In the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation,
the amount allowed as a deduction under this chapter for investment
interest for any taxable year shall not exceed the net investment
income of the taxpayer for the taxable year.
(2) Carryforward of disallowed interest.-- The amount not allowed as a
deduction for any taxable year by reason of paragraph (1) shall be
treated as investment interest paid or accrued by the taxpayer in
the succeeding taxable year.
(3) Investment interest.-- For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.-- The term 'investment interest' means any interest
allowable as a deduction under this chapter... which is paid or
accrued on indebtedness properly allocable to property held for
investment.
(4) Net investment income.-- For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.-- The term 'net investment income' means the excess
of--
(i) investment income, over
(ii) investment expenses.
"""
variable investment_interest:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Investment Interest Carryforward"
  description: "Disallowed investment interest carried to succeeding year per 26 USC 163(d)(2)"
  formula: return max(0, investment_income - investment_expenses)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "net_investment_income_positive"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        investment_income: 15_000
        investment_expenses: 5_000
      expect: 10_000

    - name: "net_investment_income_zero_when_expenses_exceed_income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        investment_income: 3_000
        investment_expenses: 8_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "zero_income_and_expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        investment_income: 0
        investment_expenses: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "income_equals_expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        investment_income: 25_000
        investment_expenses: 25_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "large_investment_portfolio"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        investment_income: 150_000
        investment_expenses: 42_500
      expect: 107_500

    - name: "small_positive_net_income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        investment_income: 1_200
        investment_expenses: 1_000
      expect: 200

documents.title: Married Filing Separately
documents.text:
(3) Qualified residence interest.-- For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.-- The term 'qualified residence interest' means any
interest which is paid or accrued during the taxable year on--
(i) acquisition indebtedness with respect to any qualified residence
of the taxpayer, or
(ii) home equity indebtedness with respect to any qualified residence
of the taxpayer.
(B) Acquisition indebtedness.--
(ii) Limitation.-- The aggregate amount treated as acquisition
indebtedness for any period shall not exceed $1,000,000
($500,000 in the case of a married individual filing a
separate return).
documents.code:
text: """
(3) Qualified residence interest.-- For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.-- The term 'qualified residence interest' means any
interest which is paid or accrued during the taxable year on--
(i) acquisition indebtedness with respect to any qualified residence
of the taxpayer, or
(ii) home equity indebtedness with respect to any qualified residence
of the taxpayer.
(B) Acquisition indebtedness.--
(ii) Limitation.-- The aggregate amount treated as acquisition
indebtedness for any period shall not exceed $1,000,000
($500,000 in the case of a married individual filing a
separate return).
"""

parameter acquisition_debt_limit:
  description: "Maximum acquisition indebtedness for mortgage interest deduction"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1987-01-01: 1_000_000
    2017-12-15: 750_000  # TCJA reduced limit for debt incurred after this date

parameter acquisition_debt_limit_mfs:
  description: "Maximum acquisition indebtedness for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1987-01-01: 500_000
    2017-12-15: 375_000  # TCJA reduced limit for debt incurred after this date

input married_separate:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Married Filing Separately"
  description: "Whether filing status is married filing separately"
  default: false

input acquisition_debt:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Acquisition Debt"
  description: "Total acquisition indebtedness on qualified residence"
  default: 0

input mortgage_interest_paid:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Mortgage Interest Paid"
  description: "Total mortgage interest paid during the year"
  default: 0

variable qualified_residence_interest:
  imports: [26/1#filing_status]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Residence Interest Deduction"
  description: "Deductible interest on qualified residence per 26 USC 163(h)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Determine applicable acquisition debt limit based on when debt was incurred
    is_mfs = filing_status == "married_separate"
    # Parameter lookup uses debt_incurred_date to get correct limit
    if is_mfs:
        applicable_limit = acquisition_debt_limit_mfs
    else:
        applicable_limit = acquisition_debt_limit
    # Calculate deductible acquisition interest
    acquisition_ratio = min(1, applicable_limit / max(1, acquisition_debt))
    acquisition_interest = mortgage_interest_paid * acquisition_ratio
    # Home equity interest: only deductible if used for home improvement (TCJA)
    if is_mfs:
        home_equity_limit = p.home_equity_debt_limit_mfs
    else:
        home_equity_limit = p.home_equity_debt_limit
    he_deductible = home_equity_used_for_improvement and home_equity_limit > 0
    if he_deductible:
        home_equity_ratio = min(1, home_equity_limit / max(1, home_equity_debt))
    else:
        home_equity_ratio = 0
    home_equity_interest = mortgage_interest_paid * home_equity_ratio
    # Note: In practice, mortgage interest is usually just acquisition debt
    # Home equity is tracked separately
    return acquisition_interest
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Joint filer with debt under limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        acquisition_debt: 500_000
        mortgage_interest_paid: 25_000
      expect: 25_000
    - name: "Joint filer at exact TCJA limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        acquisition_debt: 750_000
        mortgage_interest_paid: 37_500
      expect: 37_500
    - name: "Joint filer with debt over TCJA limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        acquisition_debt: 1_000_000
        mortgage_interest_paid: 50_000
      expect: 37_500
    - name: "Married filing separately under MFS limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        acquisition_debt: 300_000
        mortgage_interest_paid: 15_000
      expect: 15_000
    - name: "MFS with debt over limit (proportional reduction)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        acquisition_debt: 750_000
        mortgage_interest_paid: 37_500
      expect: 18_750
    - name: "Single filer with large debt exceeding limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        acquisition_debt: 1_500_000
        mortgage_interest_paid: 75_000
      expect: 37_500

documents.title: SALT Deduction Cap
documents.text:
(A) IN GENERAL.—In the case of an individual, the aggregate amount of taxes
taken into account under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed
$10,000 ($5,000 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return).
documents.code:
# Reference: Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (P.L. 115-97)
# Effective: Tax years 2018-2025

text: """
(A) IN GENERAL.—In the case of an individual, the aggregate amount of taxes
taken into account under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall not exceed
$10,000 ($5,000 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return).
"""

parameter salt_cap:
  description: "SALT deduction cap for most filing statuses"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2026-01-01: .inf
    2018-01-01: 10_000
    1900-01-01: .inf

parameter salt_cap_married_separate:
  description: "SALT deduction cap for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2026-01-01: .inf
    2018-01-01: 5_000
    1900-01-01: .inf

variable salt_deduction_cap:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SALT Deduction Cap"
  description: "Maximum allowable SALT deduction per 26 USC 164(b)(6)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 164(b)(6)(A): $5,000 cap for married filing separately, $10,000 for others
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
      return salt_cap_married_separate
    return salt_cap
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer during TCJA period"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 10_000
    - name: "Married filing jointly during TCJA period"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
      expect: 10_000
    - name: "Married filing separately - lower cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "Head of household during TCJA period"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: 10_000
    - name: "Pre-TCJA period - no cap"
      period: 2017
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: .inf
    - name: "Post-sunset period - no cap"
      period: 2026
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
      expect: .inf

input state_local_taxes:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "State and Local Taxes Paid"
  description: "Total state and local taxes paid (income + property + sales)"
  default: 0

variable salt_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SALT Deduction"
  description: "State and local tax deduction, capped per 26 USC 164(b)(6)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 164(b)(6)(A): Cap at $5,000 for MFS, $10,000 for all others
    # Cap only applies during TCJA period (2018-2025)
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
      cap = salt_cap_married_separate
    else:
      cap = salt_cap
    return min(state_local_taxes, cap)
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, SALT below cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        state_local_taxes: 8_000
      expect: 8_000
    - name: "Single filer, SALT at cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        state_local_taxes: 10_000
      expect: 10_000
    - name: "Single filer, SALT exceeds cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        state_local_taxes: 25_000
      expect: 10_000
    - name: "Married filing separately, SALT below cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        state_local_taxes: 3_000
      expect: 3_000
    - name: "Married filing separately, SALT exceeds cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        state_local_taxes: 15_000
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, high SALT capped"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        state_local_taxes: 50_000
      expect: 10_000

In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a deduction for
