variable nol_modifications:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total NOL Modifications"
  description: "Total modifications to taxable income for NOL calculation per 172(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum all modifications that adjust taxable income for NOL purposes
    # These are added to taxable income before determining if NOL exists
    return (
        nol_modification_prior_nol +
        nol_modification_capital_losses +
        nol_modification_exemptions +
        nol_modification_nonbusiness +
        nol_modification_dividends +
        nol_modification_reit +
        nol_modification_qbi +
        nol_modification_fdii
    )
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Total NOL modifications from all categories"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -50_000
        capital_gains: 0
        capital_losses: 20_000
        personal_exemption: 2_175
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 15_000
      expect: 37175
    - name: "Total NOL modifications with only capital loss adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -30_000
        capital_gains: 5_000
        capital_losses: 35_000
        personal_exemption: 0
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 0
      expect: 30000
    - name: "Total NOL modifications zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 50_000
        capital_gains: 10_000
        capital_losses: 10_000
        personal_exemption: 0
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Total modifications with prior NOL and capital losses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -75_000
        capital_gains: 5_000
        capital_losses: 25_000
        personal_exemption: 0
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 30_000
      expect: 50_000
    - name: "Total modifications pre-TCJA all categories"
      period: 2016
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -100_000
        capital_gains: 0
        capital_losses: 15_000
        personal_exemption: 8_100
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 20_000
      expect: 43_100
    - name: "Large total modifications"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -500_000
        capital_gains: 50_000
        capital_losses: 200_000
        personal_exemption: 0
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 100_000
      expect: 250_000
    - name: "Total modifications with only prior NOL"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -80_000
        capital_gains: 20_000
        capital_losses: 20_000
        personal_exemption: 0
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 45_000
      expect: 45_000
    - name: "Total modifications with only capital loss excess"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: -60_000
        capital_gains: 0
        capital_losses: 40_000
        personal_exemption: 0
        prior_nol_deduction_claimed: 0
      expect: 40_000

documents.title: Section 179 Carryforward
documents.text:
(a) TREATMENT AS EXPENSES.—A taxpayer may elect to treat the cost of any
section 179 property as an expense which is not chargeable to capital account.
Any cost so treated shall be allowed as a deduction for the taxable year in
which the section 179 property is placed in service.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) TREATMENT AS EXPENSES.—A taxpayer may elect to treat the cost of any
section 179 property as an expense which is not chargeable to capital account.
Any cost so treated shall be allowed as a deduction for the taxable year in
which the section 179 property is placed in service.
"""
variable expensing_election:
  entity: Business
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Section 179 Carryforward"
  description: "Disallowed Section 179 amount to carry forward to next year"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with maximum
    max_available = maximum_deduction
    # Calculate phaseout reduction
    excess_investment = max(0, total_cost_of_section_179_property - phaseout_threshold)
    phaseout_reduction = excess_investment * phaseout_rate
    # Available after phaseout (cannot go below zero)
    return max(0, max_available - phaseout_reduction)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Investment below phaseout threshold - full deduction available"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        maximum_deduction: 1_220_000
        total_cost_of_section_179_property: 2_000_000
        phaseout_threshold: 3_050_000
        phaseout_rate: 1.0
      expect: 1_220_000
    - name: "Investment at phaseout threshold - full deduction available"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        maximum_deduction: 1_220_000
        total_cost_of_section_179_property: 3_050_000
        phaseout_threshold: 3_050_000
        phaseout_rate: 1.0
      expect: 1_220_000
    - name: "Investment exceeds threshold by $500k - deduction reduced to $720k"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        maximum_deduction: 1_220_000
        total_cost_of_section_179_property: 3_550_000
        phaseout_threshold: 3_050_000
        phaseout_rate: 1.0
      expect: 720_000
    - name: "Investment exceeds threshold by full deduction amount - zero remaining"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        maximum_deduction: 1_220_000
        total_cost_of_section_179_property: 4_270_000
        phaseout_threshold: 3_050_000
        phaseout_rate: 1.0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Investment far exceeds threshold - floor at zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        maximum_deduction: 1_220_000
        total_cost_of_section_179_property: 5_000_000
        phaseout_threshold: 3_050_000
        phaseout_rate: 1.0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Small business with minimal investment - full deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        maximum_deduction: 1_220_000
        total_cost_of_section_179_property: 100_000
        phaseout_threshold: 3_050_000
        phaseout_rate: 1.0
      expect: 1_220_000

documents.title: Net Capital Gain
documents.text:
(a) ALLOWANCE OF DEDUCTION.—In the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation,
there shall be allowed as a deduction for any taxable year an amount equal
to the lesser of—
(1) the combined qualified business income amount of the taxpayer, or
(2) an amount equal to 20 percent of the excess (if any) of—
(A) the taxable income of the taxpayer for the taxable year, over
(B) the sum of any net capital gain (as defined in section 1(h)), plus the
aggregate amount of the qualified cooperative dividends, of the taxpayer
for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) ALLOWANCE OF DEDUCTION.—In the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation,
there shall be allowed as a deduction for any taxable year an amount equal
to the lesser of—
(1) the combined qualified business income amount of the taxpayer, or
(2) an amount equal to 20 percent of the excess (if any) of—
(A) the taxable income of the taxpayer for the taxable year, over
(B) the sum of any net capital gain (as defined in section 1(h)), plus the
aggregate amount of the qualified cooperative dividends, of the taxpayer
for the taxable year.
"""
input net_capital_gain:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Capital Gain"
  description: "Net capital gain as defined in section 1(h)"
  default: 0

input qualified_coop_dividends:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Cooperative Dividends"
  description: "Aggregate amount of qualified cooperative dividends"
  default: 0

parameter qbi_deduction_rate:
  description: "Section 199A deduction rate for pass-through income per 26 USC 199A(a)(2)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2018-01-01: 0.20

variable qbi_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/63/a#taxable_income
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/199A/c#net_qualified_business_income
    - 26/199A/d#is_sstb
    - 26/199A/d#sstb_qbi
    - 26/199A/d#sstb_w2_wages
    - 26/199A/d#sstb_ubia
    - 26/199A/d#qbi_applicable_percentage
    - 26/199A/b#qbi_w2_wages
    - 26/199A/b#qbi_ubia
    - 26/199A/b#qbi_w2_wage_limit
    - 26/199A/b#is_above_qbi_threshold
    - 26/199A/b#is_in_qbi_phaseout
    - 26/199A/b#is_above_qbi_phaseout
    - 26/199A/b#qbi_reduction_ratio
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Business Income Deduction"
  description: "Section 199A deduction for pass-through income per 26 USC § 199A(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # § 199A(a)(2): 20% of (taxable income - net capital gain - qualified coop dividends)
    ordinary_income = taxable_income - net_capital_gain - qualified_coop_dividends
    return max(0, ordinary_income * qbi_deduction_rate)
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # BASIC QBI DEDUCTION TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Basic QBI deduction with no capital gains or coop dividends"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 100_000
        net_capital_gain: 0
        qualified_coop_dividends: 0
      # 0.20 (parameter) * 100_000 = 20_000
      expect: 20_000

    - name: "QBI deduction reduced by net capital gain"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 100_000
        net_capital_gain: 25_000
        qualified_coop_dividends: 0
      # 0.20 * (100_000 - 25_000) = 0.20 * 75_000 = 15_000
      expect: 15_000

    - name: "QBI deduction reduced by qualified cooperative dividends"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 80_000
        net_capital_gain: 0
        qualified_coop_dividends: 10_000
      # 0.20 * (80_000 - 10_000) = 0.20 * 70_000 = 14_000
      expect: 14_000

    - name: "QBI deduction reduced by both capital gains and coop dividends"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 150_000
        net_capital_gain: 30_000
        qualified_coop_dividends: 20_000
      # 0.20 * (150_000 - 30_000 - 20_000) = 0.20 * 100_000 = 20_000
      expect: 20_000

    # ============================================================================
    # EDGE CASE TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Capital gains exceed taxable income - deduction floors at zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 50_000
        net_capital_gain: 60_000
        qualified_coop_dividends: 0
      # max(0, 0.20 * (50_000 - 60_000)) = max(0, -2_000) = 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Zero taxable income - no QBI deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 0
        net_capital_gain: 0
        qualified_coop_dividends: 0
      # 0.20 * 0 = 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: QBI W-2 Limitation Reduction Ratio
documents.text:
(b) COMBINED QUALIFIED BUSINESS INCOME AMOUNT.—For purposes of this section—
(1) IN GENERAL.—The term 'combined qualified business income amount' means,
with respect to any taxable year, an amount equal to—
(A) the sum of the amounts determined under paragraph (2) for each qualified
trade or business carried on by the taxpayer, plus
(B) 20 percent of the aggregate amount of the qualified REIT dividends and
qualified publicly traded partnership income of the taxpayer for the
taxable year.
(2) DETERMINATION OF DEDUCTIBLE AMOUNT FOR EACH TRADE OR BUSINESS.—The amount
determined under this paragraph with respect to any qualified trade or
business is the lesser of—
(A) 20 percent of the taxpayer's qualified business income with respect to
the qualified trade or business, or
(B) the greater of—
(i) 50 percent of the W-2 wages with respect to the qualified trade or
business, or
(ii) the sum of 25 percent of the W-2 wages with respect to the qualified
trade or business, plus 2.5 percent of the unadjusted basis immediately
after acquisition of all qualified property...
documents.code:
text: """
(b) COMBINED QUALIFIED BUSINESS INCOME AMOUNT.—For purposes of this section—
(1) IN GENERAL.—The term 'combined qualified business income amount' means,
with respect to any taxable year, an amount equal to—
(A) the sum of the amounts determined under paragraph (2) for each qualified
trade or business carried on by the taxpayer, plus
(B) 20 percent of the aggregate amount of the qualified REIT dividends and
qualified publicly traded partnership income of the taxpayer for the
taxable year.
(2) DETERMINATION OF DEDUCTIBLE AMOUNT FOR EACH TRADE OR BUSINESS.—The amount
determined under this paragraph with respect to any qualified trade or
business is the lesser of—
(A) 20 percent of the taxpayer's qualified business income with respect to
the qualified trade or business, or
(B) the greater of—
(i) 50 percent of the W-2 wages with respect to the qualified trade or
business, or
(ii) the sum of 25 percent of the W-2 wages with respect to the qualified
trade or business, plus 2.5 percent of the unadjusted basis immediately
after acquisition of all qualified property...
"""
variable w2_wage_limitation:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/199A/c#net_qualified_business_income
    - 26/199A/d#is_sstb
    - 26/199A/d#sstb_qbi
    - 26/199A/d#qbi_applicable_percentage
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: USD
  label: "QBI W-2 Limitation Reduction Ratio"
  description: "Ratio for phasing in W-2 wage limitation per 26 USC § 199A(b)(3)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Greater of:
    # (i) 50% of W-2 wages, OR
    # (ii) 25% of W-2 wages + 2.5% of UBIA
    wages_only = qbi_w2_wages * w2_wage_limit_rate
    wages_plus_property = (qbi_w2_wages * w2_wage_property_rate) + (qbi_ubia * ubia_rate)
    return max(wages_only, wages_plus_property)
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # W-2 WAGE LIMITATION TESTS - 26 USC 199A(b)(2)(B)
    # Tests the greater of:
    #   (i) 50% of W-2 wages, OR
    #   (ii) 25% of W-2 wages + 2.5% of UBIA
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Wages-only test dominates when no property"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qbi_w2_wages: 100_000
        qbi_ubia: 0
        w2_wage_limit_rate: 0.50
        w2_wage_property_rate: 0.25
        ubia_rate: 0.025
      expect: 50_000  # max(0.50 * 100_000, 0.25 * 100_000 + 0.025 * 0) = max(50_000, 25_000) = 50_000

    - name: "Property-based test dominates with large UBIA"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qbi_w2_wages: 100_000
        qbi_ubia: 2_000_000
        w2_wage_limit_rate: 0.50
        w2_wage_property_rate: 0.25
        ubia_rate: 0.025
      expect: 75_000  # max(0.50 * 100_000, 0.25 * 100_000 + 0.025 * 2_000_000) = max(50_000, 25_000 + 50_000) = 75_000

    - name: "Zero wages with property - UBIA only contributes"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qbi_w2_wages: 0
        qbi_ubia: 1_000_000
        w2_wage_limit_rate: 0.50
        w2_wage_property_rate: 0.25
        ubia_rate: 0.025
      expect: 25_000  # max(0.50 * 0, 0.25 * 0 + 0.025 * 1_000_000) = max(0, 25_000) = 25_000

    - name: "Zero wages and zero property - limitation is zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qbi_w2_wages: 0
        qbi_ubia: 0
        w2_wage_limit_rate: 0.50
        w2_wage_property_rate: 0.25
        ubia_rate: 0.025
      expect: 0  # max(0, 0) = 0

    - name: "Breakeven point where both methods equal"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qbi_w2_wages: 100_000
        qbi_ubia: 1_000_000
        w2_wage_limit_rate: 0.50
        w2_wage_property_rate: 0.25
        ubia_rate: 0.025
      expect: 50_000  # max(0.50 * 100_000, 0.25 * 100_000 + 0.025 * 1_000_000) = max(50_000, 50_000) = 50_000

    - name: "Realistic business scenario - moderate wages and property"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qbi_w2_wages: 200_000
        qbi_ubia: 500_000
        w2_wage_limit_rate: 0.50
        w2_wage_property_rate: 0.25
        ubia_rate: 0.025
      expect: 100_000  # max(0.50 * 200_000, 0.25 * 200_000 + 0.025 * 500_000) = max(100_000, 50_000 + 12_500) = 100_000

documents.title: Net Qualified Business Income
documents.text:
(c) QUALIFIED BUSINESS INCOME.—For purposes of this section—
(1) IN GENERAL.—The term 'qualified business income' means, for any taxable
year, the net amount of qualified items of income, gain, deduction, and
loss with respect to any qualified trade or business of the taxpayer.
(2) CARRYOVER OF LOSSES.—If the net amount of qualified business income from
all qualified trades or businesses during any taxable year is less than
zero, such amount shall be treated as a loss from a qualified trade or
business in the succeeding taxable year.
(3) QUALIFIED ITEMS OF INCOME, GAIN, DEDUCTION, AND LOSS.—For purposes of this
subsection—
(A) IN GENERAL.—The term 'qualified items of income, gain, deduction, and loss'
means items of income, gain, deduction, and loss to the extent such items
are—
(i) effectively connected with the conduct of a trade or business within the
United States (within the meaning of section 864(c), determined by
substituting 'qualified trade or business (within the meaning of section
199A)' for 'nonresident alien individual or a foreign corporation')...
(4) TREATMENT OF REASONABLE COMPENSATION AND GUARANTEED PAYMENTS.—Qualified
business income shall not include—
(A) reasonable compensation paid to the taxpayer by any qualified trade or
business of the taxpayer for services rendered with respect to the trade
or business,
(B) any guaranteed payment described in section 707(c) paid to a partner for
services rendered with respect to the trade or business...

business of the taxpayer for services rendered with respect to the trade
or business,
(B) any guaranteed payment described in section 707(c) paid to a partner for
services rendered with respect to the trade or business...
"""
variable qualified_business_income:
  imports: [26/1402/a/self_employment_income#self_employment_income]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Qualified Business Income"
  description: "QBI after loss carryforward adjustment"
  formula: return max(0, qualified_business_income - qualified_business_income_loss_carryforward)
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # QUALIFIED BUSINESS INCOME TESTS - 26 USC 199A(c)
    # Tests net QBI after loss carryforward adjustment per 199A(c)(2)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "No loss carryforward - full QBI passes through"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qualified_business_income: 100_000
        qualified_business_income_loss_carryforward: 0
      expect: 100_000  # max(0, 100_000 - 0) = 100_000

    - name: "Partial loss carryforward reduces QBI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qualified_business_income: 100_000
        qualified_business_income_loss_carryforward: 30_000
      expect: 70_000  # max(0, 100_000 - 30_000) = 70_000

    - name: "Loss carryforward exceeds QBI - floors at zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qualified_business_income: 50_000
        qualified_business_income_loss_carryforward: 80_000
      expect: 0  # max(0, 50_000 - 80_000) = max(0, -30_000) = 0

    - name: "Equal QBI and loss carryforward - nets to zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        qualified_business_income: 75_000
        qualified_business_income_loss_carryforward: 75_000
      expect: 0  # max(0, 75_000 - 75_000) = 0

documents.title: QBI Applicable Percentage
documents.text:
(d) QUALIFIED TRADE OR BUSINESS.—For purposes of this section—
(1) IN GENERAL.—The term 'qualified trade or business' means any trade or
business other than—
(A) a specified service trade or business, or
(B) the trade or business of performing services as an employee.
(2) SPECIFIED SERVICE TRADE OR BUSINESS.—The term 'specified service trade or
business' means any trade or business—
(A) which is described in section 1202(e)(3)(A) (applied without regard to
the words 'engineering, architecture,') or which would be so described
if the term 'employees or owners' were substituted for 'employees' therein, or
(B) which involves the performance of services that consist of investing and
investment management, trading, or dealing in securities (as defined in
section 475(c)(2)), partnership interests, or commodities (as defined in
section 475(e)(2)).
(3) EXCEPTION FOR SPECIFIED SERVICE BUSINESSES FOR TAXPAYERS WITH TAXABLE INCOME
NOT EXCEEDING THRESHOLD AMOUNT.—
(A) IN GENERAL.—If, for any taxable year, the taxable income of any taxpayer is
less than the sum of the threshold amount plus $50,000 ($100,000 in the case
of a joint return), then—
(i) any specified service trade or business of the taxpayer shall not fail to
be treated as a qualified trade or business due to paragraph (1)(A), but
(ii) only the applicable percentage of qualified items of income, gain,
deduction, or loss, and the W-2 wages and the unadjusted basis immediately
after acquisition of qualified property, of the taxpayer allocable to such
specified service trade or business shall be taken into account...

(3) EXCEPTION FOR SPECIFIED SERVICE BUSINESSES FOR TAXPAYERS WITH TAXABLE INCOME
NOT EXCEEDING THRESHOLD AMOUNT.—
(A) IN GENERAL.—If, for any taxable year, the taxable income of any taxpayer is
less than the sum of the threshold amount plus $50,000 ($100,000 in the case
of a joint return), then—
(i) any specified service trade or business of the taxpayer shall not fail to
be treated as a qualified trade or business due to paragraph (1)(A), but
(ii) only the applicable percentage of qualified items of income, gain,
deduction, or loss, and the W-2 wages and the unadjusted basis immediately
after acquisition of qualified property, of the taxpayer allocable to such
