"""

parameter threshold_single:
  description: "QBI deduction threshold amount for single filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 157_500

parameter threshold_joint:
  description: "QBI deduction threshold amount for joint filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 315_000

parameter phaseout_range_single:
  description: "QBI deduction phaseout range for single filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 50_000

parameter phaseout_range_joint:
  description: "QBI deduction phaseout range for joint filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 100_000

variable sstb:
  imports:
    - 26/63/a#taxable_income
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: percent
  label: "QBI Applicable Percentage"
  description: "Phase-in percentage for SSTB income per 26 USC § 199A(d)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Get threshold based on filing status
    is_joint_or_surviving = filing_status == JOINT or filing_status == SURVIVING_SPOUSE
    threshold = threshold_joint if is_joint_or_surviving else threshold_single
    phaseout_range = phaseout_range_joint if is_joint_or_surviving else phaseout_range_single
    # If below threshold, 100% applies
    if taxable_income <= threshold:
        return 1.0
    # If above threshold + phaseout range, 0% applies (SSTB gets no deduction)
    phaseout_end = threshold + phaseout_range
    if taxable_income >= phaseout_end:
        return 0.0
    # Within phaseout range: linear reduction
    # Applicable % = 1 - (taxable_income - threshold) / phaseout_range
    excess = taxable_income - threshold
    return 1.0 - (excess / phaseout_range)
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # SSTB APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE TESTS - 26 USC 199A(d)(3)
    # Tests phase-in percentage for specified service trade or business income
    # Single filers: threshold $157,500, phaseout range $50,000
    # Joint filers: threshold $315,000, phaseout range $100,000
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single filer below threshold - 100% applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 150_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 1.0  # Below $157,500 threshold

    - name: "Single filer above phaseout - 0% applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 220_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0.0  # Above $207,500 ($157,500 + $50,000)

    - name: "Joint filer mid-phaseout - partial percentage"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 365_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 0.5  # ($365,000 - $315,000) / $100,000 = 0.5 reduction, so 1.0 - 0.5 = 0.5

    - name: "Joint filer at threshold - 100% applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 315_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 1.0  # Exactly at threshold

documents.title: Head of Household Filing Status
documents.text:
26 USC § 2(b) - Definition of Head of Household

(1) In general.—For purposes of this subtitle, an individual shall be
considered a head of a household if, and only if, such individual is not
married at the close of his taxable year, is not a surviving spouse (as
defined in subsection (a)), and either—
(A) maintains as his home a household which constitutes for more than
one-half of such taxable year the principal place of abode, as a member
of such household, of—
(i) a qualifying child of the individual (as defined in section 152(c)),
but not if such child is married at the close of the taxpayer's taxable
year and is not a dependent of such individual, or
(ii) any other person who is a dependent of the taxpayer, or
(B) maintains a household which constitutes for such taxable year the
principal place of abode of the father or mother of the taxpayer, if the
taxpayer is entitled to a deduction for the taxable year for such father
or mother under section 151.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 2(b) - Definition of Head of Household

(1) In general.—For purposes of this subtitle, an individual shall be
considered a head of a household if, and only if, such individual is not
married at the close of his taxable year, is not a surviving spouse (as
defined in subsection (a)), and either—
(A) maintains as his home a household which constitutes for more than
one-half of such taxable year the principal place of abode, as a member
of such household, of—
(i) a qualifying child of the individual (as defined in section 152(c)),
but not if such child is married at the close of the taxpayer's taxable
year and is not a dependent of such individual, or
(ii) any other person who is a dependent of the taxpayer, or
(B) maintains a household which constitutes for such taxable year the
principal place of abode of the father or mother of the taxpayer, if the
taxpayer is entitled to a deduction for the taxable year for such father
or mother under section 151.
"""

variable is_head_of_household:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Head of Household Filing Status"
  description: |
    Determines if taxpayer qualifies for head of household filing status
    per 26 USC § 2(b). Requires being unmarried and maintaining a household
    for a qualifying person for more than half the taxable year.
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per § 2(b)(1): Must not be married at close of taxable year
    if is_married:
      return False

    # Per § 2(b)(1)(A): Must maintain household as home for qualifying person
    # Qualifying person is either:
    # - A qualifying child per § 152(c), or
    # - A qualifying relative per § 152(d) who is related by blood
    #
    # Simplified: Has at least one dependent who lived in household
    has_qualifying_person = num_dependents > 0

    # Per § 2(b)(1): Must pay more than half the cost of maintaining household
    # Simplified: Assumed true if has qualifying person
    maintains_household = has_qualifying_person

    return maintains_household
  default: False

variable filing_status:
  imports: [26/2/b#is_head_of_household]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: String
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: |
    Taxpayer filing status per 26 USC § 1 and § 2.
    One of: SINGLE, JOINT, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD, SEPARATE, WIDOW
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Check statuses in order of precedence
    if is_married and files_jointly:
      return JOINT
    if is_married and not files_jointly:
      return SEPARATE
    # Per § 2(a): Surviving spouse status for 2 years after death
    if is_surviving_spouse:
      return WIDOW
    # Per § 2(b): Head of household
    if is_head_of_household:
      return HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
    # Default: single
    return SINGLE
  default: SINGLE

# Tests per § 2(b) requirements
tests:
  - name: "Single with child qualifies as HOH"
    inputs:
      is_married: False
      num_dependents: 1
    expect:
      is_head_of_household: True
      filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD

  - name: "Single without dependents is SINGLE"
    inputs:
      is_married: False
      num_dependents: 0
    expect:
      is_head_of_household: False
      filing_status: SINGLE

  - name: "Married with children is not HOH"
    inputs:
      is_married: True
      files_jointly: True
      num_dependents: 2
    expect:
      is_head_of_household: False
      filing_status: JOINT

  - name: "Single with multiple dependents is HOH"
    inputs:
      is_married: False
      num_dependents: 3
    expect:
      is_head_of_household: True
      filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD

documents.title: Number of CDCC Qualifying Individuals
documents.code:
# https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=granuleid:USC-prelim-title26-section21

text: """
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- In the case of an individual who maintains a household which
includes as a member one or more qualifying individuals (as defined in
subsection (b)(1)), there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax
imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the
applicable percentage of the employment-related expenses (as defined in
subsection (b)(2)) paid by such individual during the taxable year.

(2) APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE DEFINED. -- For purposes of paragraph (1), the term
"applicable percentage" means 35 percent reduced (but not below 20 percent)
by 1 percentage point for each $2,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the
taxpayer's adjusted gross income for the taxable year exceeds $15,000.

(c) DOLLAR LIMIT ON AMOUNT CREDITABLE. -- The amount of the employment-related
expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be taken into account
under subsection (a) shall not exceed--
(1) $3,000 if there is 1 qualifying individual with respect to the taxpayer
    for such taxable year, or
(2) $6,000 if there are 2 or more qualifying individuals with respect to
    the taxpayer for such taxable year.

(d) EARNED INCOME LIMITATION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the
amount of the employment-related expenses incurred during any taxable year
which may be taken into account under subsection (a) shall not exceed--
(A) in the case of an individual who is not married at the close of such
    year, such individual's earned income for such year, or
(B) in the case of an individual who is married at the close of such year,
    the lesser of such individual's earned income or the earned income
    of his spouse for such year.
"""

# =============================================================================
# Parameters from 26 USC 21(c) - Dollar limit on amount creditable
# =============================================================================

# 26 USC 21(c)(1) - One qualifying individual limit
parameter cdcc_expense_limit_one:
  description: "Maximum expenses for one qualifying individual"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 3_000

# 26 USC 21(c)(2) - Two or more qualifying individuals limit
parameter cdcc_expense_limit_two_plus:
  description: "Maximum expenses for two or more qualifying individuals"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 6_000

# =============================================================================
# Parameters from 26 USC 21(a)(2) - Applicable percentage
# =============================================================================

# 26 USC 21(a)(2) - Maximum applicable percentage
parameter cdcc_maximum_rate:
  description: "Maximum applicable percentage for CDCC"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1976-01-01: 0.35

# 26 USC 21(a)(2) - Minimum applicable percentage (floor)
parameter cdcc_minimum_rate:
  description: "Minimum applicable percentage floor for CDCC"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1976-01-01: 0.20

# 26 USC 21(a)(2) - Phase-down threshold
parameter cdcc_phase_down_threshold:
  description: "AGI threshold above which applicable percentage reduces"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 15_000

# 26 USC 21(a)(2) - Phase-down increment
parameter cdcc_phase_down_increment:
  description: "AGI increment for each 1% reduction in applicable percentage"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 2_000

# 26 USC 21(a)(2) - Phase-down rate per increment
parameter cdcc_phase_down_rate:
  description: "Percentage reduction per increment above threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1976-01-01: 0.01

# =============================================================================
# Inputs
# =============================================================================

input num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Number of CDCC Qualifying Individuals"
  description: "Count of qualifying individuals for child and dependent care credit"
  default: 0

input cdcc_expenses_paid:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CDCC Expenses Paid"
  description: "Employment-related child/dependent care expenses paid during the year"
  default: 0

input earned_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Earned income for CDCC limitation"
  default: 0

input adjusted_gross_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Gross Income"
  description: "AGI for applicable percentage calculation"
  default: 0

# =============================================================================
# Variables
# =============================================================================

variable child_dependent_care_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Child and Dependent Care Credit"
  description: "Credit for employment-related expenses for care of qualifying individuals per 26 USC 21"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 26 USC 21(c): Maximum expense limits per qualifying individual
    if num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals == 0:
        expense_limit = 0
    elif num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals == 1:
        expense_limit = cdcc_expense_limit_one
    else:
        expense_limit = cdcc_expense_limit_two_plus

    # 26 USC 21(d)(1): Earned income limitation
    earned_income_limit = earned_income

    # 26 USC 21(b)(2): Qualified expenses = actual expenses capped by limits
    qualified_expenses = min(cdcc_expenses_paid, expense_limit, earned_income_limit)

    # 26 USC 21(a)(2): Applicable percentage
    # Starts at 35%, decreases by 1% per $2,000 of AGI above threshold, floor of 20%
    agi_above_threshold = max(0, adjusted_gross_income - cdcc_phase_down_threshold)
    percentage_reduction = (agi_above_threshold // cdcc_phase_down_increment) * cdcc_phase_down_rate
    applicable_rate = max(cdcc_minimum_rate, cdcc_maximum_rate - percentage_reduction)

    # Final credit = applicable percentage * qualified expenses
    return applicable_rate * qualified_expenses
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No qualifying individuals returns zero credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 0
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 5_000
        earned_income: 50_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "One child - low AGI gets maximum 35% rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 3_000
        earned_income: 15_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
      # At $15,000 AGI (threshold), rate = 35%, credit = 3,000 * 0.35 = 1,050
      expect: 1_050

    - name: "One child - AGI above threshold reduces percentage"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 3_000
        earned_income: 25_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 25_000
      # AGI $25,000 is $10,000 above threshold = 5 increments
      # Rate = 35% - 5% = 30%, credit = 3,000 * 0.30 = 900
      expect: 900

    - name: "Two children - high AGI hits 20% floor rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 8_000
        earned_income: 60_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
      # AGI $60,000 is $45,000 above threshold = 23 increments
      # Rate would be 35% - 23% = 12%, but floor is 20%
      # Expenses capped at $6,000, credit = 6,000 * 0.20 = 1,200
      expect: 1_200

    - name: "Expenses capped at one-child statutory limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 5_000
        earned_income: 40_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
      # Expenses capped at $3,000 (one child limit)
      # AGI $40,000 is $25,000 above threshold = 13 increments
      # Rate = 35% - 13% = 22%, credit = 3,000 * 0.22 = 660
      expect: 660

    - name: "Expenses capped at two-child statutory limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 10_000
        earned_income: 50_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 35_000
      # Expenses capped at $6,000 (two child limit)
      # AGI $35,000 is $20,000 above threshold = 10 increments
      # Rate = 35% - 10% = 25%, credit = 6,000 * 0.25 = 1,500
      expect: 1_500

    - name: "Earned income limit constrains expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 5_000
        earned_income: 2_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 12_000
      # Earned income only $2,000 caps expenses
      # AGI $12,000 is below threshold, rate = 35%
      # Credit = 2,000 * 0.35 = 700
      expect: 700

    - name: "AGI exactly at threshold boundary"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 3_000
        earned_income: 17_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 17_000
      # AGI $17,000 is $2,000 above threshold = 1 increment
      # Rate = 35% - 1% = 34%, credit = 3,000 * 0.34 = 1,020
      expect: 1_020

    - name: "Three or more qualifying individuals same as two"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 3
        cdcc_expenses_paid: 12_000
        earned_income: 80_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 20_000
      # Three children still uses $6,000 limit (two or more)
      # AGI $20,000 is $5,000 above threshold = 2 increments (floor of 5000/2000)
      # Rate = 35% - 2% = 33%, credit = 6,000 * 0.33 = 1,980
      expect: 1_980

documents.title: CDCC Applicable Percentage
documents.text:
(b) APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE DEFINED. -- For purposes of subsection (a), the term
'applicable percentage' means 35 percent reduced (but not below 20 percent) by
1 percentage point for each $2,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer's
adjusted gross income for the taxable year exceeds $15,000.
documents.code:
text: """
(b) APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE DEFINED. -- For purposes of subsection (a), the term
'applicable percentage' means 35 percent reduced (but not below 20 percent) by
1 percentage point for each $2,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer's
adjusted gross income for the taxable year exceeds $15,000.
"""

parameter maximum_rate:
  description: "Maximum applicable percentage for CDCC"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1976-01-01: 0.35

parameter minimum_rate:
  description: "Minimum applicable percentage for CDCC (floor rate)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1976-01-01: 0.20

parameter phase_down_threshold:
  description: "AGI threshold above which applicable percentage begins to decrease"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 15_000

parameter phase_down_increment:
  description: "AGI increment for each 1% reduction in applicable percentage"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 2_000

parameter phase_down_rate:
  description: "Rate reduction per AGI increment"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1976-01-01: 0.01

parameter arpa_complete_phaseout_threshold:
  description: "AGI threshold above which ARPA 2021 rate phases out completely (set to infinity for permanent law)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    # Under permanent law, there is no complete phaseout - use infinity
    1976-01-01: 999_999_999
    # ARPA 2021 temporarily added complete phaseout above $400,000
    2021-01-01: 400_000
    # Reverted to permanent law in 2022
    2022-01-01: 999_999_999

variable applicable_percentage:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "CDCC Applicable Percentage"
  description: "Credit rate for Child and Dependent Care Credit per 26 USC 21(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    # For ARPA 2021 complete phaseout above $400,000
    # Note: This applies only when arpa_complete_phaseout_threshold is finite
    if agi > arpa_complete_phaseout_threshold:
        # Secondary phase-out from 20% to 0%
        # AGI $400,000 to $438,000 (phasing out $50 per $1,000)
        excess_over_phaseout = agi - arpa_complete_phaseout_threshold
        phaseout_increments = ceil(excess_over_phaseout / phase_down_increment)
        secondary_reduction = phaseout_increments * phase_down_rate
        return max(0, minimum_rate - secondary_reduction)
    # Calculate excess AGI over threshold
    excess_agi = max(0, agi - phase_down_threshold)
    # Number of $2,000 increments (or fraction thereof) using ceiling
    increments = ceil(excess_agi / phase_down_increment)
    # Total rate reduction (1 percentage point per increment)
    rate_reduction = increments * phase_down_rate
    # Apply reduction but floor at minimum rate
    return max(minimum_rate, maximum_rate - rate_reduction)
  tests:
    # Low income - maximum rate of 35%
    - name: "AGI at threshold - maximum 35% rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
      expect: 0.35

    - name: "AGI below threshold - maximum 35% rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 10_000
      expect: 0.35

    # Phase-down tests
    - name: "AGI $17,000 - one increment above threshold (34%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 17_000
      # $2,000 above threshold = 1 increment = 35% - 1% = 34%
      expect: 0.34

    - name: "AGI $19,000 - two increments above threshold (33%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 19_000
      # $4,000 above threshold = 2 increments = 35% - 2% = 33%
      expect: 0.33

    - name: "AGI $25,000 - five increments above threshold (30%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 25_000
      # $10,000 above threshold = 5 increments = 35% - 5% = 30%
      expect: 0.30

    # Floor rate tests
    - name: "AGI $45,000 - hits 20% floor rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 45_000
      # $30,000 above threshold = 15 increments = 35% - 15% = 20%
      expect: 0.20

    - name: "High AGI - stays at 20% floor"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
      # Would be -8% but floor is 20%
      expect: 0.20

    # Edge cases
    - name: "AGI $16,001 - fraction of increment counts as full (34%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 16_001
      # $1,001 above threshold = 1 increment (ceiling) = 35% - 1% = 34%
      expect: 0.34

    - name: "Zero AGI - maximum 35% rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
      expect: 0.35

documents.title: CDCC Maximum Expense Limit
documents.text:
(c) DOLLAR LIMIT ON AMOUNT CREDITABLE. -- The amount of the employment-related
expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be taken into account under
subsection (a) shall not exceed --
(1) $3,000 if there is 1 qualifying individual...
(2) $6,000 if there are 2 or more qualifying individuals...
documents.code:
text: """
(c) DOLLAR LIMIT ON AMOUNT CREDITABLE. -- The amount of the employment-related
expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be taken into account under
subsection (a) shall not exceed --
(1) $3,000 if there is 1 qualifying individual...
(2) $6,000 if there are 2 or more qualifying individuals...
"""

parameter one_qualifying_limit:
  description: "Dollar limit on expenses for 1 qualifying individual"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 3_000

parameter two_or_more_limit:
  description: "Dollar limit on expenses for 2 or more qualifying individuals"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 6_000

variable expense_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/21/e#num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CDCC Maximum Expense Limit"
  description: "Dollar limit on creditable expenses based on number of qualifying individuals per 26 USC 21(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No qualifying individuals = no credit
    if num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals == 0:
        return 0
    # 1 qualifying individual
    if num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals == 1:
        return one_qualifying_limit
    # 2 or more qualifying individuals
    return two_or_more_limit
  tests:
    - name: "No qualifying individuals - zero limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "One qualifying individual - $3,000 limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 1
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Two qualifying individuals - $6,000 limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 2
      expect: 6_000

    - name: "Three qualifying individuals - $6,000 limit (same as two)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 3
      expect: 6_000

    - name: "Four qualifying individuals - $6,000 limit (capped at two or more)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_cdcc_qualifying_individuals: 4
      expect: 6_000

documents.title: Is Tax Unit Head
documents.text:
(d) EARNED INCOME LIMITATION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the amount of
the employment-related expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be
taken into account under subsection (a) shall not exceed --
(A) in the case of an individual who is not married at the close of such year,
such individual's earned income for such year, or
(B) in the case of an individual who is married at the close of such year,
the lesser of such individual's earned income or the earned income of
his spouse for such year.

(2) SPECIAL RULE FOR SPOUSE WHO IS A STUDENT OR INCAPABLE OF CARING FOR HIMSELF. --
In the case of a spouse who is a full-time student at an educational institution
or who is physically or mentally incapable of caring for himself, such spouse shall
be deemed for each month during which such spouse is a full-time student or is so
incapable to be gainfully employed and to have earned income of not less than --
(A) $250 if there is 1 qualifying individual, or
(B) $500 if there are 2 or more qualifying individuals.
documents.code:
text: """
(d) EARNED INCOME LIMITATION. --
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the amount of
the employment-related expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be
taken into account under subsection (a) shall not exceed --
(A) in the case of an individual who is not married at the close of such year,
such individual's earned income for such year, or
(B) in the case of an individual who is married at the close of such year,
the lesser of such individual's earned income or the earned income of
his spouse for such year.

(2) SPECIAL RULE FOR SPOUSE WHO IS A STUDENT OR INCAPABLE OF CARING FOR HIMSELF. --
In the case of a spouse who is a full-time student at an educational institution
or who is physically or mentally incapable of caring for himself, such spouse shall
be deemed for each month during which such spouse is a full-time student or is so
incapable to be gainfully employed and to have earned income of not less than --
(A) $250 if there is 1 qualifying individual, or
(B) $500 if there are 2 or more qualifying individuals.
"""

# Parameter for imputed earned income for disabled/student spouse per 26 USC 21(d)(2)
parameter imputed_earned_income_one_individual:
  description: "Monthly imputed earned income for disabled/student spouse with 1 qualifying individual"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 250

parameter imputed_earned_income_two_or_more:
  description: "Monthly imputed earned income for disabled/student spouse with 2+ qualifying individuals"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1976-01-01: 500

input is_tax_unit_head:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Tax Unit Head"
  description: "Whether the person is the head of the tax unit"
  default: false

input is_tax_unit_spouse:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Spouse"
  description: "Whether the person is the spouse in the tax unit"
  default: false

variable earned_income_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CDCC Earned Income Limit"
  description: "Earned income limitation on creditable expenses per 26 USC 21(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # For single/HoH filers: use the head's earned income
    # Filter earned income by role, then sum
    head_income = members.earned_income * members.is_tax_unit_head
    spouse_income = members.earned_income * members.is_tax_unit_spouse
    head_earned = sum(members, head_income)
    spouse_earned = sum(members, spouse_income)
    if filing_status == SINGLE or filing_status == HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD:
        return head_earned
    # For married filers: use lesser of two spouses' earned income
    # This incentivizes work for both spouses
    return min(head_earned, spouse_earned)
  tests:
    # Single/HoH filers - use taxpayer's earned income
    - name: "Single filer - earned income determines limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        earned_income: [40_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false]
      expect: 40_000

    - name: "Head of household - uses head's earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        earned_income: [55_000, 0]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, false]
      expect: 55_000

    - name: "Single filer with no earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        earned_income: [0]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false]
      expect: 0

    # Married filers - use lesser of two spouses' income
    - name: "Married - both spouses work, primary earner higher"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [60_000, 30_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
      expect: 30_000

    - name: "Married - both spouses work, spouse earner higher"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [25_000, 50_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
      expect: 25_000

    - name: "Married - equal earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [35_000, 35_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
      expect: 35_000

    - name: "Married - one spouse has no earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [45_000, 0]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
      expect: 0

    - name: "Married - low earning spouse limits credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        earned_income: [80_000, 5_000]
        is_tax_unit_head: [true, false]
        is_tax_unit_spouse: [false, true]
      expect: 5_000

documents.title: Is Dependent
documents.text:
(b) QUALIFYING INDIVIDUAL. -- The term 'qualifying individual' means --
(1) a dependent of the taxpayer... who has not attained age 13,
(2) a dependent of the taxpayer... who is physically or mentally incapable
of caring for himself or herself and who has the same principal place
of abode as the taxpayer for more than one-half of such taxable year, or
(3) the spouse of the taxpayer, if the spouse is physically or mentally
incapable of caring for himself or herself...
documents.code:
text: """
(b) QUALIFYING INDIVIDUAL. -- The term 'qualifying individual' means --
(1) a dependent of the taxpayer... who has not attained age 13,
(2) a dependent of the taxpayer... who is physically or mentally incapable
of caring for himself or herself and who has the same principal place
of abode as the taxpayer for more than one-half of such taxable year, or
(3) the spouse of the taxpayer, if the spouse is physically or mentally
incapable of caring for himself or herself...
"""

parameter child_age_limit:
  description: "Maximum age (exclusive) for CDCC qualifying child"
  unit: years
  values:
    1976-01-01: 13

input is_dependent:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Dependent"
  description: "Whether the person is a dependent of the taxpayer"
  default: false

input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Age of the person at end of tax year"
  default: 0

input is_disabled:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Disabled"
  description: "Whether the person is physically or mentally incapable of self-care"
  default: false

input is_tax_unit_spouse:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Spouse"
  description: "Whether the person is the spouse of the taxpayer"
  default: false

variable is_qualifying_individual:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is CDCC Qualifying Individual"
  description: "Whether person qualifies for purposes of Child and Dependent Care Credit per 26 USC 21(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Category 1: Dependent child under age 13
    is_qualifying_child = is_dependent and age < child_age_limit
    # Category 2: Disabled dependent
    is_qualifying_disabled_dependent = is_dependent and is_disabled
    # Category 3: Disabled spouse
    is_qualifying_disabled_spouse = is_tax_unit_spouse and is_disabled
    return is_qualifying_child or is_qualifying_disabled_dependent or is_qualifying_disabled_spouse
  tests:
    # Category 1: Dependent child under age 13
    - name: "Dependent child age 5 qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: true
        age: 5
        is_disabled: false
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Dependent child age 12 qualifies (just under limit)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: true
        age: 12
        is_disabled: false
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Dependent child age 13 does not qualify (at limit)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: true
        age: 13
        is_disabled: false
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Non-dependent child age 5 does not qualify"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: false
        age: 5
        is_disabled: false
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: false

    # Category 2: Disabled dependent
    - name: "Disabled dependent adult qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: true
        age: 25
        is_disabled: true
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Disabled dependent teenager qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: true
        age: 15
        is_disabled: true
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: true

    # Category 3: Disabled spouse
    - name: "Disabled spouse qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: false
        age: 45
        is_disabled: true
        is_tax_unit_spouse: true
      expect: true

    - name: "Non-disabled spouse does not qualify"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: false
        age: 45
        is_disabled: false
        is_tax_unit_spouse: true
      expect: false

    # Edge cases and combinations
    - name: "Adult disabled non-dependent non-spouse does not qualify"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: false
        age: 30
        is_disabled: true
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Dependent child under 13 who is also disabled qualifies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_dependent: true
        age: 8
        is_disabled: true
        is_tax_unit_spouse: false
      expect: true

variable num_qualifying_individuals:
  imports: [26/21/e#is_cdcc_qualifying_individual]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Count
  label: "Number of CDCC Qualifying Individuals"
  description: "Count of qualifying individuals for Child and Dependent Care Credit per 26 USC 21(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return tax_unit.members.count(is_cdcc_qualifying_individual)
  tests:
    - name: "No qualifying individuals"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_cdcc_qualifying_individual: [false, false]
      expect: 0

    - name: "One qualifying child under 13"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_cdcc_qualifying_individual: [false, true]
      expect: 1

    - name: "Two qualifying children"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_cdcc_qualifying_individual: [false, true, true]
      expect: 2

    - name: "Three qualifying individuals"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_cdcc_qualifying_individual: [false, true, true, true]
      expect: 3

    - name: "Single qualifying disabled spouse"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_cdcc_qualifying_individual: [false, true]
      expect: 1

    - name: "Mixed household - one qualifying one not"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_cdcc_qualifying_individual: [false, false, true, false]
      expect: 1

documents.title: Medical Expense Deduction
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of deduction.-- There shall be allowed as a deduction the
expenses paid during the taxable year, not compensated for by insurance
or otherwise, for medical care of the taxpayer, his spouse, or a
dependent (as defined in section 152, determined without regard to
subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B) thereof), to the extent that
such expenses exceed 7.5 percent of adjusted gross income.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Allowance of deduction.-- There shall be allowed as a deduction the
expenses paid during the taxable year, not compensated for by insurance
or otherwise, for medical care of the taxpayer, his spouse, or a
dependent (as defined in section 152, determined without regard to
subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B) thereof), to the extent that
such expenses exceed 7.5 percent of adjusted gross income.
"""
variable medical_expense_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/213/d/1#qualified_medical_expenses
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Medical Expense Deduction"
  description: "Itemized deduction for medical expenses exceeding 7.5% of AGI per 26 USC 213(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    expenses = qualified_medical_expenses
    # Calculate floor: 7.5% of AGI (permanent after CAA 2021)
    # Negative AGI treated as $0 floor
    floor = max(0, agi) * p.rate
    # Deduction is expenses exceeding the floor
    return max(0, expenses - floor)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Medical expenses exceed 7.5% AGI floor - typical case"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        qualified_medical_expenses: 15_000
      expect: 7_500  # 15,000 - (100,000 * 0.075) = 15,000 - 7,500

    - name: "Medical expenses equal AGI floor - no deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
        qualified_medical_expenses: 6_000
      expect: 0  # 6,000 - (80,000 * 0.075) = 6,000 - 6,000 = 0

    - name: "Medical expenses below AGI floor - no deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        qualified_medical_expenses: 2_000
      expect: 0  # 2,000 < (50,000 * 0.075) = 3,750, so max(0, -1,750) = 0

    - name: "Zero medical expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
        qualified_medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0  # No expenses to deduct

    - name: "Negative AGI treated as zero floor"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: -10_000
        qualified_medical_expenses: 5_000
      expect: 5_000  # max(0, -10,000) * 0.075 = 0, so full 5,000 is deductible

    - name: "High medical expenses relative to modest income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        qualified_medical_expenses: 25_000
      expect: 22_000  # 25,000 - (40,000 * 0.075) = 25,000 - 3,000

documents.title: Qualifying Medical Expenses
documents.text:
(1) The term 'medical care' means amounts paid—
(A) for the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention
of disease, or for the purpose of affecting any structure or
function of the body,
(B) for transportation primarily for and essential to medical care
referred to in subparagraph (A),
(C) for qualified long-term care services (as defined in section 7702B(c)),
(D) for insurance (including amounts paid as premiums under part B of
title XVIII of the Social Security Act) covering medical care
referred to in subparagraphs (A) and (B) or for any qualified
long-term care insurance contract (as defined in section 7702B(b)).
documents.code:
text: """
(1) The term 'medical care' means amounts paid—
(A) for the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention
of disease, or for the purpose of affecting any structure or
function of the body,
(B) for transportation primarily for and essential to medical care
referred to in subparagraph (A),
(C) for qualified long-term care services (as defined in section 7702B(c)),
(D) for insurance (including amounts paid as premiums under part B of
title XVIII of the Social Security Act) covering medical care
referred to in subparagraphs (A) and (B) or for any qualified
long-term care insurance contract (as defined in section 7702B(b)).
"""

# Note: Related provisions:
# - 213(a): Expenses must be unreimbursed and for taxpayer/spouse/dependent
# - 213(d)(9): Cosmetic surgery exclusion
# - 213(d)(10): LTC premium limits by age
variable qualified_medical_expenses:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualifying Medical Expenses"
  description: "Medical expenses eligible for deduction, net of insurance reimbursement"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Step 1: Start with gross medical expenses paid during taxable year
    gross_medical = medical_expenses_paid
    # Step 2: Subtract insurance reimbursements per 213(a)
    # "not compensated for by insurance or otherwise"
    unreimbursed = max(0, gross_medical - insurance_reimbursements)
    # Step 3: Add qualified long-term care premiums per 213(d)(1)(D)
    # Note: Premium limits by age apply per 213(d)(10)
    # Full implementation would cap LTC premiums based on taxpayer age:
    #   Age 40 or under: $480 (2023), $470 (2024)
    #   Age 41-50: $890 (2023), $880 (2024)
    #   Age 51-60: $1,790 (2023), $1,760 (2024)
    #   Age 61-70: $4,770 (2023), $4,710 (2024)
    #   Over 70: $5,960 (2023), $5,880 (2024)
    ltc_allowed = long_term_care_premiums
    # Total qualifying expenses
    return unreimbursed + ltc_allowed
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No medical expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medical_expenses_paid: 0
        insurance_reimbursements: 0
        long_term_care_premiums: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Unreimbursed medical expenses only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medical_expenses_paid: 15_000
        insurance_reimbursements: 5_000
        long_term_care_premiums: 0
      expect: 10_000

    - name: "Fully reimbursed medical expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medical_expenses_paid: 8_000
        insurance_reimbursements: 8_000
        long_term_care_premiums: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Over-reimbursed expenses floor at zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medical_expenses_paid: 5_000
        insurance_reimbursements: 7_000
        long_term_care_premiums: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Long-term care premiums with medical expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medical_expenses_paid: 20_000
        insurance_reimbursements: 12_000
        long_term_care_premiums: 4_710
      expect: 12_710

    - name: "Long-term care premiums only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medical_expenses_paid: 0
        insurance_reimbursements: 0
        long_term_care_premiums: 5_880
      expect: 5_880

documents.title: Alimony Paid
documents.text:
(a) General rule.—In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed
as a deduction an amount equal to the alimony or separate maintenance
payments paid during such individual's taxable year.
(b) Alimony or separate maintenance payments defined.—For purposes of
this section, the term 'alimony or separate maintenance payment' means
any alimony or separate maintenance payment (as defined in section 71(b))
which is includible in the gross income of the recipient under section 71.
(10) Alimony.—The deduction allowed by section 215.

Note: Per the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (TCJA), for divorce or
separation instruments executed after December 31, 2018, alimony payments
are not deductible by the payer and not includible in the recipient's income.
This change applies to instruments executed after 2018 and to instruments
modified after 2018 if the modification expressly provides that the new
rules apply.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) General rule.—In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed
as a deduction an amount equal to the alimony or separate maintenance
payments paid during such individual's taxable year.
(b) Alimony or separate maintenance payments defined.—For purposes of
this section, the term 'alimony or separate maintenance payment' means
any alimony or separate maintenance payment (as defined in section 71(b))
which is includible in the gross income of the recipient under section 71.
(10) Alimony.—The deduction allowed by section 215.

Note: Per the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (TCJA), for divorce or
separation instruments executed after December 31, 2018, alimony payments
are not deductible by the payer and not includible in the recipient's income.
This change applies to instruments executed after 2018 and to instruments
modified after 2018 if the modification expressly provides that the new
rules apply.
"""

# 26 USC 215(a) - Alimony deduction rate
parameter alimony_deduction_rate:
  description: "Rate at which alimony paid is deductible (1.0 for pre-2019 agreements)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1.0
    2019-01-01: 1.0
    2000-01-01: 1.0

input alimony_paid:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Alimony Paid"
  description: "Total alimony or separate maintenance payments made during the tax year"
  default: 0

input is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Pre-2019 Divorce Agreement Payer"
  description: "Whether the taxpayer pays alimony under a divorce or separation instrument executed before 2019"
  default: false

variable alimony_deduction:
  imports: [26/1#filing_status]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Alimony Deduction"
  description: "Above-the-line deduction for alimony payments per 26 USC 62(a)(10) and 215"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per TCJA: Only pre-2019 divorce instruments allow alimony deduction
    if not is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer:
        return 0
    # Per 26 USC 215(a): Alimony paid is deductible for pre-2019 agreements
    # The alimony_deduction_rate parameter confirms deduction rules by year
    # but the controlling factor is the agreement date, not the tax year
    return alimony_paid * alimony_deduction_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Pre-2019 agreement with $12,000 annual alimony"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer: true
        alimony_paid: 12_000
      expect: 12_000
    - name: "Pre-2019 agreement with $24,000 annual alimony"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer: true
        alimony_paid: 24_000
      expect: 24_000
    - name: "Post-2018 agreement gets no deduction per TCJA"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer: false
        alimony_paid: 18_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Pre-2019 agreement with zero alimony paid"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer: true
        alimony_paid: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Post-2018 agreement with large payment still gets zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer: false
        alimony_paid: 50_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Pre-2019 agreement with $6,000 annual alimony (smaller amount)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement_payer: true
        alimony_paid: 6_000
      expect: 6_000

documents.title: Earned Income
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of deduction.--In the case of an individual, there shall be
allowed as a deduction an amount equal to the qualified retirement
contributions of the individual for the taxable year.
(b) Maximum amount of deduction.--
(1) The amount allowable as a deduction shall not exceed the lesser of--
(A) the deductible amount, or
(B) an amount equal to compensation includible in gross income.
(c) Special rules for certain married individuals.
(g) Limitation on deduction for active participants in certain pension plans.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Allowance of deduction.--In the case of an individual, there shall be
allowed as a deduction an amount equal to the qualified retirement
contributions of the individual for the taxable year.
(b) Maximum amount of deduction.--
(1) The amount allowable as a deduction shall not exceed the lesser of--
(A) the deductible amount, or
(B) an amount equal to compensation includible in gross income.
(c) Special rules for certain married individuals.
(g) Limitation on deduction for active participants in certain pension plans.
"""

input earned_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Wages and self-employment income"
  default: 0

input adjusted_gross_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Gross Income"
  description: "AGI for phaseout calculation"
  default: 0

input filing_status:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: "Filing status code"
  default: 1

input is_active_retirement_plan_participant:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Active Participant in Retirement Plan"
  description: "Covered by employer retirement plan"
  default: false

input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Age at year-end"
  default: 0

variable ira_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/219/b#ira_contribution_limit
    - 26/219/g#ira_phaseout_ratio
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Traditional IRA Deduction"
  description: "Maximum traditional IRA deduction after phaseout"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 26 USC 219(a), (g): IRA deduction is contribution limit less phaseout reduction
    reduction = ira_contribution_limit * ira_phaseout_ratio
    deduction = ira_contribution_limit - reduction
    # Round down to nearest dollar per 219(g)
    return max(0, int(deduction))
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Young adult, no coverage, no phaseout (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        age: 30
      expect: 7000
    - name: "Age 50+, no coverage (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        age: 55
      expect: 8000
    - name: "Single, active participant, below phaseout (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 140_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 35
      expect: 7000
    - name: "Single, active participant, fully phased out (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 200_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 35
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single, active participant, partially phased out at midpoint (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 153_500
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 35
      expect: 3500
    - name: "Married filing jointly, active participant, below phaseout (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 120_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 40
      expect: 7000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, active participant, fully phased out (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 200_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 40
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing separately, active participant (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000
        filing_status: 3
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 40
      expect: 3500
    - name: "Zero earned income, no deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 0
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        age: 40
      expect: 0
    - name: "Prior year 2023, age 50+, active participant at threshold"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 116_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 55
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Age 50+ catch-up with phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 155_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
        age: 52
      expect: 4000

documents.title: Earned Income
documents.text:
(1) In General.--The amount allowable as a deduction under subsection (a)
to any individual for any taxable year shall not exceed the lesser of--
(A) the deductible amount, or
(B) an amount equal to the compensation includible in the individual's
gross income for such taxable year.
(5) Catch-up contributions.--In the case of an individual who has
attained age 50 before the close of the taxable year, the amount
applicable under paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to
the applicable catch-up contribution amount.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) In General.--The amount allowable as a deduction under subsection (a)
to any individual for any taxable year shall not exceed the lesser of--
(A) the deductible amount, or
(B) an amount equal to the compensation includible in the individual's
gross income for such taxable year.
(5) Catch-up contributions.--In the case of an individual who has
attained age 50 before the close of the taxable year, the amount
applicable under paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to
the applicable catch-up contribution amount.
"""

input earned_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Wages and self-employment income"
  default: 0

input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Person's age at year-end"
  default: 0

# 26 USC 219(b)(1)(A) - Base IRA contribution limit
parameter ira_base_limit:
  description: "Standard IRA contribution limit per taxpayer"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 7_000
    2023-01-01: 6_500
    2022-01-01: 6_000

# 26 USC 219(b)(5)(B) - Catch-up contribution amount
parameter ira_catch_up_amount:
  description: "Additional catch-up contribution for taxpayers age 50 or older"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1_000
    2023-01-01: 1_000
    2022-01-01: 1_000

# 26 USC 219(b)(5) - Catch-up eligibility age
parameter catch_up_age:
  description: "Age at which taxpayer becomes eligible for catch-up contributions"
  unit: years
  values:
    1974-01-01: 50

variable ira_contribution_limit:
  imports: [26/32/c/2/A#earned_income]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Maximum Deductible IRA Contribution"
  description: "IRA contribution limit before phaseout, lesser of earned income or statutory limit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    base_limit = ira_base_limit
    # 219(b)(5)(B): Add catch-up for age 50+
    if age >= catch_up_age:
        limit = base_limit + ira_catch_up_amount
    else:
        limit = base_limit
    # 219(b)(1)(B): Cannot exceed earned income
    return min(limit, max(0, earned_income))
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Under 50 with full earned income (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        age: 45
      expect: 7000
    - name: "Age 50 with full earned income (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        age: 50
      expect: 8000
    - name: "Age 51 with full earned income (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        age: 51
      expect: 8000
    - name: "Age 49 (catch-up not yet available)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        age: 49
      expect: 7000
    - name: "Under 50 with low earned income (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 5_000
        age: 40
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Age 50+ with low earned income (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 7_500
        age: 55
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Zero earned income (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: 0
        age: 45
      expect: 0
    - name: "Prior year 2023 under 50"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        age: 45
      expect: 6500
    - name: "Prior year 2023 age 50+"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        earned_income: 50_000
        age: 50
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Negative earned income floor"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income: -1_000
        age: 45
      expect: 0

variable ira_max_deductible_contribution:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Maximum Deductible IRA Contribution (alias)"
  description: "Alias for ira_contribution_limit for backward compatibility"
  formula: return ira_contribution_limit
  default: 0

variable traditional_ira_contributions:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Traditional IRA Contributions"
  description: "Actual traditional IRA contributions made"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # This would be an input in practice, but for testing
    # returns the maximum allowed contribution
    return ira_contribution_limit
  default: 0

documents.title: Adjusted Gross Income (MAGI for IRA)
documents.text:
(1) In general.--If, for any taxable year, the individual or the
individual's spouse is an active participant, each of the dollar
limitations... shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the amount
determined under paragraph (2).
(2) Amount of reduction.--
(A) In general.--The amount determined under this paragraph shall be
the amount which bears the same ratio to the dollar limitation...
as the excess of adjusted gross income over the applicable dollar
amount bears to $10,000 ($20,000 in the case of a joint return).
(7) Special rule for married individuals covered by employer plans.--
If this subsection applies to the individual, the applicable dollar
amount under this subsection for any taxable year shall not exceed
the applicable limit determined in accordance with the following table...
documents.code:
text: """
(1) In general.--If, for any taxable year, the individual or the
individual's spouse is an active participant, each of the dollar
limitations... shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the amount
determined under paragraph (2).
(2) Amount of reduction.--
(A) In general.--The amount determined under this paragraph shall be
the amount which bears the same ratio to the dollar limitation...
as the excess of adjusted gross income over the applicable dollar
amount bears to $10,000 ($20,000 in the case of a joint return).
(7) Special rule for married individuals covered by employer plans.--
If this subsection applies to the individual, the applicable dollar
amount under this subsection for any taxable year shall not exceed
the applicable limit determined in accordance with the following table...
"""

input adjusted_gross_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Gross Income (MAGI for IRA)"
  description: "Income for phaseout calculation purposes"
  default: 0

input filing_status:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: "Tax filing status (1=Single, 2=Married Filing Jointly, 3=Married Filing Separately, 4=Head of Household)"
  default: 1

input is_active_retirement_plan_participant:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Active Participant in Retirement Plan"
  description: "Whether individual is covered by employer-sponsored retirement plan"
  default: false

input spouse_is_active_retirement_plan_participant:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Spouse is Active Participant"
  description: "Whether spouse is covered by employer-sponsored retirement plan"
  default: false

parameter ira_phaseout_single_start:
  description: "IRA deduction phaseout starts at this MAGI for single filers who are active participants"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 146_000
    2023-01-01: 138_000
    2022-01-01: 138_000

parameter ira_phaseout_single_end:
  description: "IRA deduction completely phased out at this MAGI for single filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 161_000
    2023-01-01: 153_000
    2022-01-01: 153_000

parameter ira_phaseout_joint_start:
  description: "IRA deduction phaseout starts at this MAGI for married filing jointly with active participant"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 123_000
    2023-01-01: 116_000
    2022-01-01: 116_000

parameter ira_phaseout_joint_end:
  description: "IRA deduction completely phased out at this MAGI for married filing jointly"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 143_000
    2023-01-01: 136_000
    2022-01-01: 136_000

parameter ira_phaseout_mfs_start:
  description: "IRA deduction phaseout starts at this MAGI for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1974-01-01: 0

parameter ira_phaseout_mfs_end:
  description: "IRA deduction completely phased out at this MAGI for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 10_000
    2023-01-01: 10_000

parameter ira_phaseout_spouse_covered_start:
  description: "IRA deduction phaseout starts at this MAGI when spouse is covered but taxpayer is not"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 236_000
    2023-01-01: 230_000
    2022-01-01: 230_000

parameter ira_phaseout_spouse_covered_end:
  description: "IRA deduction completely phased out at this MAGI when spouse is covered but taxpayer is not"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 246_000
    2023-01-01: 240_000
    2022-01-01: 240_000

parameter phaseout_range_single:
  description: "Width of phaseout range for single filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1974-01-01: 15_000

parameter phaseout_range_joint:
  description: "Width of phaseout range for married filing jointly"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1974-01-01: 20_000

variable ira_phaseout_ratio:
  imports:
    - 26/219/b#ira_contribution_limit
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "IRA Phaseout Reduction Ratio"
  description: "Ratio of MAGI excess to phaseout range"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == 3:  # Married Filing Separately
        phaseout_start = ira_phaseout_mfs_start
        phaseout_end = ira_phaseout_mfs_end
    elif filing_status == 2 and not is_active_retirement_plan_participant and spouse_is_active_retirement_plan_participant:
        # 219(g)(7): Not covered but spouse is
        phaseout_start = ira_phaseout_spouse_covered_start
        phaseout_end = ira_phaseout_spouse_covered_end
    elif filing_status == 2:
        # Married Filing Jointly - taxpayer is covered
        phaseout_start = ira_phaseout_joint_start
        phaseout_end = ira_phaseout_joint_end
    else:
        # Single or Head of Household
        phaseout_start = ira_phaseout_single_start
        phaseout_end = ira_phaseout_single_end

    # No phaseout if below start threshold
    if adjusted_gross_income <= phaseout_start:
        return 0

    # Full phase-out if above end threshold
    if adjusted_gross_income >= phaseout_end:
        return 1

    # Partial phase-out
    excess = adjusted_gross_income - phaseout_start
    range_width = phaseout_end - phaseout_start
    return excess / range_width
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single, no active participant, no phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        ira_contribution_limit: 7_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single, active participant, below phaseout threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 140_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single, active participant, at phaseout start"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 146_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single, active participant, midway in phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 153_500
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Single, active participant, at phaseout end"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 161_000
        filing_status: 1
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 1
    - name: "Single, active participant, above phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        filing_status: 1

      expect: 1
    - name: "Married filing jointly, active participant, below phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 120_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing jointly, active participant, midway phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 133_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Married filing jointly, active participant, fully phased out"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 143_000
        filing_status: 2

      expect: 1
    - name: "Married filing separately, active participant"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000
        filing_status: 3
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "MFS, complete phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 10_000
        filing_status: 3
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 1
    - name: "Married jointly, spouse covered, not covered, below phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 230_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        spouse_is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married jointly, spouse covered, not covered, midway phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 241_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        spouse_is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Married jointly, spouse covered, not covered, fully phased out"
