      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 246_000
        filing_status: 2
        is_active_retirement_plan_participant: false
        spouse_is_active_retirement_plan_participant: true
      expect: 1

variable is_active_retirement_plan_participant_derived:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Active Participant Status (derived)"
  description: "Returns active participant status from input"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Pass through the input value - used when referencing via imports
    return is_active_retirement_plan_participant
  default: false

documents.title: Credit for the Elderly or Disabled
documents.text:
(a) GENERAL RULE. -- In the case of a qualified individual, there shall be
allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable
year an amount equal to 15 percent of such individual's section 22 amount
for such taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) GENERAL RULE. -- In the case of a qualified individual, there shall be
allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable
year an amount equal to 15 percent of such individual's section 22 amount
for such taxable year.
"""
variable elderly_disabled_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/22/d#adjusted_sec22_amount
    - 26/22/e#num_sec22_qualified_individuals
    - 26/26/a#tax_liability_before_credits
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Credit for the Elderly or Disabled"
  description: "Final credit for the elderly or disabled per 26 USC 22 (nonrefundable)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No credit if no qualified individuals
    if num_sec22_qualified_individuals == 0: return 0
    # Credit is 15% of the adjusted section 22 amount
    return adjusted_sec22_amount * applicable_percentage
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No qualified individuals, no credit"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 5_000
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 0
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 0
    - name: "One qualified individual, standard credit"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 5_000
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 750
    - name: "Two qualified individuals, higher base amount"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 7_500
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 2
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 1125
    - name: "Credit with fully reduced section 22 amount"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 2_500
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 375
    - name: "Zero adjusted amount despite qualified individual"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 0
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 0
    - name: "Maximum credit scenario"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 7_500
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 2
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 1125
    - name: "Single elderly person with modest reduction"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 4_000
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 600
    - name: "Disabled individual under age 65"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_sec22_amount: 3_500
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        applicable_percentage: 0.15
      expect: 525

input taxable_pension_annuity_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Taxable Pension and Annuity Income"
  description: "Pension and annuity income included in gross income (excludes Social Security)"
  default: 0

documents.title: Section 22 Initial Amount
documents.text:
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Except as provided in paragraph (2), the section 22 amount is--
(A) $5,000 in the case of--
(i) a joint return where only one spouse is a qualified individual,
(ii) a return of a surviving spouse, or
(iii) a return of a head of household or an individual who is not married,
(B) $7,500 in the case of a joint return where both spouses are qualified individuals, or
(C) $3,750 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return.
(2) DISABILITY INCOME LIMIT. -- In the case of a qualified individual who has not
attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the section 22 amount...
shall not exceed the disability income received.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) IN GENERAL. -- Except as provided in paragraph (2), the section 22 amount is--
(A) $5,000 in the case of--
(i) a joint return where only one spouse is a qualified individual,
(ii) a return of a surviving spouse, or
(iii) a return of a head of household or an individual who is not married,
(B) $7,500 in the case of a joint return where both spouses are qualified individuals, or
(C) $3,750 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return.
(2) DISABILITY INCOME LIMIT. -- In the case of a qualified individual who has not
attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, the section 22 amount...
shall not exceed the disability income received.
"""
variable initial_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/2/b#filing_status
    - 26/22/c#initial_amount_single
    - 26/22/c#initial_amount_joint_both
    - 26/22/c#initial_amount_separate
    - 26/22/c#qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold
    - 26/22/e#num_sec22_qualified_individuals
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Section 22 Initial Amount"
  description: "Initial section 22 amount before reductions per 26 USC 22(c)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No credit if no qualified individuals
    if num_sec22_qualified_individuals == 0: return 0
    # Married filing separately: $3,750
    if filing_status == SEPARATE: return initial_amount_separate
    # Joint return with both spouses qualified: $7,500
    if filing_status == JOINT and num_sec22_qualified_individuals >= qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: return initial_amount_joint_both
    # All other cases (single, HoH, surviving spouse, or joint with one qualified): $5,000
    return initial_amount_single
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No qualified individuals, no initial amount"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        initial_amount_single: 5_000
        initial_amount_joint_both: 7_500
        initial_amount_separate: 3_750
        qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: 2
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer with one qualified individual"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        initial_amount_single: 5_000
        initial_amount_joint_both: 7_500
        initial_amount_separate: 3_750
        qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: 2
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "Head of household with one qualified individual"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        initial_amount_single: 5_000
        initial_amount_joint_both: 7_500
        initial_amount_separate: 3_750
        qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: 2
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, one spouse qualified"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        filing_status: JOINT
        initial_amount_single: 5_000
        initial_amount_joint_both: 7_500
        initial_amount_separate: 3_750
        qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: 2
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "Married filing jointly, both spouses qualified"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 2
        filing_status: JOINT
        initial_amount_single: 5_000
        initial_amount_joint_both: 7_500
        initial_amount_separate: 3_750
        qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: 2
      expect: 7_500
    - name: "Married filing separately"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        num_sec22_qualified_individuals: 1
        filing_status: SEPARATE
        initial_amount_single: 5_000
        initial_amount_joint_both: 7_500
        initial_amount_separate: 3_750
        qualified_individuals_joint_both_threshold: 2
      expect: 3_750

documents.title: Adjusted Section 22 Amount
documents.text:
If the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer exceeds [threshold]...
the section 22 amount shall be reduced by one-half of the excess.
documents.code:
variable adjusted_section_22_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/22/c#sec22_initial_amount
    - 26/22/d#sec22_nontaxable_reduction
    - 26/22/d#sec22_agi_reduction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Section 22 Amount"
  description: "Section 22 amount after all reductions per 26 USC 22(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with initial amount
    initial = sec22_initial_amount
    # Subtract nontaxable income reduction (d)(1)
    after_nontaxable = max(0, initial - sec22_nontaxable_reduction)
    # Subtract AGI reduction (d)(2)
    # Note: Both reductions apply - the total reduction is the sum
    after_agi = max(0, after_nontaxable - sec22_agi_reduction)
    return after_agi
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No qualified individuals, no adjustment"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 0
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 0
        sec22_agi_reduction: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Initial amount with no reductions"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 5_000
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 0
        sec22_agi_reduction: 0
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Initial amount reduced by nontaxable income only"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 5_000
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 1_500
        sec22_agi_reduction: 0
      expect: 3500
    - name: "Initial amount reduced by AGI excess only"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 5_000
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 0
        sec22_agi_reduction: 1_000
      expect: 4000
    - name: "Initial amount with both reductions applied"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 5_000
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 1_500
        sec22_agi_reduction: 1_000
      expect: 2500
    - name: "Reductions exceed initial amount, capped at zero"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 5_000
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 3_000
        sec22_agi_reduction: 3_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Joint return both qualified, higher initial amount"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 7_500
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 2000
        sec22_agi_reduction: 1_500
      expect: 4000
    - name: "Married filing separately, lowest initial amount"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        sec22_initial_amount: 3_750
        sec22_nontaxable_reduction: 500
        sec22_agi_reduction: 500
      expect: 2750

# 26 USC 22(d)(2) - AGI Reduction
#

text: """
If the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer exceeds [threshold]...
the section 22 amount shall be reduced by one-half of the excess.
"""
variable agi_reduction:
  imports:
    - 26/22/d/reduction#agi_reduction_rate
    - 26/22/d#sec22_agi_threshold
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Section 22 AGI Reduction"
  description: "Reduction to section 22 amount based on excess AGI per 26 USC 22(d)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Calculate excess AGI over threshold
    excess_agi = max(0, adjusted_gross_income - sec22_agi_threshold)
    # Reduction is 50% of excess
    return excess_agi * agi_reduction_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "AGI below threshold, no reduction"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000
        sec22_agi_threshold: 7_500
        agi_reduction_rate: 0.5
      expect: 0
    - name: "AGI equal to threshold, no reduction"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 7_500
        sec22_agi_threshold: 7_500
        agi_reduction_rate: 0.5
      expect: 0
    - name: "AGI exceeds threshold by $2000, 50% reduction"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 9_500
        sec22_agi_threshold: 7_500
        agi_reduction_rate: 0.5
      expect: 1000
    - name: "Significant AGI excess with 50% reduction rate"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        sec22_agi_threshold: 7_500
        agi_reduction_rate: 0.5
      expect: 3750
    - name: "High income single filer"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 20_000
        sec22_agi_threshold: 7_500
        agi_reduction_rate: 0.5
      expect: 6250
    - name: "Joint return higher threshold"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        sec22_agi_threshold: 10_000
        agi_reduction_rate: 0.5
      expect: 2500


variable agi_threshold:
  imports:
    - 26/2/b#filing_status
    - 26/22/d/reduction#agi_threshold_single
    - 26/22/d/reduction#agi_threshold_joint
    - 26/22/d/reduction#agi_threshold_separate
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Section 22 AGI Threshold"
  description: "AGI threshold for section 22 reduction based on filing status per 26 USC 22(d)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == JOINT: return agi_threshold_joint
    if filing_status == SEPARATE: return agi_threshold_separate
    # Single, head of household, surviving spouse
    return agi_threshold_single
  default: 7_500
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, standard threshold"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        agi_threshold_single: 7_500
        agi_threshold_joint: 10_000
        agi_threshold_separate: 5_000
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Head of household, uses single threshold"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        agi_threshold_single: 7_500
        agi_threshold_joint: 10_000
        agi_threshold_separate: 5_000
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Surviving spouse, uses single threshold"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SURVIVING_SPOUSE
        agi_threshold_single: 7_500
        agi_threshold_joint: 10_000
        agi_threshold_separate: 5_000
      expect: 7500
    - name: "Married filing jointly, higher threshold"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        agi_threshold_single: 7_500
        agi_threshold_joint: 10_000
        agi_threshold_separate: 5_000
      expect: 10000
    - name: "Married filing separately, lowest threshold"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SEPARATE
        agi_threshold_single: 7_500
        agi_threshold_joint: 10_000
        agi_threshold_separate: 5_000
      expect: 5000


variable nontaxable_reduction:
  imports:
    - 26/22/a#nontaxable_social_security
    - 26/22/a#nontaxable_railroad_retirement
    - 26/22/a#taxable_pension_annuity
    - 26/22/a#taxable_disability_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Section 22 Nontaxable Income Reduction"
  description: "Reduction to section 22 amount for nontaxable pensions, Social Security, and disability income per 26 USC 22(d)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum all amounts that reduce the section 22 amount
    # Per statute: Social Security (nontaxable) + pensions/annuities (taxable) + disability
    social_security_reduction = nontaxable_social_security + nontaxable_railroad_retirement
    pension_reduction = taxable_pension_annuity
    disability_reduction = taxable_disability_income
    return social_security_reduction + pension_reduction + disability_reduction
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No reduction income, all zero"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 0
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 0
        taxable_pension_annuity: 0
        taxable_disability_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Nontaxable Social Security only"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 2000
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 0
        taxable_pension_annuity: 0
        taxable_disability_income: 0
      expect: 2000
    - name: "Nontaxable railroad retirement only"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 0
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 1_500
        taxable_pension_annuity: 0
        taxable_disability_income: 0
      expect: 1500
    - name: "Taxable pension/annuity only"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 0
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 0
        taxable_pension_annuity: 3_000
        taxable_disability_income: 0
      expect: 3000
    - name: "Taxable disability income only"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 0
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 0
        taxable_pension_annuity: 0
        taxable_disability_income: 2_500
      expect: 2500
    - name: "Social Security and railroad retirement combined"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 2000
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 1_000
        taxable_pension_annuity: 0
        taxable_disability_income: 0
      expect: 3000
    - name: "Pensions and disability combined"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 0
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 0
        taxable_pension_annuity: 2_500
        taxable_disability_income: 1_500
      expect: 4000
    - name: "All reduction types combined"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 2000
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 1_000
        taxable_pension_annuity: 1_500
        taxable_disability_income: 1_000
      expect: 5500
    - name: "Large reduction amounts"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        nontaxable_social_security: 3_000
        nontaxable_railroad_retirement: 2000
        taxable_pension_annuity: 4_000
        taxable_disability_income: 3_000
      expect: 12000

documents.title: Is Section 22 Qualified Individual
documents.text:
(1) QUALIFIED INDIVIDUAL. -- The term 'qualified individual' means any individual--
(A) who has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, or
(B) who retired on disability before the close of the taxable year and who,
when he retired, was permanently and totally disabled.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) QUALIFIED INDIVIDUAL. -- The term 'qualified individual' means any individual--
(A) who has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, or
(B) who retired on disability before the close of the taxable year and who,
when he retired, was permanently and totally disabled.
"""
variable is_qualified_individual:
  imports: [26/22/e/qualified_individual#elderly_age_threshold]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Section 22 Qualified Individual"
  description: "Whether the person qualifies for the credit for the elderly or disabled per 26 USC 22(e)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Age at end of tax year
    taxpayer_age = age
    # Qualifies if 65+ at end of tax year
    is_elderly = taxpayer_age >= elderly_age_threshold
    # Qualifies if permanently and totally disabled (under 65)
    # is_permanently_disabled is assumed to be an input indicating permanent/total disability
    is_disabled_and_under_65 = is_permanently_disabled and taxpayer_age < elderly_age_threshold
    return is_elderly or is_disabled_and_under_65
  default: False
  tests:
    - name: "Age 65, qualifies as elderly"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 65
        is_permanently_disabled: false
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 70, qualifies as elderly"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 70
        is_permanently_disabled: false
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 64, does not qualify as elderly"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 64
        is_permanently_disabled: false
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 50, disabled, qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 50
        is_permanently_disabled: true
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 60, disabled, qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 60
        is_permanently_disabled: true
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 65, disabled, qualifies (elderly takes precedence)"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 65
        is_permanently_disabled: true
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 64, not disabled, does not qualify"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 64
        is_permanently_disabled: false
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 64, disabled, qualifies under disability"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 64
        is_permanently_disabled: true
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 20, not disabled, does not qualify"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 20
        is_permanently_disabled: false
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 20, disabled, qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        age: 20
        is_permanently_disabled: true
        elderly_age_threshold: 65
      expect: true

variable num_qualified_individuals:
  imports: [26/22/e#is_sec22_qualified_individual]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Number of Section 22 Qualified Individuals"
  description: "Count of qualified individuals (elderly or disabled) in the tax unit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum the boolean values of is_qualified for head and spouse
    return sum(is_sec22_qualified_individual)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer, no qualifying individuals"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [false]
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer, qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [true]
      expect: 1
    - name: "Married filing jointly, head only qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [true, false]
      expect: 1
    - name: "Married filing jointly, spouse only qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [false, true]
      expect: 1
    - name: "Married filing jointly, both qualify"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [true, true]
      expect: 2
    - name: "Married filing jointly, neither qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [false, false]
      expect: 0
    - name: "Widow/widower, qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [true]
      expect: 1
    - name: "Head of household, qualifies"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [true]
      expect: 1
    - name: "Head of household, does not qualify"
      period: 2024-01-01
      inputs:
        is_sec22_qualified_individual: [false]
      expect: 0

documents.title: Student Loan Interest Deduction Eligibility
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of deduction
In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a deduction
for the taxable year an amount equal to the interest paid by the
taxpayer during the taxable year on any qualified education loan.
(b) Maximum deduction
(1) In general
Except as provided in paragraph (2), the deduction allowed by
subsection (a) for the taxable year shall not exceed $2,500.
(2) Limitation based on modified adjusted gross income
(A) In general
The amount which would (but for this paragraph) be allowable
as a deduction under this section shall be reduced (but not
below zero) by the amount determined under subparagraph (B).
(c) Definitions
For purposes of this section... the term 'qualified education loan'
means any indebtedness incurred by the taxpayer solely to pay
qualified higher education expenses...
(d) Special rules
(1) Denial of double benefit. No deduction shall be allowed...
(2) Married couples must file joint return. If the taxpayer is
married at the close of the taxable year, the deduction shall
be allowed only if the taxpayer and the taxpayer's spouse file
a joint return for the taxable year.
(3) Dependents not eligible. No deduction shall be allowed... to
an individual with respect to whom a deduction under section
151 is allowable to another taxpayer...
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Allowance of deduction
In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a deduction
for the taxable year an amount equal to the interest paid by the
taxpayer during the taxable year on any qualified education loan.
(b) Maximum deduction
(1) In general
Except as provided in paragraph (2), the deduction allowed by
subsection (a) for the taxable year shall not exceed $2,500.
(2) Limitation based on modified adjusted gross income
(A) In general
The amount which would (but for this paragraph) be allowable
as a deduction under this section shall be reduced (but not
below zero) by the amount determined under subparagraph (B).
(c) Definitions
For purposes of this section... the term 'qualified education loan'
means any indebtedness incurred by the taxpayer solely to pay
qualified higher education expenses...
(d) Special rules
(1) Denial of double benefit. No deduction shall be allowed...
(2) Married couples must file joint return. If the taxpayer is
married at the close of the taxable year, the deduction shall
be allowed only if the taxpayer and the taxpayer's spouse file
a joint return for the taxable year.
(3) Dependents not eligible. No deduction shall be allowed... to
an individual with respect to whom a deduction under section
151 is allowable to another taxpayer...
"""

# 26 USC 221(b)(1) - Maximum student loan interest deduction
parameter max_deduction:
  description: "Maximum annual student loan interest deduction"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2_500
    2023-01-01: 2_500
    2000-01-01: 2_500

# 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B) - Income phaseout thresholds (single)
parameter phaseout_single_start:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction phases out (single filers)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 80_000
    2023-01-01: 75_000
    2022-01-01: 70_000

parameter phaseout_single_end:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction fully phases out (single filers)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 95_000
    2023-01-01: 90_000
    2022-01-01: 85_000

# 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B) - Income phaseout thresholds (joint)
parameter phaseout_joint_start:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction phases out (MFJ)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 165_000
    2023-01-01: 155_000
    2022-01-01: 145_000

parameter phaseout_joint_end:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction fully phases out (MFJ)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 195_000
    2023-01-01: 185_000
    2022-01-01: 175_000

variable student_loan_interest_eligible:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Student Loan Interest Deduction Eligibility"
  description: "Whether the tax unit is eligible for the student loan interest deduction per 26 USC 221(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 26 USC 221(d)(2) - MFS cannot claim this deduction
    not_mfs = filing_status != MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
    # 26 USC 221(d)(3) - Cannot be claimed as dependent
    taxpayer_not_dependent = not any(members.is_claimed_as_dependent)
    return not_mfs and taxpayer_not_dependent
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: true
    - name: "MFJ filer eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: true
    - name: "MFS filer ineligible per 221(d)(2)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Dependent ineligible per 221(d)(3)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: true
      expect: false

variable student_loan_interest_phaseout_ratio:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "Student Loan Interest Phase-out Ratio"
  description: "Ratio of deduction reduced due to MAGI-based phase-out per 26 USC 221(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Determine thresholds based on filing status
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
        start = phaseout_joint_start
        end = phaseout_joint_end
    else:
        start = phaseout_single_start
        end = phaseout_single_end
    # For Section 221, MAGI equals AGI (per 221(b)(2)(C))
    magi = adjusted_gross_income
    range = end - start
    # Below phase-out start: no reduction
    if magi <= start:
        return 0
    # Above phase-out end: fully phased out
    if magi >= end:
        return 1
    # Per 221(b)(2)(B): proportional reduction
    return (magi - start) / range
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer below phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 70_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer at phaseout start"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer midway through phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 87_500
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Single filer above phaseout end"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
      expect: 1
    - name: "MFJ below phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "MFJ midway through phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 180_000
      expect: 0.5

variable student_loan_interest:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Student Loan Interest Deduction"
  description: "Above-the-line deduction for interest paid on qualified education loans per 26 USC 221"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Check eligibility per 221(d)
    if not student_loan_interest_eligible:
        return 0
    # Sum interest paid by all members of the tax unit
    total_interest = sum(members.student_loan_interest_paid)
    # 221(b)(1): Cannot exceed maximum deduction ($2,500)
    base = min(total_interest, max_deduction)
    # Apply phase-out per 221(b)(2)
    phaseout = student_loan_interest_phaseout_ratio
    # 221(b)(2)(A): Reduce by phase-out amount, but not below zero
    return max(base * (1 - phaseout), 0)
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible single with $2,000 interest, AGI below phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_000
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: 2_000
    - name: "Eligible single with interest exceeding $2,500 cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 3_500
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: 2_500
    - name: "Eligible single with partial phaseout (AGI $87,500 = 50%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 87_500
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_000
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: 1_000
    - name: "Eligible single fully phased out (AGI $100,000)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "MFJ with full deduction below phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: 2_500
    - name: "MFS ineligible regardless of income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_000
        members_is_claimed_as_dependent: false
      expect: 0

documents.title: Student Loan Interest Paid
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of deduction
In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a deduction for
the taxable year an amount equal to the interest paid by the taxpayer
during the taxable year on any qualified education loan.
(b) Maximum deduction
(1) In general
Except as provided in paragraph (2), the deduction allowed by
subsection (a) for the taxable year shall not exceed $2,500.
(2) Limitation based on modified adjusted gross income
(A) In general
The amount which would (but for this paragraph) be allowable
as a deduction under this section shall be reduced (but not
below zero) by the amount determined under subparagraph (B).
(B) Amount of reduction
The amount determined under this subparagraph is the amount
which bears the same ratio to the amount which would be so
allowable as (i) the excess of the taxpayer's modified adjusted
gross income over $50,000 ($100,000 in the case of a joint return)
bears to (ii) $15,000 ($30,000 in the case of a joint return).
(d) Special rules
(2) Married couples must file joint return
If the taxpayer is married at the close of the taxable year, the
deduction shall be allowed under subsection (a) only if the taxpayer
and the taxpayer's spouse file a joint return for the taxable year.
(3) Dependents not eligible
No deduction shall be allowed under this section to an individual
with respect to whom a deduction under section 151 is allowable to
another taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar year
in which such individual's taxable year begins.

# 26 USC 221(b)(1) - Maximum student loan interest deduction
parameter max_deduction:
  description: "Maximum annual student loan interest deduction"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2_500
    2023-01-01: 2_500
    2000-01-01: 2_500

# 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B) - Income phaseout start for single/HOH/QW filers
parameter phaseout_single_start:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction phases out (single filers)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 50_000
    2023-01-01: 50_000
    2000-01-01: 50_000

# 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B) - Income phaseout range for single/HOH/QW filers
parameter phaseout_single_end:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction fully phases out (single filers)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 65_000
    2023-01-01: 65_000
    2000-01-01: 65_000

# 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B) - Income phaseout start for married filing jointly
parameter phaseout_joint_start:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction phases out (MFJ)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 100_000
    2023-01-01: 100_000
    2000-01-01: 100_000

# 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B) - Income phaseout range for married filing jointly
parameter phaseout_joint_end:
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where student loan deduction fully phases out (MFJ)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 130_000
    2023-01-01: 130_000
    2000-01-01: 130_000
input student_loan_interest_paid:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Student Loan Interest Paid"
  description: "Interest paid by the taxpayer on qualified education loans during the tax year"

input is_claimed_as_dependent:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Claimed as Dependent"
  description: "Whether the individual can be claimed as a dependent by another taxpayer under Section 151"

variable student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Student Loan Interest Deduction Eligibility"
  description: "Whether the tax unit is eligible for the student loan interest deduction per 26 USC 221(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 221(d)(2): MFS cannot claim this deduction
    not_mfs = filing_status != MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
    # 221(d)(3): Cannot be claimed as dependent by another taxpayer
    # Check that primary taxpayer is not claimed as dependent
    taxpayer_not_dependent = not any(members.is_claimed_as_dependent)
    return not_mfs and taxpayer_not_dependent

variable student_loan_interest_phaseout_start:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Phase-out Start Threshold"
  description: "MAGI threshold where student loan interest deduction phase-out begins per 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
        return phaseout_joint_start
    # Single, HOH, and Qualifying Widow(er) use single thresholds
    return phaseout_single_start

variable student_loan_interest_phaseout_end:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Phase-out End Threshold"
  description: "MAGI threshold where student loan interest deduction is fully phased out per 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
        return phaseout_joint_end
    return phaseout_single_end

variable student_loan_interest_phaseout_ratio:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "Student Loan Interest Phase-out Ratio"
  description: "Ratio of deduction reduced due to MAGI-based phase-out per 26 USC 221(b)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # For Section 221, MAGI equals AGI (no add-backs required per 221(b)(2)(C))
    # Unlike some other provisions, 221 uses AGI directly
    magi = adjusted_gross_income
    start = student_loan_interest_phaseout_start
    end = student_loan_interest_phaseout_end
    range = end - start
    # Below phase-out start: no reduction
    if magi <= start:
        return 0
    # Above phase-out end: fully phased out
    if magi >= end:
        return 1
    # Per 221(b)(2)(B): proportional reduction within phase-out range
    # Reduction ratio = (MAGI - threshold) / phase-out range
    return (magi - start) / range
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer below phaseout (AGI $40,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer at phaseout start (AGI $50,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single filer midway through phaseout (AGI $57,500)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 57_500
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Single filer at phaseout end (AGI $65,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 65_000
      expect: 1
    - name: "Single filer above phaseout (AGI $75,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
      expect: 1
    - name: "MFJ below phaseout (AGI $90,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 90_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "MFJ at phaseout start (AGI $100,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "MFJ midway through phaseout (AGI $115,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 115_000
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "MFJ at phaseout end (AGI $130,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 130_000
      expect: 1
    - name: "MFJ above phaseout (AGI $150,000)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
      expect: 1

variable student_loan_interest_deduction_before_phaseout:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Student Loan Interest Deduction (Before Phase-out)"
  description: "Deduction amount before applying income-based phase-out per 26 USC 221(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum interest paid by all members of the tax unit
    total_interest = sum(members.student_loan_interest_paid)
    # 221(b)(1): Cannot exceed maximum deduction ($2,500)
    return min(total_interest, max_deduction)
  tests:
    - name: "Interest below $2,500 cap - single member"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 1_500
      expect: 1500
    - name: "Interest exceeds $2,500 cap - single member"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 3_000
      expect: 2500
    - name: "Exactly at $2,500 cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
      expect: 2500
    - name: "No interest paid"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Multiple members totaling $3,000 (should cap at $2,500)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 3_000
      expect: 2500

variable student_loan_interest_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Student Loan Interest Deduction"
  description: "Above-the-line deduction for interest paid on qualified education loans per 26 USC 221"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Check eligibility per 221(d)
    if not student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible:
        return 0
    # Get base deduction (capped at maximum per 221(b)(1))
    base = student_loan_interest_deduction_before_phaseout
    # Apply phase-out per 221(b)(2)
    phaseout = student_loan_interest_phaseout_ratio
    # 221(b)(2)(A): Reduce by phase-out amount, but not below zero
    return max(base * (1 - phaseout), 0)
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible single with $2,000 interest, AGI below phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2000
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 2000
    - name: "Eligible single with $2,500 cap, AGI below phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 3_500
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 2500
    - name: "Eligible single with $2,000 interest, AGI at phaseout midpoint ($57,500)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 57_500
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2000
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 1000
    - name: "Eligible single with $2,000 interest, AGI above phaseout end"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 70_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2000
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing jointly with $2,500 interest, AGI $100,000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 2500
    - name: "Married filing jointly with $2,500 interest, AGI $115,000 (midpoint)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 115_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 1250
    - name: "Married filing jointly with $2,500 interest, AGI $140,000 (above phaseout)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        adjusted_gross_income: 140_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Ineligible taxpayer (e.g., claimed as dependent)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2000
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing separately (ineligible per 221(d)(2))"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        members_student_loan_interest_paid: 2000
        student_loan_interest_deduction_eligible: false
      expect: 0

documents.title: Has Qualified Education Loan
documents.text:
(d) Definitions
For purposes of this section--
(1) Qualified education loan
The term 'qualified education loan' means any indebtedness incurred
by the taxpayer solely to pay qualified higher education expenses--
(A) which are incurred on behalf of the taxpayer, the taxpayer's
spouse, or any dependent of the taxpayer as of the time the
indebtedness was incurred,
(B) which are paid or incurred within a reasonable period of time
before or after the indebtedness is incurred, and
(C) which are attributable to education furnished during a period
during which the recipient was an eligible student.
Such term includes indebtedness used to refinance indebtedness which
qualifies as a qualified education loan. The term 'qualified education
loan' shall not include any indebtedness owed to a person who is
related (within the meaning of section 267(b) or 707(b)(1)) to the
taxpayer or to any person by reason of a loan under any qualified
employer plan (as defined in section 72(p)(4)) or under any contract
referred to in section 72(p)(5).
(4) Eligible student
The term 'eligible student' has the meaning given such term by
section 25A(b)(3).
(5) Dependent
The term 'dependent' has the meaning given such term by section 152
(determined without regard to subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B)
thereof).
(6) Qualified higher education expenses
The term 'qualified higher education expenses' has the meaning given
such term by section 529(e)(3) (determined by substituting 'eligible
educational institution' for 'eligible educational institution (as
defined in section 25A(f)(2))'.

such term by section 529(e)(3) (determined by substituting 'eligible

defined in section 25A(f)(2))'.
"""

# 26 USC 221(d)(1) - Loan sourced from eligible institution
parameter minimum_qualified_education_expenses:
  description: "Minimum qualified higher education expenses threshold (per 26 USC 221(d)(6))"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0
    2023-01-01: 0
    2000-01-01: 0
input has_qualified_education_loan:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Qualified Education Loan"
  description: "Whether the individual has a loan that qualifies under Section 221(d)(1)"

input qualified_higher_education_expenses_221:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Higher Education Expenses"
  description: "Expenses qualifying under Section 221(d)(6), referencing Section 529(e)(3)"

input attends_eligible_educational_institution:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Attends Eligible Educational Institution"
  description: "Whether the individual attends an institution eligible under Section 221"

input is_qualified_loan_beneficiary:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Qualified Loan Beneficiary"
  description: "Whether education expenses were for taxpayer, spouse, or dependent per Section 221(d)(1)(A)"

input has_excluded_related_party_loan:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Excluded Related-Party Loan"
  description: "Whether the loan is from a related person and thus excluded from Section 221 per Section 221(d)(1)"

input has_qualifying_refinanced_loan:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Qualifying Refinanced Loan"
  description: "Whether the individual has a loan that was refinanced and qualifies under Section 221(d)(1)"

documents.title: HSA Coverage Type
documents.text:
IRC § 223(b) - Limitations on HSA Contributions

(b) Limitations.—
(1) In general.—The amount allowable as a deduction under subsection
(a) to an individual for the taxable year shall not exceed the
sum of the monthly limitations for months during such taxable
year that the individual is an eligible individual.

(2) Monthly limitation.—The monthly limitation for any month is
1/12 of—
(A) in the case of an eligible individual who has self-only
coverage under a high deductible health plan as of the first
day of such month, $2,250 ($4,150 for 2024), and
(B) in the case of an eligible individual who has family
coverage under a high deductible health plan as of the first
day of such month, $4,500 ($8,300 for 2024).

(3) Additional contributions for individuals 55 or older.—
(A) In general.—In the case of an individual who has attained
age 55 before the close of the taxable year, the applicable
limitation under subparagraphs (A) and (B) of paragraph (2)
shall be increased by the additional contribution amount.
(B) Additional contribution amount.—For purposes of this section,
the term 'additional contribution amount' means $1,000.

(5) Special rule for married individuals.—In the case of individuals
who are married to each other, if either spouse has family
coverage—
(A) both shall be treated as having only such family coverage,
and
(B) the limitation under paragraph (1) shall be divided equally
between them unless they agree on a different division.

(6) Denial of deduction to dependents.—No deduction shall be
allowed under this section to any individual with respect to
whom a deduction under section 151 is allowable to another
taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar year in
which such individual's taxable year begins.

(7) Medicare eligible individuals.—The limitation under this
subsection for any month with respect to an individual shall
be zero for the first month such individual is entitled to
benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act and for
each month thereafter.
documents.code:
text: """
IRC § 223(b) - Limitations on HSA Contributions

(b) Limitations.—
(1) In general.—The amount allowable as a deduction under subsection
(a) to an individual for the taxable year shall not exceed the
sum of the monthly limitations for months during such taxable
year that the individual is an eligible individual.

(2) Monthly limitation.—The monthly limitation for any month is
1/12 of—
(A) in the case of an eligible individual who has self-only
coverage under a high deductible health plan as of the first
day of such month, $2,250 ($4,150 for 2024), and
(B) in the case of an eligible individual who has family
coverage under a high deductible health plan as of the first
day of such month, $4,500 ($8,300 for 2024).

(3) Additional contributions for individuals 55 or older.—
(A) In general.—In the case of an individual who has attained
age 55 before the close of the taxable year, the applicable
limitation under subparagraphs (A) and (B) of paragraph (2)
shall be increased by the additional contribution amount.
(B) Additional contribution amount.—For purposes of this section,
the term 'additional contribution amount' means $1,000.

(5) Special rule for married individuals.—In the case of individuals
who are married to each other, if either spouse has family
coverage—
(A) both shall be treated as having only such family coverage,
and
(B) the limitation under paragraph (1) shall be divided equally
between them unless they agree on a different division.

(6) Denial of deduction to dependents.—No deduction shall be
allowed under this section to any individual with respect to
whom a deduction under section 151 is allowable to another
taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar year in
which such individual's taxable year begins.

(7) Medicare eligible individuals.—The limitation under this
subsection for any month with respect to an individual shall
be zero for the first month such individual is entitled to
benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act and for
each month thereafter.
"""

# Inputs
input hsa_coverage_type:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: String
  label: "HSA Coverage Type"
  description: "Type of HDHP coverage (self_only or family)"
  default: "self_only"

input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Individual's age during the taxable year"
  default: 0

input months_of_coverage:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Months of HDHP Coverage"
  description: "Number of months during year with eligible HDHP coverage"
  default: 12

# Parameters
# 26 USC 223(b)(2)(A) - Self-only coverage limit
parameter hsa_limit_self_only:
  description: "Maximum annual HSA contribution for self-only HDHP coverage"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 4_150

# 26 USC 223(b)(2)(B) - Family coverage limit
parameter hsa_limit_family:
  description: "Maximum annual HSA contribution for family HDHP coverage"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 8_300

# 26 USC 223(b)(3)(B) - Catch-up contribution amount
parameter hsa_catchup_contribution:
  description: "Additional annual HSA contribution allowed for individuals age 55+"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1_000

# 26 USC 223(b)(3)(A) - Catch-up age threshold
parameter catchup_age_threshold:
  description: "Minimum age to qualify for HSA catch-up contributions"
  unit: years
  values:
    1977-01-01: 55

# Constant - months per year for proration
parameter months_per_year:
  description: "Number of months in a calendar year for proration"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1977-01-01: 12

# Variables
variable hsa_annual_contribution_limit:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HSA Annual Contribution Limit"
  description: "Maximum HSA contribution for the year based on coverage type, before catch-up"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 223(b)(2): Base limit depends on coverage type
    if hsa_coverage_type == "self_only":
      return hsa_limit_self_only
    elif hsa_coverage_type == "family":
      return hsa_limit_family
    else:
      return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Self-only coverage limit"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "self_only"
        age: 45
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: 4150
    - name: "Family coverage limit"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "family"
        age: 45
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: 8300
    - name: "Invalid coverage type"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "invalid"
        age: 45
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: 0

variable hsa_catchup_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HSA Catch-up Contribution Eligible"
  description: "Whether individual qualifies for additional $1,000 catch-up contribution (age 55+)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 223(b)(3)(A): Age 55 or older by end of taxable year
    return age >= catchup_age_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Age 55 eligible for catch-up"
      inputs:
        age: 55
        hsa_coverage_type: "self_only"
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 54 not eligible for catch-up"
      inputs:
        age: 54
        hsa_coverage_type: "self_only"
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 65 eligible for catch-up"
      inputs:
        age: 65
        hsa_coverage_type: "family"
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: true

variable hsa_total_contribution_limit:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HSA Total Contribution Limit"
  description: "Maximum HSA contribution including catch-up contributions, pro-rated by months"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 223(b)(1)-(3): Total limit = base limit + catch-up (if eligible)
    base_limit = hsa_annual_contribution_limit
    catchup_amount = 0

    if hsa_catchup_eligible:
      catchup_amount = hsa_catchup_contribution

    total_limit = base_limit + catchup_amount

    # Pro-rate by months of coverage (monthly limit × months)
    prorated_limit = (total_limit / months_per_year) * months_of_coverage

    return prorated_limit
  tests:
    - name: "Self-only, age 45, full year"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "self_only"
        age: 45
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: 4150
    - name: "Self-only, age 55, full year with catch-up"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "self_only"
        age: 55
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: 5150
    - name: "Family, age 60, full year with catch-up"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "family"
        age: 60
        months_of_coverage: 12
      expect: 9300
    - name: "Self-only, age 55, 6 months coverage with catch-up"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "self_only"
        age: 55
        months_of_coverage: 6
      expect: 2575
    - name: "Family, age 45, 3 months coverage"
      inputs:
        hsa_coverage_type: "family"
        age: 45
        months_of_coverage: 3
      expect: 2075

documents.title: Child Tax Credit (Nonrefundable)
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of credit.—
There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter
for the taxable year with respect to each qualifying child of the taxpayer
for which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 151 an amount
equal to $1,000.
documents.code:
#
# This file re-exports the key CTC variables from subsection files.
# All calculation logic lives in the proper subsection files:
#   - 26/24/a.rac      - Credit allowance and phaseout
#   - 26/24/b/1.rac    - Phaseout mechanics
#   - 26/24/c/3.rac    - Qualifying children count
#   - 26/24/d/1/B.rac  - Additional (refundable) CTC
#   - 26/24/h/2.rac    - Credit amount parameter
#   - 26/24/h/3.rac    - Phaseout threshold parameters
#   - 26/24/h/4.rac    - Other dependent credit parameter
#   - 26/24/h/5.rac    - Refundable maximum parameter

text: """
(a) Allowance of credit.—
There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter
for the taxable year with respect to each qualifying child of the taxpayer
for which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 151 an amount
equal to $1,000.
"""

# Re-export key variables for convenience
variable child_tax_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/24/a#child_tax_credit as ctc
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Child Tax Credit (Nonrefundable)"
  description: "Nonrefundable portion of Child Tax Credit per 26 USC Section 24"
  formula: return ctc
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Zero credit when no qualifying children"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Standard CTC with two children at $2,000 each"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc: 4_000
      expect: 4_000
    - name: "Maximum nonrefundable credit scenario"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc: 6_000
      expect: 6_000
    - name: "Partial credit after phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc: 1_500
      expect: 1_500

variable additional_child_tax_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/24/d/1/B#additional_child_tax_credit as actc
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Child Tax Credit (Refundable)"
  description: "Refundable portion of Child Tax Credit per 26 USC Section 24(d)"
  formula: return actc
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Zero refundable credit when fully nonrefundable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        actc: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Standard refundable ACTC"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        actc: 1_700
      expect: 1_700
    - name: "Maximum refundable credit at $1,700 per child"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        actc: 3_400
      expect: 3_400
    - name: "Partial refundable credit based on earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        actc: 850
      expect: 850

variable total_child_tax_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/24/a#ctc_total
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Child Tax Credit"
  description: "Combined nonrefundable CTC and refundable ACTC per 26 USC Section 24"
  formula: return ctc_total
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Zero total when no qualifying children"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc_total: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Total credit with two qualifying children"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc_total: 4_000
      expect: 4_000
    - name: "Maximum total credit scenario (three children)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc_total: 6_000
      expect: 6_000
    - name: "Combined nonrefundable and refundable portions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        ctc_total: 5_400
      expect: 5_400

documents.title: CTC Gross Credit
documents.text:
(a) Allowance of credit.—
There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter
for the taxable year with respect to each qualifying child of the taxpayer
for which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 151 an amount
equal to $1,000.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 24(a)

text: """
(a) Allowance of credit.—
There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter
for the taxable year with respect to each qualifying child of the taxpayer
for which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 151 an amount
equal to $1,000.
"""

# Import all parameters from subsections
# Credit amount from h/2
# Phaseout thresholds from h/3
# Phaseout mechanics from b/1

variable ctc_gross_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/24/h/2#credit_amount
    - 26/24/c/3#num_ctc_qualifying_children
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CTC Gross Credit"
  description: "Total CTC before phaseout per 26 USC 24(a)"
  formula: return credit_amount * num_ctc_qualifying_children
  tests:
    - name: "Two children, 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2}
      expect: 4000  # $2,000 x 2
    - name: "No children"
      inputs: {num_ctc_qualifying_children: 0}
      expect: 0

variable ctc_phaseout_threshold:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/24/h/3#phaseout_threshold_joint
    - 26/24/h/3#phaseout_threshold_other
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CTC Phaseout Threshold"
  description: "Income threshold where CTC phaseout begins per 26 USC 24(b)(2) and 24(h)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        threshold = phaseout_threshold_joint
    else:
        threshold = phaseout_threshold_other
    return threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Joint filers, 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {filing_status: JOINT}
      expect: 400000
    - name: "Single filer, 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {filing_status: SINGLE}
      expect: 200000

variable ctc_phaseout_reduction:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/24/b/1#phaseout_rate
    - 26/24/b/1#phaseout_increment
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CTC Phaseout Reduction"
  description: "Credit reduction based on income above threshold per 26 USC 24(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    threshold = ctc_phaseout_threshold
    excess = max(0, adjusted_gross_income - threshold)
    # "or fraction thereof" means round up
    increments = -(-excess // phaseout_increment)  # Ceiling division
    return phaseout_rate * increments
  tests:
    - name: "Income at threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 400_000, filing_status: JOINT}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Income $1 over threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 400_001, filing_status: JOINT}
      expect: 50  # $50 for first $1,000 increment
    - name: "Income $10k over threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 410_000, filing_status: JOINT}
      expect: 500  # 10 * $50

variable child_tax_credit_before_limit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CTC Before Tax Liability Limit"
  description: "Child Tax Credit after phaseout but before tax liability limit per 26 USC 24(a)-(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    gross = ctc_gross_credit
    reduction = ctc_phaseout_reduction
    return max(0, gross - reduction)
  tests:
    - name: "No phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 4000
    - name: "Partial phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2
        adjusted_gross_income: 420_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 3000  # 4000 - (20 * 50)
    - name: "Full phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 1
        adjusted_gross_income: 500_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0  # 2000 - (300 * 50) = 2000 - 15000 = 0

variable child_tax_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/26/a#tax_liability_limit
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Child Tax Credit (Non-refundable)"
  description: "Non-refundable portion of CTC limited to tax liability per 26 USC 24(a) and 26(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    credit = child_tax_credit_before_limit
    return min(credit, tax_liability_limit)
  tests:
    - name: "Credit less than tax liability"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        tax_liability_limit: 10_000
      expect: 4000
    - name: "Tax liability limits credit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 3
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        tax_liability_limit: 3_000
      expect: 3000  # Limited to tax liability

variable ctc_total:
  imports:
    - 26/24/d/1/B#additional_child_tax_credit
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Child Tax Credit"
  description: "Combined non-refundable CTC and refundable ACTC"
  formula: return child_tax_credit + additional_child_tax_credit
  tests:
    - name: "High income, CTC only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        tax_liability_limit: 15_000
        earned_income: 150_000
      expect: 4000  # Full CTC, no ACTC needed
    - name: "Low income with ACTC"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        tax_liability_limit: 500
        earned_income: 30_000
        social_security_taxes: 2_295
        earned_income_credit: 2000
      expect: 3900  # $500 CTC + $3400 ACTC (capped at 1700*2)

documents.title: CTC Phaseout Amount
documents.text:
(b) Limitations.—
(1) Limitation based on adjusted gross income.—
The amount of the credit allowable under subsection (a) shall be reduced
(but not below zero) by $50 for each $1,000 (or fraction thereof) by which
the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds the threshold amount.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 24(b)(1)

text: """
(b) Limitations.—
(1) Limitation based on adjusted gross income.—
The amount of the credit allowable under subsection (a) shall be reduced
(but not below zero) by $50 for each $1,000 (or fraction thereof) by which
the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds the threshold amount.
"""

parameter phaseout_rate:
  description: "CTC reduction amount per income increment above threshold"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1997-01-01: 50  # $50 per $1,000 excess

parameter phaseout_increment:
  description: "Income increment for CTC phaseout calculation"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1997-01-01: 1_000  # Per $1,000 (or fraction thereof)

variable ctc_phaseout_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/24/a#ctc_phaseout_threshold
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CTC Phaseout Amount"
  description: "Credit reduction based on excess income per 26 USC 24(b)(1): $50 per $1,000 (or fraction thereof) above threshold"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    excess = max(0, adjusted_gross_income - ctc_phaseout_threshold)
    # "or fraction thereof" means round up to next $1,000
    increments = -(-excess // phaseout_increment)  # Ceiling division
    return phaseout_rate * increments
  tests:
    - name: "Income at threshold - no phaseout"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 400_000
        ctc_phaseout_threshold: 400_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Income $1 over threshold - first increment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 400_001
        ctc_phaseout_threshold: 400_000
      expect: 50  # $50 for first $1,000 increment
    - name: "Income exactly $1,000 over threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 401_000
        ctc_phaseout_threshold: 400_000
      expect: 50  # Exactly one $1,000 increment
    - name: "Income $1,001 over threshold - two increments"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 401_001
        ctc_phaseout_threshold: 400_000
      expect: 100  # Two $1,000 increments (fraction rounds up)
    - name: "Income $10,000 over threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 210_000
        ctc_phaseout_threshold: 200_000
      expect: 500  # 10 increments * $50
    - name: "High income - full phaseout scenario"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 500_000
        ctc_phaseout_threshold: 400_000
      expect: 5_000  # 100 increments * $50

documents.title: Age
documents.text:
(c) Qualifying child.—
(1) In general.—
The term 'qualifying child' means a qualifying child of the taxpayer
(as defined in section 152(c)) who has not attained age 17.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 24(c)(1)

text: """
(c) Qualifying child.—
(1) In general.—
The term 'qualifying child' means a qualifying child of the taxpayer
(as defined in section 152(c)) who has not attained age 17.
"""

parameter qualifying_age_limit:
  description: "Maximum age (exclusive) for CTC qualifying child"
  unit: years
  values:
    2021-01-01: 18  # ARP temporarily raised to 18
    2022-01-01: 17  # Reverted
    1997-01-01: 17  # Original TRA97

input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Age of the person at end of tax year"
  default: 0

variable is_ctc_qualifying_child:
  imports:
    - 26/152/c#is_qualifying_child
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "CTC Qualifying Child"
  description: "Whether this person is a qualifying child for CTC per 26 USC 24(c)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be a qualifying child under Section 152(c) AND under age 17
    return is_qualifying_child and age < qualifying_age_limit
  tests:
    - name: "Child under 17"
      inputs: {age: 10, is_qualifying_child: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Child 17 or older"
      inputs: {age: 17, is_qualifying_child: true}
      expect: false
    - name: "Not qualifying child under 152(c)"
      inputs: {age: 10, is_qualifying_child: false}
      expect: false

documents.title: Number of CTC Qualifying Children
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 24(c)(3) - Qualifying Child Requirements

For purposes of this section, the term "qualifying child" means a qualifying
child of the taxpayer (as defined in section 152(c)) who has not attained
age 17.

This helper variable counts the number of qualifying children in the tax
unit for purposes of calculating the Child Tax Credit amount.
"""

variable num_ctc_qualifying_children:
  imports:
    - 26/24/c/1#is_ctc_qualifying_child
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Number of CTC Qualifying Children"
  description: "Count of qualifying children for Child Tax Credit per 26 USC 24(c)"
  formula: return person.count(is_ctc_qualifying_child)
  tests:
    - name: "No children"
      inputs: {is_ctc_qualifying_child: [false, false]}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Two qualifying children"
      inputs: {is_ctc_qualifying_child: [true, true, false]}
      expect: 2

documents.title: ACTC Earned Income Formula
documents.text:
(d) Portion of credit refundable.—
(1) In general.—
The aggregate credits allowed to a taxpayer under subpart C shall be increased
by the lesser of—
(A) the credit which would be allowed under this section without regard to
this subsection and the limitation under section 26(a), or
(B) the amount by which the aggregate amount of credits allowed by this
subpart (determined without regard to this subsection) would increase if the
limitation imposed by section 26(a) were increased by the greater of—
(i) 15 percent of so much of the taxpayer's earned income (within the
meaning of section 32) which exceeds $2,500, or
(ii) in the case of a taxpayer with 3 or more qualifying children, the
excess (if any) of—
(I) the taxpayer's social security taxes for the taxable year, over
(II) the credit allowed under section 32 for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
(d) Portion of credit refundable.—
(1) In general.—
The aggregate credits allowed to a taxpayer under subpart C shall be increased
by the lesser of—
(A) the credit which would be allowed under this section without regard to
this subsection and the limitation under section 26(a), or
(B) the amount by which the aggregate amount of credits allowed by this
subpart (determined without regard to this subsection) would increase if the
limitation imposed by section 26(a) were increased by the greater of—
(i) 15 percent of so much of the taxpayer's earned income (within the
meaning of section 32) which exceeds $2,500, or
(ii) in the case of a taxpayer with 3 or more qualifying children, the
excess (if any) of—
(I) the taxpayer's social security taxes for the taxable year, over
(II) the credit allowed under section 32 for the taxable year.
"""

parameter earned_income_threshold:
  description: "Earned income threshold for ACTC calculation"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 2_500  # TCJA
    2009-01-01: 3_000  # ARRA
    1997-01-01: 0     # Pre-ARRA formula was different

parameter refundable_rate:
  description: "Rate applied to earned income above threshold for ACTC"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1997-01-01: 0.15  # 15% of earned income above threshold

parameter qualifying_children_threshold:
  description: "Number of qualifying children to use SS tax calculation"
  unit: persons
  values:
    1997-01-01: 3  # 3 or more qualifying children

variable actc_earned_income_formula:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/24/h/5#refundable_max
    - 26/24/c/3#num_ctc_qualifying_children
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACTC Earned Income Formula"
  description: "15% of earned income above threshold"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    excess = max(0, earned_income - earned_income_threshold)
    earned_formula = refundable_rate * excess
    # Cap at refundable max per child times number of qualifying children
    max_refundable = refundable_max * num_ctc_qualifying_children
    return min(earned_formula, max_refundable)

variable actc_ss_tax_formula:
  imports:
    - 26/3101#social_security_taxes
    - 26/32/a/1#earned_income_credit
    - 26/24/c/3#num_ctc_qualifying_children
    - 26/24/h/5#refundable_max
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACTC SS Tax Formula"
  description: "SS taxes minus EITC for families with 3+ qualifying children"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only applies with 3+ qualifying children
    ss_excess = max(0, social_security_taxes - earned_income_credit)
    max_refundable = refundable_max * num_ctc_qualifying_children
    # Zero out if less than 3 children (vectorized)
    applies = (num_ctc_qualifying_children >= qualifying_children_threshold)
    return min(ss_excess, max_refundable) * applies

variable additional_child_tax_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/24/a#child_tax_credit_before_limit
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Child Tax Credit"
  description: "Refundable portion of CTC per 26 USC 24(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # ACTC = lesser of:
    # (A) CTC before tax liability limit
    # (B) greater of earned income formula or SS tax formula
    earned_amt = actc_earned_income_formula
    ss_amt = actc_ss_tax_formula
    max_formula = max(earned_amt, ss_amt)
    return min(child_tax_credit_before_limit, max_formula)
  tests:
    - name: "Low income family, $30k earned income, 2 children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        earned_income: 30_000
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 2
        child_tax_credit_before_limit: 4_000
        social_security_taxes: 2_295
        earned_income_credit: 0
      expect: 3400  # min(4000, 0.15*(30000-2500)) = min(4000, 4125) but capped at 1700*2
    - name: "Family with 3 children, SS tax formula higher"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        earned_income: 10_000
        num_ctc_qualifying_children: 3
        child_tax_credit_before_limit: 6_000
        social_security_taxes: 5_000
        earned_income_credit: 1_000
      expect: 4000  # SS formula: min(max(0, 5000-1000), 1700*3) = min(4000, 5100) = 4000
