documents.title: Dividends Received
documents.code:
text: """
(a) GENERAL RULE.—In the case of a corporation, there shall be allowed as
a deduction an amount equal to the following percentages of the amount
received as dividends from a domestic corporation which is subject to
taxation under this chapter:
(1) 50 percent, in the case of dividends other than dividends described
in paragraph (2) or (3);
(2) 100 percent, in the case of dividends received by a small business
investment company;
(3) 100 percent, in the case of qualifying dividends [from affiliates].
substituting "65 percent" for "50 percent".
"""

input dividends_received:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Dividends Received"
  description: "Total dividends received from domestic corporations"
  default: 0

input ownership_percentage:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "Ownership Percentage"
  description: "Percentage of voting stock owned in the dividend-paying corporation"
  default: 0

parameter ownership_threshold_affiliated:
  description: "Ownership threshold for affiliated corporation status (80%)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1987-01-01: 0.80

parameter ownership_threshold_20_percent:
  description: "Ownership threshold for 20-percent owned corporation status"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1987-01-01: 0.20

parameter deduction_rate_affiliated:
  description: "Deduction rate for dividends from affiliated corporations (80%+ ownership)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1987-01-01: 1.00

parameter deduction_rate_20_percent:
  description: "Deduction rate for dividends from 20-percent owned corporations"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2018-01-01: 0.65
    1987-01-01: 0.80

parameter deduction_rate_portfolio:
  description: "Deduction rate for portfolio dividends (less than 20% ownership)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2018-01-01: 0.50
    1987-01-01: 0.70

variable dividends_received_deduction:
  entity: Corporation
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Dividends Received Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for dividends received from domestic corporations under IRC 243"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Determine applicable deduction rate based on ownership percentage
    if ownership_percentage >= ownership_threshold_affiliated:
        rate = deduction_rate_affiliated
    elif ownership_percentage >= ownership_threshold_20_percent:
        rate = deduction_rate_20_percent
    else:
        rate = deduction_rate_portfolio
    return dividends_received * rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Portfolio dividends (less than 20% ownership)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dividends_received: 100_000
        ownership_percentage: 0.10
      expect: 50_000

    - name: "20-percent owned corporation (exactly 20%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dividends_received: 100_000
        ownership_percentage: 0.20
      expect: 65_000

    - name: "20-percent owned corporation (50% ownership)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dividends_received: 200_000
        ownership_percentage: 0.50
      expect: 130_000

    - name: "Affiliated corporation (exactly 80%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dividends_received: 100_000
        ownership_percentage: 0.80
      expect: 100_000

    - name: "Wholly-owned subsidiary (100% ownership)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dividends_received: 500_000
        ownership_percentage: 1.00
      expect: 500_000

    - name: "No dividends received"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        dividends_received: 0
        ownership_percentage: 0.50
      expect: 0

documents.title: AOC Qualified Expenses
documents.text:
(i) American opportunity tax credit.--In the case of any taxable year
beginning after 2008--
(1) In general.--In the case of an eligible student for whom an
election is made under this subsection, the Hope Scholarship Credit
shall be an amount equal to the sum of--
(A) 100 percent of so much of the qualified tuition and related
expenses paid by the taxpayer during the taxable year (for education
furnished to the eligible student during any academic period beginning
in such taxable year) as does not exceed $2,000, plus
(B) 25 percent of such expenses so paid as exceeds $2,000 but does
not exceed $4,000.
documents.code:
text: """
(i) American opportunity tax credit.--In the case of any taxable year
beginning after 2008--
(1) In general.--In the case of an eligible student for whom an
election is made under this subsection, the Hope Scholarship Credit
shall be an amount equal to the sum of--
(A) 100 percent of so much of the qualified tuition and related
expenses paid by the taxpayer during the taxable year (for education
furnished to the eligible student during any academic period beginning
in such taxable year) as does not exceed $2,000, plus
(B) 25 percent of such expenses so paid as exceeds $2,000 but does
not exceed $4,000.
"""

# 26 USC 25A(i)(1)(A) - First tier limit for AOC
parameter aoc_first_tier_limit:
  description: "Maximum expenses at 100% rate for American Opportunity Credit"
  indexed_by: statute/26/25A/h
  unit: USD
  values:
    2009-01-01: 2_000

# 26 USC 25A(i)(1)(A) - First tier rate for AOC
parameter aoc_first_tier_rate:
  description: "Credit rate for first tier of qualified expenses per 26 USC 25A(i)(1)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2009-01-01: 1.0

# 26 USC 25A(i)(1)(B) - Second tier limit for AOC
parameter aoc_second_tier_limit:
  description: "Maximum total expenses eligible for American Opportunity Credit"
  indexed_by: statute/26/25A/h
  unit: USD
  values:
    2009-01-01: 4_000

# 26 USC 25A(i)(1)(B) - Second tier rate for AOC
parameter aoc_second_tier_rate:
  description: "Credit rate for second tier of qualified expenses per 26 USC 25A(i)(1)(B)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2009-01-01: 0.25

input aoc_qualified_expenses:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "AOC Qualified Expenses"
  description: "Qualified tuition and related expenses for American Opportunity Credit"
  default: 0

variable education_credits_validation:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Education Credit"
  description: "Total education credit claimed per 26 USC § 25A"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 100% of first $2,000 + 25% of next $2,000 = max $2,500
    expenses = aoc_qualified_expenses
    first_tier = min(expenses, aoc_first_tier_limit) * aoc_first_tier_rate
    second_tier_expenses = max(0, min(expenses, aoc_second_tier_limit) - aoc_first_tier_limit)
    second_tier = second_tier_expenses * aoc_second_tier_rate
    return first_tier + second_tier
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No qualified expenses results in zero credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        aoc_qualified_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Expenses below first tier limit - full 100% credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        aoc_qualified_expenses: 1_500
      # $1,500 * 100% = $1,500
      expect: 1_500
    - name: "Expenses at first tier limit exactly"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        aoc_qualified_expenses: 2_000
      # $2,000 * 100% = $2,000 (at parameter limit)
      expect: 2_000
    - name: "Expenses in second tier - partial 25% credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        aoc_qualified_expenses: 3_000
      # First tier: $2,000 * 100% = $2,000
      # Second tier: ($3,000 - $2,000) * 25% = $250
      # Total: $2,250
      expect: 2_250
    - name: "Maximum credit at second tier limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        aoc_qualified_expenses: 4_000
      # First tier: $2,000 * 100% = $2,000
      # Second tier: ($4,000 - $2,000) * 25% = $500
      # Total: $2,500 (maximum AOTC)
      expect: 2_500
    - name: "Expenses exceed limit - credit capped at maximum"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        aoc_qualified_expenses: 10_000
      # Expenses capped at $4,000 for credit calculation
      # First tier: $2,000 * 100% = $2,000
      # Second tier: ($4,000 - $2,000) * 25% = $500
      # Total: $2,500 (maximum AOTC)
      expect: 2_500

documents.title: American Opportunity Tax Credit
documents.text:
In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against
the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year the amount equal to
the sum of—
(1) the American Opportunity Tax Credit, plus
(2) the Lifetime Learning Credit.

documents.title: LLC Qualified Expenses
documents.text:
(1) Per taxpayer credit - ... an amount equal to 20 percent of so much
of the qualified tuition and related expenses paid by the taxpayer
during the taxable year (for education furnished during any academic
period beginning in such taxable year) as does not exceed $10,000.
documents.code:
text: """
(1) Per taxpayer credit - ... an amount equal to 20 percent of so much
of the qualified tuition and related expenses paid by the taxpayer
during the taxable year (for education furnished during any academic
period beginning in such taxable year) as does not exceed $10,000.
"""

parameter llc_expense_limit:
  description: "Maximum qualified expenses eligible for LLC"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2009-01-01: 10_000

parameter llc_credit_rate:
  description: "Credit rate for lifetime learning credit"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2009-01-01: 0.20

parameter llc_max_credit:
  description: "Maximum lifetime learning credit per taxpayer"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2009-01-01: 2000

input llc_qualified_expenses:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "LLC Qualified Expenses"
  description: "Qualified tuition and related education expenses per 26 USC 25A(f)"
  default: 0

variable llc:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Lifetime Learning Credit"
  description: "Lifetime Learning Credit after phaseout per 26 USC § 25A(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Calculate 20% of qualified expenses up to $10,000 = max $2,000
    eligible_expenses = min(llc_qualified_expenses, llc_expense_limit)
    return eligible_expenses * llc_credit_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No qualified expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Small qualified expenses ($1,000)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 1_000
      expect: 200

    - name: "Mid-range qualified expenses ($5,000)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 5_000
      expect: 1000

    - name: "At expense limit ($10,000)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 10_000
      expect: 2000

    - name: "Expenses exceed limit ($15,000)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 15_000
      expect: 2000

    - name: "Maximum credit achievable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 10_000
      expect: 2000

    - name: "Half of maximum credit ($5,000 expenses)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 5_000
      expect: 1000

    - name: "Minimal qualified expenses ($100)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 100
      expect: 20

    - name: "Very large qualified expenses ($50,000)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 50_000
      expect: 2000

    - name: "Expenses just under limit ($9,999)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        llc_qualified_expenses: 9_999
      expect: 1999

documents.title: Saver
documents.text:
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT.--In the case of an eligible individual, there shall
be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the
taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of so much of
the qualified retirement savings contributions of the eligible individual
for the taxable year as do not exceed $2,000.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT.--In the case of an eligible individual, there shall
be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the
taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of so much of
the qualified retirement savings contributions of the eligible individual
for the taxable year as do not exceed $2,000.
"""
variable savers_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/25B/c#is_savers_credit_eligible
    - 26/25B/b#savers_credit_applicable_percentage
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Saver's Credit"
  description: "Credit for qualified retirement savings contributions per 26 USC 25B (nonrefundable)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum of all qualified retirement savings contributions per 25B(d)(1)
    return (
    traditional_ira_contributions +
    traditional_401k_contributions +
    traditional_403b_contributions +
    roth_ira_contributions +
    roth_401k_contributions +
    roth_403b_contributions +
    self_employed_pension_contributions +
    able_contributions_person
    )
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single contribution type - Traditional IRA only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 2_000
        traditional_401k_contributions: 0
        traditional_403b_contributions: 0
        roth_ira_contributions: 0
        roth_401k_contributions: 0
        roth_403b_contributions: 0
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 0
        able_contributions_person: 0
      expect: 2_000
    - name: "Multiple contribution types - IRA and 401k"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 1_500
        traditional_401k_contributions: 3_000
        traditional_403b_contributions: 0
        roth_ira_contributions: 0
        roth_401k_contributions: 0
        roth_403b_contributions: 0
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 0
        able_contributions_person: 0
      expect: 4_500
    - name: "Mixed traditional and Roth contributions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 1_000
        traditional_401k_contributions: 0
        traditional_403b_contributions: 0
        roth_ira_contributions: 1_000
        roth_401k_contributions: 2_500
        roth_403b_contributions: 0
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 0
        able_contributions_person: 0
      expect: 4_500
    - name: "All contribution types with non-zero values"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 500
        traditional_401k_contributions: 1_000
        traditional_403b_contributions: 750
        roth_ira_contributions: 500
        roth_401k_contributions: 1_000
        roth_403b_contributions: 750
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 2_000
        able_contributions_person: 500
      expect: 7_000
    - name: "Self-employed pension and ABLE contributions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        traditional_401k_contributions: 0
        traditional_403b_contributions: 0
        roth_ira_contributions: 0
        roth_401k_contributions: 0
        roth_403b_contributions: 0
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 5_000
        able_contributions_person: 1_000
      expect: 6_000
    - name: "Zero contributions - no credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        traditional_401k_contributions: 0
        traditional_403b_contributions: 0
        roth_ira_contributions: 0
        roth_401k_contributions: 0
        roth_403b_contributions: 0
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 0
        able_contributions_person: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Saver
documents.text:
