(1) JOINT RETURNS.--In the case of a joint return, the applicable percentage
is determined in accordance with the following table:
Over $0   but not over $43,500 . . . . . . . . . 50 percent
Over $43,500 but not over $47,500 . . . . . . . 20 percent
Over $47,500 but not over $73,000 . . . . . . . 10 percent
Over $73,000 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  0 percent
(2) HEAD OF HOUSEHOLD.--In the case of an individual who is a head of
household (as defined in section 2(b)), the applicable percentage...
(3) OTHER INDIVIDUALS.--In any other case, the applicable percentage...
documents.code:
text: """
(b) APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE.--For purposes of this section--
(1) JOINT RETURNS.--In the case of a joint return, the applicable percentage
is determined in accordance with the following table:
Over $0   but not over $43,500 . . . . . . . . . 50 percent
Over $43,500 but not over $47,500 . . . . . . . 20 percent
Over $47,500 but not over $73,000 . . . . . . . 10 percent
Over $73,000 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  0 percent
(2) HEAD OF HOUSEHOLD.--In the case of an individual who is a head of
household (as defined in section 2(b)), the applicable percentage...
(3) OTHER INDIVIDUALS.--In any other case, the applicable percentage...
"""

parameter savers_credit_rate_tier1:
  description: "Saver's credit rate for lowest AGI tier (50%)"
  values:
    2002-01-01: 0.50

parameter savers_credit_rate_tier2:
  description: "Saver's credit rate for second AGI tier (20%)"
  values:
    2002-01-01: 0.20

parameter savers_credit_rate_tier3:
  description: "Saver's credit rate for third AGI tier (10%)"
  values:
    2002-01-01: 0.10

variable applicable_percentage:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "Saver's Credit Applicable Percentage"
  description: "Credit rate for Saver's Credit based on AGI and filing status per 26 USC 25B(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    # Get threshold adjustment factor based on filing status
    # Joint is the base (1.0), other statuses adjust down
    threshold_adjustment = threshold_adjustments[filing_status]
    # Adjust AGI to compare against joint thresholds
    # This is equivalent to adjusting thresholds down, but more efficient
    adjusted_agi = agi / threshold_adjustment
    # Apply rate based on adjusted AGI against joint thresholds
    # 50% rate: AGI at or below first threshold
    if adjusted_agi <= joint_threshold_50:
        return savers_credit_rate_tier1
    # 20% rate: AGI above first but at or below second threshold
    if adjusted_agi <= joint_threshold_20:
        return savers_credit_rate_tier2
    # 10% rate: AGI above second but at or below third threshold
    if adjusted_agi <= joint_threshold_10:
        return savers_credit_rate_tier3
    # 0% rate: AGI above third threshold - no credit
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # SAVER'S CREDIT APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE TESTS - 26 USC 25B(b)
    # Tests credit rate based on AGI and filing status
    # Joint thresholds (2024): $43,500 (50%), $47,500 (20%), $73,000 (10%)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Joint filer in 50% tier - lowest AGI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        joint_threshold_50: 43_500
        joint_threshold_20: 47_500
        joint_threshold_10: 73_000
        threshold_adjustments: {JOINT: 1.0, SINGLE: 0.5, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD: 0.75}
      expect: 0.50  # AGI $40,000 <= $43,500 threshold

    - name: "Joint filer in 20% tier"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 45_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        joint_threshold_50: 43_500
        joint_threshold_20: 47_500
        joint_threshold_10: 73_000
        threshold_adjustments: {JOINT: 1.0, SINGLE: 0.5, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD: 0.75}
      expect: 0.20  # AGI $45,000 > $43,500 but <= $47,500

    - name: "Joint filer in 10% tier"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        joint_threshold_50: 43_500
        joint_threshold_20: 47_500
        joint_threshold_10: 73_000
        threshold_adjustments: {JOINT: 1.0, SINGLE: 0.5, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD: 0.75}
      expect: 0.10  # AGI $60,000 > $47,500 but <= $73,000

    - name: "Joint filer above all thresholds - no credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        joint_threshold_50: 43_500
        joint_threshold_20: 47_500
        joint_threshold_10: 73_000
        threshold_adjustments: {JOINT: 1.0, SINGLE: 0.5, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD: 0.75}
      expect: 0  # AGI $80,000 > $73,000

documents.title: Eligible for Saver
documents.code:
text: """
(c) ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL.--For purposes of this section--
(1) IN GENERAL.--The term 'eligible individual' means any individual if such
individual has attained the age of 18 as of the close of the taxable year.
(2) DEPENDENTS AND FULL-TIME STUDENTS NOT ELIGIBLE.--The term 'eligible
individual' shall not include--
(A) any individual with respect to whom a deduction under section 151 is
allowed to another taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the
calendar year in which such individual's taxable year begins, and
(B) any individual who is a student (as defined in section 152(f)(2)).
Note: The statute says "with respect to whom a deduction under section 151
is allowed to another taxpayer" - this means the person cannot be claimed
"""
variable eligible_individual:
  imports: [26/1/is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse#is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Eligible for Saver's Credit"
  description: "Whether individual is an eligible individual for the Saver's Credit per 26 USC 25B(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 25B(c)(1): Must be at least 18 at end of tax year
    meets_age_requirement = age >= minimum_age
    # Only head of household or spouse can claim (they are the filers)
    is_filer = is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse
    # 25B(c)(2)(A): Not claimed as dependent on ANOTHER taxpayer's return
    not_dependent_elsewhere = not claimed_as_dependent_on_another_return
    # 25B(c)(2)(B): Not a full-time student (as defined in 152(f)(2))
    not_a_student = not is_full_time_student
    # All conditions must be met
    return meets_age_requirement and is_filer and not_dependent_elsewhere and not_a_student
  default: False
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL TESTS - 26 USC 25B(c)
    # Tests eligibility for Saver's Credit per 25B(c)(1) and (2)
    # Must be: age 18+, filer (head/spouse), not dependent elsewhere, not student
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Eligible adult filer - meets all requirements"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 35
        is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse: True
        claimed_as_dependent_on_another_return: False
        is_full_time_student: False
        minimum_age: 18
      expect: True

    - name: "Under 18 - not eligible per 25B(c)(1)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 17
        is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse: True
        claimed_as_dependent_on_another_return: False
        is_full_time_student: False
        minimum_age: 18
      expect: False

    - name: "Full-time student - not eligible per 25B(c)(2)(B)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 22
        is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse: True
        claimed_as_dependent_on_another_return: False
        is_full_time_student: True
        minimum_age: 18
      expect: False

    - name: "Claimed as dependent elsewhere - not eligible per 25B(c)(2)(A)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 25
        is_tax_unit_head_or_spouse: True
        claimed_as_dependent_on_another_return: True
        is_full_time_student: False
        minimum_age: 18
      expect: False

documents.title: Used Clean Vehicle Credit
documents.text:
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. -- In the case of a qualified buyer who during a
taxable year places in service a previously-owned clean vehicle, there shall
be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the
taxable year an amount equal to the lesser of--
(1) $4,000, or
(2) the amount equal to 30 percent of the sale price with respect to
such vehicle.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. -- In the case of a qualified buyer who during a
taxable year places in service a previously-owned clean vehicle, there shall
be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the
taxable year an amount equal to the lesser of--
(1) $4,000, or
(2) the amount equal to 30 percent of the sale price with respect to
such vehicle.
"""
variable used_vehicle_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/1#income_tax_before_credits
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Used Clean Vehicle Credit"
  description: "Credit for previously-owned clean vehicles per 26 USC 25E"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Note: Law specifies lesser of current or prior year MAGI
    # For simplicity, using current year AGI
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    limit = p.eligibility.income_limit[filing_status]
    return agi <= limit
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer under income limit with low-price vehicle"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        used_clean_vehicle_sale_price: 8_000
      # Eligible: AGI $60k < $75k limit for single
      # Credit = min($4,000, 30% of $8,000) = min($4,000, $2,400) = $2,400
      expect: 2_400
    - name: "Single filer under income limit with high-price vehicle"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 70_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        used_clean_vehicle_sale_price: 20_000
      # Eligible: AGI $70k < $75k limit for single
      # Credit = min($4,000, 30% of $20,000) = min($4,000, $6,000) = $4,000
      expect: 4_000
    - name: "Single filer over income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        used_clean_vehicle_sale_price: 15_000
      # Not eligible: AGI $80k > $75k limit for single
      expect: 0
    - name: "Joint filers under income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 140_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        used_clean_vehicle_sale_price: 18_000
      # Eligible: AGI $140k < $150k limit for joint
      # Credit = min($4,000, 30% of $18,000) = min($4,000, $5,400) = $4,000
      expect: 4_000
    - name: "Joint filers at income limit boundary"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        used_clean_vehicle_sale_price: 12_000
      # Eligible: AGI $150k = $150k limit for joint (at limit, still eligible)
      # Credit = min($4,000, 30% of $12,000) = min($4,000, $3,600) = $3,600
      expect: 3_600
    - name: "Head of household filer under income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        used_clean_vehicle_sale_price: 25_000
      # Eligible: AGI $100k < $112,500 limit for HoH
      # Credit = min($4,000, 30% of $25,000) = min($4,000, $7,500) = $4,000
      expect: 4_000

documents.title: Total Nonrefundable Credits
documents.code:
text: """
Section 26(a) provides: "The aggregate amount of credits allowed by this
(2) the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year.
"""
variable total_nonrefundable_credits:
  imports:
    - 26/21/a#child_dependent_care_credit
    - 26/24#child_tax_credit
    - 26/25A/a#education_credits_nonrefundable
    - 26/26/a#tax_liability_before_credits
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Nonrefundable Credits"
  description: "Sum of nonrefundable personal credits per 26 USC Section 26, limited by tax liability"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum all nonrefundable credits
    # Each credit is already individually limited by tax liability in its own formula
    total = child_dependent_care_credit + child_tax_credit + education_credits_nonrefundable
    # Total cannot exceed tax liability (belt-and-suspenders with individual limits)
    return min(total, tax_liability_before_credits)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "no_credits_zero_liability"
      description: "No credits when tax liability is zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        child_dependent_care_credit: 0
        child_tax_credit: 0
        education_credits_nonrefundable: 0
        tax_liability_before_credits: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "single_credit_under_liability"
      description: "Child tax credit of $2,000 with sufficient tax liability"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        child_dependent_care_credit: 0
        child_tax_credit: 2_000
        education_credits_nonrefundable: 0
        tax_liability_before_credits: 5_000
      expect: 2_000

    - name: "multiple_credits_under_liability"
      description: "All three credits totaling $5,500 with $10,000 liability"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        child_dependent_care_credit: 1_500
        child_tax_credit: 2_000
        education_credits_nonrefundable: 2_000
        tax_liability_before_credits: 10_000
      expect: 5_500

    - name: "credits_limited_by_liability"
      description: "Total credits exceed tax liability - should be limited"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        child_dependent_care_credit: 3_000
        child_tax_credit: 4_000
        education_credits_nonrefundable: 2_500
        tax_liability_before_credits: 6_000
      expect: 6_000

    - name: "exact_liability_match"
      description: "Credits exactly equal tax liability"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        child_dependent_care_credit: 2_000
        child_tax_credit: 3_000
        education_credits_nonrefundable: 2_500
        tax_liability_before_credits: 7_500
      expect: 7_500

    - name: "high_income_scenario"
      description: "Higher income taxpayer with large liability and multiple credits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        child_dependent_care_credit: 6_000
        child_tax_credit: 8_000
        education_credits_nonrefundable: 2_500
        tax_liability_before_credits: 25_000
      expect: 16_500

documents.title: Tax Liability Before Credits
documents.text:
The aggregate amount of credits allowed by this subpart for the taxable
year shall not exceed the excess (if any) of—
(1) the taxpayer's regular tax liability for the taxable year, over
(2) the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year
documents.code:
text: """
The aggregate amount of credits allowed by this subpart for the taxable
year shall not exceed the excess (if any) of—
(1) the taxpayer's regular tax liability for the taxable year, over
(2) the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year
"""
variable tax_liability_before_credits:
  imports:
    - 26/1#income_tax_before_credits
    - 26/55/a#tentative_minimum_tax
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Tax Liability Before Credits"
  description: "Maximum amount of nonrefundable credits per Section 26(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Regular tax is the income tax computed under Section 1
    # Self-employment tax is separate and not limited by Section 26
    return income_tax_before_credits
  tests:
    # Test 1: Zero income tax means no nonrefundable credits can be claimed
    - name: "Zero income tax - no credit capacity"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 0
      expect: 0

    # Test 2: Low income taxpayer with modest credit capacity
    - name: "Low income taxpayer with $1,500 tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 1_500
      expect: 1_500

    # Test 3: Middle income taxpayer with moderate credit capacity
    - name: "Middle income taxpayer with $8,000 tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 8_000
      expect: 8_000

    # Test 4: Higher income taxpayer with substantial credit capacity
    - name: "Higher income taxpayer with $25,000 tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 25_000
      expect: 25_000

    # Test 5: High income taxpayer with large credit capacity
    - name: "High income taxpayer with $75,000 tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 75_000
      expect: 75_000

    # Test 6: Very small tax liability edge case
    - name: "Very small tax liability - $1"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        income_tax_before_credits: 1
      expect: 1

documents.title: Purchased New Clean Vehicle
documents.text:
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. -- There shall be allowed as a credit against the
tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the sum
of the credit amounts determined under subsection (b) with respect to each
new clean vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

(b) CREDIT AMOUNT. -- For purposes of subsection (a), the credit amount
determined under this subsection with respect to any new clean vehicle is
the sum of the credit amounts determined under paragraphs (2) and (3).

(2) CRITICAL MINERALS. -- In the case of a vehicle that meets the
requirements of subsection (e)(1)(A), $3,750.

(3) BATTERY COMPONENTS. -- In the case of a vehicle that meets the
requirements of subsection (e)(2)(A), $3,750.
documents.code:
#
# The credit is comprised of two components of $3,750 each:
#   - Critical minerals component: 30D(b)(2)
#   - Battery components component: 30D(b)(3)
# Maximum total credit: $7,500
#
# Eligibility requirements:
#   - Final assembly in North America: 30D(d)(1)(G)
#   - Minimum 7 kWh battery capacity: 30D(d)(1)(F)
#   - MSRP limits: 30D(f)(11) - $80k for vans/SUVs/pickups, $55k for others
#   - AGI limits: 30D(f)(10) - $300k joint, $225k HoH, $150k single/other

text: """
(a) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. -- There shall be allowed as a credit against the
tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the sum
of the credit amounts determined under subsection (b) with respect to each
new clean vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

(b) CREDIT AMOUNT. -- For purposes of subsection (a), the credit amount
determined under this subsection with respect to any new clean vehicle is
the sum of the credit amounts determined under paragraphs (2) and (3).

(2) CRITICAL MINERALS. -- In the case of a vehicle that meets the
requirements of subsection (e)(1)(A), $3,750.

(3) BATTERY COMPONENTS. -- In the case of a vehicle that meets the
requirements of subsection (e)(2)(A), $3,750.
"""

# Parameters for the credit
parameters:
  credit:
    critical_minerals_amount:
      values:
        2023: 3_750
        2024: 3_750
      description: "Credit amount for meeting critical minerals requirements"
      reference: "26 USC 30D(b)(2)"
      unit: USD

    battery_components_amount:
      values:
        2023: 3_750
        2024: 3_750
      description: "Credit amount for meeting battery components requirements"
      reference: "26 USC 30D(b)(3)"
      unit: USD

    maximum_credit:
      values:
        2023: 7_500
        2024: 7_500
      description: "Maximum total credit ($3,750 + $3,750)"
      reference: "26 USC 30D(b)"
      unit: USD

  eligibility:
    min_battery_capacity_kwh:
      values:
        2023: 7
        2024: 7
      description: "Minimum battery capacity in kWh"
      reference: "26 USC 30D(d)(1)(F)"
      unit: kWh

    msrp_limit_van_suv_pickup:
      values:
        2023: 80_000
        2024: 80_000
      description: "MSRP limit for vans, SUVs, and pickup trucks"
      reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(11)(B)(i)"
      unit: USD

    msrp_limit_other:
      values:
        2023: 55_000
        2024: 55_000
      description: "MSRP limit for all other vehicles"
      reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(11)(B)(ii)"
      unit: USD

    income_limit:
      JOINT:
        values:
          2023: 300_000
          2024: 300_000
        description: "AGI limit for joint filers"
        reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(10)(B)(i)"
      SURVIVING_SPOUSE:
        values:
          2023: 300_000
          2024: 300_000
        description: "AGI limit for surviving spouse"
        reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(10)(B)(i)"
      HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD:
        values:
          2023: 225_000
          2024: 225_000
        description: "AGI limit for head of household"
        reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(10)(B)(ii)"
      SINGLE:
        values:
          2023: 150_000
          2024: 150_000
        description: "AGI limit for single filers"
        reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(10)(B)(iii)"
      SEPARATE:
        values:
          2023: 150_000
          2024: 150_000
        description: "AGI limit for married filing separately"
        reference: "26 USC 30D(f)(10)(B)(iii)"

# Input variables for vehicle characteristics
input purchased_new_clean_vehicle:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Purchased New Clean Vehicle"
  description: "Whether taxpayer purchased a qualifying new clean vehicle during the tax year"
  default: false

input new_clean_vehicle_msrp:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "New Clean Vehicle MSRP"
  description: "Manufacturer's suggested retail price of the new clean vehicle"
  default: 0

input new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Decimal
  unit: kWh
  label: "New Clean Vehicle Battery Capacity"
  description: "Battery capacity in kilowatt-hours of new clean vehicle"
  default: 0

input new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "New Clean Vehicle Is Van/SUV/Pickup"
  description: "Whether the new clean vehicle is classified as a van, SUV, or pickup truck"
  default: false

input new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Final Assembly in North America"
  description: "Whether vehicle final assembly occurred in North America"
  default: false

input new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Meets Critical Minerals Requirement"
  description: "Whether the vehicle meets the critical minerals sourcing requirements of 30D(e)(1)(A)"
  default: false

input new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Meets Battery Components Requirement"
  description: "Whether the vehicle meets the battery components requirements of 30D(e)(2)(A)"
  default: false

# Eligibility check for battery capacity - 30D(d)(1)(F)
variable new_vehicle_meets_battery_capacity:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Meets Minimum Battery Capacity"
  description: "Whether vehicle meets the minimum 7 kWh battery capacity requirement"
  formula: |
    return new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh >= p.eligibility.min_battery_capacity_kwh

# MSRP limit based on vehicle type - 30D(f)(11)
variable new_vehicle_msrp_limit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Applicable MSRP Limit"
  description: "MSRP limit based on vehicle classification"
  formula: |
    if new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup:
      return p.eligibility.msrp_limit_van_suv_pickup
    return p.eligibility.msrp_limit_other

# MSRP eligibility check - 30D(f)(11)
variable new_vehicle_meets_msrp_limit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Meets MSRP Limit"
  description: "Whether vehicle MSRP is within the applicable limit"
  formula: |
    return new_clean_vehicle_msrp <= new_vehicle_msrp_limit

# AGI limit based on filing status - 30D(f)(10)
variable new_vehicle_agi_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Applicable AGI Limit"
  description: "Modified AGI limit based on filing status"
  formula: |
    return p.eligibility.income_limit[filing_status]

# AGI eligibility check - 30D(f)(10)
variable new_vehicle_meets_income_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Meets Income Limit"
  description: "Whether taxpayer's AGI is within the applicable limit"
  formula: |
    # Note: Law allows lesser of current year or prior year MAGI
    # For simplicity, using current year AGI
    return adjusted_gross_income <= new_vehicle_agi_limit

# Overall eligibility - combines all requirements
variable new_vehicle_credit_eligible:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Eligible for New Clean Vehicle Credit"
  description: "Whether taxpayer meets all eligibility requirements for the credit"
  formula: |
    if not purchased_new_clean_vehicle:
      return false
    if not new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america:
      return false
    if not new_vehicle_meets_battery_capacity:
      return false
    if not new_vehicle_meets_msrp_limit:
      return false
    if not new_vehicle_meets_income_limit:
      return false
    return true

# Critical minerals component - 30D(b)(2)
variable new_vehicle_critical_minerals_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Critical Minerals Credit Component"
  description: "Credit amount for meeting critical minerals requirements"
  formula: |
    if not new_vehicle_credit_eligible:
      return 0
    if new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement:
      return p.credit.critical_minerals_amount
    return 0

# Battery components credit - 30D(b)(3)
variable new_vehicle_battery_components_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Battery Components Credit Component"
  description: "Credit amount for meeting battery components requirements"
  formula: |
    if not new_vehicle_credit_eligible:
      return 0
    if new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement:
      return p.credit.battery_components_amount
    return 0

# Main credit calculation - 30D(a), (b)
variable new_vehicle_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "New Clean Vehicle Credit"
  description: "Credit for new clean vehicles per 26 USC 30D"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum of critical minerals and battery components credits
    # Maximum $7,500 ($3,750 + $3,750)
    return new_vehicle_critical_minerals_credit + new_vehicle_battery_components_credit
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No purchase - zero credit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: false
      expect: 0

    - name: "Full credit - meets both requirements"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 7500

    - name: "Partial credit - critical minerals only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 3750

    - name: "Partial credit - battery components only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: false
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 3750

    - name: "Zero credit - neither requirement met"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: false
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible - AGI over limit for single filer"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 160000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

    - name: "Eligible - joint filer at higher income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 250000
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 7500

    - name: "Ineligible - joint filer over income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 350000
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible - MSRP over limit for sedan"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 60000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

    - name: "Eligible - SUV with higher MSRP limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 70000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 100
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: true
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 7500

    - name: "Ineligible - SUV over MSRP limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 85000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 100
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: true
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible - battery capacity below minimum"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 5
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible - not assembled in North America"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 75
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: false
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

    - name: "Eligible - head of household under income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 50000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 80
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 200000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: 7500

    - name: "Ineligible - head of household over income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 50000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 80
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 250000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: 0

    - name: "Battery capacity exactly at minimum threshold - eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        purchased_new_clean_vehicle: true
        new_clean_vehicle_msrp: 45000
        new_clean_vehicle_battery_capacity_kwh: 7
        new_clean_vehicle_is_van_suv_pickup: false
        new_clean_vehicle_final_assembly_north_america: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_critical_minerals_requirement: true
        new_clean_vehicle_meets_battery_components_requirement: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 7500

documents.title: Federal Income Tax Withheld
documents.text:
Section 31 allows as a credit against tax the amount of tax withheld
at source under chapter 24 (income tax withholding on wages). This is
a refundable credit - any excess over tax liability is refunded.

(a) Wage withholding - The amount withheld as tax under chapter 24
shall be allowed to the recipient of the income as a credit against
the tax imposed by this subtitle.
documents.code:
#
# Reference: https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/31

text: """
Section 31 allows as a credit against tax the amount of tax withheld
at source under chapter 24 (income tax withholding on wages). This is
a refundable credit - any excess over tax liability is refunded.

(a) Wage withholding - The amount withheld as tax under chapter 24
shall be allowed to the recipient of the income as a credit against
the tax imposed by this subtitle.
"""

input wage_withholding_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Federal Income Tax Withheld"
  description: "Amount of federal income tax withheld from wages per 26 USC 31(a)"
  default: 0

documents.title: Wages
documents.code:
# https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=granuleid:USC-prelim-title26-section3101

text: |
  26 USC 3101 - Rate of tax

  (a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance
    In addition to other taxes, there is hereby imposed on the income of every
    individual a tax equal to 6.2 percent of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a))
    received by the individual with respect to employment (as defined in section
    3121(b)).

  (b) Hospital insurance
    (1) In general
    In addition to the tax imposed by the preceding subsection, there is hereby
    imposed on the income of every individual a tax equal to 1.45 percent of the
    wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) received by him with respect to
    employment (as defined in section 3121(b)).

    (2) Additional tax
    In addition to the tax imposed by paragraph (1) and the preceding subsection,
    there is hereby imposed on every taxpayer (other than a corporation, estate,
    or trust) a tax equal to 0.9 percent of wages which are received with respect
    to employment (as defined in section 3121(b)) during any taxable year beginning
    after December 31, 2012, and which are in excess of—
      (A) in the case of a joint return, $250,000,
      (B) in the case of a married taxpayer (as defined in section 7703) filing
          a separate return, 1/2 of the dollar amount determined under subparagraph (A), and
      (C) in any other case, $200,000.

  Note: The contribution and benefit base (Social Security wage base) is determined
  under 42 USC 430 and adjusted annually for inflation.

# =============================================================================
# OASDI (Social Security) Tax Parameters
# =============================================================================

# 26 USC 3101(a) - OASDI tax rate
parameter oasdi_employee_rate:
  description: "Employee OASDI (Social Security) tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1990-01-01: 0.062

# 42 USC 430 - Social Security wage base (contribution and benefit base)
parameter social_security_wage_base:
  description: "Maximum wages subject to OASDI tax (contribution and benefit base)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2025-01-01: 176_100
    2024-01-01: 168_600
    2023-01-01: 160_200
    2022-01-01: 147_000
    2021-01-01: 142_800
    2020-01-01: 137_700

# =============================================================================
# Hospital Insurance (Medicare) Tax Parameters
# =============================================================================

# 26 USC 3101(b)(1) - Medicare tax rate
parameter medicare_employee_rate:
  description: "Employee Hospital Insurance (Medicare) tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1986-01-01: 0.0145

# 26 USC 3101(b)(2) - Additional Medicare Tax rate
parameter additional_medicare_tax_rate:
  description: "Additional Medicare Tax rate on high earners"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2013-01-01: 0.009

# 26 USC 3101(b)(2)(A) - Additional Medicare Tax threshold (joint)
parameter additional_medicare_threshold_joint:
  description: "Wage threshold for Additional Medicare Tax on joint returns"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 250_000

# 26 USC 3101(b)(2)(B) - Additional Medicare Tax threshold (MFS)
parameter additional_medicare_threshold_separate:
  description: "Wage threshold for Additional Medicare Tax for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 125_000

# 26 USC 3101(b)(2)(C) - Additional Medicare Tax threshold (other)
parameter additional_medicare_threshold_other:
  description: "Wage threshold for Additional Medicare Tax for single filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2013-01-01: 200_000

# =============================================================================
# Inputs
# =============================================================================

input wages:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Wages"
  description: "Wages subject to FICA taxes per 26 USC 3121(a)"
  default: 0

input filing_status:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Enum
  label: "Filing Status"
  description: "Tax filing status (SINGLE, JOINT, SEPARATE, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD)"
  default: SINGLE

# =============================================================================
# Variables
# =============================================================================

variable oasdi_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "OASDI Tax (Employee Share)"
  description: "Employee Social Security tax per 26 USC 3101(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 26 USC 3101(a): 6.2% of wages up to the wage base
    taxable_wages = min(wages, social_security_wage_base)
    return taxable_wages * oasdi_employee_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Wages below wage base (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 100_000
      # $100,000 * 6.2% = $6,200
      expect: 6_200

    - name: "Wages at wage base (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 168_600
      # $168,600 * 6.2% = $10,453.20
      expect: 10_453.20

    - name: "Wages exceed wage base - capped (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 300_000
      # Capped at $168,600 * 6.2% = $10,453.20
      expect: 10_453.20

    - name: "Zero wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "2025 wage base"
      period: 2025
      inputs:
        wages: 200_000
      # Capped at $176,100 * 6.2% = $10,918.20
      expect: 10_918.20

variable medicare_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Medicare Tax (Employee Share)"
  description: "Employee Medicare tax per 26 USC 3101(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 26 USC 3101(b)(1): 1.45% of all wages (no cap)
    return wages * medicare_employee_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Standard Medicare tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 100_000
      # $100,000 * 1.45% = $1,450
      expect: 1_450

    - name: "High wages - no cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 500_000
      # $500,000 * 1.45% = $7,250 (no wage base cap)
      expect: 7_250

    - name: "Zero wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
      expect: 0

variable additional_medicare_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Medicare Tax"
  description: "0.9% additional tax on wages exceeding threshold per 26 USC 3101(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 26 USC 3101(b)(2): 0.9% on wages exceeding threshold
    # Threshold varies by filing status
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        threshold = additional_medicare_threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == SEPARATE:
        threshold = additional_medicare_threshold_separate
    else:
        threshold = additional_medicare_threshold_other
    excess_wages = max(0, wages - threshold)
    return excess_wages * additional_medicare_tax_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer below threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 150_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # $150k < $200k threshold, no additional tax
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single filer above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 250_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # ($250k - $200k) * 0.9% = $50k * 0.009 = $450
      expect: 450

    - name: "Joint filers above threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 350_000
        filing_status: JOINT
      # ($350k - $250k) * 0.9% = $100k * 0.009 = $900
      expect: 900

    - name: "MFS lower threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 200_000
        filing_status: SEPARATE
      # ($200k - $125k) * 0.9% = $75k * 0.009 = $675
      expect: 675

    - name: "Single exactly at threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 200_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

variable total_fica_employee_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total FICA Tax (Employee Share)"
  description: "Total employee FICA taxes: OASDI + Medicare + Additional Medicare"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return oasdi_tax + medicare_tax + additional_medicare_tax
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Typical worker below all thresholds (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 60_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # OASDI: $60k * 6.2% = $3,720
      # Medicare: $60k * 1.45% = $870
      # Additional Medicare: $0
      # Total: $4,590
      expect: 4_590

    - name: "High earner single (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 300_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # OASDI: $168,600 * 6.2% = $10,453.20
      # Medicare: $300k * 1.45% = $4,350
      # Additional Medicare: ($300k - $200k) * 0.9% = $900
      # Total: $15,703.20
      expect: 15_703.20

    - name: "Maximum Social Security earner (2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 168_600
        filing_status: SINGLE
      # OASDI: $168,600 * 6.2% = $10,453.20
      # Medicare: $168,600 * 1.45% = $2,444.70
      # Additional Medicare: $0 (below $200k)
      # Total: $12,897.90
      expect: 12_897.90

documents.title: Employee Social Security Tax
documents.text:
(a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance -
In addition to other taxes, there is hereby imposed on the income of every
individual a tax equal to 6.2 percent of the wages (as defined in section
3121(a)) received by him with respect to employment (as defined in section
3121(b)).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance -
In addition to other taxes, there is hereby imposed on the income of every
individual a tax equal to 6.2 percent of the wages (as defined in section
3121(a)) received by him with respect to employment (as defined in section
3121(b)).
"""

parameter employee_rate:
  description: "Employee Social Security tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1990-01-01: 0.062

parameter wage_base:
  description: "Social Security wage base (maximum taxable earnings)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 168_600
    2023-01-01: 160_200
    2022-01-01: 147_000

variable employee_social_security_tax:
  imports: [26/3121/a/irs_employment_income#irs_employment_income]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employee Social Security Tax"
  description: "Employee share of Social Security (OASDI) tax at 6.2% of wages up to wage base per 26 USC 3_101(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Social Security tax applies only up to the wage base cap
    taxable_wages = min(irs_employment_income, wage_base)
    return taxable_wages * employee_rate
  tests:
    # Normal cases - wages below wage base
    - name: "Median income earner - wages below wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 60_000
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 3_720
    - name: "Higher income earner - still below wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 100_000
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 6_200
    - name: "Low wage earner"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 25_000
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 1_550
    # Edge cases - at and around wage base
    - name: "Wages exactly at wage base - maximum taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 168_600
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 10_453.20
    - name: "Wages exceed wage base - capped at maximum"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 200_000
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 10_453.20
    - name: "High earner - well above wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 500_000
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 10_453.20
    # Edge cases - zero and minimal wages
    - name: "Zero wages - no tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 0
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 0
    - name: "Minimal wages - $1"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 1
        wage_base: 168_600
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 0.062
    # Different year with different wage base
    - name: "2023 wage base - wages at cap"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 160_200
        wage_base: 160_200
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 9_932.40
    - name: "2023 wage base - wages exceed cap"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 180_000
        wage_base: 160_200
        employee_rate: 0.062
      expect: 9_932.40



# ---- Merged from employee_fica_tax.rac ----

# 26 USC 3101 - Employee FICA Tax (Combined Social Security + Medicare)
#
variable employee_fica_tax:
  imports:
    - 26/3101/a#employee_social_security_tax
    - 26/3101/b#employee_medicare_tax
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employee FICA Tax"
  description: "Combined employee Social Security and Medicare taxes per 26 USC 3_101"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum of Social Security (6.2%) and Medicare (1.45%) employee taxes
    # Note: Additional Medicare Tax (0.9%) is computed separately in 3101(b)(2)
    return employee_social_security_tax + employee_medicare_tax
  tests:
    # Normal cases - wages below wage base (full 7.65% = 6.2% + 1.45%)
    - name: "Median income earner - full FICA rate applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 3_720
        employee_medicare_tax: 870
      expect: 4_590
    - name: "Low wage earner - both taxes apply"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 1_550
        employee_medicare_tax: 362.50
      expect: 1_912.50
    - name: "Higher income below wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 6_200
        employee_medicare_tax: 1_450
      expect: 7_650
    # Edge case - wages at wage base
    - name: "Wages at wage base - maximum SS plus full Medicare"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 10_453.20
        employee_medicare_tax: 2_444.70
      expect: 12_897.90
    # High earners - SS capped but Medicare continues
    - name: "High earner - SS capped, Medicare on all wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 10_453.20
        employee_medicare_tax: 2_900
      expect: 13_353.20
    - name: "Very high earner - SS capped, Medicare higher"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 10_453.20
        employee_medicare_tax: 7_250
      expect: 17_703.20
    # Edge cases - zero wages
    - name: "Zero wages - no FICA tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 0
        employee_medicare_tax: 0
      expect: 0
    # Minimal wages
    - name: "Minimal wages - small combined tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employee_social_security_tax: 0.062
        employee_medicare_tax: 0.145
      expect: 0.0765

documents.title: Employment Income
documents.text:
(b) Hospital insurance -
(1) In general - In addition to the tax imposed by subsection (a), there is
hereby imposed on the income of every individual a tax equal to 1.45 percent
of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) received by him with respect to
employment (as defined in section 3121(b)).
documents.code:
text: """
(b) Hospital insurance -
(1) In general - In addition to the tax imposed by subsection (a), there is
hereby imposed on the income of every individual a tax equal to 1.45 percent
of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) received by him with respect to
employment (as defined in section 3121(b)).
"""

input irs_employment_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employment Income"
  description: "Wages, salaries, and tips subject to employment taxes"
  default: 0

parameter employee_rate:
  description: "Employee Medicare tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1986-01-01: 0.0145

variable medicare_tax:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Medicare Tax Withheld"
  description: "Total Medicare tax withheld from wages (employee share) per 26 USC 3_101(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Medicare tax applies to ALL wages - no cap unlike Social Security
    return irs_employment_income * employee_rate
  tests:
    - name: "Zero income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Median wage earner"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 60_000
      expect: 870  # 60_000 * 0.0145 = 870

    - name: "Six figure income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 150_000
      expect: 2_175  # 150_000 * 0.0145 = 2_175

    - name: "High earner below additional Medicare threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 200_000
      expect: 2_900  # 200_000 * 0.0145 = 2_900

    - name: "Very high earner - no cap applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 500_000
      expect: 7_250  # 500_000 * 0.0145 = 7_250

    - name: "Millionaire - demonstrates no wage cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 1_000_000
      expect: 14_500  # 1_000_000 * 0.0145 = 14_500

documents.title: Employment Income
documents.text:
(2) Additional tax -
In addition to the tax imposed by paragraph (1), there is hereby imposed
on the income of every individual a tax equal to 0.9 percent of so much
of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) received by him with respect
to employment (as defined in section 3121(b)) during any calendar year as
exceeds -
(A) in the case of a joint return, $250,000,
(B) in the case of a married individual (as defined in section 7703)
filing a separate return, $125,000, and
(C) in any other case, $200,000.
documents.code:
text: """
(2) Additional tax -
In addition to the tax imposed by paragraph (1), there is hereby imposed
on the income of every individual a tax equal to 0.9 percent of so much
of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) received by him with respect
to employment (as defined in section 3121(b)) during any calendar year as
exceeds -
(A) in the case of a joint return, $250,000,
(B) in the case of a married individual (as defined in section 7703)
filing a separate return, $125,000, and
(C) in any other case, $200,000.
"""

input irs_employment_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employment Income"
  description: "Wages, salaries, and tips subject to employment taxes"
  default: 0

input taxable_self_employment_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Taxable Self-Employment Income"
  description: "Self-employment income subject to Additional Medicare Tax"
  default: 0

variable additional_medicare_tax:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Medicare Tax"
  description: "0.9% additional Medicare tax on wages above threshold per 26 USC 3_101(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Both wages and self-employment income are subject to the tax
    total_wages = sum(members, irs_employment_income)
    total_se = sum(members, taxable_self_employment_income)
    return total_wages + total_se
  tests:
    - name: "Zero wages and zero self-employment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 0
            taxable_self_employment_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Only wages, no self-employment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 150_000
            taxable_self_employment_income: 0
      expect: 150_000
    - name: "Only self-employment income, no wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 0
            taxable_self_employment_income: 85_000
      expect: 85_000
    - name: "Combined wages and self-employment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 200_000
            taxable_self_employment_income: 50_000
      expect: 250_000
    - name: "High earner with both income types"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 350_000
            taxable_self_employment_income: 75_000
      expect: 425_000
    - name: "Two-person tax unit with combined income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        members:
          - irs_employment_income: 120_000
            taxable_self_employment_income: 30_000
          - irs_employment_income: 80_000
            taxable_self_employment_income: 20_000
      expect: 250_000

documents.title: Employer Social Security Tax
documents.text:
(a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance -
In addition to other taxes, there is hereby imposed on every employer an excise
tax, with respect to having individuals in his employ, equal to 6.2 percent of
the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) paid by him with respect to employment
(as defined in section 3121(b)).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Old-age, survivors, and disability insurance -
In addition to other taxes, there is hereby imposed on every employer an excise
tax, with respect to having individuals in his employ, equal to 6.2 percent of
the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) paid by him with respect to employment
(as defined in section 3121(b)).
"""

parameter employer_rate:
  description: "Employer Social Security tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1990-01-01: 0.062

parameter wage_base:
  description: "Social Security wage base (maximum taxable earnings)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 168_600
    2023-01-01: 160_200
    2022-01-01: 147_000

variable employer_social_security_tax:
  imports: [26/3121/a/irs_employment_income#irs_employment_income]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employer Social Security Tax"
  description: "Employer share of Social Security (OASDI) tax at 6.2% of wages up to wage base per 26 USC 3_111(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Social Security tax applies only up to the wage base cap
    # Employer rate matches employee rate
    taxable_wages = min(irs_employment_income, wage_base)
    return taxable_wages * employer_rate
  tests:
    - name: "Zero wages - no tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Low wages - full 6.2% applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 50_000
      expect: 3_100  # 50,000 * 0.062 = 3,100
    - name: "Moderate wages below wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 100_000
      expect: 6_200  # 100,000 * 0.062 = 6,200
    - name: "Wages exactly at wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 168_600
      expect: 10_453.20  # 168,600 * 0.062 = 10,453.20
    - name: "Wages above wage base - capped at wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 200_000
      expect: 10_453.20  # min(200,000, 168,600) * 0.062 = 10,453.20
    - name: "High earner - tax capped at wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 500_000
      expect: 10_453.20  # min(500,000, 168,600) * 0.062 = 10,453.20
    - name: "Wages slightly above wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 170_000
      expect: 10_453.20  # min(170,000, 168,600) * 0.062 = 10,453.20
    - name: "Wages slightly below wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 165_000
      expect: 10_230  # 165,000 * 0.062 = 10,230
    - name: "Minimum wage worker annual income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 15_080  # ~$7.25/hr * 2080 hrs
      expect: 934.96  # 15,080 * 0.062 = 934.96
    - name: "2023 wage base - lower cap applies"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 200_000
      expect: 9_932.40  # min(200,000, 160,200) * 0.062 = 9,932.40



# ---- Merged from employer_fica_tax.rac ----

# 26 USC 3111 - Employer FICA Tax (Combined)
#
variable employer_fica_tax:
  imports:
    - 26/3111/a#employer_social_security_tax
    - 26/3111/b#employer_medicare_tax
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Employer FICA Tax"
  description: "Combined employer Social Security and Medicare tax per 26 USC 3_111"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Total employer FICA = Social Security (capped) + Medicare (uncapped)
    return employer_social_security_tax + employer_medicare_tax
  tests:
    - name: "Zero wages - no FICA tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 0
        employer_medicare_tax: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Low wages - combined 7.65% rate"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 3_100  # 50,000 * 0.062
        employer_medicare_tax: 725  # 50,000 * 0.145
      expect: 3_825  # 50,000 * 0.0765
    - name: "Moderate wages below wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 6_200  # 100,000 * 0.062
        employer_medicare_tax: 1_450  # 100,000 * 0.145
      expect: 7_650  # 100,000 * 0.0765
    - name: "Wages at wage base"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 10_453.20  # 168,600 * 0.062
        employer_medicare_tax: 2_444.70  # 168,600 * 0.145
      expect: 12_897.90  # SS capped + uncapped Medicare
    - name: "Wages above wage base - SS capped, Medicare uncapped"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 10_453.20  # Capped at 168,600 * 0.062
        employer_medicare_tax: 2_900  # 200,000 * 0.145
      expect: 13_353.20  # SS capped at 10,453.20 + uncapped Medicare
    - name: "High earner - SS capped, Medicare continues"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 10_453.20  # Capped at wage base
        employer_medicare_tax: 7_250  # 500,000 * 0.145
      expect: 17_703.20  # SS maxed out, Medicare grows with wages
    - name: "Minimum wage worker annual FICA"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employer_social_security_tax: 934.96  # 15,080 * 0.062
        employer_medicare_tax: 218.66  # 15,080 * 0.145
      expect: 1_153.62  # 15,080 * 0.0765

documents.title: Total Medicare Tax
documents.text:
(b) Hospital insurance -
In addition to the tax imposed by subsection (a), there is hereby imposed
on every employer an excise tax, with respect to having individuals in his
employ, equal to 1.45 percent of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a))
paid by him with respect to employment (as defined in section 3121(b)).
documents.code:
text: """
(b) Hospital insurance -
In addition to the tax imposed by subsection (a), there is hereby imposed
on every employer an excise tax, with respect to having individuals in his
employ, equal to 1.45 percent of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a))
paid by him with respect to employment (as defined in section 3121(b)).
"""

parameter employer_medicare_rate:
  description: "Employer Medicare tax rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1986-01-01: 0.0145

variable employer_medicare_tax:
  imports: [26/3121/a/irs_employment_income#irs_employment_income]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Medicare Tax"
  description: "Combined employer and employee Medicare tax (2.9% of wages)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Medicare tax applies to ALL wages - no cap unlike Social Security
    # Employer rate matches employee rate
    return irs_employment_income * employer_medicare_rate
  tests:
    - name: "Zero wages - no tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Low wages - full 1.45% applies"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 50_000
      expect: 725  # 50,000 * 0.0145 = 725
    - name: "Moderate wages - Medicare has no cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 100_000
      expect: 1_450  # 100,000 * 0.0145 = 1,450
    - name: "High earner above SS wage base - Medicare still uncapped"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 200_000
      expect: 2_900  # 200,000 * 0.0145 = 2,900 (no cap unlike Social Security)
    - name: "Very high earner - Medicare continues on all wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 500_000
      expect: 7_250  # 500,000 * 0.0145 = 7,250
    - name: "Minimum wage worker annual income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        irs_employment_income: 15_080  # ~$7.25/hr * 2080 hrs
      expect: 218.66  # 15,080 * 0.0145 = 218.66

documents.title: Earned Income Tax Credit
documents.code:
# https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=granuleid:USC-prelim-title26-section32

text: |
  26 USC 32 - Earned income

  (a) Allowance of credit
    (1) In general
    In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against
    the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the
    credit percentage of so much of the taxpayer's earned income for the taxable
    year as does not exceed the earned income amount.

    (2) Limitation
    The amount of the credit allowable to a taxpayer under paragraph (1) for any
    taxable year shall not exceed the excess (if any) of—
      (A) the credit percentage of the earned income amount, over
      (B) the phaseout percentage of so much of the adjusted gross income (or, if
          greater, the earned income) of the taxpayer for the taxable year as
          exceeds the phaseout amount.

  (b) Percentages and amounts
    (1) Percentages
    The credit percentage and the phaseout percentage shall be determined as follows:
      In the case of an eligible individual with:    Credit %    Phaseout %
      1 qualifying child                               34          15.98
      2 qualifying children                            40          21.06
      3 or more qualifying children                    45          21.06
      No qualifying children                           7.65         7.65

    (2) Amounts
      (A) In general
      Subject to subparagraph (B), the earned income amount and the phaseout
      amount shall be determined as follows:
        In the case of an eligible individual with:  Earned income  Phaseout
        1 qualifying child                             $6,330       $11,610
        2 or more qualifying children                  $8,890       $11,610
        No qualifying children                         $4,220        $5,280
      [Note: Amounts shown are base amounts; actual amounts adjusted for inflation per (j)]

      (B) Joint returns
      In the case of a joint return filed by an eligible individual and such
      individual's spouse, the phaseout amount determined under subparagraph (A)
      shall be increased by $5,000. [Note: Amount adjusted for inflation per (j)]

  (c) Definitions and special rules
    For purposes of this section—

    (1) Eligible individual
      (A) In general
      The term "eligible individual" means—
        (i) any individual who has a qualifying child for the taxable year, or
        (ii) any other individual who does not have a qualifying child for the
             taxable year, if—
             (I) such individual's principal place of abode is in the United States
                 for more than one-half of such taxable year,
             (II) such individual (or, if the individual is married, either the
                  individual or the individual's spouse) has attained age 25 but
                  not attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, and
             (III) such individual is not a dependent for whom a deduction is
                   allowable under section 151 to another taxpayer for any taxable
                   year beginning in the same calendar year as such taxable year.

    (2) Earned income
      (A) The term "earned income" means—
        (i) wages, salaries, tips, and other employee compensation, but only if
            such amounts are includible in gross income for the taxable year, plus
        (ii) the amount of the taxpayer's net earnings from self-employment for
             the taxable year (within the meaning of section 1402(a)), but such
             net earnings shall be determined with regard to the deduction allowed
             to the taxpayer by section 164(f).

    (3) Qualifying child
      (A) In general
      The term "qualifying child" means a qualifying child of the taxpayer (as
      defined in section 152(c), determined without regard to paragraph (1)(D)
      thereof and section 152(e)).

  (d) Married individuals
    In the case of an individual who is married (within the meaning of section 7703),
    this section shall apply only if a joint return is filed for the taxable year
    under section 6013.

  (i) Denial of credit for individuals having excessive investment income
    (1) In general
    No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) for the taxable year if the
    aggregate amount of disqualified income of the taxpayer for the taxable year
    exceeds $10,000. [Note: Amount adjusted for inflation per (j)]

    (2) Disqualified income
    For purposes of paragraph (1), the term "disqualified income" means—
      (A) interest or dividends to the extent includible in gross income,
      (B) interest received or accrued during the taxable year which is exempt
          from tax imposed by this chapter,
      (C) the excess (if any) of—
          (i) gross income from rents or royalties not derived in the ordinary
              course of a trade or business, over
          (ii) the sum of the deductions allowable with respect to such income,
      (D) the capital gain net income (as defined in section 1222) of the taxpayer
          for such taxable year, and
      (E) the excess (if any) of—
          (i) the aggregate income from all passive activities for the taxable
              year (determined without regard to any amount included in earned
              income under subsection (c)(2) or described in a preceding
              subparagraph), over
          (ii) the aggregate losses from all passive activities for the taxable
               year (as so determined).

  (j) Inflation adjustments
    (1) In general
    In the case of any taxable year beginning after 2015, each of the dollar amounts
    in subsections (b)(2) and (i)(1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—
      (A) such dollar amount, multiplied by
      (B) the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the
          calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting
          "calendar year 2015" for "calendar year 2016" in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

# Parameters for EITC credit rates and caps
parameter credit_rate_0:
  description: "EITC credit rate for taxpayers with no qualifying children"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.0765

parameter credit_rate_1:
  description: "EITC credit rate for taxpayers with one qualifying child"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.34

parameter credit_rate_2:
  description: "EITC credit rate for taxpayers with two qualifying children"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.40

parameter credit_rate_3:
  description: "EITC credit rate for taxpayers with three or more qualifying children"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.45

parameter earned_income_cap_0:
  description: "EITC earned income cap for taxpayers with no qualifying children"

    2018: 6_330

parameter earned_income_cap_2:

  indexed_by: statute/26/32/j

    2018: 8_890
    2019: 9_030

parameter phaseout_rate_0:
  description: "EITC phaseout rate for taxpayers with no qualifying children"
  unit: /1

    2024-01-01: 0.0765

parameter phaseout_rate_1:
  description: "EITC phaseout rate for taxpayers with one qualifying child"

    2024-01-01: 0.1598

parameter phaseout_rate_2:

    2024-01-01: 0.2106

parameter phaseout_start_0:
  description: "EITC phaseout start for taxpayers with no qualifying children"

    2018: 5_280

  indexed_by: statute/26/32/j

    2018: 5_000
    2019: 5_080
    2020: 5_160
    2021: 5_240
    2022: 5_450
    2023: 6_570
