variable eitc_standalone:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/2/b#filing_status
    - 26/32/c/1/A/i#is_eligible_individual
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income Tax Credit"
  description: "Refundable credit for low-to-moderate income working individuals per 26 USC 32(a)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cap children at 3 for credit calculation
    n_children = min(num_qualifying_children, 3)
    # Get credit rate based on number of children - 32(a)(2)(A)
    if n_children == 0:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_0
    elif n_children == 1:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_1
    elif n_children == 2:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_2
    else:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_3
    # Get earned income cap based on number of children
    if n_children == 0:
        earned_income_cap = earned_income_cap_0
    elif n_children == 1:
        earned_income_cap = earned_income_cap_1
    else:
        earned_income_cap = earned_income_cap_2
    # Phase-in: credit_rate * min(earned_income, cap)
    phase_in_amount = credit_rate * min(earned_income, earned_income_cap)
    # Use greater of AGI or earned income for phaseout - 32(a)(2)(B)
    income = max(adjusted_gross_income, earned_income)
    # Get phaseout rate based on number of children
    if n_children == 0:
        phaseout_rate = phaseout_rate_0
    elif n_children == 1:
        phaseout_rate = phaseout_rate_1
    else:
        phaseout_rate = phaseout_rate_2
    # Get phaseout threshold (single/HoH base)
    if n_children == 0:
        phaseout_threshold = phaseout_start_0
    else:
        phaseout_threshold = phaseout_start_1
    # Joint filers get higher threshold per 32(b)(2)(B)
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        adjusted_threshold = phaseout_threshold + joint_adjustment
    else:
        adjusted_threshold = phaseout_threshold
    # Reduction = rate * (income - threshold), but not below zero
    phase_out_amount = max(0, phaseout_rate * (income - adjusted_threshold))
    # Final credit = phase-in minus phase-out, but not below zero
    # Eligibility check: ineligible individuals get 0
    if is_eligible_individual:
        return max(0, phase_in_amount - phase_out_amount)
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # PHASE-IN REGION TESTS (Income below cap, increasing credit)
    # Tests use parameters from definitions above (credit_rate_0 = 0.0765, etc.)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, no children, low income phase-in: $5_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 5_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 382.5  # 0.0765 * 5000 = 382.50

    - name: "Single, 1 child, low income phase-in: $5_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 5_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 1700  # 0.34 * 5000 = 1700

    - name: "Single, 2 children, low income phase-in: $8_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 8_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 8_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 3200  # 0.40 * 8000 = 3200

    - name: "Single, 3+ children, low income phase-in: $8_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 3
        earned_income: 8_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 8_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 3600  # 0.45 * 8000 = 3600

    # ============================================================================
    # PLATEAU REGION TESTS (Income at or above cap, maximum credit)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, no children, at cap: $8_260"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 8_260
        adjusted_gross_income: 8_260
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 631.89  # 0.0765 * 8260 = 631.89

    - name: "Single, 1 child, at cap: $12_390"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 12_390
        adjusted_gross_income: 12_390
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # 0.34 * 12390 = 4212.6

    - name: "Single, 2 children, at cap: $17_400"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 17_400
        adjusted_gross_income: 17_400
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 6960  # 0.40 * 17400 = 6960

    - name: "Single, 3+ children, at cap: $17_400"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 3
        earned_income: 17_400
        adjusted_gross_income: 17_400
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 7830  # 0.45 * 17400 = 7830

    - name: "Single, 1 child, above cap: $20_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 20_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 20_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # Still at cap, max = 0.34 * 12390

    # ============================================================================
    # PHASE-OUT REGION TESTS (Income above threshold, credit reducing)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, no children, phaseout begins: $10_330"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 10_330
        adjusted_gross_income: 10_330
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 631.89  # Max 631.89, phaseout starts but income = threshold, so 0 reduction

    - name: "Single, no children, partial phaseout: $15_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 15_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 274.635  # Phase-in: 0.0765 * 8260 = 631.89; Reduction: 0.0765 * (15000 - 10330) = 357.255; Credit: 631.89 - 357.255 = 274.635

    - name: "Single, 1 child, phaseout begins: $22_720"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 22_720
        adjusted_gross_income: 22_720
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # Max 4212.6, income = threshold, no reduction yet

    - name: "Single, 1 child, partial phaseout: $35_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 35_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 35_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 2251.464  # Phase-in: 4212.6; Reduction: 0.1598 * (35000 - 22720) = 1961.136; Credit: 4212.6 - 1961.136 = 2251.464

    - name: "Single, 2 children, partial phaseout: $40_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 40_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 40_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 3320.832  # Phase-in: 6960; Reduction: 0.2106 * (40000 - 22720) = 3639.168; Credit: max(0, 6960 - 3639.168) = 3320.832

    # ============================================================================
    # JOINT FILER TESTS (higher phaseout thresholds)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Joint, 1 child, phaseout with adjustment: $35_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 35_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 35_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 3356.072  # Phase-in: 4212.6; Threshold: 22720 + 6920 = 29640; Reduction: 0.1598 * (35000 - 29640) = 856.528; Credit: 4212.6 - 856.528 = 3356.072

    - name: "Joint, 2 children, at higher phaseout threshold: $29_640"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 29_640
        adjusted_gross_income: 29_640
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 6960  # At threshold, no phaseout yet

    - name: "Joint, 2 children, partial phaseout: $45_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 45_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 45_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 3725.184  # Phase-in: 6960; Reduction: 0.2106 * (45000 - 29640) = 3234.816; Credit: 6960 - 3234.816 = 3725.184

    # ============================================================================
    # HEAD OF HOUSEHOLD TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Head of household, 1 child, phaseout: $35_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 35_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 35_000
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 2251.464  # Same as SINGLE (no adjustment for HOH), Reduction: 0.1598 * (35000 - 22720) = 1961.136; Credit: 4212.6 - 1961.136 = 2251.464

    # ============================================================================
    # ZERO AND ABOVE PHASE-OUT TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, no children, zero earned income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 0
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single, 1 child, completely phased out: $50_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 50_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 0  # max(0, 4212.6 - 0.1598*(50000-22720)) = 4212.6 - 4360.944 = 0

    - name: "Single, no children, completely phased out: $20_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 20_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 20_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 0  # Max 631.89; Reduction: 0.0765 * (20000 - 10330) = 739.755; Credit: max(0, 631.89 - 739.755) = 0

    # ============================================================================
    # INVESTMENT INCOME LIMIT TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, 1 child, just below investment income limit: $11_599"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 12_390
        adjusted_gross_income: 12_390
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # At cap

    - name: "Single, 1 child, just at investment income limit: $11_600"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 12_390
        adjusted_gross_income: 12_390
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # At cap

    # ============================================================================
    # INELIGIBILITY TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Ineligible individual gets 0"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 30_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: false
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible individual with 3+ children gets 0"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 4
        earned_income: 15_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: false
      expect: 0

    # ============================================================================
    # MORE THAN 3 CHILDREN TESTS (should cap at 3)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, 4 children, capped at 3-child rate: $10_000"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 4
        earned_income: 10_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 10_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4500  # 0.45 * 10000 = 4500 (uses 3+ child rate)

    - name: "Single, 5 children, capped at 3-child rate: $17_400"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 5
        earned_income: 17_400
        adjusted_gross_income: 17_400
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 7830  # 0.45 * 17400 = 7830 (uses 3+ child rate, at cap)

    # ============================================================================
    # EDGE CASES AND BOUNDARY TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, 1 child, just before phaseout: $22_719"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 22_719
        adjusted_gross_income: 22_719
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # Still at max

    - name: "Single, 1 child, just after phaseout begins: $22_721"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 22_721
        adjusted_gross_income: 22_721
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.4402  # 4212.6 - 0.1598 * 1 = 4212.4402

    - name: "Joint, 2 children, above AGI threshold: $62_688"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 62_688
        adjusted_gross_income: 62_688
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 0  # Completely phased out

    # ============================================================================
    # ORIGINAL TESTS (preserved for backward compatibility)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single, no children, $8_000 earned income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 8_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 8_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 612  # 0.0765 * 8000 = 612

    - name: "Single, 1 child, $15_000 earned income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 15_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6  # 0.34 * 12390 = 4212.6 (at cap, no phaseout yet)

    - name: "Joint, 2 children, $30_000 earned income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 30_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 6884.184  # Phase-in: 0.40 * 17400 = 6960; Phaseout threshold: 22720 + 6920 = 29640; Reduction: 0.2106 * (30000-29640) = 75.816; Credit: 6960 - 75.816 = 6884.184

    - name: "Zero earned income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 0
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 0

# 26 USC 32 - Earned Income Credit (Validation Version)
#
variable eitc_validation:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/2/b#filing_status
    - 26/32/c/1/A/i#is_eligible_individual
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income Tax Credit"
  description: "Refundable credit for low-to-moderate income working individuals per 26 USC 32(a)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cap children at 3 for credit calculation
    n_children = min(num_qualifying_children, 3)
    # Get credit rate based on number of children - 32(a)(2)(A)
    if n_children == 0:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_0
    elif n_children == 1:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_1
    elif n_children == 2:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_2
    else:
        credit_rate = credit_rate_3
    # Get earned income cap based on number of children
    if n_children == 0:
        earned_income_cap = earned_income_cap_0
    elif n_children == 1:
        earned_income_cap = earned_income_cap_1
    else:
        earned_income_cap = earned_income_cap_2
    # Phase-in: credit_rate * min(earned_income, cap)
    phase_in_amount = credit_rate * min(earned_income, earned_income_cap)
    # Use greater of AGI or earned income for phaseout - 32(a)(2)(B)
    income = max(adjusted_gross_income, earned_income)
    # Get phaseout rate based on number of children
    if n_children == 0:
        phaseout_rate = phaseout_rate_0
    elif n_children == 1:
        phaseout_rate = phaseout_rate_1
    else:
        phaseout_rate = phaseout_rate_2
    # Get phaseout threshold (single/HoH base)
    if n_children == 0:
        phaseout_threshold = phaseout_start_0
    else:
        phaseout_threshold = phaseout_start_1
    # Joint filers get higher threshold per 32(b)(2)(B)
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        adjusted_threshold = phaseout_threshold + joint_adjustment
    else:
        adjusted_threshold = phaseout_threshold
    # Reduction = rate * (income - threshold), but not below zero
    phase_out_amount = max(0, phaseout_rate * (income - adjusted_threshold))
    # Final credit = phase-in minus phase-out, but not below zero
    # Eligibility check: ineligible individuals get 0
    if is_eligible_individual:
        return max(0, phase_in_amount - phase_out_amount)
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single, 1 child, $15_000 earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 15_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 4212.6

    - name: "Joint, 2 children, $30_000 earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 30_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 6884.184

    - name: "Zero earned income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 0
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: true
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible individual"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 15_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 15_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_eligible_individual: false
      expect: 0

documents.title: Earned Income Tax Credit
documents.text:
In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit
against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount
equal to the credit percentage of so much of the taxpayer's earned income
for the taxable year as does not exceed the earned income amount.
documents.code:
text: """
In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit
against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount
equal to the credit percentage of so much of the taxpayer's earned income
for the taxable year as does not exceed the earned income amount.
"""
variable earned_income_credit:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/32/c/1/A/i#is_eligible_individual
    - 26/32/a/2/A#initial_credit_amount
    - 26/32/a/2/B#credit_reduction_amount
    - 26/32/b/2/A#agi_limit
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income Tax Credit"
  description: "Refundable credit for low-to-moderate income working individuals and families per 26 USC 32(a)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # is_eligible_individual checks all requirements from 32(c), 32(d), and 32(i)
    if not is_eligible_individual:
        return 0
    # Credit = phase-in amount minus phase-out reduction, but not below zero
    return max(0, initial_credit_amount - credit_reduction_amount)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible individual with positive credit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_eligible_individual: true
        initial_credit_amount: 4_000
        credit_reduction_amount: 500
      expect: 3500
    - name: "Eligible individual, no reduction"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_eligible_individual: true
        initial_credit_amount: 4212.60
        credit_reduction_amount: 0
      expect: 4212.60
    - name: "Ineligible individual gets 0"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_eligible_individual: false
        initial_credit_amount: 6_960
        credit_reduction_amount: 1_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Reduction exceeds credit, result is 0"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_eligible_individual: true
        initial_credit_amount: 2000
        credit_reduction_amount: 3_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Zero credit, no reduction"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_eligible_individual: true
        initial_credit_amount: 0
        credit_reduction_amount: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: EITC Phase-In Amount
documents.text:
The amount determined under paragraph (1) for any taxable year is the
credit percentage of so much of the taxpayer's earned income for such
taxable year as does not exceed the earned income amount.
documents.code:
text: """
The amount determined under paragraph (1) for any taxable year is the
credit percentage of so much of the taxpayer's earned income for such
taxable year as does not exceed the earned income amount.
"""
variable initial_credit_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/32/b/1#credit_percentage
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "EITC Phase-In Amount"
  description: "Credit percentage of earned income up to the earned income amount per 26 USC §32(a)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Get parameters indexed by number of qualifying children
    rate = credit_percentage[num_qualifying_children]
    cap = earned_income_amount[num_qualifying_children]
    # Credit = rate × min(earned_income, cap)
    return rate * min(earned_income, cap)
  tests:
    - name: "No children, income below cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 5_000
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 382.50  # 0.0765 * 5000
    - name: "No children, income at cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 8_260
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 631.89  # 0.0765 * 8260
    - name: "No children, income above cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 15_000
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 631.89  # 0.0765 * 8260 (capped)
    - name: "One child, income below cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 10_000
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 3400  # 0.34 * 10000
    - name: "One child, maximum credit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 12_390
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 4212.60  # 0.34 * 12390
    - name: "Two children, income at cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 17_400
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 6960  # 0.40 * 17400
    - name: "Three+ children, income at cap"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 3
        earned_income: 17_400
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 7830  # 0.45 * 17400
    - name: "Zero earned income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 0
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        earned_income_amount: {0: 8_260, 1: 12_390, 2: 17_400, 3: 17_400}
      expect: 0

documents.title: EITC Phase-Out Reduction
documents.text:
The amount determined under subparagraph (A) shall be reduced (but not
below zero) by the phaseout percentage of so much of the greater of—
(i) the adjusted gross income, or
(ii) the earned income,
of the taxpayer for the taxable year as exceeds the phaseout amount.
documents.code:
text: """
The amount determined under subparagraph (A) shall be reduced (but not
below zero) by the phaseout percentage of so much of the greater of—
(i) the adjusted gross income, or
(ii) the earned income,
of the taxpayer for the taxable year as exceeds the phaseout amount.
"""
variable credit_reduction_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/32/b/1#phaseout_percentage
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "EITC Phase-Out Reduction"
  description: "Reduction of credit based on income exceeding phaseout threshold per 26 USC §32(a)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Use the greater of AGI or earned income
    income = max(adjusted_gross_income, earned_income)
    # Get parameters indexed by number of qualifying children
    rate = phaseout_percentage[num_qualifying_children]
    threshold = phaseout_amount[num_qualifying_children]
    # Joint filers get higher threshold per 32(b)(2)(B)
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        adjusted_threshold = threshold + joint_return_adjustment
    else:
        adjusted_threshold = threshold
    # Reduction = rate × (income - threshold), but not below zero
    return max(0, rate * (income - adjusted_threshold))
  tests:
    - name: "No children, income below threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 8_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 8_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 0  # Income below threshold
    - name: "No children, income at threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 10_330
        adjusted_gross_income: 10_330
        filing_status: SINGLE
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 0
    - name: "No children, income $1_000 above threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        earned_income: 11_330
        adjusted_gross_income: 11_330
        filing_status: SINGLE
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 76.50  # 0.0765 * 1000
    - name: "One child, single, income in phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 30_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 1163.34  # 0.1598 * (30000 - 22720)
    - name: "One child, joint filer gets higher threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 30_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        filing_status: JOINT
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 57.53  # 0.1598 * (30000 - 29640)
    - name: "Two children, high income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        earned_income: 50_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 5751.17  # 0.2106 * (50000 - 22720)
    - name: "AGI higher than earned income, uses AGI"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        earned_income: 25_000
        adjusted_gross_income: 35_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        phaseout_amount: {0: 10_330, 1: 22_720, 2: 22_720, 3: 22_720}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 1962.75  # 0.1598 * (35000 - 22720), uses AGI since higher

documents.title: EITC Credit Percentage
documents.text:
(b) Percentages and amounts.—
(1) Percentages.—
The credit percentage and the phaseout percentage shall be determined as follows:
In the case of an eligible individual with:
    1 qualifying child........credit percentage is 34 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 15.98 percent.
    2 qualifying children.....credit percentage is 40 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 21.06 percent.
    3 or more qualifying
    children..................credit percentage is 45 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 21.06 percent.
    No qualifying children....credit percentage is 7.65 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 7.65 percent.
documents.code:
text: """
(b) Percentages and amounts.—

The credit percentage and the phaseout percentage shall be determined as follows:
In the case of an eligible individual with:
    1 qualifying child........credit percentage is 34 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 15.98 percent.
    2 qualifying children.....credit percentage is 40 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 21.06 percent.
    3 or more qualifying
    children..................credit percentage is 45 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 21.06 percent.
    No qualifying children....credit percentage is 7.65 percent,
                              phaseout percentage is 7.65 percent.
"""

# Parameters for credit percentage by number of qualifying children

# 26 USC 32(b)(1) - Credit Percentage
variable credit_percentage:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
  entity: TaxUnit

  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "EITC Credit Percentage"
  description: "Credit percentage for EITC phase-in calculation per 26 USC 32(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |

    children_key = min(num_qualifying_children, 3)

documents.title: EITC Earned Income Amount
documents.text:
(2) Amounts.—

phaseout amount shall be determined as follows:

    No qualifying children............................the earned income amount is $5,280,
                                                      and the phaseout amount is $8,530.
(Note: These are 2021 base amounts before inflation adjustments per 32(j))
