      expect: 17400
    - name: "Three qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 3
      expect: 17400
    - name: "Four or more qualifying children (uses 3+ amount)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 5
      expect: 17400
    - name: "Edge case - exactly at child count boundary"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
      expect: 17400

# 26 USC 32(b)(2)(A) - Phaseout Amount
variable phaseout_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "EITC Phaseout Amount"
  description: "Income threshold where EITC phaseout begins per 26 USC 32(b)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cap at 3 for lookup (3+ children use same amount as 3)
    children_key = min(num_qualifying_children, 3)
    return phaseout_amount_by_children[children_key]
  tests:
    - name: "No qualifying children - lower phaseout threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
      expect: 10330
    - name: "One qualifying child"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
      expect: 22720
    - name: "Two qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
      expect: 22720
    - name: "Three qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 3
      expect: 22720
    - name: "Five qualifying children (uses 3+ amount)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 5
      expect: 22720
    - name: "Zero vs one child difference verification"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
      expect: 10330

# 26 USC 32(b)(2)(A) - AGI Limit
# Note: This represents the maximum AGI at which credit reaches zero
variable agi_limit:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/32/b/1#credit_percentage
    - 26/32/b/1#phaseout_percentage
    - 26/32/b/2/B#joint_return_adjustment
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "EITC AGI Limit"
  description: "Maximum AGI to receive any EITC per 26 USC 32(b)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # AGI limit = phaseout_amount + (max_credit / phaseout_percentage)
    # Where max_credit = credit_percentage * earned_income_amount
    children_key = min(num_qualifying_children, 3)
    earned_amt = earned_income_amount_by_children[children_key]
    phaseout_start = phaseout_amount_by_children[children_key]
    credit_rate = credit_percentage[children_key]
    phaseout_rate = phaseout_percentage[children_key]
    # Max credit is rate times earned income amount
    max_credit = credit_rate * earned_amt
    # Credit phases out at phaseout_rate per dollar over threshold
    phaseout_range = max_credit / phaseout_rate
    # Joint filers get higher threshold per 32(b)(2)(B)
    if filing_status == JOINT:
      return phaseout_start + joint_return_adjustment + phaseout_range
    return phaseout_start + phaseout_range
  tests:
    - name: "No children, single filer - AGI limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 18590  # 10330 + (0.0765 * 8260) / 0.0765 = 10330 + 8260
    - name: "No children, joint filer - higher AGI limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        filing_status: JOINT
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 25510  # 10330 + 6920 + 8260
    - name: "One child, single filer"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 49078.47  # 22720 + (0.34 * 12390) / 0.1598
    - name: "One child, joint filer"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        filing_status: JOINT
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 55998.47  # 22720 + 6920 + 26358.47
    - name: "Two children, single filer"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        filing_status: SINGLE
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 55762.11  # 22720 + (0.40 * 17400) / 0.2106
    - name: "Three children, joint filer"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 3
        filing_status: JOINT
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 66830.67  # 22720 + 6920 + (0.45 * 17400) / 0.2106
    - name: "Zero income edge case"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
        credit_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.34, 2: 0.40, 3: 0.45}
        phaseout_percentage: {0: 0.765, 1: 0.1_598, 2: 0.2_106, 3: 0.2_106}
        joint_return_adjustment: 6_920
      expect: 18590

documents.title: EITC Joint Return Adjustment
documents.text:
(B) Joint returns.—
In the case of a joint return filed by an eligible individual and such
individual's spouse, the phaseout amount determined under subparagraph (A)
shall be increased by $3,000.
(Note: Base amount of $3,000 is from 2008 enactment per P.L. 110-351,
adjusted for inflation per 32(j) to $6,920 for 2024)
documents.code:
text: """
(B) Joint returns.—
In the case of a joint return filed by an eligible individual and such
individual's spouse, the phaseout amount determined under subparagraph (A)
shall be increased by $3,000.
(Note: Base amount of $3,000 is from 2008 enactment per P.L. 110-351,
adjusted for inflation per 32(j) to $6,920 for 2024)
"""

# Parameter for joint return adjustment amount
# Value is 2024 amount per Rev. Proc. 2023-34, Section 3.06
# This amount is inflation-adjusted per 26 USC 32(j)
parameter joint_return_adjustment_amount:
  description: "Additional phaseout threshold for married filing jointly taxpayers"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: "inflation"
  values:
    2024-01-01: 6_920
    2023-01-01: 6_570
    2022-01-01: 5_980
    2021-01-01: 5_700
    2020-01-01: 5_600

# 26 USC 32(b)(2)(B) - Joint Return Adjustment
variable joint_return_adjustment:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "EITC Joint Return Adjustment"
  description: "Additional phaseout threshold amount for joint filers per 26 USC 32(b)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Joint filers get higher phaseout threshold
    if filing_status == JOINT:
      return joint_return_adjustment_amount
    return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Joint filers receive adjustment amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 6_920
    - name: "Single filers receive no adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0
    - name: "Head of household receives no adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: 0
    - name: "Married filing separately receives no adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
      expect: 0
    - name: "Qualifying surviving spouse receives no adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SURVIVING_SPOUSE
      expect: 0
    - name: "2023 joint return adjustment amount"
      period: 2023
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: 6_570

documents.title: Eligible for EITC
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'eligible individual' means--
(i) in the case of an eligible individual who has 1 or more qualifying
children, an individual who has a qualifying child for such taxable year
Combined with 32(d): "In the case of an individual who is married... this
section shall apply only if a joint return is filed
"""
variable is_eligible_individual:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/3/A#num_qualifying_children
    - 26/32/c/1/A/ii#meets_no_child_requirements
    - 26/32/c/1/B#is_qualifying_child_of_other
    - 26/32/c/1/C#has_foreign_earned_income
    - 26/32/c/1/D#is_nonresident_alien
    - 26/32/c/1/E/i#missing_taxpayer_tin
    - 26/32/c/1/E/ii#missing_spouse_tin
    - 26/32/i/1#has_excessive_investment_income
    - 26/32/d#is_mfs_filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Eligible for EITC"
  description: "Whether individual meets all EITC eligibility requirements per 26 USC 32(c)(1) and 32(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 32(d): MFS filing status disqualifies
    if is_mfs_filing_status:
        return False
    # Must have qualifying children OR meet no-child requirements
    meets_child_requirement = (num_qualifying_children > 0) or meets_no_child_requirements
    # Check all disqualifying conditions
    not_disqualified = (
        not is_qualifying_child_of_other      # 32(c)(1)(B)
        and not has_foreign_earned_income     # 32(c)(1)(C)
        and not is_nonresident_alien          # 32(c)(1)(D)
        and not missing_taxpayer_tin          # 32(c)(1)(E)(i)
        and not missing_spouse_tin            # 32(c)(1)(E)(ii)
        and not has_excessive_investment_income  # 32(i)
    )
    return meets_child_requirement and not_disqualified
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible with qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Eligible with no children but meets requirements"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        meets_no_child_requirements: true
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Ineligible - MFS filing status"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Ineligible - qualifying child of another"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        meets_no_child_requirements: true
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: true
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Ineligible - has foreign earned income exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: true
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Ineligible - nonresident alien"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: true
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Ineligible - missing taxpayer TIN"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 1
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: true
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Ineligible - excessive investment income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 2
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: true
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Ineligible - no children and does not meet no-child requirements"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        num_qualifying_children: 0
        meets_no_child_requirements: false
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false
        has_foreign_earned_income: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false
        missing_spouse_tin: false
        has_excessive_investment_income: false
        is_mfs_filing_status: false
      expect: false

documents.title: Meets Childless EITC Requirements
documents.text:
The term 'eligible individual' means—
(ii) in the case of an individual who has no qualifying children, an
individual who—
(I) has attained age 25 but not attained age 65 before the close
of the taxable year,
(II) was not a dependent of another taxpayer for any taxable year
beginning in the same calendar year, and
(III) has a principal place of abode in the United States for more
than one-half of such taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'eligible individual' means—
(ii) in the case of an individual who has no qualifying children, an
individual who—
(I) has attained age 25 but not attained age 65 before the close
of the taxable year,
(II) was not a dependent of another taxpayer for any taxable year
beginning in the same calendar year, and
(III) has a principal place of abode in the United States for more
than one-half of such taxable year.
"""
variable meets_no_child_requirements:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Meets Childless EITC Requirements"
  description: "Whether individual meets age, dependency, and abode requirements for childless EITC per 26 USC §32(c)(1)(A)(ii)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # (I) Age requirement: at least 25 but under 65
    meets_age = (age >= min_age) and (age < max_age)
    # (II) Not a dependent of another taxpayer
    not_dependent = not is_dependent_of_another
    # (III) Principal place of abode in US for more than half the year
    us_abode = has_us_principal_abode
    return meets_age and not_dependent and us_abode
  tests:
    - name: "Meets all requirements - age 30"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 30
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: false
        has_us_principal_abode: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Meets all requirements - age 25 (minimum)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 25
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: false
        has_us_principal_abode: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Meets all requirements - age 64 (just under max)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 64
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: false
        has_us_principal_abode: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Too young - age 24"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 24
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: false
        has_us_principal_abode: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Too old - age 65"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 65
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: false
        has_us_principal_abode: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Is dependent of another taxpayer"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 30
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: true
        has_us_principal_abode: true
      expect: false
    - name: "No US principal abode"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 30
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: false
        has_us_principal_abode: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Multiple disqualifications"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 20
        min_age: 25
        max_age: 65
        is_dependent_of_another: true
        has_us_principal_abode: false
      expect: false

documents.title: Is Qualifying Child of Another Taxpayer
documents.text:
An individual shall not be treated as an eligible individual for a taxable
year if such individual is a qualifying child of another taxpayer for such
taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
An individual shall not be treated as an eligible individual for a taxable
year if such individual is a qualifying child of another taxpayer for such
taxable year.
"""

parameter qualifying_child_age_under_threshold:
  description: "Age threshold for qualifying child (under this age)"
  unit: years
  values:
    1984-01-01: 19

parameter qualifying_child_student_age_threshold:
  description: "Age threshold for qualifying child who is full-time student"
  unit: years
  values:
    1984-01-01: 24

variable is_qualifying_child_of_other:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Qualifying Child of Another Taxpayer"
  description: "Whether taxpayer could be claimed as qualifying child of another, disqualifying them from EITC per 26 USC §32(c)(1)(B)"
  formula: |
    # A person is a qualifying child of another if they meet one of:
    # 1. Under 19 and lived with parent during the year
    # 2. Under 24, full-time student, and lived with parent
    # 3. Permanently disabled (no age limit)
    (
      (age < qualifying_child_age_under_threshold and lived_with_parent) or
      (age < qualifying_child_student_age_threshold and is_full_time_student and lived_with_parent) or
      (is_permanently_disabled and lived_with_parent)
    )
  tests:
    - name: "independent_adult_qualifies"
      period: 2024
      description: "Adult filer age 30 living independently is not a qualifying child of anyone"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          age: 30
          lived_with_parent: false
          is_full_time_student: false
          is_permanently_disabled: false
          earned_income: 35_000
      expect:
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false

    - name: "young_adult_with_parents_disqualified"
      period: 2024
      description: "22-year-old living with parents who could claim them is disqualified per §32(c)(1)(B)"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          age: 22
          lived_with_parent: true
          is_full_time_student: true
          is_permanently_disabled: false
          earned_income: 8_000
      expect:
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: true

    - name: "young_adult_not_student_over_18"
      period: 2024
      description: "20-year-old non-student not living with parents is not a qualifying child"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          age: 20
          lived_with_parent: false
          is_full_time_student: false
          is_permanently_disabled: false
          earned_income: 22_000
      expect:
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false

    - name: "student_under_24_with_parents"
      period: 2024
      description: "23-year-old full-time student living with parents could be qualifying child"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          age: 23
          lived_with_parent: true
          is_full_time_student: true
          is_permanently_disabled: false
          earned_income: 12_000
      expect:
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: true

    - name: "adult_over_24_with_parents_qualifies"
      period: 2024
      description: "25-year-old living with parents exceeds age limit for qualifying child"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          age: 25
          lived_with_parent: true
          is_full_time_student: false
          is_permanently_disabled: false
          earned_income: 28_000
      expect:
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: false

    - name: "disabled_adult_with_parents"
      period: 2024
      description: "Permanently disabled adult over 24 living with parents is still qualifying child (no age limit)"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          age: 35
          lived_with_parent: true
          is_full_time_student: false
          is_permanently_disabled: true
          earned_income: 5_000
      expect:
        is_qualifying_child_of_other: true

documents.title: Has Form 2_555 Foreign Earned Income Exclusion
documents.text:
No credit shall be allowed under this section to an individual who has
elected to exclude any amount from gross income under section 911.
documents.code:
text: """
No credit shall be allowed under this section to an individual who has
elected to exclude any amount from gross income under section 911.
"""
variable has_foreign_earned_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Form 2_555 Foreign Earned Income Exclusion"
  description: "Whether taxpayer has elected foreign earned income exclusion under 26 USC §911, disqualifying from EITC per 26 USC §32(c)(1)(C)"
  formula: |
    # Disqualified if claimed any foreign earned income exclusion under §911
    foreign_earned_income_exclusion > 0
  tests:
    - name: "domestic_worker_no_exclusion"
      period: 2024
      description: "US worker with only domestic income has no foreign exclusion, qualifies for EITC consideration"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
          earned_income: 35_000
      expect:
        has_foreign_earned_income: false

    - name: "expat_with_full_exclusion"
      period: 2024
      description: "US expat claiming full foreign earned income exclusion under §911 is disqualified from EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 126_500
          earned_income: 150_000
      expect:
        has_foreign_earned_income: true

    - name: "expat_with_partial_exclusion"
      period: 2024
      description: "US expat claiming partial foreign earned income exclusion is still disqualified from EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 50_000
          earned_income: 80_000
      expect:
        has_foreign_earned_income: true

    - name: "returned_expat_current_year_domestic"
      period: 2024
      description: "Former expat now working domestically with no current exclusion qualifies for EITC consideration"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
          earned_income: 42_000
      expect:
        has_foreign_earned_income: false

    - name: "low_income_expat_with_exclusion"
      period: 2024
      description: "Low-income expat with small exclusion amount is still disqualified from EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 10_000
          earned_income: 25_000
      expect:
        has_foreign_earned_income: true

    - name: "housing_exclusion_only"
      period: 2024
      description: "Expat claiming foreign housing exclusion but no earned income exclusion qualifies for EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
          foreign_housing_exclusion: 15_000
          earned_income: 60_000
      expect:
        has_foreign_earned_income: false

documents.title: Is Nonresident Alien
documents.text:
No credit shall be allowed under this section to—
(i) any nonresident alien individual for any portion of the taxable year
during which such individual is a nonresident alien, or
(ii) any individual who is a nonresident alien at any time during the
taxable year, unless such individual elects to be treated as a
resident of the United States for purposes of this chapter for
such taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
No credit shall be allowed under this section to—
(i) any nonresident alien individual for any portion of the taxable year
during which such individual is a nonresident alien, or
(ii) any individual who is a nonresident alien at any time during the
taxable year, unless such individual elects to be treated as a
resident of the United States for purposes of this chapter for
such taxable year.
"""
variable is_nonresident_alien:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Nonresident Alien"
  description: "Whether taxpayer is a nonresident alien not electing US tax treatment, disqualifying from EITC per 26 USC §32(c)(1)(D)"
  formula: |
    # Disqualified if nonresident alien and hasn't elected US tax treatment
    # §32(c)(1)(D) disqualifies nonresident aliens unless they elect to be treated as residents
    (citizenship_status == "NONRESIDENT_ALIEN" or citizenship_status == "PARTIAL_YEAR_NONRESIDENT" or citizenship_status == "DUAL_STATUS_ALIEN") and not elects_us_tax_treatment
  tests:
    - name: "us_citizen_qualifies_for_eitc"
      period: 2024
      description: "US citizen with earned income is not disqualified by nonresident alien rule"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          citizenship_status: "US_CITIZEN"
          earned_income: 25_000
      expect:
        is_nonresident_alien: false

    - name: "resident_alien_qualifies_for_eitc"
      period: 2024
      description: "Lawful permanent resident (green card holder) is not disqualified"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          citizenship_status: "LAWFUL_PERMANENT_RESIDENT"
          earned_income: 30_000
      expect:
        is_nonresident_alien: false

    - name: "nonresident_alien_disqualified"
      period: 2024
      description: "Nonresident alien without election is disqualified from EITC per §32(c)(1)(D)(i)"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          citizenship_status: "NONRESIDENT_ALIEN"
          elects_us_tax_treatment: false
          earned_income: 20_000
      expect:
        is_nonresident_alien: true

    - name: "nonresident_alien_with_election_qualifies"
      period: 2024
      description: "Nonresident alien electing US tax treatment qualifies per §32(c)(1)(D)(ii)"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          citizenship_status: "NONRESIDENT_ALIEN"
          elects_us_tax_treatment: true
          earned_income: 35_000
      expect:
        is_nonresident_alien: false

    - name: "partial_year_nonresident_disqualified"
      period: 2024
      description: "Individual who was nonresident alien for any portion of year is disqualified"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          citizenship_status: "PARTIAL_YEAR_NONRESIDENT"
          elects_us_tax_treatment: false
          earned_income: 40_000
      expect:
        is_nonresident_alien: true

    - name: "dual_status_alien_with_election_qualifies"
      period: 2024
      description: "Dual-status alien electing full-year US treatment qualifies for EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          citizenship_status: "DUAL_STATUS_ALIEN"
          elects_us_tax_treatment: true
          earned_income: 28_000
      expect:
        is_nonresident_alien: false

documents.title: Missing Taxpayer SSN for EITC
documents.text:
No credit shall be allowed under this section unless the taxpayer
(and, if the taxpayer is married, the taxpayer's spouse) includes a
valid identification number on the return of tax for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
No credit shall be allowed under this section unless the taxpayer
(and, if the taxpayer is married, the taxpayer's spouse) includes a
valid identification number on the return of tax for the taxable year.
"""
variable missing_taxpayer_tin:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Missing Taxpayer SSN for EITC"
  description: "Whether taxpayer lacks a valid SSN for work, disqualifying from EITC per 26 USC §32(c)(1)(E)(i) and §32(m)"
  formula: |
    # §32(c)(1)(E)(i) requires taxpayer to have valid SSN for work
    # ITIN does not qualify; SSN with work restrictions does not qualify
    not has_valid_ssn_for_work
  tests:
    - name: "taxpayer_with_valid_ssn_qualifies"
      period: 2024
      description: "Taxpayer with valid SSN for work meets EITC identification requirement"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          has_valid_ssn_for_work: true
          earned_income: 25_000
      expect:
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false

    - name: "taxpayer_with_itin_disqualified"
      period: 2024
      description: "Taxpayer with ITIN (Individual Taxpayer Identification Number) instead of SSN is disqualified from EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          has_valid_ssn_for_work: false
          has_itin: true
          earned_income: 30_000
      expect:
        missing_taxpayer_tin: true

    - name: "taxpayer_no_ssn_no_itin_disqualified"
      period: 2024
      description: "Taxpayer without any valid identification number is disqualified from EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          has_valid_ssn_for_work: false
          has_itin: false
          earned_income: 15_000
      expect:
        missing_taxpayer_tin: true

    - name: "taxpayer_with_ssn_not_valid_for_work"
      period: 2024
      description: "Taxpayer with SSN not valid for employment (e.g., issued with work restrictions) is disqualified per §32(m)"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          has_valid_ssn_for_work: false
          has_ssn_with_work_restriction: true
          earned_income: 22_000
      expect:
        missing_taxpayer_tin: true

    - name: "naturalized_citizen_with_valid_ssn"
      period: 2024
      description: "Naturalized citizen with valid SSN for work qualifies for EITC consideration"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          has_valid_ssn_for_work: true
          citizenship_status: "NATURALIZED_CITIZEN"
          earned_income: 35_000
      expect:
        missing_taxpayer_tin: false

    - name: "low_income_taxpayer_missing_ssn"
      period: 2024
      description: "Low-income taxpayer who would otherwise qualify but lacks valid SSN is disqualified"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          has_valid_ssn_for_work: false
          earned_income: 8_000
          num_qualifying_children: 2
      expect:
        missing_taxpayer_tin: true

documents.title: Missing Spouse SSN for EITC
documents.text:
No credit shall be allowed under this section unless the taxpayer
(and, if the taxpayer is married, the taxpayer's spouse) includes a
valid identification number on the return of tax for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
No credit shall be allowed under this section unless the taxpayer
(and, if the taxpayer is married, the taxpayer's spouse) includes a
valid identification number on the return of tax for the taxable year.
"""
variable missing_spouse_tin:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Missing Spouse SSN for EITC"
  description: "Whether taxpayer's spouse lacks a valid SSN for work when filing jointly, disqualifying from EITC per 26 USC §32(c)(1)(E)(ii) and §32(m)"
  formula: |
    # §32(c)(1)(E)(ii) requires spouse to have valid SSN for work when filing jointly
    # This only applies to married filing jointly; MFS and other statuses don't have this requirement
    filing_status == "married_filing_jointly" and not spouse_has_valid_ssn
  tests:
    - name: "single_filer_not_applicable"
      period: 2024
      description: "Single filer has no spouse, so spouse TIN requirement does not apply"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          filing_status: single
          has_spouse: false
          earned_income: 25_000
      expect:
        missing_spouse_tin: false

    - name: "married_both_valid_ssn"
      period: 2024
      description: "Married filing jointly where both spouses have valid SSNs qualifies for EITC consideration"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          filing_status: married_filing_jointly
          has_spouse: true
          taxpayer_has_valid_ssn: true
          spouse_has_valid_ssn: true
          earned_income: 42_000
      expect:
        missing_spouse_tin: false

    - name: "married_spouse_has_itin"
      period: 2024
      description: "Married filing jointly where spouse has ITIN instead of SSN disqualifies from EITC per §32(m)"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          filing_status: married_filing_jointly
          has_spouse: true
          taxpayer_has_valid_ssn: true
          spouse_has_valid_ssn: false
          spouse_has_itin: true
          earned_income: 35_000
      expect:
        missing_spouse_tin: true

    - name: "married_spouse_no_tin"
      period: 2024
      description: "Married filing jointly where spouse has no TIN at all disqualifies from EITC"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          filing_status: married_filing_jointly
          has_spouse: true
          taxpayer_has_valid_ssn: true
          spouse_has_valid_ssn: false
          spouse_has_itin: false
          earned_income: 28_000
      expect:
        missing_spouse_tin: true

    - name: "married_filing_separately"
      period: 2024
      description: "Married filing separately does not require spouse TIN on return"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          filing_status: married_filing_separately
          has_spouse: true
          taxpayer_has_valid_ssn: true
          spouse_has_valid_ssn: false
          earned_income: 18_000
      expect:
        missing_spouse_tin: false

    - name: "head_of_household_no_spouse"
      period: 2024
      description: "Head of household filer with no current spouse has no spouse TIN requirement"
      inputs:
        tax_unit:
          filing_status: head_of_household
          has_spouse: false
          taxpayer_has_valid_ssn: true
          earned_income: 32_000
      expect:
        missing_spouse_tin: false

documents.title: Earned Income
documents.text:
The term 'earned income' means—
(i) wages, salaries, tips, and other employee compensation, but only
if such amounts are includible in gross income for the taxable year, plus
(ii) the amount of the taxpayer's net earnings from self-employment for
the taxable year (within the meaning of section 1402(a)), but such
net earnings shall be determined with regard to the deduction allowed
to the taxpayer by section 164(f).
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'earned income' means—
(i) wages, salaries, tips, and other employee compensation, but only
if such amounts are includible in gross income for the taxable year, plus
(ii) the amount of the taxpayer's net earnings from self-employment for
the taxable year (within the meaning of section 1402(a)), but such
net earnings shall be determined with regard to the deduction allowed
to the taxpayer by section 164(f).
"""
variable earned_income:
  imports:
    - 26/1402/a#net_earnings_self_employment
    - 26/164/f#se_tax_deduction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Wages, salaries, tips, and net self-employment income per 26 USC §32(c)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Employee compensation
    employee_compensation = wages + salaries + tips
    # Self-employment income (with §164(f) deduction applied)
    self_employment = net_earnings_self_employment - se_tax_deduction
    return employee_compensation + max(0, self_employment)
  tests:
    - name: "Wages only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 30_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        net_earnings_self_employment: 0
        se_tax_deduction: 0
      expect: 30000
    - name: "Wages, salaries, and tips"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 20_000
        salaries: 5_000
        tips: 3_000
        net_earnings_self_employment: 0
        se_tax_deduction: 0
      expect: 28000
    - name: "Self-employment only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        net_earnings_self_employment: 50_000
        se_tax_deduction: 3532.50
      expect: 46467.50  # 50000 - 3532.50
    - name: "Combined wages and self-employment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 25_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 2000
        net_earnings_self_employment: 20_000
        se_tax_deduction: 1_413
      expect: 45587  # 25000 + 2000 + (20000 - 1413)
    - name: "Self-employment loss (capped at 0)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 15_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        net_earnings_self_employment: -5_000
        se_tax_deduction: 0
      expect: 15000  # SE loss doesn't reduce wages for EITC
    - name: "Zero income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        net_earnings_self_employment: 0
        se_tax_deduction: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "SE deduction exceeds SE income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        wages: 10_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        net_earnings_self_employment: 5_000
        se_tax_deduction: 6_000
      expect: 10000  # SE portion is max(0, 5000-6000) = 0

documents.title: Number of Qualifying Children (uncapped)
documents.text:
The term 'qualifying child' means a qualifying child of the taxpayer
(as defined in section 152(c), determined without regard to paragraph
(1)(D) thereof and section 152(e)).
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'qualifying child' means a qualifying child of the taxpayer
(as defined in section 152(c), determined without regard to paragraph
(1)(D) thereof and section 152(e)).
"""
variable num_qualifying_children:
  imports:
    - 26/152/c#is_qualifying_child
    - 26/32/c/3/B#child_is_married_filing_joint
    - 26/32/c/3/C#child_meets_place_of_abode
    - 26/32/c/3/D/i#child_has_valid_tin
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Count
  label: "Number of Qualifying Children (uncapped)"
  description: "Actual count of qualifying children, not capped at 3"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Count children who meet all EITC-specific requirements
    count = person.count(
        is_qualifying_child
        and not child_is_married_filing_joint
        and child_meets_place_of_abode
        and child_has_valid_tin
    )
    # For EITC parameter lookup, 3+ children use the same rates
    return min(count, 3)
  tests:
    - name: "No qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [false, false]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true]
      expect: 0
    - name: "One qualifying child"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, false]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true]
      expect: 1
    - name: "Two qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, true]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true]
      expect: 2
    - name: "Three qualifying children"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, true, true]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true, true]
      expect: 3
    - name: "Four children, capped at 3"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, true, true, true]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false, false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true, true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true, true, true]
      expect: 3  # Capped at 3 for EITC
    - name: "Child disqualified - married filing joint"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, true]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [true, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true]
      expect: 1  # First child disqualified
    - name: "Child disqualified - no abode"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, true]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [false, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [true, true]
      expect: 1  # First child disqualified
    - name: "Child disqualified - no valid TIN"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_qualifying_child: [true, true]
        child_is_married_filing_joint: [false, false]
        child_meets_place_of_abode: [true, true]
        child_has_valid_tin: [false, true]
      expect: 1  # First child disqualified

documents.title: Child is married filing joint return
documents.text:
(B) Married individual
The term 'qualifying child' shall not include an individual who is married
as of the close of the taxpayer's taxable year unless the taxpayer is
entitled to a deduction under section 151 for such taxable year with
respect to such individual (or would be so entitled but for section 152(e)).
documents.code:
text: """
(B) Married individual
The term 'qualifying child' shall not include an individual who is married
as of the close of the taxpayer's taxable year unless the taxpayer is
entitled to a deduction under section 151 for such taxable year with
respect to such individual (or would be so entitled but for section 152(e)).
"""

input child_is_married_filing_joint:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Child is married filing joint return"
  description: |
    Whether the child is married and files a joint return with their spouse.
    Under IRC 32(c)(3)(B), a married child filing jointly is not a qualifying
    child for EITC unless the return was filed solely to claim a refund.
  default: false

documents.title: Child Meets Place of Abode Requirement
documents.text:
26 USC § 32(c)(3)(C) - Place of Abode

The term 'qualifying child' means, with respect to any individual,
a child who meets the requirements of section 152(c)(1)(B), which requires
that the child has the same principal place of abode as the taxpayer for
more than one-half of such taxable year.

Note: For EITC purposes, the principal place of abode must be in the
United States. A child who is born or dies during the taxable year is
treated as having the same principal place of abode as the taxpayer for
the taxpayer's entire taxable year if the child lived with the taxpayer
for more than one-half of the time the child was alive during the year.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 32(c)(3)(C) - Place of Abode

The term 'qualifying child' means, with respect to any individual,
a child who meets the requirements of section 152(c)(1)(B), which requires
that the child has the same principal place of abode as the taxpayer for
more than one-half of such taxable year.

Note: For EITC purposes, the principal place of abode must be in the
United States. A child who is born or dies during the taxable year is
treated as having the same principal place of abode as the taxpayer for
the taxpayer's entire taxable year if the child lived with the taxpayer
for more than one-half of the time the child was alive during the year.
"""

parameter days_in_year:
  description: "Number of days in the tax year"
  values:
    2024-01-01: 366
    2023-01-01: 365
    2020-01-01: 366
    2019-01-01: 365

parameter minimum_residency_fraction:
  description: "Minimum fraction of year child must reside with taxpayer"
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.5

variable child_meets_place_of_abode:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Child Meets Place of Abode Requirement"
  description: "Whether child has same principal place of abode as taxpayer for more than half of the taxable year per 26 USC §32(c)(3)(C) and §152(c)(1)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Child must live with taxpayer for more than half the year
    # For children born/deceased during year, we use fraction of days alive
    if days_lived_in_year > 0:
      residency_fraction = days_with_taxpayer / days_lived_in_year
    else:
      return False
    # Must be MORE than half, not equal to half
    return residency_fraction > minimum_residency_fraction
  tests:
    - name: "Child lives with taxpayer full year"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        days_with_taxpayer: 366
        days_lived_in_year: 366
        days_in_year: 366
        minimum_residency_fraction: 0.5
      expect: true
    - name: "Child lives with taxpayer exactly half year - not qualifying"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        days_with_taxpayer: 183
        days_lived_in_year: 366
        days_in_year: 366
        minimum_residency_fraction: 0.5
      expect: false
    - name: "Child lives with taxpayer more than half year - qualifying"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        days_with_taxpayer: 184
        days_lived_in_year: 366
        days_in_year: 366
        minimum_residency_fraction: 0.5
      expect: true
    - name: "Child born mid-year, lives with taxpayer entire time alive"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        days_with_taxpayer: 200
        days_lived_in_year: 200
        days_in_year: 366
        minimum_residency_fraction: 0.5
      expect: true
    - name: "Child died mid-year, lived with taxpayer more than half of days alive"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        days_with_taxpayer: 100
        days_lived_in_year: 150
        days_in_year: 366
        minimum_residency_fraction: 0.5
      expect: true
    - name: "Child died mid-year, lived with taxpayer less than half of days alive"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        days_with_taxpayer: 70
        days_lived_in_year: 150
        days_in_year: 366
        minimum_residency_fraction: 0.5
      expect: false

documents.title: Child TIN on Return
documents.code:
text: """
(i) In general.— The term "qualifying child" shall not be taken into account
under subsection (b) unless the taxpayer includes the name, age, and TIN of
the qualifying child on the return of tax for the taxable year.
"""

# Note: Per 26 USC 32(m), for purposes of 32(c)(3)(D), "taxpayer identification
# number" means a social security number issued by SSA. The SSN must be valid
# for employment per 26 USC 32(m)(2), but that provision is encoded in 32/m.rac.

input child_tin_on_return:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Child TIN on Return"
  description: "Whether taxpayer included name, age, and TIN for this child on tax return"
  default: false
# Note: This is an input variable - tests would verify downstream usage
# in the qualifying_child determination. The SSN validity checks are
# in 32/m.rac which handles the SSN requirements.

documents.title: Is Married Filing Separately
documents.text:
(d) Married individuals filing separate returns
In the case of an individual who is married (within the meaning of
section 7703), this section shall apply only if a joint return is filed
for the taxable year under section 6013.
For purposes of this paragraph, marital status shall be determined
under section 7703.
documents.code:
text: """
(d) Married individuals filing separate returns
In the case of an individual who is married (within the meaning of
section 7703), this section shall apply only if a joint return is filed
for the taxable year under section 6013.
For purposes of this paragraph, marital status shall be determined
under section 7703.
"""
variable is_mfs_filing_status:
  imports: [26/1#filing_status]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Married Filing Separately"
  description: "Whether filing status is MFS, disqualifying from EITC per 26 USC 32(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY filing status disqualifies from EITC
    return filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
  tests:
    - name: "Married filing separately - disqualified"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
      expect: true
    - name: "Single - not disqualified"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: false
    - name: "Married filing jointly - not disqualified"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
      expect: false
    - name: "Head of household - not disqualified"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: false
    - name: "Surviving spouse - not disqualified"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SURVIVING_SPOUSE
      expect: false

documents.title: Investment Income Limit
documents.text:
No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) for the taxable year if
the aggregate amount of disqualified income of the taxpayer for the taxable
year exceeds $10,000.
documents.code:
parameter disqualified_income_limit_amount:
  description: "Maximum investment income limit for EITC eligibility"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: "inflation"
  values:
    2024-01-01: 11_600
    2023-01-01: 11_000
    2022-01-01: 10_000
    2021-01-01: 10_000
    2020-01-01: 10_000

variable disqualified_income_limit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Investment Income Limit"
  description: "Maximum investment income allowed before EITC disqualification per 26 USC 32(i)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return disqualified_income_limit_amount

# 26 USC §32(i)(1) - Denial of Credit for Excessive Investment Income
#

text: """
No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) for the taxable year if
the aggregate amount of disqualified income of the taxpayer for the taxable
year exceeds $10,000.
"""
variable has_excessive_investment_income:
  imports:
    - 26/103#tax_exempt_interest
    - 26/32/i/2/C#net_rent_royalty_income
    - 26/1222/11#capital_gain_net_income
    - 26/32/i/2/E#net_passive_income
    - 26/32/i/1#disqualified_income_limit
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  unit: USD
  label: "Disqualified by Investment Income"
  description: "Whether investment income exceeds the limit per 26 USC §32(i)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    disqualified_income = (
        interest_income                # §32(i)(2)(A)
        + dividend_income              # §32(i)(2)(A)
        + tax_exempt_interest          # §32(i)(2)(B)
        + net_rent_royalty_income      # §32(i)(2)(C)
        + capital_gain_net_income      # §32(i)(2)(D)
        + net_passive_income           # §32(i)(2)(E)
    )
    return disqualified_income > disqualified_income_limit
  tests:
    - name: "No investment income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        net_rent_royalty_income: 0
        capital_gain_net_income: 0
        net_passive_income: 0
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: false
    - name: "Investment income below limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 5_000
        dividend_income: 3_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 1_000
        net_rent_royalty_income: 0
        capital_gain_net_income: 1_000
        net_passive_income: 0
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: false  # Total = 10000, under limit
    - name: "Investment income at limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 5_000
        dividend_income: 3_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 1_600
        net_rent_royalty_income: 1_000
        capital_gain_net_income: 1_000
        net_passive_income: 0
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: false  # Total = 11600, at limit (not over)
    - name: "Investment income exceeds limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 5_000
        dividend_income: 4_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 2000
        net_rent_royalty_income: 1_000
        capital_gain_net_income: 500
        net_passive_income: 0
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: true  # Total = 12500, exceeds limit
    - name: "High investment income disqualifies"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 10_000
        dividend_income: 5_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 2000
        net_rent_royalty_income: 3_000
        capital_gain_net_income: 5_000
        net_passive_income: 2000
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: true  # Total = 27000, well over limit
    - name: "Only capital gains"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        net_rent_royalty_income: 0
        capital_gain_net_income: 15_000
        net_passive_income: 0
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: true  # Capital gains alone exceed limit
    - name: "Only passive income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        net_rent_royalty_income: 0
        capital_gain_net_income: 0
        net_passive_income: 12_000
        disqualified_income_limit: 11_600
      expect: true

documents.title: FUTA Coverage Status
documents.text:
26 USC § 3304 - Approval of State Laws

(a) Requirements.—The Secretary of Labor shall approve any State law submitted
to him, within 30 days of such submission, which he finds provides that—
(1) all compensation is to be paid through public employment offices or
such other agencies as the Secretary of Labor may approve;
(2) no compensation shall be payable with respect to any day of unemployment
occurring within 2 years after the first day of the first period with respect
to which contributions are required;
(3) all money received in the unemployment fund shall be used solely in the
payment of unemployment compensation, exclusive of expenses of administration.

Coverage under FUTA (Federal Unemployment Tax Act) is required for most
employment, with exceptions specified in section 3306(c).
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 3304 - Approval of State Laws

(a) Requirements.—The Secretary of Labor shall approve any State law submitted
to him, within 30 days of such submission, which he finds provides that—
(1) all compensation is to be paid through public employment offices or
such other agencies as the Secretary of Labor may approve;
(2) no compensation shall be payable with respect to any day of unemployment
occurring within 2 years after the first day of the first period with respect
to which contributions are required;
(3) all money received in the unemployment fund shall be used solely in the
payment of unemployment compensation, exclusive of expenses of administration.

Coverage under FUTA (Federal Unemployment Tax Act) is required for most
employment, with exceptions specified in section 3306(c).
"""

variable coverage:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "FUTA Coverage Status"
  description: "Whether employment is covered under FUTA per 26 USC 3_304(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Most employment is covered; exceptions defined in 3306(c)
    # Exceptions include:
    # - Agricultural labor (unless employer has 10+ workers or $20k+ payroll)
    # - Domestic service (unless $1,000+ per quarter)
    # - Self-employment
    # - Federal government employees (separate system)
    # - Certain nonprofit employees (optional coverage)
    return is_employee and not is_excluded_employment
  default: false
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # STANDARD COVERED EMPLOYMENT TESTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Standard W-2 employee is covered"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_employee: true
        is_excluded_employment: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Regular private sector employee with $50_000 wages"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_employee: true
        is_excluded_employment: false
      expect: true

    # ============================================================================
    # EXCLUDED EMPLOYMENT TESTS (per 26 USC 3306(c))
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Self-employed individual not covered"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_employee: false
        is_excluded_employment: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Federal government employee excluded"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_employee: true
        is_excluded_employment: true
      expect: false

    - name: "Agricultural worker in excluded category"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_employee: true
        is_excluded_employment: true
      expect: false

    # ============================================================================
    # EDGE CASES
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Non-employee with excluded employment flag"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_employee: false
        is_excluded_employment: true
      expect: false

documents.title: Fuel Tax Credit
documents.text:
Section 34 provides a refundable credit for certain uses of gasoline,
diesel fuel, and other special fuels. The credit allows taxpayers to
recover federal excise taxes paid on fuels used for nontaxable purposes
such as farming, off-highway business use, or export.

(a) General rule - There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax
imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the
sum of the amounts payable to the taxpayer under sections 6420, 6421,
and 6427 (determined without regard to section 6421(i)) with respect
to gasoline and special fuels used during such year.
documents.code:

# Reference: https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/34

imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the
sum of the amounts payable to the taxpayer under sections 6420, 6421,
and 6427 (determined without regard to section 6421(i)) with respect
to gasoline and special fuels used during such year.
"""

input fuel_tax_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit

  unit: USD
  label: "Fuel Tax Credit"
  description: "Credit for federal excise taxes on fuels used for nontaxable purposes per 26 USC 34"
  default: 0

documents.title: Health Coverage Tax Credit
documents.text:
Section 35 provides a refundable credit (Health Coverage Tax Credit or HCTC)
for a percentage of health insurance premiums paid by eligible individuals
who receive trade adjustment assistance (TAA) or are PBGC pension recipients.

(a) In general - In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a
credit against the tax imposed by subtitle A an amount equal to the
applicable percentage of the amount paid by the taxpayer for coverage of
the taxpayer and qualifying family members under qualified health insurance
for eligible coverage months.

Note: This credit has been largely superseded by the Premium Tax Credit
(Section 36B) under the Affordable Care Act for most taxpayers.

"""

documents.title: First-Time Homebuyer Credit
documents.text:
Section 36 provided a refundable credit for first-time homebuyers. The credit
was available for homes purchased between April 9, 2008 and September 30, 2010.
The credit has expired and is no longer available for new purchases.

(a) Allowance of credit - In the case of an individual who is a first-time
homebuyer of a principal residence in the United States during a taxable year,
there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle
for such taxable year an amount equal to 10 percent of the purchase price
of the residence.

Note: While expired for new claims, some taxpayers may still have recapture
obligations if they sold their home within 36 months of purchase or converted
it to non-principal residence use.
