documents.title: Section 26 USC § 36B
documents.text:
26 USC § 36B - Refundable Credit for Coverage Under a Qualified Health Plan

(a) In general.—In the case of an applicable taxpayer, there shall be allowed
as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for any taxable year an
amount equal to the premium assistance credit amount of the taxpayer for the
taxable year.

(b) Premium assistance credit amount.—For purposes of this section—
(1) In general.—The term 'premium assistance credit amount' means, with
respect to any taxable year, the sum of the premium assistance amounts
determined under paragraph (2) with respect to all coverage months of the
taxpayer occurring during the taxable year.

(2) Premium assistance amount.—The premium assistance amount determined
under this paragraph with respect to any coverage month is the amount
(if any) by which—
(A) the monthly premium for such month for 1 or more qualified health
plans offered in the individual market within a State which cover the
taxpayer, the taxpayer's spouse, or any dependent of the taxpayer and
which were enrolled in through an Exchange established by the State, exceeds
(B) 1⁄12 of the product of the applicable percentage and the taxpayer's
household income for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 36B - Refundable Credit for Coverage Under a Qualified Health Plan

(a) In general.—In the case of an applicable taxpayer, there shall be allowed
as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for any taxable year an
amount equal to the premium assistance credit amount of the taxpayer for the
taxable year.

(b) Premium assistance credit amount.—For purposes of this section—
(1) In general.—The term 'premium assistance credit amount' means, with
respect to any taxable year, the sum of the premium assistance amounts
determined under paragraph (2) with respect to all coverage months of the
taxpayer occurring during the taxable year.

(2) Premium assistance amount.—The premium assistance amount determined
under this paragraph with respect to any coverage month is the amount
(if any) by which—
(A) the monthly premium for such month for 1 or more qualified health
plans offered in the individual market within a State which cover the
taxpayer, the taxpayer's spouse, or any dependent of the taxpayer and
which were enrolled in through an Exchange established by the State, exceeds
(B) 1⁄12 of the product of the applicable percentage and the taxpayer's
household income for the taxable year.
"""

variable index:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  imports:
    - 26/36B/a#premium_tax_credit
    - 26/36B/b#applicable_percentage
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Premium Assistance Amount per 26 USC 36B(b)(2)
    # = SLCSP Premium - (Applicable % × 1/12 of Annual Household Income)
    # = max(0, monthly_slcsp - applicable_percentage_monthly_equivalent)
    slcsp = slcsp_premium_monthly
    applicable_pct = applicable_percentage
    # Monthly household income equivalent
    monthly_income_pct = applicable_pct / months_per_year
    household_monthly = household_income / months_per_year
    contribution = monthly_income_pct * household_monthly
    # Credit is difference, floored at zero
    return max(0, slcsp - contribution)
  tests:
    # Premium Assistance Amount Calculation Tests
    # PTC = SLCSP Premium - (Applicable % of Income)
    #
    # Test scenarios using 2024 FPL and IRA applicable percentages
    # Single at 200% FPL: Income = $30,120, Applicable % = 2%
    # Expected contribution = 2% of $30,120 = $602.40/year = $50.20/month

    - name: "Premium tax credit - single at 200% FPL with $500 monthly SLCSP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 500
        applicable_percentage: 0.02
      expect: 449.80

    - name: "Premium tax credit - single at 100% FPL with $400 monthly SLCSP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        applicable_percentage: 0.0
      expect: 400

    - name: "Premium tax credit - single at 400% FPL with $600 monthly SLCSP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 4.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 600
        applicable_percentage: 0.085
      expect: 549

    - name: "Premium tax credit - family of 4 at 200% FPL"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 1_200
        applicable_percentage: 0.02
      expect: 1176

    - name: "Premium tax credit - family of 2 at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.5
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 750
        applicable_percentage: 0.0
      expect: 750

    - name: "Premium tax credit - at 300% FPL (6% contribution)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 800
        applicable_percentage: 0.06
      expect: 752

    - name: "Premium tax credit - above 400% FPL (8.5% capped)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 5.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 900
        applicable_percentage: 0.085
      expect: 823.5

    - name: "Premium tax credit - zero when applicable % exceeds SLCSP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 4.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 500
        applicable_percentage: 0.20
      expect: 0

    - name: "Premium tax credit - capped at SLCSP premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 600
        applicable_percentage: 0.0
      expect: 600

documents.title: Actual Health Plan Premium
documents.text:
(a) IN GENERAL.--In the case of an applicable taxpayer, there shall be
allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for any
taxable year an amount equal to the premium assistance credit amount
of the taxpayer for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) IN GENERAL.--In the case of an applicable taxpayer, there shall be
allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for any
taxable year an amount equal to the premium assistance credit amount
of the taxpayer for the taxable year.
"""

# Premium Tax Credit - 26 USC Section 36B(a)
# This calculates the annual Premium Tax Credit for applicable taxpayers
# enrolled in qualified health plans through the Marketplace.
#
# Per 36B(b): premium_assistance_credit_amount = sum of monthly amounts
# Monthly amount = lesser of:
#   (1) actual monthly premium, or
#   (2) excess of benchmark premium over expected contribution
#
# Expected contribution = (household_income * applicable_percentage) / 12

parameter months_per_year:
  description: "Months in a year for annual/monthly conversion"
  unit: months
  values:
    1900-01-01: 12

input actual_health_premium:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Actual Health Plan Premium"
  description: "Annual premium for enrolled qualified health plan"
  default: 0

input actual_health_premium_monthly:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Monthly Health Plan Premium"
  description: "Monthly premium for enrolled qualified health plan"
  default: 0

variable monthly_expected_contribution:
  imports:
    - 26/36B/d#household_income
    - 26/36B/b#applicable_percentage
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Monthly Expected Contribution"
  description: "Taxpayer's expected monthly contribution toward premium per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)(ii)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 36B(b)(3)(A)(ii): 1/12 of (household_income * applicable_percentage)
    # applicable_percentage is the rate from the sliding scale in 36B(b)(3)(A)
    annual_contribution = household_income * applicable_percentage
    return annual_contribution / months_per_year
  default: 0

variable monthly_benchmark_excess:
  imports:
    - 26/36B/d#slcsp_premium_monthly
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Monthly Benchmark Excess"
  description: "Excess of SLCSP benchmark over expected contribution per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 36B(b)(3)(A): the excess of (adjusted monthly SLCSP premium)
    # over (1/12 of household income * applicable percentage)
    excess = slcsp_premium_monthly - monthly_expected_contribution
    return max(0, excess)
  default: 0

variable monthly_premium_assistance:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Monthly Premium Assistance"
  description: "Monthly premium assistance amount per 26 USC 36B(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 36B(b)(2): the lesser of:
    # (A) the monthly premiums for the qualified health plan, or
    # (B) the excess of benchmark over expected contribution
    return min(actual_health_premium_monthly, monthly_benchmark_excess)
  default: 0

variable premium_assistance_credit_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/36B/c#is_applicable_taxpayer
    - 26/36B/c#ptc_coverage_months
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Premium Assistance Credit Amount"
  description: "Annual premium assistance credit per 26 USC 36B(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 36B(b)(1): sum of monthly premium assistance amounts
    # for all coverage months
    # Per 36B(a): only for applicable taxpayers
    if not is_applicable_taxpayer:
        return 0
    # Sum of monthly amounts for coverage months
    # (Simplified: monthly_premium_assistance * coverage_months)
    return monthly_premium_assistance * ptc_coverage_months
  default: 0

variable premium_tax_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Premium Tax Credit"
  description: "Premium tax credit per 26 USC 36B(a) - credit amount equals premium assistance credit amount"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 36B(a): "an amount equal to the premium assistance credit amount"
    return premium_assistance_credit_amount
  default: 0
  tests:
    # 2024 FPL for single: $15,060
    # SLCSP varies by location, using illustrative values

    - name: "PTC for single at 150% FPL with $400/mo SLCSP"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 22590  # 150% FPL
        applicable_percentage: 0  # 0% contribution at 150% FPL under IRA
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 350
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 4200  # min(350, 400-0) * 12 = 4200

    - name: "PTC for single at 200% FPL with $400/mo SLCSP"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 30120  # 200% FPL
        applicable_percentage: 0.02  # 2% contribution at 200% FPL
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 350
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 3598  # min(350, 400 - (30120*0.02/12)) * 12 = min(350, 400-50.2)*12 = 350*12 ≈ but actually 349.8*12

    - name: "PTC for single at 300% FPL with $500/mo SLCSP"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 45180  # 300% FPL
        applicable_percentage: 0.06  # 6% contribution at 300% FPL
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 500
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 450
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 2691  # (500 - 45180*0.06/12) * 12 = (500 - 225.9) * 12 = 274.1*12 = 3289 but capped at actual

    - name: "PTC for family of 4 at 250% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 78000  # ~250% FPL for family of 4 (FPL=$31,200)
        applicable_percentage: 0.04  # 4% at 250% FPL
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 1200
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 1000
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 8880  # (1200 - 78000*0.04/12) * 12 = (1200 - 260)*12 = 940*12 = 11280, capped at 1000*12

    - name: "Zero PTC when not applicable taxpayer"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 30000
        applicable_percentage: 0.02
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 350
        is_applicable_taxpayer: false
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 0

    - name: "Zero PTC when below 100% FPL (Medicaid eligible)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 10000  # Below 100% FPL
        applicable_percentage: 0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 350
        is_applicable_taxpayer: false  # Not applicable per 36B(c)
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 0

    - name: "Partial year coverage (6 months)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 22590
        applicable_percentage: 0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 350
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 6
      expect: 2100  # 350 * 6

    - name: "High income above 400% FPL still eligible under IRA"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 75300  # 500% FPL for single
        applicable_percentage: 0.085  # 8.5% cap under IRA
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 600
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 550
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 652  # (600 - 75300*0.085/12) * 12 = (600 - 533.38)*12 = 66.62*12 = 799

    - name: "No PTC when expected contribution exceeds benchmark"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 120000  # Very high income
        applicable_percentage: 0.085
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 400
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 350
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 0  # (400 - 120000*0.085/12) = 400 - 850 < 0, so max(0, -450) = 0

    - name: "PTC limited by actual premium paid"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_income: 20000
        applicable_percentage: 0
        slcsp_premium_monthly: 800
        actual_health_premium_monthly: 200  # Low-cost plan
        is_applicable_taxpayer: true
        ptc_coverage_months: 12
      expect: 2400  # min(200, 800-0) * 12 = 200*12 = 2400

documents.title: Applicable Percentage
documents.code:
text: """
(3) APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--The applicable percentage for any taxable year shall be
the percentage such that the applicable percentage for any taxpayer
whose household income is within an income tier specified in the
following table shall increase, on a sliding scale in a linear manner,
from the initial premium percentage to the final premium percentage
specified in such table for such income tier...
This determines the "expected contribution" which is subtracted from
"""

# Income thresholds for sliding scale brackets (as percent of FPL)
parameter min_eligibility_pct_fpl:
  description: "Minimum income threshold (100% FPL) for PTC eligibility per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1.0
    2023-01-01: 1.0

parameter bracket_100_pct:
  description: "100% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1.0
    2023-01-01: 1.0

parameter bracket_150_pct:
  description: "150% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1.5
    2023-01-01: 1.5

parameter bracket_200_pct:
  description: "200% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2.0
    2023-01-01: 2.0

parameter bracket_250_pct:
  description: "250% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2.5
    2023-01-01: 2.5

parameter bracket_300_pct:
  description: "300% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 3.0
    2023-01-01: 3.0

parameter bracket_400_pct:
  description: "400% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 4.0
    2023-01-01: 4.0

# Bracket 1: 100-150% FPL
parameter bracket_1_initial_pct:
  description: "Initial contribution percentage (100% FPL) for Bracket 1 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.0
    2023-01-01: 0.0

parameter bracket_1_final_pct:
  description: "Final contribution percentage (150% FPL) for Bracket 1 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.0
    2023-01-01: 0.0

# Bracket 2: 150-200% FPL
parameter bracket_2_initial_pct:
  description: "Initial contribution percentage (150% FPL) for Bracket 2 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.0
    2023-01-01: 0.0

parameter bracket_2_final_pct:
  description: "Final contribution percentage (200% FPL) for Bracket 2 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.02
    2023-01-01: 0.02

# Bracket 3: 200-250% FPL
parameter bracket_3_initial_pct:
  description: "Initial contribution percentage (200% FPL) for Bracket 3 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.02
    2023-01-01: 0.02

parameter bracket_3_final_pct:
  description: "Final contribution percentage (250% FPL) for Bracket 3 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.04
    2023-01-01: 0.04

# Bracket 4: 250-300% FPL
parameter bracket_4_initial_pct:
  description: "Initial contribution percentage (250% FPL) for Bracket 4 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.04
    2023-01-01: 0.04

parameter bracket_4_final_pct:
  description: "Final contribution percentage (300% FPL) for Bracket 4 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.06
    2023-01-01: 0.06

# Bracket 5: 300-400% FPL
parameter bracket_5_initial_pct:
  description: "Initial contribution percentage (300% FPL) for Bracket 5 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.06
    2023-01-01: 0.06

parameter bracket_5_final_pct:
  description: "Final contribution percentage (400% FPL) for Bracket 5 per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.085
    2023-01-01: 0.085

# Bracket 6: 400%+ FPL
parameter bracket_6_initial_pct:
  description: "Flat contribution percentage above 400% FPL per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.085
    2023-01-01: 0.085

parameter income_lower_limit:
  description: "Minimum income as percent of FPL for PTC eligibility per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1.0
    2023-01-01: 1.0

parameter income_upper_limit_ira:
  description: "Maximum income as percent of FPL for PTC eligibility under IRA (2021-2025) per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)(A)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 10.0  # Effectively no upper limit under IRA
    2023-01-01: 10.0

variable applicable_percentage:
  imports:
    - 26/36B/d#household_income_pct_fpl
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "Applicable Percentage"
  description: "Applicable percentage for expected contribution per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(A), as amended by IRA"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    income_pct = household_income_pct_fpl
    # Under IRA (2021-2025): Income above 400% FPL still eligible at 8.5%
    # Below 100% FPL: No credit (Medicaid eligible in expansion states)
    if income_pct < min_eligibility_pct_fpl:
        return 0
    # Bracket 1: 100-150% FPL (0% contribution under IRA)
    if income_pct < bracket_150_pct:
        # Linear interpolation from initial to final percentage
        range_pct = bracket_150_pct - bracket_100_pct
        range_amt = bracket_1_final_pct - bracket_1_initial_pct
        return bracket_1_initial_pct + (income_pct - bracket_100_pct) / range_pct * range_amt
    # Bracket 2: 150-200% FPL (0% to 2% under IRA)
    if income_pct < bracket_200_pct:
        range_pct = bracket_200_pct - bracket_150_pct
        range_amt = bracket_2_final_pct - bracket_2_initial_pct
        return bracket_2_initial_pct + (income_pct - bracket_150_pct) / range_pct * range_amt
    # Bracket 3: 200-250% FPL (2% to 4% under IRA)
    if income_pct < bracket_250_pct:
        range_pct = bracket_250_pct - bracket_200_pct
        range_amt = bracket_3_final_pct - bracket_3_initial_pct
        return bracket_3_initial_pct + (income_pct - bracket_200_pct) / range_pct * range_amt
    # Bracket 4: 250-300% FPL (4% to 6% under IRA)
    if income_pct < bracket_300_pct:
        range_pct = bracket_300_pct - bracket_250_pct
        range_amt = bracket_4_final_pct - bracket_4_initial_pct
        return bracket_4_initial_pct + (income_pct - bracket_250_pct) / range_pct * range_amt
    # Bracket 5: 300-400% FPL (6% to 8.5% under IRA)
    if income_pct < bracket_400_pct:
        range_pct = bracket_400_pct - bracket_300_pct
        range_amt = bracket_5_final_pct - bracket_5_initial_pct
        return bracket_5_initial_pct + (income_pct - bracket_300_pct) / range_pct * range_amt
    # Bracket 6: 400%+ FPL (8.5% flat under IRA - no cliff!)
    return bracket_6_initial_pct
  default: 0
  tests:
    # 2024 FPL Levels & Applicable Percentages (under IRA 2021-2025)
    # Single: $15,060 FPL
    # Bracket 1: 100-150% FPL (0% initial to 0% final)
    # Bracket 2: 150-200% FPL (0% to 2%)
    # Bracket 3: 200-250% FPL (2% to 4%)
    # Bracket 4: 250-300% FPL (4% to 6%)
    # Bracket 5: 300-400% FPL (6% to 8.5%)
    # Bracket 6: 400%+ FPL (8.5% flat)

    # Bracket 1 Tests (100-150% FPL, 0% contribution)
    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 100% FPL (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.0
      expect: 0

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 125% FPL (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.25
      expect: 0

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 150% FPL boundary (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.5
      expect: 0

    # Bracket 2 Tests (150-200% FPL, 0% to 2%)
    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 150% FPL start (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.5
      expect: 0

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 175% FPL (1% interpolated)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.75
      expect: 0.01

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 200% FPL (2%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.0
      expect: 0.02

    # Bracket 3 Tests (200-250% FPL, 2% to 4%)
    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 200% FPL start (2%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.0
      expect: 0.02

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 225% FPL (3% interpolated)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.25
      expect: 0.03

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 250% FPL (4%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.5
      expect: 0.04

    # Bracket 4 Tests (250-300% FPL, 4% to 6%)
    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 250% FPL start (4%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.5
      expect: 0.04

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 275% FPL (5% interpolated)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.75
      expect: 0.05

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 300% FPL (6%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.0
      expect: 0.06

    # Bracket 5 Tests (300-400% FPL, 6% to 8.5%)
    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 300% FPL start (6%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.0
      expect: 0.06

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 350% FPL (7.25% interpolated)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.5
      expect: 0.0725

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 400% FPL (8.5%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 4.0
      expect: 0.085

    # Bracket 6 Tests (400%+ FPL, 8.5% flat under IRA)
    - name: "Applicable percentage - above 400% FPL (8.5% flat)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 4.5
      expect: 0.085

    - name: "Applicable percentage - well above 400% FPL (8.5% flat)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 6.0
      expect: 0.085

    - name: "Applicable percentage - very high income (8.5% flat)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 10.0
      expect: 0.085

    # Edge Cases - Below 100% FPL
    - name: "Applicable percentage - below 100% FPL (0 credit)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 0.75
      expect: 0

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 50% FPL (0 credit)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 0.5
      expect: 0

    # Interpolation accuracy tests
    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 162.5% FPL (1% interpolated)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.625
      expect: 0.01

    - name: "Applicable percentage - at 237.5% FPL (3% interpolated)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.375
      expect: 0.03

documents.title: Applicable Taxpayer for PTC
documents.text:
(c) DEFINITION AND RULES RELATING TO APPLICABLE TAXPAYER, COVERAGE MONTHS,
AND QUALIFIED HEALTH PLAN.--
(1) APPLICABLE TAXPAYER.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--The term 'applicable taxpayer' means, with respect to
any taxable year, a taxpayer whose household income for the taxable
year equals or exceeds 100 percent but does not exceed 400 percent
of an amount equal to the poverty line for a family of the size
involved.
(B) SPECIAL RULE FOR CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS LAWFULLY PRESENT IN THE
UNITED STATES.--
(C) MARRIED COUPLES MUST FILE JOINT RETURN.--If the taxpayer is married
(within the meaning of section 7703) at the close of the taxable
year, the taxpayer shall be treated as an applicable taxpayer only
if the taxpayer and the taxpayer's spouse file a joint return for
the taxable year.
(D) DENIAL OF CREDIT TO DEPENDENTS.--No credit shall be allowed under
this section to any individual with respect to whom a deduction
under section 151 is allowable to another taxpayer for a taxable
year beginning in the calendar year in which such individual's
taxable year begins.
documents.code:
text: """
(c) DEFINITION AND RULES RELATING TO APPLICABLE TAXPAYER, COVERAGE MONTHS,
AND QUALIFIED HEALTH PLAN.--
(1) APPLICABLE TAXPAYER.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--The term 'applicable taxpayer' means, with respect to
any taxable year, a taxpayer whose household income for the taxable
year equals or exceeds 100 percent but does not exceed 400 percent
of an amount equal to the poverty line for a family of the size
involved.
(B) SPECIAL RULE FOR CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS LAWFULLY PRESENT IN THE
UNITED STATES.--
(C) MARRIED COUPLES MUST FILE JOINT RETURN.--If the taxpayer is married
(within the meaning of section 7703) at the close of the taxable
year, the taxpayer shall be treated as an applicable taxpayer only
if the taxpayer and the taxpayer's spouse file a joint return for
the taxable year.
(D) DENIAL OF CREDIT TO DEPENDENTS.--No credit shall be allowed under
this section to any individual with respect to whom a deduction
under section 151 is allowable to another taxpayer for a taxable
year beginning in the calendar year in which such individual's
taxable year begins.
"""
variable applicable_taxpayer:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Applicable Taxpayer for PTC"
  description: "Meets applicable taxpayer requirements per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)"
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Use is_applicable_taxpayer which consolidates all eligibility requirements
    return is_applicable_taxpayer

variable ptc_filing_status_eligible:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "PTC Filing Status Eligible"
  description: "Eligible filing status per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)(C)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Married filing separately is generally ineligible
    # Exception: Victims of domestic abuse or spousal abandonment (not modeled)
    return filing_status != "separate"

variable ptc_income_eligible:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "PTC Income Eligible"
  description: "Household income within eligible range per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    income_pct = household_income_pct_fpl
    # Must be at least 100% FPL
    # Those below 100% may be eligible for Medicaid
    if income_pct < income_lower_limit:
        return False
    # Under IRA (2021-2025): No upper limit
    # Credit phases out naturally via 8.5% contribution rate
    return income_pct <= income_upper_limit_ira

variable ptc_not_dependent:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "PTC Not Claimed as Dependent"
  description: "Not claimed as dependent by another per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)(D)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Taxpayer cannot be claimed as dependent by another
    return not is_tax_unit_dependent

variable is_applicable_taxpayer:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Applicable Taxpayer for PTC"
  description: "Meets all applicable taxpayer requirements per 26 USC 36B(c)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # All conditions must be met
    if not ptc_filing_status_eligible:
        return False
    if not ptc_income_eligible:
        return False
    if not ptc_not_dependent:
        return False
    return True

input ptc_coverage_months:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "PTC Coverage Months"
  description: "Number of months enrolled in qualified health plan per 26 USC 36B(c)(2)"
  default: 0

input enrolled_in_qualified_health_plan:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Enrolled in Qualified Health Plan"
  description: "Enrolled in QHP through Marketplace per 26 USC 36B(c)(3)"
  default: false

    - name: "Income eligible - at 100% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 15_060
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income eligible - at 150% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 22_590
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income eligible - at 200% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 30_120
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income eligible - at 300% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 45_180
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income eligible - at 400% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 60_240
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income eligible - above 400% FPL (IRA allows)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 90_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income ineligible - below 100% FPL"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 10_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Income ineligible - claimed as dependent"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 30_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: true
      expect: false

    # Filing Status Tests
    - name: "Filing status ineligible - married filing separately"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 30_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Filing status eligible - single"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 30_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Filing status eligible - married filing jointly"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 40_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 20_440
        ptc_household_size: 2
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Filing status eligible - head of household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 30_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    # Family Size Tests
    - name: "Income eligible - family of 4 at 200% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 62_400
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 31_200
        ptc_household_size: 4
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Income eligible - family of 4 below 100% FPL threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 20_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 31_200
        ptc_household_size: 4
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: false

    # Edge Cases at FPL Boundaries
    - name: "Edge case - exactly at 100% FPL (single)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 15_060
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Edge case - just below 100% FPL (single)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 15_059
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Edge case - exactly at 400% FPL (single)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 60_240
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Edge case - well above 400% FPL (IRA eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_income: 120_000
        ptc_federal_poverty_level: 15_060
        ptc_household_size: 1
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_tax_unit_dependent: false
      expect: true

documents.title: PTC Household Size
documents.text:
(d) TERMS RELATING TO INCOME AND FAMILIES.--For purposes of this section--
(1) FAMILY SIZE.--The family size involved with respect to any taxpayer
shall be equal to the number of individuals for whom the taxpayer is
allowed a deduction under section 151 (relating to allowance of
deduction for personal exemptions) for the taxable year.
(2) HOUSEHOLD INCOME.--
(A) HOUSEHOLD INCOME.--The term 'household income' means, with respect
to any taxpayer, an amount equal to the sum of--
(i) the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer, plus
(ii) the aggregate modified adjusted gross incomes of all other
individuals who... were taken into account in determining the
taxpayer's family size under paragraph (1)...
(B) MODIFIED ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.--The term 'modified adjusted gross
income' means adjusted gross income increased by--
(i) any amount excluded from gross income under section 911,
(ii) any amount of interest received or accrued by the taxpayer
during the taxable year which is exempt from tax, and
(iii) an amount equal to the portion of the taxpayer's social
security benefits (as defined in section 86(d)) which is not
included in gross income...
(3) POVERTY LINE.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--The term 'poverty line' has the meaning given that
term in section 2110(c)(5) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C.
1397jj(c)(5)).
(B) POVERTY LINE USED.--In the case of any qualified health plan
offered through an Exchange for coverage during a taxable year
beginning in a calendar year, the poverty line used shall be the
most recently published poverty line as of the 1st day of the
regular enrollment period for coverage during such calendar year.
documents.code:
text: """
(d) TERMS RELATING TO INCOME AND FAMILIES.--For purposes of this section--
(1) FAMILY SIZE.--The family size involved with respect to any taxpayer
shall be equal to the number of individuals for whom the taxpayer is
allowed a deduction under section 151 (relating to allowance of
deduction for personal exemptions) for the taxable year.
(2) HOUSEHOLD INCOME.--
(A) HOUSEHOLD INCOME.--The term 'household income' means, with respect
to any taxpayer, an amount equal to the sum of--
(i) the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer, plus
(ii) the aggregate modified adjusted gross incomes of all other
individuals who... were taken into account in determining the
taxpayer's family size under paragraph (1)...
(B) MODIFIED ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.--The term 'modified adjusted gross
income' means adjusted gross income increased by--
(i) any amount excluded from gross income under section 911,
(ii) any amount of interest received or accrued by the taxpayer
during the taxable year which is exempt from tax, and
(iii) an amount equal to the portion of the taxpayer's social
security benefits (as defined in section 86(d)) which is not
included in gross income...
(3) POVERTY LINE.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--The term 'poverty line' has the meaning given that
term in section 2110(c)(5) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C.
1397jj(c)(5)).
(B) POVERTY LINE USED.--In the case of any qualified health plan
offered through an Exchange for coverage during a taxable year
beginning in a calendar year, the poverty line used shall be the
most recently published poverty line as of the 1st day of the
regular enrollment period for coverage during such calendar year.
"""
parameter definitions:
  description: "Container for PTC definitions per 26 USC 36B(d)"

variable ptc_household_size:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "PTC Household Size"
  description: "Family size for FPL determination per 26 USC 36B(d)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Household includes:
    # - Taxpayer (and spouse if filing jointly)
    # - All dependents for whom deduction under section 151 is allowed
    return tax_unit_size

variable ptc_magi:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Modified AGI for PTC"
  description: "MAGI for PTC purposes per 26 USC 36B(d)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # MAGI = AGI + excluded items:
    # (i) Foreign earned income exclusion (Section 911)
    # (ii) Tax-exempt interest
    # (iii) Non-taxable Social Security benefits
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    # For simplified implementation, using AGI as approximation
    # Full implementation would add:
    # + foreign_earned_income_exclusion
    # + tax_exempt_interest
    # + nontaxable_social_security_benefits
    return agi

variable household_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Household Income for PTC"
  description: "Modified AGI of taxpayer plus dependents per 26 USC 36B(d)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Household income = MAGI of taxpayer + MAGI of dependents required to file
    # For simplicity, using tax unit MAGI (which includes all members)
    return ptc_magi

variable ptc_federal_poverty_level:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Federal Poverty Level for PTC"
  description: "FPL for household size per 26 USC 36B(d)(3) and HHS Guidelines"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    size = ptc_household_size
    if size <= 0:
        return 0
    # FPL = First person amount + (additional persons * additional amount)
    # Uses 48 contiguous states + DC guidelines (Alaska/Hawaii have higher FPL)
    return fpl_first_person + max(0, size - 1) * fpl_additional_person

variable household_income_pct_fpl:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "Household Income as Percentage of FPL"
  description: "Household income relative to federal poverty level"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    income = household_income
    fpl = ptc_federal_poverty_level
    if fpl <= 0:
        return 0
    return income / fpl

input slcsp_premium:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Second Lowest Cost Silver Plan Premium"
  description: "SLCSP benchmark premium per 26 USC 36B(b)(3)(B)"
  default: 0

variable slcsp_premium_monthly:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Monthly SLCSP Premium"
  description: "Monthly portion of benchmark premium"
  formula: return slcsp_premium / months_per_year
  tests:
    # 2024 FPL Levels (48 contiguous states + DC)
    # Individual: $15,060
    # Family of 2: $20,440
    # Family of 3: $25,820
    # Family of 4: $31,200
    # Family of 5: $36,580

    # Test FPL Calculation - Single Individual
    - name: "FPL calculation - single at 100% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 1
      expect: 15060

    - name: "FPL calculation - single at 150% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 1
      expect: 15060

    - name: "FPL calculation - single at 200% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 1
      expect: 15060

    - name: "FPL calculation - single at 400% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 1
      expect: 15060

    # Test FPL Calculation - Family of 2
    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 2 at 100% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 2
      expect: 20440

    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 2 at 150% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 2
      expect: 20440

    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 2 at 200% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 2
      expect: 20440

    # Test FPL Calculation - Family of 3
    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 3 at 100% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 3
      expect: 25820

    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 3 at 200% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 3
      expect: 25820

    # Test FPL Calculation - Family of 4
    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 4 at 100% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 4
      expect: 31200

    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 4 at 150% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ptc_household_size: 4
      expect: 31200

    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 4 at 300% FPL (2024)"
      period: 2024-01

      expect: 31200

    - name: "FPL calculation - family of 5 at 100% FPL (2024)"

documents.title: Household Income as % of Federal Poverty Line
documents.text:
(f) RECONCILIATION OF CREDIT AND ADVANCE CREDIT.--
(1) IN GENERAL.--The amount of the credit allowed under this section for
any taxable year shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the amount
of any advance payment of such credit under section 1412 of the
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
(2) EXCESS ADVANCE PAYMENTS.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--If the advance payments to a taxpayer under section
1412 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act for a
taxable year exceed the credit allowed by this section (determined
without regard to paragraph (1)), the tax imposed by this chapter
for the taxable year shall be increased by the amount of such
excess.
(B) LIMITATION ON INCREASE.--
(i) IN GENERAL.--In the case of a taxpayer whose household income is
less than 400 percent of the poverty line for the size of the
family involved for the taxable year, the amount of the increase
under subparagraph (A) shall in no event exceed the applicable
dollar amount determined in accordance with the following table...
documents.code:
text: """
(f) RECONCILIATION OF CREDIT AND ADVANCE CREDIT.--
(1) IN GENERAL.--The amount of the credit allowed under this section for
any taxable year shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the amount
of any advance payment of such credit under section 1412 of the
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
(2) EXCESS ADVANCE PAYMENTS.--
(A) IN GENERAL.--If the advance payments to a taxpayer under section
1412 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act for a
taxable year exceed the credit allowed by this section (determined
without regard to paragraph (1)), the tax imposed by this chapter
for the taxable year shall be increased by the amount of such
excess.
(B) LIMITATION ON INCREASE.--
(i) IN GENERAL.--In the case of a taxpayer whose household income is
less than 400 percent of the poverty line for the size of the
family involved for the taxable year, the amount of the increase
under subparagraph (A) shall in no event exceed the applicable
dollar amount determined in accordance with the following table...
"""
parameter repay_cap_under_200_single:
  description: "Maximum excess APTC repayment for single filers under 200% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 300
    2023-01-01: 300
    2022-01-01: 300

parameter repay_cap_under_200_joint:
  description: "Maximum excess APTC repayment for joint filers under 200% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 600
    2023-01-01: 600
    2022-01-01: 600

parameter repay_cap_200_300_single:
  description: "Maximum excess APTC repayment for single filers 200-300% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 750
    2023-01-01: 750
    2022-01-01: 750

parameter repay_cap_200_300_joint:
  description: "Maximum excess APTC repayment for joint filers 200-300% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1_500
    2023-01-01: 1_500
    2022-01-01: 1_500

parameter repay_cap_300_400_single:
  description: "Maximum excess APTC repayment for single filers 300-400% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1_200
    2023-01-01: 1_200
    2022-01-01: 1_200

parameter repay_cap_300_400_joint:
  description: "Maximum excess APTC repayment for joint filers 300-400% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2_400
    2023-01-01: 2_400
    2022-01-01: 2_400

parameter bracket_200_pct:
  description: "200% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2.0
    2023-01-01: 2.0
    2022-01-01: 2.0

parameter bracket_300_pct:
  description: "300% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 3.0
    2023-01-01: 3.0
    2022-01-01: 3.0

parameter bracket_400_pct:
  description: "400% of federal poverty line threshold per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 4.0
    2023-01-01: 4.0
    2022-01-01: 4.0

input household_income_pct_fpl:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "Household Income as % of Federal Poverty Line"
  description: "Household income expressed as percentage of FPL for family size"
  default: 2.5

parameter reconciliation:
  description: "Container for PTC reconciliation per 26 USC 36B(f)"

input advance_ptc:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Advance Premium Tax Credit"
  description: "Advance payments of PTC made during year per 26 USC 36B(f)(1)"
  default: 0

variable net_ptc_adjustment:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net PTC Adjustment"
  description: "Difference between actual PTC and advance payments per 26 USC 36B(f)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    actual_credit = premium_tax_credit
    advance = advance_ptc
    # Positive = Additional credit due (taxpayer gets refund)
    # Negative = Excess advance (taxpayer owes repayment)
    return actual_credit - advance
  tests:
    - name: "Actual equals advance (no adjustment)"
      inputs:
        premium_tax_credit: 4_800
        advance_ptc: 4_800
      expect: 0
    - name: "Actual exceeds advance (refund due)"
      inputs:
        premium_tax_credit: 5_500
        advance_ptc: 4_800
      expect: 700
    - name: "Advance exceeds actual (repayment owed)"
      inputs:
        premium_tax_credit: 4_000
        advance_ptc: 4_800
      expect: -800
    - name: "Large excess advance payment"
      inputs:
        premium_tax_credit: 3_000
        advance_ptc: 8_500
      expect: -5500

variable excess_aptc_repayment_cap:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Excess APTC Repayment Cap"
  description: "Maximum repayment of excess advance per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    income_pct = household_income_pct_fpl
    is_joint = filing_status == "joint"
    # No cap for income at or above 400% FPL (per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(ii))
    if income_pct >= bracket_400_pct:
        return float("inf")  # No repayment cap above 400% FPL
    # Cap based on income bracket and filing status per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(i) table
    if income_pct < bracket_200_pct:
        if is_joint:
            return repay_cap_under_200_joint
        else:
            return repay_cap_under_200_single
    if income_pct < bracket_300_pct:
        if is_joint:
            return repay_cap_200_300_joint
        else:
            return repay_cap_200_300_single
    # 300-400% FPL
    if is_joint:
        return repay_cap_300_400_joint
    else:
        return repay_cap_300_400_single
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer under 200% FPL"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.5
        filing_status: "single"
      expect: 300
    - name: "Joint filer under 200% FPL"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.8
        filing_status: "joint"
      expect: 600
    - name: "Single filer 200-300% FPL"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.5
        filing_status: "single"
      expect: 750
    - name: "Joint filer 200-300% FPL"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.8
        filing_status: "joint"
      expect: 1500
    - name: "Single filer 300-400% FPL"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.5
        filing_status: "single"
      expect: 1200
    - name: "Joint filer 300-400% FPL"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.9
        filing_status: "joint"
      expect: 2400
    - name: "Single filer at 400% FPL (no cap)"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 4.0
        filing_status: "single"
      # Returns float('inf') when at or above 400% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(ii)
      expect: null  # Infinity value
    - name: "Joint filer above 400% FPL (no cap)"
      inputs:
        household_income_pct_fpl: 5.0
        filing_status: "joint"
      # Returns float('inf') when above 400% FPL per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)(B)(ii)
      expect: null  # Infinity value

variable excess_advance_ptc_repayment:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Excess Advance PTC Repayment"
  description: "Additional tax due for excess advance payments per 26 USC 36B(f)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    adjustment = net_ptc_adjustment
    # If adjustment is positive or zero, no repayment needed
    if adjustment >= 0:
        return 0
    # Excess advance (negative adjustment becomes positive repayment)
    excess = -adjustment
    # Apply repayment cap for those below 400% FPL
    cap = excess_aptc_repayment_cap
    return min(excess, cap)
  tests:
    - name: "No excess advance (actual > advance)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: 500
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.5
        filing_status: "single"
      expect: 0
    - name: "No excess advance (equal)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: 0
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.5
        filing_status: "single"
      expect: 0
    - name: "Small excess advance below cap (under 200% FPL)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: -200
        household_income_pct_fpl: 1.8
        filing_status: "single"
      # Cap is $300 for single filer under 200% FPL
      expect: 200
    - name: "Excess advance hits repayment cap (200-300% FPL)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: -1_000
        household_income_pct_fpl: 2.5
        filing_status: "single"
      # Cap is $750 for single filer 200-300% FPL
      expect: 750
    - name: "Large excess advance (300-400% FPL)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: -5_500
        household_income_pct_fpl: 3.5
        filing_status: "single"
      # Cap is $1200 for single filer 300-400% FPL
      expect: 1200

variable additional_ptc_refund:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional PTC Refund"
  description: "Additional refund if actual PTC exceeds advance payments"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    adjustment = net_ptc_adjustment
    # If positive, taxpayer is owed additional credit
    return max(0, adjustment)
  tests:
    - name: "No additional refund (actual = advance)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "No refund (excess advance)"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: -500
      expect: 0
    - name: "Small additional refund"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: 300
      expect: 300
    - name: "Large additional refund"
      inputs:
        net_ptc_adjustment: 1_200
      expect: 1200

documents.title: Credit for Elderly or Disabled
documents.text:
Section 37 provides the credit for the elderly or the disabled. This is a
nonrefundable credit available to individuals who are 65 or older, or who
are under 65 and retired on permanent and total disability.

(a) General rule - In the case of a qualified individual, there shall be
allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable
year an amount equal to 15 percent of such individual's section 22 amount
for such taxable year.

Note: Despite being in the refundable credits section, this credit is actually
nonrefundable. It reduces tax liability to zero but does not generate refunds.

documents.title: General Business Credit
documents.text:
Section 38 establishes the general business credit, which is the sum of
numerous business-related credits. While primarily nonrefundable, certain
components may be refundable in specific circumstances.

(a) Allowance of credit - There shall be allowed as a credit against the
tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the
sum of the business credit carryforwards, the current year business credit,
and the business credit carrybacks.

(b) Current year business credit - For purposes of this subpart, the amount
of the current year business credit is the sum of the following credits:
  (1) Investment credit (Section 46)
  (2) Work opportunity credit (Section 51)
  (3) Alcohol fuels credit (Section 40)
  (4) Research credit (Section 41)
  (5) Low-income housing credit (Section 42)
  (6) Disabled access credit (Section 44)
  (7) Renewable electricity production credit (Section 45)
  ... and many others
documents.code:
#
# Reference: https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/38

text: """
Section 38 establishes the general business credit, which is the sum of
numerous business-related credits. While primarily nonrefundable, certain
components may be refundable in specific circumstances.

(a) Allowance of credit - There shall be allowed as a credit against the
tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the
sum of the business credit carryforwards, the current year business credit,
and the business credit carrybacks.

(b) Current year business credit - For purposes of this subpart, the amount
of the current year business credit is the sum of the following credits:
  (1) Investment credit (Section 46)
  (2) Work opportunity credit (Section 51)
  (3) Alcohol fuels credit (Section 40)
  (4) Research credit (Section 41)
  (5) Low-income housing credit (Section 42)
  (6) Disabled access credit (Section 44)
  (7) Renewable electricity production credit (Section 45)
  ... and many others
"""

input general_business_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "General Business Credit"
  description: "Sum of current year business credits per 26 USC 38"
  default: 0

input general_business_credit_carryforward:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "General Business Credit Carryforward"
  description: "Business credit carryforward from prior years"
  default: 0

input general_business_credit_carryback:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "General Business Credit Carryback"
  description: "Business credit carryback from future years"
  default: 0

documents.title: Net Taxable Distribution
documents.text:
(a) Taxability of beneficiary of exempt trust.--
(1) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in this section, any
amount actually distributed to any distributee by any employees'
trust described in section 401(a) which is exempt from tax under
section 501(a) shall be taxable to the distributee, in the taxable
year of the distributee in which distributed, under section 72
(relating to annuities).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Taxability of beneficiary of exempt trust.--
(1) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in this section, any
amount actually distributed to any distributee by any employees'
trust described in section 401(a) which is exempt from tax under
section 501(a) shall be taxable to the distributee, in the taxable
year of the distributee in which distributed, under section 72
(relating to annuities).
"""
variable distributions:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/402/e/4#early_withdrawal_penalty_401k
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Taxable Distribution"
  description: "Taxable distribution after excluding rollover amounts"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Traditional distributions are fully taxable
    traditional_taxable = traditional_401k_distribution
    # Roth distributions are tax-free if qualified
    # Qualified: 5-year holding period AND (age 59.5+ OR death/disability)
    is_qualified_roth = roth_401k_5_year_satisfied and age >= early_withdrawal_penalty_age
    # Non-qualified Roth: earnings portion is taxable
    # Simplified: assume contributions recovered first (FIFO)
    if is_qualified_roth:
        roth_taxable = 0
    else:
        roth_taxable = max(0, roth_401k_distribution - roth_401k_contribution_basis)
    return traditional_taxable + roth_taxable
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Traditional 401k distribution, fully taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_401k_distribution: 50_000
        roth_401k_distribution: 0
        roth_401k_5_year_satisfied: false
        age: 65
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
      expect: 50_000  # Traditional is fully taxable
    - name: "Qualified Roth distribution, tax-free"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_401k_distribution: 0
        roth_401k_distribution: 30_000
        roth_401k_5_year_satisfied: true
        roth_401k_contribution_basis: 25_000
        age: 62
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
      expect: 0  # Qualified Roth is entirely tax-free
    - name: "Non-qualified Roth, earnings taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_401k_distribution: 0
        roth_401k_distribution: 40_000
        roth_401k_5_year_satisfied: false
        roth_401k_contribution_basis: 30_000
        age: 45
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
      expect: 10_000  # Only earnings (40_000 - 30_000) are taxable
    - name: "Mixed distributions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_401k_distribution: 20_000
        roth_401k_distribution: 15_000
        roth_401k_5_year_satisfied: true
        roth_401k_contribution_basis: 10_000
        age: 60
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
      expect: 20_000  # Traditional taxable, qualified Roth tax-free

documents.title: Required Minimum Distribution
documents.text:
(9) Required distributions.--
(A) In general.--A trust shall not constitute a qualified trust under
this subsection unless the plan provides that the entire interest
of each employee--
(i) will be distributed to such employee not later than the required
beginning date, or
(ii) will be distributed, beginning not later than the required
beginning date...
documents.code:
text: """
(9) Required distributions.--
(A) In general.--A trust shall not constitute a qualified trust under
this subsection unless the plan provides that the entire interest
of each employee--
(i) will be distributed to such employee not later than the required
beginning date, or
(ii) will be distributed, beginning not later than the required
beginning date...
"""

parameter uniform_lifetime_table:
  description: "Life expectancy divisors for RMD calculation (Table III)"
  unit: years
  values:
    # Schedule: [27.4, 26.5, 25.5, 24.6, 23.7, 22.9, 22.0, 21.1, 20.2, 19.4, 18.5, 17.7, 16.8, 16.0, 15.2, 14.4, 13.7, 12.9, 12.2, 11.5, 10.8, 10.1, 9.5, 8.9, 8.4, 7.8, 7.3, 6.8, 6.4, 6.0, 5.6, 5.2, 4.9, 4.6, 4.3, 4.1, 3.9, 3.7, 3.5, 3.4, 3.3, 3.1, 3.0, 2.9, 2.8, 2.7, 2.5, 2.3, 2.0]

parameter rmd_birth_year_thresholds:
  description: "Birth year thresholds for RMD age determination per SECURE 2.0"
  values:
    # Schedule: [72, 73, 75]

input rmd:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Required Minimum Distribution"
  description: "Minimum amount required to be distributed from qualified retirement plan per 26 USC 402(c)"

input birth_year:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Birth Year"
  description: "Year of birth for RMD age determination"

input prior_year_401k_balance:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "401(k) Prior Year Balance"
  description: "Account balance as of December 31 of prior year for RMD calculation"
  default: 0

input is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Still Working for Plan Sponsor"
  description: "Whether employee is still working for the 401(k) plan sponsor"
  default: false

input is_5_percent_owner:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is 5% Owner"
  description: "Whether employee owns 5% or more of the business"
  default: false

variable rmd_applicable_age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "RMD Applicable Age"
  description: "Age at which required minimum distributions must begin"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Use cut() to look up applicable age from birth year thresholds
    return cut(birth_year, rmd_birth_year_thresholds)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Birth year 1950 (age 72 under SECURE 1.0)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1950
      expect: 72
    - name: "Birth year 1951 (age 72)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1951
      expect: 72
    - name: "Birth year 1952 (age 73 under SECURE 2.0)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1952
      expect: 73
    - name: "Birth year 1960 (age 73)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1960
      expect: 73
    - name: "Birth year 1961 onwards (age 75 under SECURE 2.0)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1961
      expect: 75
    - name: "Birth year 1970 (age 75)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1970
      expect: 75

variable has_reached_rmd_age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Reached RMD Age"
  description: "Whether individual has reached required minimum distribution age"
  formula: return age >= rmd_applicable_age
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Age 72, RMD age 72 (reached)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 72
        rmd_applicable_age: 72
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 71, RMD age 72 (not reached)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 71
        rmd_applicable_age: 72
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 73, RMD age 73 (reached)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 73
        rmd_applicable_age: 73
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 75, RMD age 73 (exceeded)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 75
        rmd_applicable_age: 73
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 74, RMD age 75 (not reached)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 74
        rmd_applicable_age: 75
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 75, RMD age 75 (reached)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 75
        rmd_applicable_age: 75
      expect: true

variable is_rmd_required:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "RMD Required"
  description: "Whether a required minimum distribution must be taken this year"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must have reached RMD age
    if not has_reached_rmd_age:
        return False
    # Still-working exception for non-5% owners
    if is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor and not is_5_percent_owner:
        return False
    # Must have account balance
    if prior_year_401k_balance <= 0:
        return False
    return True
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Basic case: reached RMD age, not working, has balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: false
        is_5_percent_owner: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: 100_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Not reached RMD age yet"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: false
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: false
        is_5_percent_owner: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: 100_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Still-working exception: working and not 5% owner"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: true
        is_5_percent_owner: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: 100_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Still-working exception does not apply: 5% owner"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: true
        is_5_percent_owner: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 100_000
      expect: true
    - name: "No account balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: false
        is_5_percent_owner: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: 0
      expect: false
    - name: "Negative account balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: false
        is_5_percent_owner: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: -1_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Retired with 5% ownership (still-working exception does not apply)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: false
        is_5_percent_owner: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 500_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Small account balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_reached_rmd_age: true
        is_still_working_for_plan_sponsor: false
        is_5_percent_owner: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: 1
      expect: true

variable rmd_divisor:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Decimal
  label: "RMD Divisor"
  description: "Life expectancy divisor from IRS Uniform Lifetime Table"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Use cut() to look up divisor from Uniform Lifetime Table
    return cut(age, uniform_lifetime_table)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Age 72 (start of RMDs under prior law)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 72
      expect: 27.4
    - name: "Age 73"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 73
      expect: 26.5
    - name: "Age 80 (mid-range)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 80
      expect: 19.4
    - name: "Age 85"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 85
      expect: 15.2
    - name: "Age 90"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 90
      expect: 11.5
    - name: "Age 95"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 95
      expect: 9.5
    - name: "Age 100 (advanced age)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 100
      expect: 5.6
    - name: "Age 110 (very advanced age)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 110
      expect: 2.0

variable required_minimum_distribution:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Required Minimum Distribution"
  description: "Minimum amount that must be withdrawn from retirement account"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if not is_rmd_required:
        return 0
    # RMD = Prior year balance / Life expectancy divisor
    return prior_year_401k_balance / rmd_divisor
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "RMD not required (age not reached)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: false
        prior_year_401k_balance: 100_000
        rmd_divisor: 27.4
      expect: 0
    - name: "Age 72 with $500,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 500_000
        rmd_divisor: 27.4
      expect: 18248.18
    - name: "Age 73 with $300,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 300_000
        rmd_divisor: 26.5
      expect: 11320.75
    - name: "Age 80 with $250,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 250_000
        rmd_divisor: 19.4
      expect: 12886.60
    - name: "Age 85 with $1,000,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 1_000_000
        rmd_divisor: 15.2
      expect: 65789.47
    - name: "Age 90 with modest balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 100_000
        rmd_divisor: 11.5
      expect: 8695.65
    - name: "Age 100 with large balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_rmd_required: true
        prior_year_401k_balance: 2_000_000
        rmd_divisor: 5.6
      expect: 357142.86

variable rmd_shortfall_penalty:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "RMD Shortfall Penalty"
  description: "Excise tax on failure to take required minimum distribution"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Input: Actual distribution taken
    # For now, assume full compliance
    return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Full compliance: no penalty"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Placeholder: assumes full compliance"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {}
      expect: 0
    - name: "RMD penalty will depend on shortfall percentage (future implementation)"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {}
      expect: 0

documents.title: Early Withdrawal Penalty
documents.text:
(t) 10-percent additional tax on early distributions from qualified
retirement plans.--
(1) Imposition of additional tax.--If any taxpayer receives any amount
from a qualified retirement plan (as defined in section 4974(c)),
the taxpayer's tax under this chapter for the taxable year in which
such amount is received shall be increased by an amount equal to
10 percent of the portion of such amount which is includible in
gross income.
documents.code:
text: """
(t) 10-percent additional tax on early distributions from qualified
retirement plans.--
(1) Imposition of additional tax.--If any taxpayer receives any amount
from a qualified retirement plan (as defined in section 4974(c)),
the taxpayer's tax under this chapter for the taxable year in which
such amount is received shall be increased by an amount equal to
10 percent of the portion of such amount which is includible in
gross income.
"""
variable early_withdrawal:
  imports:
    - 26/402/a#taxable_401k_distribution
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Early Withdrawal Penalty"
  description: "10% additional tax on early distributions from retirement plans per 72(t)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # No penalty if no taxable distribution
    if taxable_401k_distribution <= 0:
        return False
    # Exception (A)(i): Age 59-1/2 or older
    if age >= early_withdrawal_penalty_age:
        return False
    # Exception (A)(ii): Death
    if is_death_distribution:
        return False
    # Exception (A)(iii): Disability
    if is_disabled:
        return False
    # Exception (A)(iv): SEPP/72(t) payments
    if is_sepp_distribution:
        return False
    # Exception (A)(vi): QDRO
    if is_qdro_distribution:
        return False
    # Exception (A)(vii): Separation at 55+ (401k only)
    if is_age_55_separation_distribution:
        return False
    # Exception (J): Terminal illness
    if is_terminal_illness_distribution:
        return False
    # If none of the exceptions apply, penalty applies
    return True
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Early withdrawal, no exceptions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_401k_distribution: 25_000
        age: 45
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
        is_death_distribution: false
        is_disabled: false
        is_sepp_distribution: false
        is_qdro_distribution: false
        is_age_55_separation_distribution: false
        is_terminal_illness_distribution: false
      expect: true  # Penalty applies
    - name: "Age 59.5 or older, no penalty"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_401k_distribution: 30_000
        age: 60
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
        is_death_distribution: false
        is_disabled: false
        is_sepp_distribution: false
        is_qdro_distribution: false
        is_age_55_separation_distribution: false
        is_terminal_illness_distribution: false
      expect: false  # Age exception
    - name: "Disability exception"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_401k_distribution: 20_000
        age: 40
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
        is_death_distribution: false
        is_disabled: true
        is_sepp_distribution: false
        is_qdro_distribution: false
        is_age_55_separation_distribution: false
        is_terminal_illness_distribution: false
      expect: false  # Disability exception
    - name: "No taxable distribution"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_401k_distribution: 0
        age: 35
        early_withdrawal_penalty_age: 59.5
        is_death_distribution: false
        is_disabled: false
        is_sepp_distribution: false
        is_qdro_distribution: false
        is_age_55_separation_distribution: false
        is_terminal_illness_distribution: false
      expect: false  # No distribution means no penalty

documents.title: IRA Definitions
documents.text:
(a) Individual retirement account.--For purposes of this section, the term
'individual retirement account' means a trust created or organized in
the United States for the exclusive benefit of an individual or his
beneficiaries...
