    return rmd_applicable_age
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Younger than RMD age"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1970
        age: 54
      expect: 0
    - name: "At RMD age boundary (2024: age 73)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1951
        age: 73
      expect: 73
    - name: "Above RMD age"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        birth_year: 1945
        age: 79
      expect: 73

variable is_ira_reached_rmd_age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "IRA Reached RMD Age"
  description: "Whether individual has reached IRA required minimum distribution age"
  formula: return age >= ira_rmd_applicable_age
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Young person not at RMD age"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 45
        birth_year: 1979
      expect: false
    - name: "Person at RMD age (73 in 2024)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 73
        birth_year: 1951
      expect: true
    - name: "Elderly person well past RMD age"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 82
        birth_year: 1942
      expect: true

input ira_prior_year_balance:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "IRA Prior Year Balance"
  description: "Total IRA account balance as of December 31 of prior year"
  default: 0

variable ira_required_minimum_distribution:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "IRA Required Minimum Distribution"
  description: "Minimum amount that must be withdrawn from IRA"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must have reached RMD age
    if not is_ira_reached_rmd_age:
    return 0
    # Must have account balance
    if ira_prior_year_balance <= 0:
    return 0
    # RMD = Prior year balance / divisor from Uniform Lifetime Table
    # Reuses rmd_divisor from 401(k) rules (same table)
    return ira_prior_year_balance / rmd_divisor
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No RMD - person under age 73"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 60
        birth_year: 1964
        ira_prior_year_balance: 100_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "No RMD - no account balance despite being at RMD age"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 75
        birth_year: 1949
        ira_prior_year_balance: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "RMD calculation - age 73 with $200,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 73
        birth_year: 1951
        ira_prior_year_balance: 200_000
      expect: 7518
    - name: "RMD calculation - age 75 with $350,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 75
        birth_year: 1949
        ira_prior_year_balance: 350_000
      expect: 10769
    - name: "RMD calculation - age 82 with $500,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 82
        birth_year: 1942
        ira_prior_year_balance: 500_000
      expect: 16393
    - name: "Large RMD - age 90 with $1,000,000 balance"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        age: 90
        birth_year: 1934
        ira_prior_year_balance: 1_000_000
      expect: 34483

input has_simple_ira:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has SIMPLE IRA"
  description: "Whether individual has a SIMPLE IRA (higher contribution limits)"
  default: false

input has_sep_ira:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has SEP IRA"
  description: "Whether individual has a SEP IRA (self-employed)"
  default: false

variable total_ira_balance:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total IRA Balance"
  description: "Combined balance of all traditional and Roth IRAs"
  formula: return traditional_ira_balance + roth_ira_balance
  tests:
    - name: "No IRAs"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_balance: 0
        roth_ira_balance: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Traditional IRA only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_balance: 150_000
        roth_ira_balance: 0
      expect: 150000
    - name: "Roth IRA only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_balance: 0
        roth_ira_balance: 100_000
      expect: 100000
    - name: "Combined traditional and Roth IRAs"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_balance: 200_000
        roth_ira_balance: 150_000
      expect: 350000
    - name: "Both IRAs maxed out"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_balance: 500_000
        roth_ira_balance: 300_000
      expect: 800000

documents.title: IRA Early Withdrawal Penalty
documents.text:
(d) Tax treatment of distributions.--
(1) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, any
amount paid or distributed out of an individual retirement plan
shall be included in gross income by the payee or distributee, as
the case may be, in the manner provided under section 72.
documents.code:
text: """
(d) Tax treatment of distributions.--
(1) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, any
amount paid or distributed out of an individual retirement plan
shall be included in gross income by the payee or distributee, as
the case may be, in the manner provided under section 72.
"""

parameter early_withdrawal_penalty_threshold_age:
  description: "Age at which early withdrawal penalty no longer applies"
  unit: years
  values:
    1977-01-01: 59.5

variable distributions:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "IRA Early Withdrawal Penalty"
  description: "10% additional tax on early IRA distributions per 72(t)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if traditional_ira_distribution <= 0:
        return 0
    # If no basis, entire distribution is taxable
    if traditional_ira_basis <= 0:
        return traditional_ira_distribution
    # Pro-rata rule: basis recovery based on ratio of basis to total value
    # Total value = year-end value + current year distributions
    total_value = traditional_ira_total_value + traditional_ira_distribution
    if total_value <= 0:
        return traditional_ira_distribution
    # Non-taxable ratio = basis / total value
    nontaxable_ratio = min(1.0, traditional_ira_basis / total_value)
    nontaxable_amount = traditional_ira_distribution * nontaxable_ratio
    return traditional_ira_distribution - nontaxable_amount
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No distribution"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_distribution: 0
        traditional_ira_basis: 10_000
        traditional_ira_total_value: 100_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Distribution with no basis (all taxable)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_distribution: 5_000
        traditional_ira_basis: 0
        traditional_ira_total_value: 50_000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Distribution with basis ratio 1:2"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_distribution: 10_000
        traditional_ira_basis: 50_000
        traditional_ira_total_value: 100_000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Distribution with basis ratio 1:3 (after-tax contributions)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_distribution: 12_000
        traditional_ira_basis: 30_000
        traditional_ira_total_value: 90_000
      expect: 8000
    - name: "Small distribution, high basis"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_distribution: 2000
        traditional_ira_basis: 50_000
        traditional_ira_total_value: 60_000
      expect: 1667

documents.title: Is IRA Direct Transfer
documents.text:
(3) Rollover contribution.--An amount is described in this paragraph as
a rollover contribution if it meets the requirements of subparagraphs
(A) and (B).
(A) In general.--Paragraph (1) does not apply to any amount paid or
distributed out of an individual retirement account or individual
retirement annuity to the individual for whose benefit the account
or annuity is maintained if--
(i) the entire amount received (including money and any other property)
is paid into an individual retirement account or individual
retirement annuity (other than an endowment contract) for the
benefit of such individual not later than the 60th day after the
day on which he receives the payment or distribution...
documents.code:
text: """
(3) Rollover contribution.--An amount is described in this paragraph as
a rollover contribution if it meets the requirements of subparagraphs
(A) and (B).
(A) In general.--Paragraph (1) does not apply to any amount paid or
distributed out of an individual retirement account or individual
retirement annuity to the individual for whose benefit the account
or annuity is maintained if--
(i) the entire amount received (including money and any other property)
is paid into an individual retirement account or individual
retirement annuity (other than an endowment contract) for the

day on which he receives the payment or distribution...
"""

parameter rollover_deadline_days:
  description: "Number of days allowed to complete a rollover"
  unit: days
  values:
    1977-01-01: 60

parameter rollover_once_per_months:
  description: "Minimum months between non-direct rollover distributions from same IRA"
  unit: months
  values:
    2013-01-01: 12

input is_ira_direct_transfer:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is IRA Direct Transfer"
  description: "Whether distribution is a direct trustee-to-trustee transfer"
  default: false

input has_prior_12_month_rollover:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Had Prior 12-Month Rollover"
  description: "Whether individual completed a non-direct rollover in prior 12 months"
  default: false

variable rollovers:
  imports: [26/408/d#traditional_ira_distribution]
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Valid IRA Rollover"
  description: "Whether rollover meets statutory requirements"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Direct transfers always permitted - unlimited
    if is_ira_direct_transfer:
        return True
    # 60-day rollover limited to once per 12 months
    if has_prior_12_month_rollover:
        return False
    return True
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Direct trustee-to-trustee transfer (always valid)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_ira_direct_transfer: true
        has_prior_12_month_rollover: true
      expect: true
    - name: "First 60-day rollover (no prior rollover)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_ira_direct_transfer: false
        has_prior_12_month_rollover: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Second 60-day rollover within 12 months (invalid)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_ira_direct_transfer: false
        has_prior_12_month_rollover: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Multiple direct transfers allowed"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_ira_direct_transfer: true
        has_prior_12_month_rollover: true
      expect: true

documents.title: Traditional IRA Contributions
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 408(o) - Tax on Excess Contributions

For purposes of section 4973, in the case of contributions to individual
retirement accounts or individual retirement annuities, the term "excess
contributions" means the sum of—
(1) the excess (if any) of—
(A) the amount contributed for the taxable year to the accounts or for
the annuities (other than a rollover contribution), over
(B) the amount allowable as a deduction under section 219 for such contributions.

26 USC § 4973 imposes a 6% excise tax on excess contributions left in the
account at the end of the tax year.
"""

parameter contribution_limit_excess_tax_rate:
  description: "Excise tax rate on excess IRA contributions"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1977-01-01: 0.06

parameter ira_catchup_age_threshold:
  description: "Age threshold for IRA catch-up contributions"
  unit: years
  values:
    2002-01-01: 50

parameter ira_contribution_limit_under_catchup_age:
  description: "IRA contribution limit for individuals under catch-up age"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 7_000

parameter ira_contribution_limit_catchup_age:
  description: "IRA contribution limit for individuals at or above catch-up age"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 8_000

input traditional_ira_contributions:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Traditional IRA Contributions"
  description: "Amount contributed to traditional IRA accounts during the year"
  default: 0

input roth_ira_contributions:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Roth IRA Contributions"
  description: "Amount contributed to Roth IRA accounts during the year"
  default: 0

variable contribution_limits:
  imports:
    - 26/32/c/2/A#earned_income
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Excess Contribution Penalty"
  description: "6% excise tax on excess IRA contributions left in account"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    total_contributions = traditional_ira_contributions + roth_ira_contributions
    # Determine applicable limit based on age and account type
    if age >= ira_catchup_age_threshold:
        limit = ira_contribution_limit_catchup_age
    else:
        limit = ira_contribution_limit_under_catchup_age

    if total_contributions > limit:
        excess = total_contributions - limit
        return excess * contribution_limit_excess_tax_rate
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No contributions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        roth_ira_contributions: 0
        age: 45
      expect: 0
    - name: "At limit - under 50"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_000
        roth_ira_contributions: 2000
        age: 40
      expect: 0
    - name: "Excess contributions - under 50"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_000
        roth_ira_contributions: 3_000
        age: 45
      expect: 60
    - name: "At limit - age 50+"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 6_000
        roth_ira_contributions: 2000
        age: 52
      expect: 0
    - name: "Excess contributions - age 50+"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_000
        roth_ira_contributions: 4_000
        age: 55
      expect: 60
    - name: "Significant excess - both account types"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        traditional_ira_contributions: 10_000
        roth_ira_contributions: 5_000
        age: 48
      expect: 180

documents.title: Age
documents.text:
(d) Distribution rules.--For purposes of this title--
(1) Exclusion.--Any qualified distribution from a Roth IRA shall not be
includible in gross income.
(2) Qualified distribution.--For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.--The term 'qualified distribution' means any payment
or distribution--
(i) made on or after the date on which the individual attains
age 59-1/2,
(ii) made to a beneficiary (or to the estate of the individual)
on or after the death of the individual,
(iii) attributable to the individual's being disabled, or
(iv) which is a qualified special purpose distribution.
(B) Distributions within nonexclusion period.--A payment or distribution
from a Roth IRA shall not be treated as a qualified distribution...
if such payment or distribution is made within the 5-taxable year
period beginning with the first taxable year for which the
individual made a contribution to a Roth IRA...
documents.code:
text: """
(d) Distribution rules.--For purposes of this title--
(1) Exclusion.--Any qualified distribution from a Roth IRA shall not be
includible in gross income.
(2) Qualified distribution.--For purposes of this subsection--
(A) In general.--The term 'qualified distribution' means any payment
or distribution--
(i) made on or after the date on which the individual attains
age 59-1/2,
(ii) made to a beneficiary (or to the estate of the individual)
on or after the death of the individual,
(iii) attributable to the individual's being disabled, or
(iv) which is a qualified special purpose distribution.
(B) Distributions within nonexclusion period.--A payment or distribution
from a Roth IRA shall not be treated as a qualified distribution...
if such payment or distribution is made within the 5-taxable year
period beginning with the first taxable year for which the
individual made a contribution to a Roth IRA...
"""

# 26 USC 408A(d)(2)(A)(i) - Age threshold for qualified Roth distribution
parameter early_withdrawal_penalty_age:
  description: "Age at which distributions qualify under 408A(d)(2)(A)(i) - 59 1/2"
  unit: years
  values:
    1998-01-01: 59.5

# Basic person attributes needed for Roth IRA distribution rules
input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Person's age at year-end"
  default: 0

# Roth IRA 5-year holding period requirement per 408A(d)(2)(B)
variable is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Roth IRA 5-Year Rule Satisfied"
  description: "Whether the 5-year holding period for qualified Roth distributions has been met per 26 USC 408A(d)(2)(B)"
  formula: |
    # Placeholder: Would require tracking first Roth contribution date
    # and comparing to distribution date (5 years)
    return True
  default: false

# Roth IRA distribution due to death per 408A(d)(2)(A)(ii)
variable is_roth_death_distribution:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Roth Death Distribution"
  description: "Whether distribution is made to beneficiary/estate due to death per 26 USC 408A(d)(2)(A)(ii)"
  formula: |
    # Placeholder: Would require estate information
    return False
  default: false

# Roth IRA owner disability per 408A(d)(2)(A)(iii)
variable is_roth_owner_disabled:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Roth IRA Owner Disabled"
  description: "Whether owner is disabled as defined in 22 USC 72(m)(7) per 26 USC 408A(d)(2)(A)(iii)"
  formula: |
    # Placeholder: Would require disability determination
    return False
  default: false

# Roth IRA first-time homebuyer distribution per 408A(d)(2)(A)(iv)
variable roth_first_home_distribution:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Roth First Home Distribution"
  description: "Amount of Roth IRA distributed as first-time homebuyer (max $10,000 lifetime) per 26 USC 408A(d)(2)(A)(iv)"
  formula: |
    # Placeholder: Would require tracking lifetime first-home distributions
    return 0
  default: 0

variable is_qualified_roth_distribution:
  imports:
    - 26/408A/d#early_withdrawal_penalty_age
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Qualified Roth IRA Distribution"
  description: "Whether distribution meets qualified distribution requirements per 26 USC 408A(d)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must satisfy 5-year holding period per 408A(d)(2)(B)
    if not is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied:
        return False
    # Must meet one of these conditions per 408A(d)(2)(A):
    # (i) Age 59 1/2 or older
    if age >= early_withdrawal_penalty_age:
        return True
    # (ii) Death
    if is_roth_death_distribution:
        return True
    # (iii) Disability
    if is_roth_owner_disabled:
        return True
    # (iv) First-time homebuyer (up to $10,000 lifetime)
    if roth_first_home_distribution > 0:
        return True
    return False
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Qualified - age 59.5 with 5-year rule satisfied"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied: true
        age: 60
        is_roth_death_distribution: false
        is_roth_owner_disabled: false
        roth_first_home_distribution: 0
      expect: true  # Qualifies under (i) - age 59.5+
    - name: "Qualified - death distribution with 5-year rule"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied: true
        age: 45
        is_roth_death_distribution: true
        is_roth_owner_disabled: false
        roth_first_home_distribution: 0
      expect: true  # Qualifies under (ii) - death
    - name: "Qualified - disability with 5-year rule"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied: true
        age: 50
        is_roth_death_distribution: false
        is_roth_owner_disabled: true
        roth_first_home_distribution: 0
      expect: true  # Qualifies under (iii) - disability
    - name: "Qualified - first-time homebuyer with 5-year rule"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied: true
        age: 35
        is_roth_death_distribution: false
        is_roth_owner_disabled: false
        roth_first_home_distribution: 10_000
      expect: true  # Qualifies under (iv) - first home up to $10,000
    - name: "Non-qualified - 5-year rule not satisfied"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied: false
        age: 65
        is_roth_death_distribution: false
        is_roth_owner_disabled: false
        roth_first_home_distribution: 0
      expect: false  # Fails 5-year requirement per (B)
    - name: "Non-qualified - under 59.5 no special conditions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_roth_ira_5_year_satisfied: true
        age: 40
        is_roth_death_distribution: false
        is_roth_owner_disabled: false
        roth_first_home_distribution: 0
      expect: false  # No qualifying condition met

documents.title: ISO Shares Held at Year End
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 422(b) - Incentive Stock Options

text: """
26 USC § 422(b) - Incentive stock option defined

For purposes of this part, the term "incentive stock option" means an option
granted to an individual for any reason connected with his employment by a
corporation, if granted by the employer corporation or its parent or subsidiary
corporation, to purchase stock of any of such corporations...

The "bargain element" (difference between fair market value at exercise and
exercise price) must be included in alternative minimum taxable income (AMTI)
under Section 56 when ISO shares are exercised and held through year end.
"""

# Inputs for ISO exercise tracking
input iso_shares_held_at_year_end:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ISO Shares Held at Year End"
  description: "Whether ISO shares exercised during the year were still held at year end (triggering AMT preference)"
  default: false

input iso_exercise_price:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ISO Exercise Price"
  description: "Total amount paid to exercise incentive stock options during the year"
  default: 0

input iso_fmv_at_exercise:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ISO Fair Market Value at Exercise"
  description: "Fair market value of ISO stock at the time of exercise"
  default: 0

# The bargain element for AMT purposes
variable iso_exercise_bargain_element:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ISO Bargain Element for AMT"
  description: "Difference between FMV at exercise and exercise price, included in AMTI when shares are held through year end per 26 USC 422(b) and 56(b)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # ISO bargain element only applies for AMT if shares are held at year end
    # If shares are sold before year end, it's a disqualifying disposition
    # and taxed as ordinary income instead
    if not iso_shares_held_at_year_end:
      return 0
    # Bargain element = FMV at exercise - Exercise price paid
    bargain = iso_fmv_at_exercise - iso_exercise_price
    return max(0, bargain)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No ISO exercise"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        iso_shares_held_at_year_end: false
        iso_exercise_price: 0
        iso_fmv_at_exercise: 0
      expect: 0

    - name: "ISO exercised but sold before year end (disqualifying disposition)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        iso_shares_held_at_year_end: false
        iso_exercise_price: 10_000
        iso_fmv_at_exercise: 50_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "ISO exercised and held - basic bargain element"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        iso_shares_held_at_year_end: true
        iso_exercise_price: 10_000
        iso_fmv_at_exercise: 50_000
      expect: 40_000

    - name: "ISO exercised and held - large bargain element"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        iso_shares_held_at_year_end: true
        iso_exercise_price: 25_000
        iso_fmv_at_exercise: 200_000
      expect: 175_000

    - name: "ISO exercised at FMV (no bargain element)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        iso_shares_held_at_year_end: true
        iso_exercise_price: 100_000
        iso_fmv_at_exercise: 100_000
      expect: 0

    - name: "Underwater ISO (exercise price exceeds FMV)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        iso_shares_held_at_year_end: true
        iso_exercise_price: 75_000
        iso_fmv_at_exercise: 50_000
      expect: 0

documents.title: Base Rental Real Estate Allowance
documents.text:
(a) Disallowance.--
(1) In general.--If for any taxable year the taxpayer is described in
paragraph (2), neither--
(A) the passive activity loss, nor
(B) the passive activity credit,
for the taxable year shall be allowed.
(2) Persons described.--The following are described in this paragraph:
(A) any individual, estate, or trust,
(B) any closely held C corporation, and
(C) any personal service corporation.
(b) Disallowed Loss or Credit Carried to Next Year.--
Except as otherwise provided in this section, any loss or credit from
an activity which is disallowed under subsection (a) shall be treated
as a deduction or credit allocable to such activity in the next
taxable year.
(c) Passive Activity Defined.--
(1) In general.--The term 'passive activity' means any activity--
(A) which involves the conduct of any trade or business, and
(B) in which the taxpayer does not materially participate.
(2) Passive activity includes any rental activity.--
Except as provided in paragraph (7), the term 'passive activity' includes
any rental activity.
(d) Passive Activity Loss and Credit Defined.--
(1) Passive activity loss.--The term 'passive activity loss' means the
amount (if any) by which--
(A) the aggregate losses from all passive activities for the taxable year,
exceed
(B) the aggregate income from all passive activities for such year.
(i)(2) Amount allowable.--$25,000 per 469(i)(2)
(i)(3)(A) Phaseout.--reduce by 50% of excess over $100,000 AGI
(i)(5)(B) MFS living apart.--$12,500 allowance, $50,000 phaseout threshold
(c)(7)(B)(ii) Real estate professional.--More than 750 hours
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Disallowance.--
(1) In general.--If for any taxable year the taxpayer is described in
paragraph (2), neither--
(A) the passive activity loss, nor
(B) the passive activity credit,
for the taxable year shall be allowed.
(2) Persons described.--The following are described in this paragraph:
(A) any individual, estate, or trust,
(B) any closely held C corporation, and
(C) any personal service corporation.
(b) Disallowed Loss or Credit Carried to Next Year.--
Except as otherwise provided in this section, any loss or credit from
an activity which is disallowed under subsection (a) shall be treated
as a deduction or credit allocable to such activity in the next
taxable year.
(c) Passive Activity Defined.--
(1) In general.--The term 'passive activity' means any activity--
(A) which involves the conduct of any trade or business, and
(B) in which the taxpayer does not materially participate.
(2) Passive activity includes any rental activity.--
Except as provided in paragraph (7), the term 'passive activity' includes
any rental activity.
(d) Passive Activity Loss and Credit Defined.--
(1) Passive activity loss.--The term 'passive activity loss' means the
amount (if any) by which--
(A) the aggregate losses from all passive activities for the taxable year,
exceed
(B) the aggregate income from all passive activities for such year.
(i)(2) Amount allowable.--$25,000 per 469(i)(2)
(i)(3)(A) Phaseout.--reduce by 50% of excess over $100,000 AGI
(i)(5)(B) MFS living apart.--$12,500 allowance, $50,000 phaseout threshold
(c)(7)(B)(ii) Real estate professional.--More than 750 hours
"""

# Parameter Declarations

parameter allowance_amount:
  description: "Base rental real estate allowance amount"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1986-01-01: 25_000

parameter allowance_amount_mfs:
  description: "Rental real estate allowance for MFS living apart"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1986-01-01: 12_500

parameter phaseout_start:
  description: "AGI threshold where phaseout begins"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1986-01-01: 100_000

parameter phaseout_start_mfs:
  description: "AGI threshold for MFS living apart"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1986-01-01: 50_000

parameter phaseout_rate:
  description: "Rate at which allowance phases out (50%)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1986-01-01: 0.5

parameter hours_threshold:
  description: "Hours required to qualify as real estate professional"
  unit: hours
  values:
    1993-01-01: 750

# Applicable Allowance Amount - Depends on Filing Status
# 26 USC Section 469(i)(2)
variable base_rental_real_estate_allowance:
  imports: [26/1#filing_status]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Base Rental Real Estate Allowance"
  description: "Base $25,000 allowance amount before phaseout per 26 USC 469(i)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 469(i)(5)(A): MFS living together gets $0
    # Per 469(i)(5)(B): MFS living apart gets $12,500
    # All others get $25,000
    is_mfs = filing_status == "married_separate"
    lived_apart = lived_apart_from_spouse_all_year
    # MFS living apart gets $12,500
    if is_mfs and lived_apart: return allowance_amount_mfs
    # MFS living together gets $0
    if is_mfs: return 0
    # All others get $25,000
    return allowance_amount
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer gets $25k base allowance"
      inputs: {filing_status: "single"}
      expect: 25000
    - name: "Married joint filers get $25k base allowance"
      inputs: {filing_status: "married_joint"}
      expect: 25000
    - name: "MFS living apart gets $12.5k base allowance"
      inputs: {filing_status: "married_separate", lived_apart_from_spouse_all_year: true}
      expect: 12500
    - name: "MFS living together gets $0 base allowance"
      inputs: {filing_status: "married_separate", lived_apart_from_spouse_all_year: false}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Head of household gets $25k base allowance"
      inputs: {filing_status: "head_of_household"}
      expect: 25000

# Disallowed Rental Real Estate Loss
# 26 USC Section 469(a)
variable disallowed_rental_real_estate_loss:
  imports:
    - 26/469#net_rental_real_estate_loss
    - 26/469#rental_real_estate_loss_allowance
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Disallowed Rental Real Estate Loss"
  description: "Rental real estate loss that is suspended per 26 USC 469(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Loss that cannot be deducted this year - carries forward
    return max(0, net_rental_real_estate_loss - rental_real_estate_loss_allowance)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Loss exceeds allowance - full suspension"
      inputs: {net_rental_real_estate_loss: 50_000, rental_real_estate_loss_allowance: 25_000}
      expect: 25000
    - name: "Loss equals allowance - no suspension"
      inputs: {net_rental_real_estate_loss: 25_000, rental_real_estate_loss_allowance: 25_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Loss less than allowance - no suspension"
      inputs: {net_rental_real_estate_loss: 15_000, rental_real_estate_loss_allowance: 25_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "No loss - no suspension"
      inputs: {net_rental_real_estate_loss: 0, rental_real_estate_loss_allowance: 25_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Large loss with phased-out allowance"
      inputs: {net_rental_real_estate_loss: 100_000, rental_real_estate_loss_allowance: 0}
      expect: 100000

# Net Rental Real Estate Loss - For Exception Calculation
# 26 USC Section 469(i)
variable net_rental_real_estate_loss:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Rental Real Estate Loss"
  description: "Losses from rental real estate activities exceeding income per 26 USC 469(i)"
  formula: return max(0, rental_real_estate_loss - rental_real_estate_income)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Losses exceed income"
      inputs: {rental_real_estate_loss: 50_000, rental_real_estate_income: 20_000}
      expect: 30000
    - name: "Income exceeds losses"
      inputs: {rental_real_estate_loss: 20_000, rental_real_estate_income: 50_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Loss equals income"
      inputs: {rental_real_estate_loss: 30_000, rental_real_estate_income: 30_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "No activity"
      inputs: {rental_real_estate_loss: 0, rental_real_estate_income: 0}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Large loss, small income"
      inputs: {rental_real_estate_loss: 100_000, rental_real_estate_income: 5_000}
      expect: 95000

variable passive_loss_limitation:
  imports:
    - 26/469#rental_real_estate_loss_allowance as rental_real_estate_allowance
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Net Passive Activity Income"
  description: "Net income from passive activities per 26 USC 469(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 469(d)(1): Passive activity loss = losses - income (if positive)
    # Net income is the reverse: income - losses (if positive)
    return max(0, passive_activity_income - passive_activity_losses)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Income exceeds losses - net income"
      inputs: {passive_activity_income: 50_000, passive_activity_losses: 20_000}
      expect: 30000
    - name: "Losses exceed income - net loss"
      inputs: {passive_activity_income: 20_000, passive_activity_losses: 50_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Break even - no net income"
      inputs: {passive_activity_income: 30_000, passive_activity_losses: 30_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "No activity"
      inputs: {passive_activity_income: 0, passive_activity_losses: 0}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Only income, no losses"
      inputs: {passive_activity_income: 100_000, passive_activity_losses: 0}
      expect: 100000


variable real_estate_professional:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  unit: 
  label: "Real Estate Professional"
  description: "Whether taxpayer qualifies as real estate professional per 26 USC 469(c)(7)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 469(c)(7)(B)(ii): More than 750 hours in real property trades/businesses
    # where taxpayer materially participates
    hours_in_real_property = hours_in_real_property_trades_businesses
    materially_participates = materially_participates_in_real_property_business
    return materially_participates and (hours_in_real_property > hours_threshold)
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Qualifies - materially participates and over 750 hours"
      inputs: {materially_participates_in_real_property_business: true, hours_in_real_property_trades_businesses: 800}
      expect: true
    - name: "Does not qualify - lacks material participation"
      inputs: {materially_participates_in_real_property_business: false, hours_in_real_property_trades_businesses: 800}
      expect: false
    - name: "Does not qualify - insufficient hours despite material participation"
      inputs: {materially_participates_in_real_property_business: true, hours_in_real_property_trades_businesses: 700}
      expect: false
    - name: "Does not qualify - no participation and insufficient hours"
      inputs: {materially_participates_in_real_property_business: false, hours_in_real_property_trades_businesses: 500}
      expect: false
    - name: "Qualifies - exactly 751 hours (over threshold)"
      inputs: {materially_participates_in_real_property_business: true, hours_in_real_property_trades_businesses: 751}
      expect: true

variable rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout:
  imports:
    - 26/469#base_rental_real_estate_allowance
    - 26/469#rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Rental Real Estate Allowance After Phaseout"
  description: "Allowance remaining after AGI-based phaseout per 26 USC 469(i)"
  formula: return max(0, base_rental_real_estate_allowance - rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No phaseout - full allowance"
      inputs: {base_rental_real_estate_allowance: 25_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout: 0}
      expect: 25000
    - name: "Partial phaseout - $12.5k remains"
      inputs: {base_rental_real_estate_allowance: 25_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout: 12_500}
      expect: 12500
    - name: "Full phaseout - no allowance"
      inputs: {base_rental_real_estate_allowance: 25_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout: 25_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Over-phaseout - no negative allowance"
      inputs: {base_rental_real_estate_allowance: 25_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout: 30_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "MFS phaseout - $6.25k remains"
      inputs: {base_rental_real_estate_allowance: 12_500, rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout: 6_250}
      expect: 6250

variable rental_real_estate_allowance_phaseout:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/469#rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Rental Real Estate Allowance Phaseout"
  description: "Reduction in allowance due to AGI phaseout per 26 USC 469(i)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 469(i)(3)(A): Reduce by 50% of AGI over threshold
    excess_agi = max(0, adjusted_gross_income - rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold)
    return excess_agi * phaseout_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "AGI below threshold - no phaseout"
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 80_000, rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold: 100_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "AGI at threshold - no phaseout"
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 100_000, rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold: 100_000}
      expect: 0
    - name: "AGI $20k above threshold - $10k phaseout"
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 120_000, rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold: 100_000}
      expect: 10000
    - name: "AGI $50k above threshold - $25k phaseout"
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 150_000, rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold: 100_000}
      expect: 25000
    - name: "MFS with $50k threshold - $5k phaseout"
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 60_000, rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold: 50_000}
      expect: 5000


variable rental_real_estate_exception:
  imports:
    - 26/469#net_rental_real_estate_loss
    - 26/469#rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout
    - 26/469#is_real_estate_professional
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Rental Real Estate Loss Allowance"
  description: "Amount of rental real estate loss allowed against non-passive income per 26 USC 469(i)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Requirements per 469(i):
    # 1. Natural person (not corporation, trust, or estate - simplified here)
    # 2. Active participation in rental real estate
    # Real estate professionals are not subject to passive loss rules for rentals
    # Per 469(c)(7): Their rental activities are treated as non-passive
    # So they can deduct unlimited rental losses (no need for this exception)
    if is_real_estate_professional: return net_rental_real_estate_loss
    # Active participants get up to $25,000 (or $12,500 MFS) after phaseout
    # Limited to actual net loss
    allowance = rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout
    if actively_participates_in_rental: return min(net_rental_real_estate_loss, allowance)
    # No active participation - no exception, passive loss rules apply fully
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Real estate professional - unlimited deduction"
      inputs: {is_real_estate_professional: true, net_rental_real_estate_loss: 100_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout: 25_000, actively_participates_in_rental: false}
      expect: 100000
    - name: "Active participant - $25k exception applies"
      inputs: {is_real_estate_professional: false, net_rental_real_estate_loss: 50_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout: 25_000, actively_participates_in_rental: true}
      expect: 25000
    - name: "Active participant with small loss - loss limits deduction"
      inputs: {is_real_estate_professional: false, net_rental_real_estate_loss: 10_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout: 25_000, actively_participates_in_rental: true}
      expect: 10000
    - name: "Passive activity - no exception allowed"
      inputs: {is_real_estate_professional: false, net_rental_real_estate_loss: 50_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout: 25_000, actively_participates_in_rental: false}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Active participant after $100k AGI phaseout"
      inputs: {is_real_estate_professional: false, net_rental_real_estate_loss: 50_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout: 0, actively_participates_in_rental: true}
      expect: 0
    - name: "$25k rental real estate exception at-risk limit applied"
      inputs: {is_real_estate_professional: false, net_rental_real_estate_loss: 35_000, rental_real_estate_allowance_after_phaseout: 25_000, actively_participates_in_rental: true}
      expect: 25000

variable rental_real_estate_phaseout_threshold:
  imports: [26/1#filing_status]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Rental Real Estate Phaseout Threshold"
  description: "Modified AGI threshold where phaseout begins per 26 USC 469(i)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 469(i)(5)(B): MFS living apart uses $50,000 threshold
    # All others (including MFS living together, who get $0 anyway) use $100,000
    is_mfs = filing_status == "married_separate"
    lived_apart = lived_apart_from_spouse_all_year
    if is_mfs and lived_apart: return phaseout_start_mfs
    return phaseout_start
  default: 100_000
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer - $100k threshold"
      inputs: {filing_status: "single"}
      expect: 100000
    - name: "Married joint - $100k threshold"
      inputs: {filing_status: "married_joint"}
      expect: 100000
    - name: "MFS living apart - $50k threshold"
      inputs: {filing_status: "married_separate", lived_apart_from_spouse_all_year: true}
      expect: 50000
    - name: "MFS living together - $100k threshold"
      inputs: {filing_status: "married_separate", lived_apart_from_spouse_all_year: false}
      expect: 100000
    - name: "Head of household - $100k threshold"
      inputs: {filing_status: "head_of_household"}
      expect: 100000

documents.title: AMT Credit Carryforward
documents.text:
Section 53 provides a credit for prior year minimum tax liability (AMT credit).
When a taxpayer pays Alternative Minimum Tax (AMT) due to timing differences
(rather than permanent preferences), they may be entitled to a credit in
future years when their regular tax exceeds their tentative minimum tax.

(a) Allowance of credit - There shall be allowed as a credit against the
tax imposed by this chapter for any taxable year an amount equal to the
minimum tax credit for such taxable year.

(b) Minimum tax credit - For purposes of subsection (a), the minimum tax
credit for any taxable year is the excess (if any) of the adjusted net
minimum tax imposed for all prior taxable years beginning after 1986
over the amount allowable as a credit under subsection (a) for such
prior taxable years.

Note: The AMT credit is generally nonrefundable but may be refundable in
certain circumstances for individuals with long-term unused credits.
documents.code:
#
# Reference: https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/53

text: """
Section 53 provides a credit for prior year minimum tax liability (AMT credit).
When a taxpayer pays Alternative Minimum Tax (AMT) due to timing differences
(rather than permanent preferences), they may be entitled to a credit in
future years when their regular tax exceeds their tentative minimum tax.

(a) Allowance of credit - There shall be allowed as a credit against the
tax imposed by this chapter for any taxable year an amount equal to the
minimum tax credit for such taxable year.

(b) Minimum tax credit - For purposes of subsection (a), the minimum tax
credit for any taxable year is the excess (if any) of the adjusted net
minimum tax imposed for all prior taxable years beginning after 1986
over the amount allowable as a credit under subsection (a) for such
prior taxable years.

Note: The AMT credit is generally nonrefundable but may be refundable in
certain circumstances for individuals with long-term unused credits.
"""

input amt_credit_carryforward:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "AMT Credit Carryforward"
  description: "Credit for prior year minimum tax liability per 26 USC 53"
  default: 0

input refundable_amt_credit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Refundable AMT Credit"
  description: "Refundable portion of AMT credit for long-term unused credits"
  default: 0

documents.title: Alternative Minimum Tax
documents.text:
There is hereby imposed (in addition to any other tax imposed by this
subtitle) a tax equal to the excess (if any) of—
(1) the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year, over
(2) the regular tax for the taxable year.
documents.code:
text: """
There is hereby imposed (in addition to any other tax imposed by this
subtitle) a tax equal to the excess (if any) of—
(1) the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year, over
(2) the regular tax for the taxable year.
"""
variable amt:
  imports:
    - 26/55/b/2#alternative_minimum_taxable_income as amti
    - 26/1#income_tax_before_credits as regular_tax
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/59#amt_foreign_tax_credit
    - 26/55/b/1#amt_rate_low
    - 26/55/b/1#amt_rate_high
    - 26/55/b/3#amt_bracket_joint
    - 26/55/b/3#amt_bracket_single
    - 26/55/b/3#amt_bracket_married_separate
    - 26/55/d/1#exemption_joint
    - 26/55/d/1#exemption_single
    - 26/55/d/1#exemption_married_separate
    - 26/55/d/2#phaseout_threshold_joint
    - 26/55/d/2#phaseout_threshold_single
    - 26/55/d/2#phaseout_threshold_married_separate
    - 26/55/d/2#phaseout_rate
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Alternative Minimum Tax"
  description: "AMT liability under Section 55(a): excess of tentative minimum tax over regular tax"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 55(a): AMT = max(0, tentative_minimum_tax - regular_tax)
    # Where tentative_minimum_tax is computed in Section 55(b)

    # Step 1: Get base exemption based on filing status per Section 55(d)(1)
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
      base_exemption = exemption_joint
      bracket_threshold = amt_bracket_joint
      phaseout_threshold = phaseout_threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == QUALIFYING_WIDOW:
      base_exemption = exemption_joint
      bracket_threshold = amt_bracket_joint
      phaseout_threshold = phaseout_threshold_joint
    elif filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
      base_exemption = exemption_married_separate
      bracket_threshold = amt_bracket_married_separate
      phaseout_threshold = phaseout_threshold_married_separate
    else:  # SINGLE, HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      base_exemption = exemption_single
      bracket_threshold = amt_bracket_single
      phaseout_threshold = phaseout_threshold_single

    # Step 2: Apply exemption phaseout per Section 55(d)(2)
    # Exemption reduced 25% for each dollar of AMTI above threshold
    excess_income = max(0, amti - phaseout_threshold)
    phaseout_reduction = excess_income * phaseout_rate
    exemption = max(0, base_exemption - phaseout_reduction)

    # Step 3: Compute taxable excess (AMTI - exemption)
    taxable_excess = max(0, amti - exemption)

    # Step 4: Compute tentative minimum tax with two-tier rate structure per Section 55(b)(1)
    # 26% on amount up to bracket threshold, 28% on excess
    amt_in_low_bracket = min(taxable_excess, bracket_threshold)
    amt_in_high_bracket = max(0, taxable_excess - bracket_threshold)
    tentative_minimum_tax = (amt_in_low_bracket * amt_rate_low) + (amt_in_high_bracket * amt_rate_high)

    # Step 5: Apply foreign tax credit (if applicable) per Section 55(c)
    tentative_minimum_tax_after_credits = max(0, tentative_minimum_tax - amt_foreign_tax_credit)

    # Step 6: AMT is the excess of tentative minimum tax over regular tax (or zero)
    amt_liability = max(0, tentative_minimum_tax_after_credits - regular_tax)

    return amt_liability
  default: 0
  tests:
    # Test 1: No AMT - income below exemption threshold
    - name: "No AMT - income below exemption"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        amti: 100_000
        exemption_joint: 133_300
        amt_bracket_joint: 232_600
        phaseout_threshold_joint: 1_000_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 12_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 0

    # Test 2: Single filer with AMT liability
    - name: "Single filer with positive AMT"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        amti: 300_000
        exemption_single: 85_700
        amt_bracket_single: 116_300
        phaseout_threshold_single: 500_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 50_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 7678

    # Test 3: Married filing jointly with exemption phaseout
    - name: "MFJ with exemption phaseout"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        amti: 1_500_000
        exemption_joint: 133_300
        amt_bracket_joint: 232_600
        phaseout_threshold_joint: 1_000_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 350_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 63024

    # Test 4: Married filing separately with reduced AMT
    - name: "MFS filing with reduced exemption"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        amti: 400_000
        exemption_married_separate: 66_650
        amt_bracket_married_separate: 116_300
        phaseout_threshold_married_separate: 500_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 75_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 11012

    # Test 5: Qualifying widow gets joint exemption
    - name: "Qualifying widow with joint exemption"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: QUALIFYING_WIDOW
        amti: 500_000
        exemption_joint: 133_300
        amt_bracket_joint: 232_600
        phaseout_threshold_joint: 1_000_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 90_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 26516

    # Test 6: High income with significant AMT
    - name: "High income single with significant AMT"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        amti: 2_000_000
        exemption_single: 85_700
        amt_bracket_single: 116_300
        phaseout_threshold_single: 500_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 200_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 157674

    # Test 7: Regular tax exceeds tentative minimum tax (no AMT)
    - name: "Regular tax exceeds TMT"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        amti: 250_000
        exemption_joint: 133_300
        amt_bracket_joint: 232_600
        phaseout_threshold_joint: 1_000_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 50_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 0

    # Test 8: High income single filer crossing bracket threshold
    - name: "Single filer in high bracket"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        amti: 600_000
        exemption_single: 85_700
        amt_bracket_single: 116_300
        phaseout_threshold_single: 500_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 50_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 48678

    # Test 9: With foreign tax credit reducing AMT
    - name: "AMT with foreign tax credit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        amti: 800_000
        exemption_joint: 133_300
        amt_bracket_joint: 232_600
        phaseout_threshold_joint: 1_000_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 100_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 5_000
      expect: 27024

    # Test 10: Minimum AMTI with no AMT
    - name: "Very low AMTI"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        amti: 10_000
        exemption_single: 85_700
        amt_bracket_single: 116_300
        phaseout_threshold_single: 500_000
        phaseout_rate: 0.25
        amt_rate_low: 0.26
        amt_rate_high: 0.28
        regular_tax: 1_000
        amt_foreign_tax_credit: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 55(b)(1)
documents.text:
(b) Tentative minimum tax
(1) Amount of tentative tax
(A) In general
The tentative minimum tax for the taxable year is the sum of—
(i) 26 percent of so much of the taxable excess as does not exceed $232,600, plus
(ii) 28 percent of so much of the taxable excess as exceeds $232,600.

(ii) 28 percent of so much of the taxable excess as exceeds $232,600.
"""

documents.title: Alternative Minimum Taxable Income
documents.text:
The term 'alternative minimum taxable income' means the taxable income
of the taxpayer for the taxable year—
(A) determined with the adjustments provided in section 56 and section 58, and
(B) increased by the amount of the items of tax preference described in section 57.
documents.code:
text: """
The term 'alternative minimum taxable income' means the taxable income
of the taxpayer for the taxable year—
(A) determined with the adjustments provided in section 56 and section 58, and
(B) increased by the amount of the items of tax preference described in section 57.
"""
variable amti:
  imports:
    - 26/63/a#taxable_income
    - 26/56#amt_adjustments
    - 26/57#amt_preferences
    - 26/59#amt_nol_deduction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Alternative Minimum Taxable Income"
  description: "AMTI computed per Section 55(b)(2) as taxable income plus adjustments and preferences, less AMT NOL"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with regular taxable income
    base = taxable_income
    # Add AMT adjustments from Sections 56 and 58
    adjustments = amt_adjustments
    # Add tax preference items from Section 57
    preferences = amt_preferences
    return max(0, base + adjustments + preferences)
  default: 0
  tests:
    # Test 1: Basic AMTI with positive adjustments and preferences
    - name: "Basic AMTI calculation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 150_000
        amt_adjustments: 25_000
        amt_preferences: 10_000
      expect: 185_000  # 150,000 + 25,000 + 10,000

    # Test 2: AMTI with zero adjustments and preferences
    - name: "AMTI equals taxable income when no adjustments"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 200_000
        amt_adjustments: 0
        amt_preferences: 0
      expect: 200_000  # Just the taxable income

    # Test 3: AMTI with negative adjustments (rare but possible)
    - name: "AMTI with negative adjustments"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 100_000
        amt_adjustments: -15_000
        amt_preferences: 5_000
      expect: 90_000  # 100,000 - 15,000 + 5,000

    # Test 4: AMTI floor at zero (cannot be negative)
    - name: "AMTI floor at zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 50_000
        amt_adjustments: -60_000
        amt_preferences: 0
      expect: 0  # max(0, 50,000 - 60,000) = 0

    # Test 5: High income with substantial preferences
    - name: "High income with substantial tax preferences"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 500_000
        amt_adjustments: 75_000
        amt_preferences: 125_000
      expect: 700_000  # 500,000 + 75,000 + 125,000

    # Test 6: Typical case with ISO exercise preferences
    - name: "Typical ISO exercise scenario"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        taxable_income: 250_000
        amt_adjustments: 10_000
        amt_preferences: 200_000  # ISO spread
      expect: 460_000  # 250,000 + 10,000 + 200,000

documents.text:
(2) Phase-out of exemption amount
The exemption amount of any taxpayer shall be reduced (but not below zero)
by an amount equal to 25 percent of the amount by which the alternative
minimum taxable income of the taxpayer exceeds the threshold amount.

documents.title: Uses Standard Deduction
documents.text:
In determining the amount of the alternative minimum taxable income for any
taxable year, the following adjustments shall apply to taxable income...
documents.code:
text: """
In determining the amount of the alternative minimum taxable income for any
taxable year, the following adjustments shall apply to taxable income...
"""

input uses_standard_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Uses Standard Deduction"
  description: "Whether the taxpayer uses the standard deduction"
  default: true

input state_local_taxes:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "State and Local Taxes"
  description: "State and local taxes deducted as itemized deduction"
  default: 0

variable adjustments:
  imports:
    - 26/63/c#standard_deduction
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/422/b#iso_exercise_bargain_element
    - 26/58#total_section_58_adjustments as section_58_adjustments
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total AMT Adjustments"
  description: "Sum of all AMT adjustments under Sections 56 and 58"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # State and local taxes (including property taxes) claimed as itemized
    # deduction must be added back for AMT purposes
    if uses_standard_deduction: return 0
    return state_local_taxes
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Standard deduction filer - no adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        uses_standard_deduction: true
        state_local_taxes: 15_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Itemizer with SALT deduction - full add-back"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        uses_standard_deduction: false
        state_local_taxes: 25_000
      expect: 25_000
    - name: "Itemizer with zero SALT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        uses_standard_deduction: false
        state_local_taxes: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Itemizer with high SALT - exceeds SALT cap"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        uses_standard_deduction: false
        state_local_taxes: 50_000
      expect: 50_000
    - name: "Itemizer with modest SALT deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        uses_standard_deduction: false
        state_local_taxes: 8_500
      expect: 8_500
    - name: "Standard deduction with zero SALT"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        uses_standard_deduction: true
        state_local_taxes: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Percentage Depletion
documents.text:
For purposes of this part, the items of tax preference determined under
this section are—
documents.code:
text: """
For purposes of this part, the items of tax preference determined under
this section are—
"""

input percentage_depletion:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Percentage Depletion"
  description: "Depletion deduction computed using percentage method"
  default: 0

input cost_depletion:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Cost Depletion"
  description: "Depletion deduction computed using cost method (adjusted basis)"
  default: 0

variable preferences:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total AMT Preference Items"
  description: "Sum of all tax preference items under Section 57"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # The preference amount is the excess of percentage depletion over
    # the adjusted basis of the property (cost depletion)
    excess = percentage_depletion - cost_depletion
    return max(0, excess)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No depletion - zero preference"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        percentage_depletion: 0
        cost_depletion: 0
      expect: 0
      description: "No depletion claimed results in zero preference"

    - name: "Percentage equals cost - zero preference"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        percentage_depletion: 50_000
        cost_depletion: 50_000
      expect: 0
      description: "When percentage depletion equals cost depletion, no preference"

    - name: "Cost exceeds percentage - zero preference"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        percentage_depletion: 25_000
        cost_depletion: 40_000
      expect: 0
      description: "When cost depletion exceeds percentage, preference is zero (not negative)"

    - name: "Percentage exceeds cost - basic preference"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        percentage_depletion: 75_000
        cost_depletion: 50_000
      expect: 25_000
      description: "Excess of percentage over cost: $75,000 - $50,000 = $25,000 preference"

    - name: "Large excess - oil and gas example"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        percentage_depletion: 150_000
        cost_depletion: 30_000
      expect: 120_000
      description: "Substantial excess common in natural resources: $150,000 - $30,000 = $120,000"

    - name: "Zero cost depletion - full preference"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        percentage_depletion: 100_000
        cost_depletion: 0
      expect: 100_000
      description: "When no cost basis remains, entire percentage depletion is preference"

documents.title: Material Participation in Farming
documents.text: For purposes of this part—
documents.code:
text: """
For purposes of this part—
"""

input is_material_participant_farming:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year

  label: "Material Participation in Farming"

  default: false

variable denial_of_losses:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Section 58 Loss Adjustments"
  description: "Sum of all loss disallowances under Section 58"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Material participation is determined under Section 469 passive activity rules
    # Taxpayer must work 500+ hours, be sole participant, or meet other tests
    # This is a simplification - actual rules are in Section 469 regulations
    # For now, we assume this is provided as an input
    return is_material_participant_farming
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Non-material participant - no adjustment"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_material_participant_farming: false
        filing_status: "SINGLE"
        adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
      expect: false

    - name: "Material participant in farming"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_material_participant_farming: true
        filing_status: "SINGLE"
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
      expect: true

    - name: "Joint filers - not material participant"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_material_participant_farming: false
        filing_status: "JOINT"
        adjusted_gross_income: 250_000
      expect: false

    - name: "Joint filers - material participant"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_material_participant_farming: true
        filing_status: "JOINT"
        adjusted_gross_income: 500_000
      expect: true

    - name: "Head of household - no farming participation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_material_participant_farming: false
        filing_status: "HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD"
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
      expect: false

    - name: "High income taxpayer with material participation"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_material_participant_farming: true
        filing_status: "SINGLE"
        adjusted_gross_income: 1_000_000
      expect: true

documents.title: Foreign Source Income
documents.text:
26 USC § 59 - Other Definitions and Special Rules

(a) Alternative minimum tax foreign tax credit.—For purposes of this part—
(1) In general.—The alternative minimum tax foreign tax credit for any
taxable year shall be the credit which would be determined under section 27(a)
for such taxable year if—
(A) the pre-credit tentative minimum tax were the tax against which such
credit was taken for purposes of section 904 for the taxable year and all
prior taxable years beginning after December 31, 1986,
(B) section 904 were applied on the basis of alternative minimum taxable
income instead of taxable income, and
(C) the determination of whether any income is high-taxed income for
purposes of section 904(d)(2) were made on the basis of the applicable rate
specified in section 55(b)(1) in lieu of the highest rate of tax specified
in section 1.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 59 - Other Definitions and Special Rules

(a) Alternative minimum tax foreign tax credit.—For purposes of this part—
(1) In general.—The alternative minimum tax foreign tax credit for any
taxable year shall be the credit which would be determined under section 27(a)
for such taxable year if—
(A) the pre-credit tentative minimum tax were the tax against which such
credit was taken for purposes of section 904 for the taxable year and all
prior taxable years beginning after December 31, 1986,
(B) section 904 were applied on the basis of alternative minimum taxable
income instead of taxable income, and
(C) the determination of whether any income is high-taxed income for
purposes of section 904(d)(2) were made on the basis of the applicable rate
specified in section 55(b)(1) in lieu of the highest rate of tax specified
in section 1.
"""

input foreign_source_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Foreign Source Income"
  description: "Income from foreign sources"
  default: 0

input worldwide_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Worldwide Income"
  description: "Total worldwide income"
  default: 0

variable special_rules:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/55/b/2#alternative_minimum_taxable_income as amti
    - 26/55/a#tentative_minimum_tax
    - 26/1411/a#net_investment_income_tax as niit
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Regular Tax"
  description: "Regular income tax for Section 55(c) cross-reference"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # For AMT purposes, foreign source income must be recomputed
    # using AMT adjustments (Section 56) and preferences (Section 57)
    #
    # This requires recalculating the foreign source portion of AMTI
    # rather than using regular tax foreign source income
    #
    # Simplified: Assume same ratio of foreign to worldwide income
    # In practice, would need detailed AMT adjustment allocation
    if worldwide_income == 0: return 0
    foreign_ratio = foreign_source_income / worldwide_income
    return amti * foreign_ratio
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Foreign income portion of AMTI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        foreign_source_income: 50_000
        worldwide_income: 200_000
        amti: 180_000
      expect: 45_000  # 50_000/200_000 * 180_000 = 0.25 * 180_000
    - name: "All income is foreign"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        foreign_source_income: 100_000
        worldwide_income: 100_000
        amti: 90_000
      expect: 90_000  # 100% foreign ratio
    - name: "No foreign income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        foreign_source_income: 0
        worldwide_income: 150_000
        amti: 140_000
      expect: 0  # 0% foreign ratio
    - name: "Zero worldwide income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        foreign_source_income: 10_000
        worldwide_income: 0
        amti: 50_000
      expect: 0  # Division by zero protection

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 61(a)
documents.code:
text: |
  (a) General definition.--Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle,
  gross income means all income from whatever source derived, including
  (but not limited to)--
  (1) Compensation for services, including fees, commissions, fringe
  benefits, and similar items;
  (2) Gross income derived from business;
  (3) Gains derived from dealings in property;
  (4) Interest;
  (5) Rents;
  (6) Royalties;
  (7) Dividends;
  (8) Annuities;
  (9) Income from life insurance and endowment contracts;
  (10) Pensions;
  (11) Income from discharge of indebtedness;
  (12) Distributive share of partnership gross income;
  (13) Income in respect of a decedent; and
  (14) Income from an interest in an estate or trust.

input other_income:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Other Income
  description: Miscellaneous income not categorized as wages, interest, dividends, etc.

variable gross_income:
  imports:
    - 26/61/a/1#wages
    - 26/61/a/1#salaries
    - 26/61/a/1#tips
    - 26/1402/a#self_employment_income
    - 26/61/a/3#gains_from_property
    - 26/61/a/4#interest_income
    - 26/61/a/7#dividend_income
    - 26/61/a/10#pension_income
    - 26/85/a#unemployment_compensation
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Gross Income
  description: Total gross income from all sources per 26 USC Section 61
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return wages + salaries + tips + self_employment_income + gains_from_property + interest_income + dividend_income + pension_income + other_income + unemployment_compensation
  tests:
    # Zero income cases
    - name: "Zero income - no sources"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      expect: 0
    # Single income source cases
    - name: "Wages only - median worker"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 56_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      expect: 56_000
    - name: "Self-employment only - freelancer"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 85_000
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      expect: 85_000
    # Typical income scenarios
    - name: "W2 employee with savings interest"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 65_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 850
        dividend_income: 200
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      # wages + interest + dividends = 65_000 + 850 + 200
      expect: 66_050
    - name: "Restaurant worker with tips"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 25_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 18_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      # wages + tips = 25_000 + 18_000
      expect: 43_000
    - name: "Retiree with pension and investment income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 3_500
        dividend_income: 8_200
        pension_income: 42_000
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      # pension + interest + dividends = 42_000 + 3_500 + 8_200
      expect: 53_700
    # High income scenarios
    - name: "High earner with diversified income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 180_000
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 50_000
        gains_from_property: 25_000
        interest_income: 12_000
        dividend_income: 35_000
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 5_000
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      # salaries + SE + gains + interest + dividends + other
      # 180_000 + 50_000 + 25_000 + 12_000 + 35_000 + 5_000
      expect: 307_000
    - name: "Investor with capital gains"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 150_000
        interest_income: 25_000
        dividend_income: 75_000
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      # gains + interest + dividends = 150_000 + 25_000 + 75_000
      expect: 250_000
    # Mixed scenarios
    - name: "Unemployed with benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 100
        dividend_income: 0
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 0
        unemployment_compensation: 15_600
      # unemployment + interest = 15_600 + 100
      expect: 15_700
    - name: "Mixed employment and side business"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 48_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 22_000
        gains_from_property: 0
        interest_income: 500
        dividend_income: 1_200
        pension_income: 0
        other_income: 800
        unemployment_compensation: 0
      # wages + SE + interest + dividends + other
      # 48_000 + 22_000 + 500 + 1_200 + 800
      expect: 72_500

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 61(a)(1)
documents.code:
# Gross income includes compensation for services, including fees, commissions,
# fringe benefits, and similar items.

text: |
  Gross income includes "compensation for services, including fees, commissions,
  fringe benefits, and similar items."

input wages:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Wages
  description: Compensation for services as an employee

input salaries:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Salaries
  description: Fixed periodic compensation for services as an employee

input tips:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Tips
  description: Gratuities received for services

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 61(a)(10)
documents.code:
text: |
  (a) General definition.--Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle,
  gross income means all income from whatever source derived, including
  (but not limited to)--
  ...
  (10) Pensions;

variable pension_income:
  imports:
    - 26/402/a#distributions
    - 26/408/d#distributions
    - 26/408A/d#is_qualified_roth_distribution
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Gross Pension Distributions
  description: Gross distributions before rollover exclusions
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 26 USC 402(a) - employer plan distributions (401k, 403b, pension)
    employer_plan_income = distributions  # From 26/402/a
    # Per 26 USC 408(d) - traditional IRA distributions
    traditional_ira_income = distributions  # From 26/408/d
    # Per 26 USC 408A(d) - Roth IRA distributions (qualified exclusions apply)
    # If qualified distribution, exclusion applies; non-qualified earnings are taxable
    roth_ira_income = 0 if is_qualified_roth_distribution else distributions
    return employer_plan_income + traditional_ira_income + roth_ira_income
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No distributions - zero pension income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        distributions: 0
        is_qualified_roth_distribution: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Employer plan only - 401k distribution"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        distributions: 25_000
        is_qualified_roth_distribution: false
      expect: 25_000
    - name: "Traditional IRA only - full distribution taxable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        distributions: 15_000
        is_qualified_roth_distribution: false
      expect: 15_000
    - name: "Roth IRA qualified distribution - tax-free"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        distributions: 3_500
        is_qualified_roth_distribution: true
      expect: 3_500
    - name: "Combined distributions - non-qualified Roth"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        distributions: 75_000
        is_qualified_roth_distribution: false
      expect: 225_000
    - name: "Large retirement distributions - high income retiree"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        distributions: 225_000
        is_qualified_roth_distribution: false
      expect: 225_000
