documents.title: Adjusted Gross Income
documents.text:
(a) General Rule.—For purposes of this subtitle, the term 'adjusted
gross income' means, in the case of an individual, gross income minus
the deductions specified in subsection (a).
documents.code:
text: """
(a) General Rule.—For purposes of this subtitle, the term 'adjusted
gross income' means, in the case of an individual, gross income minus
the deductions specified in subsection (a).
"""
variable adjusted_gross_income:
  imports:
    # Gross income components (26 USC §61)
    - 26/61/a/1#wages
    - 26/61/a/1#salaries
    - 26/61/a/1#tips
    - 26/1402/a#self_employment_income
    - 26/701#partnership_s_corp_income
    - 26/61/a/6#farm_income
    - 26/61/a/4#interest_income
    - 26/61/a/7#dividend_income
    - 26/61/a/3#capital_gains
    - 26/61/a/5#rental_income
    - 26/86#taxable_social_security
    - 26/61/a/11#pension_income
    - 26/85/a#taxable_unemployment
    - 26/402#retirement_distributions
    - 26/61/a#miscellaneous_income
    # Above-the-line deductions (26 USC §62(a))
    - 26/62/a/1#self_employment_tax_deduction
    - 26/62/a/1#self_employed_health_insurance_deduction
    - 26/62/a/2/D#educator_expense_deduction
    - 26/62/a/4#loss_deduction
    - 26/62/a/6#self_employed_pension_deduction
    - 26/62/a/7#ira_deduction
    - 26/62/a/12#hsa_deduction
    - 26/62/a/17#student_loan_interest_deduction
    - 26/62/a/23#tip_income_deduction
    - 26/225/a#qualified_overtime_deduction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Gross Income"
  description: "Gross income minus above-the-line deductions per 26 USC §62(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Step 1: Calculate gross income per 26 USC §61
    # Includes all items listed in Section 61(a)(1)-(15)
    employee_income = wages + salaries + tips
    business_income = self_employment_income + partnership_s_corp_income + farm_income
    investment_income = interest_income + dividend_income + capital_gains + rental_income
    transfer_income = taxable_social_security + pension_income + taxable_unemployment + retirement_distributions
    gross_income = employee_income + business_income + investment_income + transfer_income + miscellaneous_income
    # Step 2: Sum above-the-line deductions (Section 62(a))
    above_the_line_deductions = (
    self_employment_tax_deduction +           # §62(a)(1) - 50% of SE tax
    self_employed_health_insurance_deduction + # §62(a)(1) - health insurance for self-employed
    educator_expense_deduction +               # §62(a)(2)(D) - up to $300
    loss_deduction +                           # §62(a)(4) - losses from property sales
    self_employed_pension_deduction +          # §62(a)(6) - SEP, SIMPLE, qualified plans
    ira_deduction +                            # §62(a)(7) via §219
    hsa_deduction +                            # §62(a)(12) via §223
    student_loan_interest_deduction +          # §62(a)(17) via §221
    tip_income_deduction +                     # §62(a)(23) via §74A (OBBBA temporary)
    qualified_overtime_deduction               # §62(a)(24) via §225 (OBBBA temporary)
    )
    # Step 3: AGI = Gross Income - Above-the-Line Deductions
    return gross_income - above_the_line_deductions
  tests:
    - name: "W-2 employee with no deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 75_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        partnership_s_corp_income: 0
        farm_income: 0
        interest_income: 500
        dividend_income: 200
        capital_gains: 0
        rental_income: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        pension_income: 0
        taxable_unemployment: 0
        retirement_distributions: 0
        miscellaneous_income: 0
        self_employment_tax_deduction: 0
        self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 0
        educator_expense_deduction: 0
        loss_deduction: 0
        self_employed_pension_deduction: 0
        ira_deduction: 0
        hsa_deduction: 0
        student_loan_interest_deduction: 0
        tip_income_deduction: 0
        qualified_overtime_deduction: 0
      expect: 75_700  # 75,000 + 500 + 200

    - name: "Self-employed with SE tax and health insurance deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 120_000
        partnership_s_corp_income: 0
        farm_income: 0
        interest_income: 1_000
        dividend_income: 500
        capital_gains: 0
        rental_income: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        pension_income: 0
        taxable_unemployment: 0
        retirement_distributions: 0
        miscellaneous_income: 0
        self_employment_tax_deduction: 8_478  # 50% of SE tax on $120k
        self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 12_000
        educator_expense_deduction: 0
        loss_deduction: 0
        self_employed_pension_deduction: 0
        ira_deduction: 0
        hsa_deduction: 0
        student_loan_interest_deduction: 0
        tip_income_deduction: 0
        qualified_overtime_deduction: 0
      expect: 101_022  # 121,500 - 8,478 - 12,000

    - name: "Teacher with educator expenses and student loan interest"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 55_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        partnership_s_corp_income: 0
        farm_income: 0
        interest_income: 100
        dividend_income: 0
        capital_gains: 0
        rental_income: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        pension_income: 0
        taxable_unemployment: 0
        retirement_distributions: 0
        miscellaneous_income: 0
        self_employment_tax_deduction: 0
        self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 0
        educator_expense_deduction: 300  # 2024 limit
        loss_deduction: 0
        self_employed_pension_deduction: 0
        ira_deduction: 0
        hsa_deduction: 0
        student_loan_interest_deduction: 2_500  # 2024 limit
        tip_income_deduction: 0
        qualified_overtime_deduction: 0
      expect: 52_300  # 55,100 - 300 - 2,500

    - name: "Retiree with pension and Social Security"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        partnership_s_corp_income: 0
        farm_income: 0
        interest_income: 2_000
        dividend_income: 3_000
        capital_gains: 5_000
        rental_income: 0
        taxable_social_security: 18_000
        pension_income: 36_000
        taxable_unemployment: 0
        retirement_distributions: 0
        miscellaneous_income: 0
        self_employment_tax_deduction: 0
        self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 0
        educator_expense_deduction: 0
        loss_deduction: 0
        self_employed_pension_deduction: 0
        ira_deduction: 0
        hsa_deduction: 0
        student_loan_interest_deduction: 0
        tip_income_deduction: 0
        qualified_overtime_deduction: 0
      expect: 64_000  # 2,000 + 3,000 + 5,000 + 18,000 + 36,000

    - name: "Mixed income with HSA and IRA deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 85_000
        salaries: 0
        tips: 2_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        partnership_s_corp_income: 15_000
        farm_income: 0
        interest_income: 500
        dividend_income: 1_200
        capital_gains: 3_000
        rental_income: 6_000
        taxable_social_security: 0
        pension_income: 0
        taxable_unemployment: 0
        retirement_distributions: 0
        miscellaneous_income: 0
        self_employment_tax_deduction: 0
        self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 0
        educator_expense_deduction: 0
        loss_deduction: 0
        self_employed_pension_deduction: 0
        ira_deduction: 7_000  # 2024 limit under 50
        hsa_deduction: 4_150  # 2024 self-only limit
        student_loan_interest_deduction: 0
        tip_income_deduction: 0
        qualified_overtime_deduction: 0
      expect: 101_550  # 112,700 - 7,000 - 4,150

    - name: "Zero income results in zero AGI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        wages: 0
        salaries: 0
        tips: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        partnership_s_corp_income: 0
        farm_income: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        capital_gains: 0
        rental_income: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        pension_income: 0
        taxable_unemployment: 0
        retirement_distributions: 0
        miscellaneous_income: 0
        self_employment_tax_deduction: 0
        self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 0
        educator_expense_deduction: 0
        loss_deduction: 0
        self_employed_pension_deduction: 0
        ira_deduction: 0
        hsa_deduction: 0
        student_loan_interest_deduction: 0
        tip_income_deduction: 0
        qualified_overtime_deduction: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Self-Employment Tax Paid
documents.text:
(1) Trade and business deductions.—The deductions allowed by part VI
(sec. 161 and following) which consist of expenses paid or incurred by
the taxpayer in connection with the performance by him of services as
an employee.
documents.code:
# Deductions attributable to a trade or business carried on by the taxpayer.

parameter se_tax_deduction_rate:
  description: "Deductible portion of self-employment tax"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1990-01-01: 0.5

text: """
(1) Trade and business deductions.—The deductions allowed by part VI
(sec. 161 and following) which consist of expenses paid or incurred by
the taxpayer in connection with the performance by him of services as
an employee.
"""

input self_employment_tax_paid:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employment Tax Paid"
  description: "Total self-employment tax paid during the tax year"
  default: 0

input self_employed_health_insurance_premiums:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Health Insurance Premiums"
  description: "Health insurance premiums paid for self-employed individual and spouse/dependents"
  default: 0

# Self-employment tax deduction - 50% of SE tax
# Reference: 26 USC 164(f)
variable self_employment_tax_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employment Tax Deduction"
  description: "Deductible portion (50%) of self-employment tax per 26 USC 164(f)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only 50% of SE tax is deductible
    return self_employment_tax_paid * se_tax_deduction_rate

# Self-employed health insurance deduction
# Reference: 26 USC 162(l)
variable self_employed_health_insurance_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Health Insurance Deduction"
  description: "Health insurance premiums for self-employed individuals per 26 USC 162(l)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Full health insurance premiums are deductible if self-employed
    return self_employed_health_insurance_premiums

tests:
  - name: "Standard SE tax deduction"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_tax_paid: 3_856
    outputs:
      self_employment_tax_deduction: 1928

  - name: "No SE tax paid"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_tax_paid: 0
    outputs:
      self_employment_tax_deduction: 0

  - name: "Large SE tax deduction"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_tax_paid: 8_500
    outputs:
      self_employment_tax_deduction: 4_250

  - name: "Health insurance premiums deduction"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 6_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 6_000

  - name: "No health insurance premiums"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 0
    outputs:
      self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 0

  - name: "Combined SE tax and health insurance deductions"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_tax_paid: 4_000
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 7_200
    outputs:
      self_employment_tax_deduction: 2000
      self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 7_200

  - name: "High health insurance premiums"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employed_health_insurance_premiums: 15_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_health_insurance_deduction: 15_000

  - name: "50% of SE tax calculation"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_tax_paid: 5_000
    outputs:
      self_employment_tax_deduction: 2_500

documents.title: Covered by HDHP
documents.text:
(12) Health savings account deduction.—The deduction allowed by
section 223.
documents.code:
text: """
(12) Health savings account deduction.—The deduction allowed by
section 223.
"""

input has_hdhp:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Covered by HDHP"
  description: "Whether taxpayer is covered by a High Deductible Health Plan"
  default: False

input hsa_coverage_type:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Enum[self_only, family]
  label: "HSA Coverage Type"
  description: "Self-only or family coverage under HDHP"
  default: self_only

input hsa_contributions:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HSA Contributions"
  description: "Amount contributed to HSA during tax year"
  default: 0

input age:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Age of primary taxpayer"
  default: 30

parameter self_only_limit:
  description: "HSA contribution limit for self-only coverage"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 3_450
    2024-01-01: 4_150

parameter family_limit:
  description: "HSA contribution limit for family coverage"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 6_900
    2024-01-01: 8_300

parameter catch_up_age:
  description: "Age at which catch-up contributions allowed (55+)"
  values:
    2003-01-01: 55

parameter catch_up_amount:
  description: "HSA catch-up contribution for age 55+"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2003-01-01: 1_000

variable hsa_contribution_limit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HSA Contribution Limit"
  description: "Maximum allowable HSA contribution including catch-up"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must have HDHP to contribute
    if not has_hdhp:
      return 0
    # Base limit depends on coverage type
    if hsa_coverage_type == "self_only":
      base_limit = self_only_limit
    else:
      base_limit = family_limit
    # Add catch-up contribution if age 55 or older
    if age >= catch_up_age:
      return base_limit + catch_up_amount
    return base_limit

variable hsa_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total HSA Deduction"
  description: "Combined HSA deduction for tax unit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must have HDHP to contribute
    if not has_hdhp:
      return 0
    # Cannot deduct more than contributed or the annual limit
    limit = hsa_contribution_limit
    return min(hsa_contributions, limit)

tests:
  - name: "Self-only coverage, under age 55, at limit"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: self_only
        hsa_contributions: 4_150
        age: 40
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 4_150
      hsa_deduction: 4_150

  - name: "Self-only coverage with catch-up at age 55"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: self_only
        hsa_contributions: 5_150
        age: 55
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 5_150
      hsa_deduction: 5_150

  - name: "Family coverage, under age 55"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: family
        hsa_contributions: 8_300
        age: 45
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 8_300
      hsa_deduction: 8_300

  - name: "Family coverage with catch-up at age 65"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: family
        hsa_contributions: 9_300
        age: 65
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 9_300
      hsa_deduction: 9_300

  - name: "No HDHP, no deduction allowed"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: false
        hsa_coverage_type: self_only
        hsa_contributions: 4_150
        age: 40
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 0
      hsa_deduction: 0

  - name: "Contributions below limit"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: self_only
        hsa_contributions: 2000
        age: 40
    outputs:
      hsa_deduction: 2000

  - name: "Contributions exceed limit, capped"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: self_only
        hsa_contributions: 6_000
        age: 40
    outputs:
      hsa_deduction: 4_150

  - name: "Zero contributions"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: family
        hsa_contributions: 0
        age: 50
    outputs:
      hsa_deduction: 0

  - name: "2018 limits, self-only"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: self_only
        hsa_contributions: 3_450
        age: 40
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 3_450
      hsa_deduction: 3_450

  - name: "2018 limits, family with catch-up"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        has_hdhp: true
        hsa_coverage_type: family
        hsa_contributions: 7_900
        age: 55
    outputs:
      hsa_contribution_limit: 7_900
      hsa_deduction: 7_900

documents.title: Student Loan Interest Paid
documents.text: (17) Interest on education loans.—The deduction allowed by section 221.
documents.code:
text: """
(17) Interest on education loans.—The deduction allowed by section 221.
"""

# Input for student loan interest paid during the year
input student_loan_interest_paid:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Student Loan Interest Paid"
  description: "Total interest paid on qualified education loans during tax year"
  default: 0

# 26 USC 221(b)(1) - Maximum deduction cap
parameter max_deduction:
  description: "Maximum annual student loan interest deduction"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2_500
    2023-01-01: 2_500
    2000-01-01: 2_500

variable student_loan_interest_deduction:
  imports: [26/1#filing_status]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Student Loan Interest Deduction"
  description: "Above-the-line deduction for student loan interest per 26 USC 221"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cannot deduct more than paid or the maximum
    return min(student_loan_interest_paid, max_deduction)

tests:
  - name: "Interest paid below cap - full deduction"
    period: 2024
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        student_loan_interest_paid: 1_500
    outputs:
      student_loan_interest_deduction: 1_500

  - name: "Interest paid at cap - capped deduction"
    period: 2024
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        student_loan_interest_paid: 2_500
    outputs:
      student_loan_interest_deduction: 2_500

  - name: "Interest paid exceeds cap - limited to max"
    period: 2024
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        student_loan_interest_paid: 4_000
    outputs:
      student_loan_interest_deduction: 2_500

  - name: "Zero interest paid - no deduction"
    period: 2024
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        student_loan_interest_paid: 0
    outputs:
      student_loan_interest_deduction: 0

  - name: "Small interest amount - full deduction"
    period: 2024
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        student_loan_interest_paid: 250
    outputs:
      student_loan_interest_deduction: 250

  - name: "Historical period 2023 - same cap applies"
    period: 2023
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        student_loan_interest_paid: 3_000
    outputs:
      student_loan_interest_deduction: 2_500

documents.title: Eligible Educator
documents.text:
(2) Certain trade and business deductions of employees.—
(D) Deduction for certain expenses of eligible educators.—
The deductions allowed by section 162 which consist of expenses,
not in excess of $300, paid or incurred by an eligible educator—
(i) by reason of the participation of the educator in professional
development courses related to the curriculum in which the
educator provides instruction or to the students for whom the
educator provides instruction, and
(ii) in connection with books, supplies (other than nonathletic
supplies for courses of instruction in health or physical
education), computer equipment (including related software
and services), other equipment, and supplementary materials
used by the eligible educator in the classroom.
documents.code:
text: """
(2) Certain trade and business deductions of employees.—
(D) Deduction for certain expenses of eligible educators.—
The deductions allowed by section 162 which consist of expenses,
not in excess of $300, paid or incurred by an eligible educator—
(i) by reason of the participation of the educator in professional
development courses related to the curriculum in which the
educator provides instruction or to the students for whom the
educator provides instruction, and
(ii) in connection with books, supplies (other than nonathletic
supplies for courses of instruction in health or physical
education), computer equipment (including related software
and services), other equipment, and supplementary materials
used by the eligible educator in the classroom.
"""
input is_eligible_educator:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Eligible Educator"
  description: "Whether taxpayer is an eligible educator (K-12 teacher/instructor)"
  default: False

input educator_expenses:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Educator Expenses"
  description: "Qualified out-of-pocket expenses for classroom supplies and professional development"
  default: 0

variable educator_expense_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Educator Expense Deduction"
  description: "Combined educator expense deduction for tax unit (both spouses if applicable)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only eligible educators can claim this deduction
    if not is_eligible_educator:
      return 0
    # Cannot deduct more than the maximum allowed
    return min(educator_expenses, max_deduction)

parameter max_deduction:
  description: "Maximum educator expense deduction per taxpayer per year"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2002-01-01: 250
    2018-01-01: 300

tests:
  - name: "Eligible educator with qualifying expenses below limit"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 250
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 250

  - name: "Eligible educator with expenses above limit"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 500
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 300

  - name: "Eligible educator with no expenses"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 0
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 0

  - name: "Non-educator cannot claim deduction"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: false
        educator_expenses: 400
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 0

  - name: "Educator with exactly limit amount (2018+)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 300
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 300

  - name: "Educator limit was lower in 2002"
    period: 2002-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 300
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 250

  - name: "Educator with minimal expenses"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 50
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 50

  - name: "Large expenses capped at maximum"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        is_eligible_educator: true
        educator_expenses: 1_000
    outputs:
      educator_expense_deduction: 300

documents.title: Qualified Tip Income
documents.text:
(23) Qualified tip income.—In the case of an individual, the deduction
allowed by section 74A (relating to exclusion for qualified tips).
documents.code:
text: """
(23) Qualified tip income.—In the case of an individual, the deduction
allowed by section 74A (relating to exclusion for qualified tips).
"""

input qualified_tip_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Qualified Tip Income"
  description: "Tips received in qualified occupations (food service, hospitality, etc.)"
  default: 0

parameter max_deduction:
  description: "Maximum annual tip income deduction"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2025-01-01: 25_000

parameter termination_year:
  description: "Final year the tip income deduction is available"
  unit: years
  values:
    2025-01-01: 2028

variable tip_income_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/1402/a#self_employment_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Tip Income Deduction"
  description: "Above-the-line deduction for qualified tip income per 26 USC 62(a)(23) via Section 74A"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 74A(g): No deduction after the termination year
    if tax_year > termination_year:
        return 0
    # Section 74A(e): Married individuals must file jointly
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
        return 0
    # For employees (not self-employed): deduction is lesser of tips or max
    # For self-employed: also limited to net self-employment earnings
    base_deduction = min(qualified_tip_income, max_deduction)
    if self_employment_income <= 0:
        # Not self-employed, use full capped amount
        return base_deduction
    # Self-employed: cannot exceed net earnings from trade/business
    return min(base_deduction, self_employment_income)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Employee with tips below max"
      period: 2025
      inputs:
        qualified_tip_income: 15_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 15_000
    - name: "Employee with tips at max cap"
      period: 2025
      inputs:
        qualified_tip_income: 30_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 25_000
    - name: "Self-employed limited by SE income"
      period: 2025
      inputs:
        qualified_tip_income: 20_000
        self_employment_income: 12_000
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 12_000
    - name: "Married filing separately disqualified"
      period: 2025
      inputs:
        qualified_tip_income: 10_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
      expect: 0
    - name: "After termination year no deduction"
      period: 2029
      inputs:
        qualified_tip_income: 15_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0
    - name: "Zero tips zero deduction"
      period: 2025
      inputs:
        qualified_tip_income: 0
        self_employment_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 0

documents.title: Self-Employment Income
documents.text:
(6) Pension, profit-sharing, and annuity plans of self-employed
individuals.—In the case of an individual who is an employee within
the meaning of section 401(c)(1), the deduction allowed by section 404.
documents.code:
# Deductions for contributions to qualified retirement plans by self-employed.

text: """
(6) Pension, profit-sharing, and annuity plans of self-employed
individuals.—In the case of an individual who is an employee within
the meaning of section 401(c)(1), the deduction allowed by section 404.
"""

input self_employment_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employment Income"
  description: "Net self-employment income (Schedule C)"
  default: 0

input self_employed_pension_contributions:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Pension Contributions"
  description: "Contributions to SEP, SIMPLE, Solo 401(k), or other qualified self-employed plans"
  default: 0

parameter sep_contribution_rate:
  description: "Maximum contribution rate for SEP plans (25% of net self-employment income)"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 0.25

parameter solo_401k_employee_limit:
  description: "Employee deferral limit for Solo 401(k) plans"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 18_500
    2024-01-01: 23_500

parameter solo_401k_employer_limit:
  description: "Employer contribution limit for Solo 401(k) plans (25% of net SE income)"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 0.25

variable self_employed_pension_limit:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Pension Contribution Limit"
  description: "Maximum deductible pension contribution based on self-employment income"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Maximum is generally 25% of net self-employment income
    # Capped at annual limits for specific plan types
    max_contribution = self_employment_income * sep_contribution_rate
    return min(max_contribution, solo_401k_employee_limit + int(solo_401k_employer_limit * self_employment_income))

variable self_employed_pension_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Self-Employed Pension Deduction"
  description: "Contributions to SEP, SIMPLE, or qualified plans by self-employed per 26 USC 62(a)(6)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cannot deduct more than contributed or the annual limit
    limit = self_employed_pension_limit
    return min(self_employed_pension_contributions, limit)

tests:
  - name: "SEP contribution at limit"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 100_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 25_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 25_000

  - name: "No self-employment income"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 0
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 10_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_limit: 0
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 0

  - name: "Contribution below limit"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 100_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 15_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 15_000

  - name: "Contribution exceeds limit, capped"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 100_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 35_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 25_000

  - name: "High self-employment income"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 200_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 50_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 50_000

  - name: "Low self-employment income"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 30_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 7_500
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 7_500

  - name: "25% of SE income rule"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 80_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 20_000
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 20_000

  - name: "No contributions"
    period: 2024-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        self_employment_income: 100_000
        self_employed_pension_contributions: 0
    outputs:
      self_employed_pension_deduction: 0

documents.title: Traditional IRA Contributions
documents.text:
(7) Retirement savings.—The deduction allowed by section 219 (relating
to deduction for retirement savings).
documents.code:
text: """
(7) Retirement savings.—The deduction allowed by section 219 (relating
to deduction for retirement savings).
"""
parameter contribution_limit:
  description: "IRA regular contribution limit"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/b/5
  values:
    2018-01-01: 5_500

# Statutory fixed amount - not indexed
parameter catch_up_amount:
  description: "IRA catch-up contribution for age 50+"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2006-01-01: 1_000

# Statutory age threshold - not indexed
parameter catch_up_age:
  description: "Age at which catch-up contributions allowed"
  values:
    2002-01-01: 50

# Phase-out thresholds - indexed annually
parameter phaseout_single_start:
  description: "IRA phase-out start for single filers covered by employer plan"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/g
  values:
    2018-01-01: 63_000

parameter phaseout_single_end:
  description: "IRA phase-out end for single filers covered by employer plan"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/g
  values:
    2018-01-01: 73_000

parameter phaseout_joint_start:
  description: "IRA phase-out start for joint filers (contributor covered)"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/g
  values:
    2018-01-01: 101_000

parameter phaseout_joint_end:
  description: "IRA phase-out end for joint filers (contributor covered)"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/g
  values:
    2018-01-01: 121_000

parameter phaseout_spouse_covered_start:
  description: "IRA phase-out start when only spouse is covered"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/g
  values:
    2018-01-01: 189_000

parameter phaseout_spouse_covered_end:
  description: "IRA phase-out end when only spouse is covered"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/219/g
  values:
    2018-01-01: 199_000

# Statutory fixed threshold - not indexed
parameter phaseout_mfs_start:
  description: "IRA phase-out start for MFS when spouse is covered"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 0

parameter phaseout_mfs_end:
  description: "IRA phase-out end for MFS when spouse is covered"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2018-01-01: 10_000


input traditional_ira_contributions:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Traditional IRA Contributions"
  description: "Contributions made to traditional IRA during the tax year"
  default: 0

input has_retirement_plan_at_work:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Covered by Employer Retirement Plan"
  description: "Whether the individual is an active participant in an employer retirement plan"
  default: False


variable ira_contribution_limit:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "IRA Contribution Limit"
  description: "Maximum allowable IRA contribution including catch-up"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    base_limit = contribution_limit
    # Add catch-up contribution if age 50 or older
    if age >= catch_up_age:
      return base_limit + catch_up_amount
    return base_limit

variable ira_deduction_before_phaseout:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "IRA Deduction Before Phase-out"
  description: "IRA deduction amount before applying income phase-out"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cannot deduct more than contributed or the annual limit
    return min(traditional_ira_contributions, ira_contribution_limit)

variable ira_phaseout_ratio:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  label: "IRA Deduction Phase-out Ratio"
  description: "Ratio of IRA deduction that is phased out based on income"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # If not covered by employer plan, no phase-out applies
    if not has_retirement_plan_at_work:
      return 0
    # Determine phase-out range based on filing status
    start = phaseout_single_start
    end = phaseout_single_end
    magi = adjusted_gross_income
    if magi <= start:
      return 0  # No phase-out
    if magi >= end:
      return 1  # Fully phased out
    # Proportional phase-out
    return (magi - start) / (end - start)

variable ira_deduction:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "IRA Deduction"
  description: "Above-the-line deduction for traditional IRA contributions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    base_deduction = ira_deduction_before_phaseout
    phaseout = ira_phaseout_ratio
    # Apply phase-out
    return base_deduction * (1 - phaseout)

variable total_ira_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total IRA Deduction"
  description: "Combined IRA deduction for tax unit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return sum(members.ira_deduction)


tests:
  # ============================================================
  # ira_contribution_limit tests
  # ============================================================
  - name: "ira_contribution_limit: Under 50, base limit only"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 5_500

  - name: "ira_contribution_limit: Age 49, just below catch-up threshold"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 49
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 5_500

  - name: "ira_contribution_limit: Age 50, exactly at catch-up threshold"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 50
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500

  - name: "ira_contribution_limit: Age 65, well above catch-up threshold"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 65
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500

  - name: "ira_contribution_limit: Very young taxpayer (age 18)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 18
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 5_500

  # ============================================================
  # ira_deduction_before_phaseout tests
  # ============================================================
  - name: "ira_deduction_before_phaseout: Zero contributions"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 0
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 0
      ira_deduction: 0

  - name: "ira_deduction_before_phaseout: Small contribution below limit"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 1_000
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 1_000
      ira_deduction: 1_000

  - name: "ira_deduction_before_phaseout: Contribution exactly at limit (under 50)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 5_500
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "ira_deduction_before_phaseout: Contribution exceeds limit (under 50)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 10_000
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 5_500
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "ira_deduction_before_phaseout: Contribution exactly at catch-up limit (age 50+)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 55
        traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 6_500
      ira_deduction: 6_500

  - name: "ira_deduction_before_phaseout: Contribution exceeds catch-up limit (age 50+)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 60
        traditional_ira_contributions: 8_000
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 6_500
      ira_deduction: 6_500

  # ============================================================
  # ira_phaseout_ratio tests
  # ============================================================
  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: No employer plan, no phaseout regardless of income"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income at zero"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income exactly at phaseout start ($63,000)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 63_000
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income $1 above phaseout start"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 63_001
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.1
      ira_deduction: 5499.45

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income at 25% through phaseout range"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 65_500
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.25
      ira_deduction: 4_125

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income at 50% through phaseout range ($68,000)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 68_000
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.5
      ira_deduction: 2_750

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income at 75% through phaseout range"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 70_500
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.75
      ira_deduction: 1_375

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income $1 below phaseout end"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 72_999
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.9_999
      ira_deduction: 0.55

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income exactly at phaseout end ($73,000)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 73_000
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 1
      ira_deduction: 0

  - name: "ira_phaseout_ratio: Employer plan, income above phaseout end (fully phased out)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 1
      ira_deduction: 0

  # ============================================================
  # ira_deduction tests (combined scenarios)
  # ============================================================
  - name: "ira_deduction: Under 50, no employer plan, full contribution"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 35
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "ira_deduction: Age 50+, catch-up eligible, no employer plan"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 55
        traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500
      ira_deduction: 6_500

  - name: "ira_deduction: Age 50+ with catch-up and mid-phaseout"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 55
        traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 68_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.5
      ira_deduction: 3_250

  - name: "ira_deduction: Age 65+ with catch-up fully phased out"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 65
        traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 1
      ira_deduction: 0

  - name: "ira_deduction: Partial contribution with no employer plan"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 30
        traditional_ira_contributions: 2_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 45_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 2_500
      ira_deduction: 2_500

  - name: "ira_deduction: Partial contribution with employer plan and partial phaseout"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 30
        traditional_ira_contributions: 2_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 68_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 2_500
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.5
      ira_deduction: 1_250

  # ============================================================
  # total_ira_deduction tests (tax unit aggregation)
  # ============================================================
  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Single person tax unit"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 40
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, both under 50"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 40
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
          - age: 35
            traditional_ira_contributions: 3_000
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 8_500

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, one with catch-up"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 55
            traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
          - age: 45
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 12_000

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, both with catch-up"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 60
            traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
          - age: 55
            traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 13_000

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, mixed employer plan status"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 40
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
          - age: 35
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
            adjusted_gross_income: 68_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 8_250

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, one fully phased out"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 40
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
          - age: 35
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
            adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, both fully phased out"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 40
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
            adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
          - age: 35
            traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
            adjusted_gross_income: 100_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 0

  - name: "total_ira_deduction: Two people, neither contributes"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      tax_unit:
        members:
          - age: 40
            traditional_ira_contributions: 0
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
          - age: 35
            traditional_ira_contributions: 0
            has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
            adjusted_gross_income: 60_000
    outputs:
      total_ira_deduction: 0

  # ============================================================
  # Edge cases and boundary values
  # ============================================================
  - name: "Edge case: Very large income with no employer plan (no phaseout)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 40
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 1_000_000
    outputs:
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0
      ira_deduction: 5_500

  - name: "Edge case: Very small contribution ($1)"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 30
        traditional_ira_contributions: 1
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: false
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
    outputs:
      ira_deduction_before_phaseout: 1
      ira_deduction: 1

  - name: "Edge case: Contribution exactly at base limit for under 50 with employer plan fully phased out"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 45
        traditional_ira_contributions: 5_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 5_500
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 1
      ira_deduction: 0

  - name: "Edge case: Age exactly 50, employer plan, mid-phaseout"
    period: 2018-01
    inputs:
      person:
        age: 50
        traditional_ira_contributions: 6_500
        has_retirement_plan_at_work: true
        adjusted_gross_income: 68_000
    outputs:
      ira_contribution_limit: 6_500
      ira_phaseout_ratio: 0.5
      ira_deduction: 3_250

documents.title: Dependent Status
documents.code:
# This file provides the primary standard_deduction variable that aggregates:
# - Basic standard deduction (63(c)(2))
# - Dependent limitation (63(c)(5))
# - Additional amounts for aged/blind (63(f))
# - Ineligibility rules (63(c)(6))

text: """
26 USC Section 63 - Taxable Income Defined

(a) In general.-- Except as provided in subsection (b), for purposes of
this subtitle, the term "taxable income" means gross income minus the
deductions allowed by this chapter (other than the standard deduction).

(b) Individuals who do not itemize their deductions.-- In the case of
an individual who does not elect to itemize his deductions for the
taxable year, for purposes of this subtitle, the term "taxable income"
means adjusted gross income, minus--
(1) the standard deduction, and
(2) the deduction for personal exemptions provided in section 151.

(c) Standard deduction.--
(1) In general.-- For purposes of this subtitle--
(A) In the case of an individual who is not a married individual
(as defined in section 7703) who is not a surviving spouse or head
of household (as defined in section 2), the term "standard deduction"
means the sum of--
(i) the basic standard deduction, and
(ii) the additional standard deduction.

(c)(2) Basic standard deduction.-- For purposes of paragraph (1), the
basic standard deduction is--
(A) 200 percent of the dollar amount in effect under subparagraph (C)
for the taxable year in the case of--
(i) a joint return, or
(ii) a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)),
(B) $4,400 in the case of a head of household (as defined in
section 2(b)), or
(C) $3,000 in any other case.

(c)(5) Limitation on basic standard deduction in the case of certain
dependents.-- In the case of an individual with respect to whom a
deduction under section 151 is allowable to another taxpayer for a
taxable year beginning in the calendar year in which the individual's
taxable year begins, the basic standard deduction applicable to such
individual for such individual's taxable year shall not exceed the
greater of--
(A) $500, or
(B) the sum of $250 and such individual's earned income.

(c)(6) Certain individuals, etc., not eligible for standard deduction.--
In the case of--
(A) a married individual filing a separate return where either spouse
itemizes deductions,
(B) a nonresident alien individual, or
(C) an individual making a return under section 443(a)(1) for a
period of less than 12 months on account of a change in his annual
accounting period,
the standard deduction shall be zero.

(f) Aged or blind additional amounts.--
(1) Additional amounts for the aged.-- The taxpayer shall be entitled
to an additional amount of $600--
(A) for himself if he has attained age 65 before the close of his
taxable year, and
(B) for the spouse of the taxpayer if the spouse has attained age
65 before the close of the taxable year and an additional exemption
is allowable to the taxpayer for such spouse under section 151(b).
(2) Additional amount for blind.-- The taxpayer shall be entitled
to an additional amount of $600--
(A) for himself if he is blind at the close of the taxable year, and
(B) for the spouse of the taxpayer if the spouse is blind as of the
close of the taxable year and an additional exemption is allowable
to the taxpayer for such spouse under section 151(b).
(3) Higher amount for certain unmarried individuals.-- In the case of
an individual who is not married and is not a surviving spouse,
paragraphs (1) and (2) shall be applied by substituting "$750"
for "$600".
"""

input is_dependent:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Dependent Status"
  description: "Whether the taxpayer can be claimed as a dependent on another return"
  default: false

# Main standard deduction variable
variable standard_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/63/c/2#basic_standard_deduction
    - 26/63/c/5#dependent_standard_deduction
    - 26/63/f#additional_standard_deduction
    - 26/63/c/6#is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Standard Deduction"
  description: "Total standard deduction including basic and additional amounts per 26 USC 63"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 63(c)(5): Use dependent limitation if applicable
    if is_dependent:
        basic = dependent_standard_deduction
    else:
        basic = basic_standard_deduction
    # 63(c)(6): Check for ineligibility (MFS spouse itemizes, NRA, etc.)
    if is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
        return 0
    return basic + additional_standard_deduction
  tests:
    # FILING STATUS: Single
    - name: "Single filer 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 30
        is_blind: false
      expect: 14600
      description: "Basic single filer, no dependent, no aged/blind credits"

    - name: "Single aged exactly 65 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 65
        is_blind: false
      expect: 16550
      description: "Single filer at minimum aged threshold (65)"

    - name: "Single aged 67 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 67
        is_blind: false
      expect: 16550
      description: "Single aged 65+ gets additional $1,950"

    - name: "Single blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 40
        is_blind: true
      expect: 16550
      description: "Single blind person gets additional $1,950"

    - name: "Single aged and blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 70
        is_blind: true
      expect: 18500
      description: "Single filer qualifies for both aged and blind: $14,600 + $1,950 + $1,950"

    # FILING STATUS: Married Filing Jointly
    - name: "Married filing jointly under 65 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 40
        spouse_age: 38
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 29200
      description: "Married couple, both under 65, no blind credits"

    - name: "Married filing jointly one aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 67
        spouse_age: 60
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 30750
      description: "One spouse 65+: $29,200 + $1,550"

    - name: "Married filing jointly both aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 68
        spouse_age: 66
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 32300
      description: "Both aged 65+: $29,200 + $1,550 + $1,550"

    - name: "Married filing jointly both blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 45
        spouse_age: 43
        is_blind: true
        spouse_is_blind: true
      expect: 32300
      description: "Both blind: $29,200 + $1,550 + $1,550"

    - name: "Married filing jointly both aged and both blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 72
        spouse_age: 70
        is_blind: true
        spouse_is_blind: true
      expect: 35400
      description: "Both 65+ and both blind: $29,200 + (1,550 × 2) + (1,550 × 2)"

    # FILING STATUS: Married Filing Separately
    - name: "Married filing separately 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 45
        is_blind: false
      expect: 14600
      description: "MFS uses single amount when eligible"

    - name: "Married filing separately aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 66
        is_blind: false
      expect: 16150
      description: "MFS aged 65+ uses married aged amount: $14,600 + $1,550"

    - name: "Married filing separately spouse itemizes 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        age: 45
        is_blind: false
      expect: 0
      description: "MFS ineligible when spouse itemizes per 63(c)(6)(A)"

    # FILING STATUS: Head of Household
    - name: "Head of household 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 35
        is_blind: false
      expect: 21900
      description: "Head of household basic amount"

    - name: "Head of household aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 66
        is_blind: false
      expect: 23850
      description: "HOH aged 65+ uses single aged amount: $21,900 + $1,950"

    - name: "Head of household blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 40
        is_blind: true
      expect: 23850
      description: "HOH blind uses single blind amount: $21,900 + $1,950"

    # FILING STATUS: Qualifying Widow(er)
    - name: "Qualifying widow 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: QUALIFYING_WIDOW
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 50
        is_blind: false
      expect: 29200
      description: "QW uses married (joint) amount"

    - name: "Qualifying widow aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: QUALIFYING_WIDOW
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 68
        is_blind: false
      expect: 30750
      description: "QW aged uses married aged amount: $29,200 + $1,550"

    # DEPENDENT STANDARD DEDUCTION
    - name: "Dependent with no earned income 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 0
        age: 16
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1300
      description: "Dependent minimum floor per 63(c)(5)(A)"

    - name: "Dependent exactly at threshold $850 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 850
        age: 17
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1300
      description: "Dependent earned income at threshold: still gets minimum $1,300"

    - name: "Dependent just above threshold $900 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 900
        age: 17
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1350
      description: "Dependent formula: $250 + $900 earned income = $1,150, capped at $14,600"

    - name: "Dependent with $5_000 earned income 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 5_000
        age: 17
        is_blind: false
      expect: 5450
      description: "Dependent formula: $250 + $5,000 = $5,250, includes addon"

    - name: "Dependent earned income capped at basic 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 20_000
        age: 19
        is_blind: false
      expect: 14600
      description: "Dependent cannot exceed basic single deduction of $14,600"

    - name: "Dependent aged also uses limit 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 8_000
        age: 67
        is_blind: false
      expect: 8450
      description: "Dependent limit applies even if aged: $250 + $8,000, not eligible for aged credit"

    - name: "Dependent MFJ married child 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 0
        age: 22
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1300
      description: "Dependent MFJ child still limited per 63(c)(5)"

    # INELIGIBILITY CASES
    - name: "Ineligible - MFS spouse itemizes 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        age: 45
        is_blind: false
      expect: 0
      description: "MFS spouse itemizing makes other ineligible per 63(c)(6)(A)"

    - name: "Ineligible - nonresident alien 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        age: 35
        is_blind: false
      expect: 0
      description: "Nonresident alien ineligible per 63(c)(6)(B)"

    # HISTORICAL YEAR TESTS
    - name: "Single filer 2023"
      period: 2023-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 30
        is_blind: false
      expect: 13850
      description: "2023 single basic amount (indexed)"

    - name: "Married filing jointly 2023"
      period: 2023-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 40
        spouse_age: 38
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 27700
      description: "2023 married joint basic amount (indexed)"

    - name: "Head of household 2023"
      period: 2023-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        age: 35
        is_blind: false
      expect: 20800
      description: "2023 HOH basic amount (indexed)"

    # EDGE CASES
    - name: "Single dependent aged and blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        earned_income: 0
        age: 67
        is_blind: true
      expect: 1300
      description: "Dependent limit applies first, no age/blind credits for dependents"

    - name: "Married MFS both aged but ineligible 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        is_dependent: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        age: 70
        is_blind: false
      expect: 0
      description: "Ineligibility overrides all age/blind calculations"

documents.title: Taxable Income
documents.text:
26 USC 63(a) - In General

(a) In general.— Except as provided in subsection (b), for purposes of
this subtitle, the term 'taxable income' means gross income minus
the deductions allowed by this chapter (other than the standard
deduction).
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC 63(a) - In General

(a) In general.— Except as provided in subsection (b), for purposes of
this subtitle, the term 'taxable income' means gross income minus
the deductions allowed by this chapter (other than the standard
deduction).
"""

# 26 USC 63(a) - Taxable Income for Itemizers
# For taxpayers who elect to itemize, taxable income = gross income - itemized deductions
# The actual combined calculation is below since it handles both (a) and (b)
variable taxable_income:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/63/e#taxable_income_deductions
    - 26/151#personal_exemption
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Taxable Income"
  description: "Adjusted gross income minus deductions per 26 USC 63"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    deductions = taxable_income_deductions
    # Personal exemption (suspended 2018-2025 by TCJA Section 11041)
    exemptions = personal_exemption
    # Taxable income cannot be negative
    return max(0, agi - deductions - exemptions)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer with wage income using standard deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
        taxable_income_deductions: 14_600  # 2024 single standard deduction
        personal_exemption: 0  # Suspended under TCJA
      expect: 60_400  # 75,000 - 14,600 - 0

    - name: "Married filing jointly with higher income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
        taxable_income_deductions: 29_200  # 2024 MFJ standard deduction
        personal_exemption: 0
      expect: 120_800  # 150,000 - 29,200

    - name: "Taxpayer with itemized deductions exceeding standard"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 200_000
        taxable_income_deductions: 45_000  # High itemized (mortgage, SALT, charity)
        personal_exemption: 0
      expect: 155_000  # 200,000 - 45,000

    - name: "Low income with deductions exceeding AGI floors to zero"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 10_000
        taxable_income_deductions: 14_600  # Standard deduction exceeds AGI
        personal_exemption: 0
      expect: 0  # max(0, 10,000 - 14,600) = 0, cannot be negative

    - name: "Pre-TCJA year with personal exemption"
      period: 2017
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 80_000
        taxable_income_deductions: 6_350  # 2017 single standard deduction
        personal_exemption: 4_050  # Pre-TCJA exemption amount
      expect: 69_600  # 80,000 - 6,350 - 4,050

    - name: "Zero income taxpayer"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        taxable_income_deductions: 14_600
        personal_exemption: 0
      expect: 0  # max(0, 0 - 14,600) = 0

documents.title: Uses Standard Deduction
documents.text:
26 USC 63(b) - Individuals Who Do Not Itemize Their Deductions

(b) Individuals who do not itemize their deductions.— In the case of
an individual who does not elect to itemize his deductions for the
taxable year, for purposes of this subtitle, the term 'taxable
income' means adjusted gross income, minus—
(1) the standard deduction, and
(2) the deduction for personal exemptions provided in section 151.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC 63(b) - Individuals Who Do Not Itemize Their Deductions

(b) Individuals who do not itemize their deductions.— In the case of
an individual who does not elect to itemize his deductions for the
taxable year, for purposes of this subtitle, the term 'taxable
income' means adjusted gross income, minus—
(1) the standard deduction, and
(2) the deduction for personal exemptions provided in section 151.
"""

# 26 USC 63(b) - Taxable Income for Non-Itemizers
# For taxpayers who use the standard deduction:
# taxable income = AGI - standard deduction - personal exemptions

# Note: The actual taxable_income variable is in 63/a.rac and handles
# both (a) itemizers and (b) non-itemizers by importing the appropriate
# deduction choice from 63/e.rac

variable uses_standard_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Uses Standard Deduction"
  description: "Whether taxpayer uses standard deduction instead of itemizing"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 63(b): taxpayers who do not elect to itemize use standard deduction
    # This is determined by comparing standard vs itemized deductions
    # (handled in 63/e.rac)
    return not elects_to_itemize
  default: True
  tests:
    - name: "Taxpayer using standard deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        elects_to_itemize: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Taxpayer electing to itemize"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        elects_to_itemize: true
      expect: false

documents.title: Dependent Status
documents.text:
26 USC § 63(c) - Standard Deduction

(2) Basic standard deduction.—For purposes of paragraph (1), the basic standard
deduction is—
(A) 200 percent of the dollar amount in effect under subparagraph (C) for the
taxable year in the case of—
(i) a joint return, or
(ii) a surviving spouse,
(B) $4,400 in the case of a head of household, or
(C) $3,000 in any other case.

(5) Limitation on basic standard deduction in the case of certain dependents.—
In the case of an individual with respect to whom a deduction under section 151
is allowable to another taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar
year in which the individual's taxable year begins, the basic standard deduction
applicable to such individual for such individual's taxable year shall not exceed
the greater of—
(A) $500, or
(B) the sum of $250 and such individual's earned income.

(6) Certain individuals, etc., not eligible for standard deduction.—
In the case of—
(A) a married individual filing a separate return where either spouse itemizes,
(B) a nonresident alien individual,
the standard deduction shall be zero.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC § 63(c) - Standard Deduction

(2) Basic standard deduction.—For purposes of paragraph (1), the basic standard
deduction is—
(A) 200 percent of the dollar amount in effect under subparagraph (C) for the
taxable year in the case of—
(i) a joint return, or
(ii) a surviving spouse,
(B) $4,400 in the case of a head of household, or
(C) $3,000 in any other case.

(5) Limitation on basic standard deduction in the case of certain dependents.—
In the case of an individual with respect to whom a deduction under section 151
is allowable to another taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar
year in which the individual's taxable year begins, the basic standard deduction
applicable to such individual for such individual's taxable year shall not exceed
the greater of—
(A) $500, or
(B) the sum of $250 and such individual's earned income.

(6) Certain individuals, etc., not eligible for standard deduction.—
In the case of—
(A) a married individual filing a separate return where either spouse itemizes,
(B) a nonresident alien individual,
the standard deduction shall be zero.
"""

# Standalone validation version - all logic inline (no imports)
# Simplified for vectorization - no nested if/else

input is_dependent:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Dependent Status"
  description: "Whether the taxpayer can be claimed as a dependent on another return"
  default: false

input earned_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Taxpayer's earned income for dependent standard deduction calculation"
  default: 0

input max_age:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Maximum Age in Tax Unit"
  description: "Maximum age of taxpayer(s) for additional standard deduction"
  default: 0

input any_blind:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Any Blind"
  description: "Whether any taxpayer in the unit is blind"
  default: false

input is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Ineligible for Standard Deduction"
  description: "Whether taxpayer is ineligible for standard deduction (e.g., NRA or spouse itemizes)"
  default: false

variable standard_deduction_standalone:
  imports:
    - 26/2/b#filing_status
    - 26/63/c/2#basic_joint
    - 26/63/c/2#basic_head_of_household
    - 26/63/c/2#basic_single
    - 26/63/c/5#dependent_minimum
    - 26/63/c/5#dependent_earned_addon
    - 26/63/f/1#additional_aged_married
    - 26/63/f/1#additional_aged_unmarried
    - 26/63/f/2#additional_blind_married
    - 26/63/f/2#additional_blind_unmarried
    - 26/63/f/1#aged_threshold
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Standard Deduction"
  description: "Total standard deduction including basic and additional amounts per 26 USC 63"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 63(c)(2): Basic standard deduction based on filing status
    # Use JOINT since that's what the validation passes in for married couples
    if filing_status == JOINT:
        basic = basic_joint
    elif filing_status == HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD:
        basic = basic_head_of_household
    else:
        basic = basic_single
    # 63(c)(5): Dependents get limited deduction (compute unconditionally)
    dep_deduction = min(dependent_minimum + earned_income + dependent_earned_addon, basic)
    dep_deduction = max(dependent_minimum, dep_deduction)
    # Select basic based on dependent status (vectorized)
    basic_final = basic * (1 - is_dependent) + dep_deduction * is_dependent
    # 63(f): Additional amounts - simplified using JOINT = married
    # JOINT filers use married amounts, others use unmarried
    aged_married = additional_aged_married * (max_age >= aged_threshold)
    aged_unmarried = additional_aged_unmarried * (max_age >= aged_threshold)
    blind_married = additional_blind_married * any_blind
    blind_unmarried = additional_blind_unmarried * any_blind
    # Select additional based on filing status
    is_joint = (filing_status == JOINT)
    additional = (aged_married + blind_married) * is_joint + (aged_unmarried + blind_unmarried) * (1 - is_joint)
    # 63(c)(6): Ineligible filers get zero
    total = (basic_final + additional) * (1 - is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction)
    return total
  default: 0
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # BASIC STANDARD DEDUCTION BY FILING STATUS (non-dependent, non-elderly/blind)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single filer - basic standard deduction only"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 40
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000  # basic_single = $3,000

    - name: "Joint filer - basic standard deduction only"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 50
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_000  # basic_joint = $5,000

    - name: "Head of household - basic standard deduction only"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
