        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 45
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 4_400  # basic_head_of_household = $4,400

    # ============================================================================
    # ELDERLY TAXPAYERS (age 65+) - ADDITIONAL DEDUCTION
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single filer aged 65 - gets unmarried elderly additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_750  # 3000 + 750 (additional_aged_unmarried)

    - name: "Single filer aged 70 - elderly additional applies"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 70
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_750  # 3000 + 750

    - name: "Joint filer aged 65 - gets married elderly additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_600  # 5000 + 600 (additional_aged_married)

    - name: "Head of household aged 65 - gets unmarried elderly additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_150  # 4400 + 750 (additional_aged_unmarried)

    - name: "Single filer aged 64 - just below threshold, no additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 64
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000  # No additional for age < 65

    # ============================================================================
    # BLIND TAXPAYERS - ADDITIONAL DEDUCTION
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single blind filer - gets unmarried blind additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 40
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_750  # 3000 + 750 (additional_blind_unmarried)

    - name: "Joint filer blind - gets married blind additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 50
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_600  # 5000 + 600 (additional_blind_married)

    - name: "Head of household blind - gets unmarried blind additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 45
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_150  # 4400 + 750 (additional_blind_unmarried)

    # ============================================================================
    # BOTH ELDERLY AND BLIND - COMBINED ADDITIONAL DEDUCTIONS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Single filer aged 65 and blind - both additionals"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 4_500  # 3000 + 750 + 750 = 4500

    - name: "Joint filer aged 65 and blind - both additionals (married rates)"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 6_200  # 5000 + 600 + 600 = 6200

    - name: "Head of household aged 70 and blind - both additionals (unmarried rates)"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 70
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_900  # 4400 + 750 + 750 = 5900

    # ============================================================================
    # DEPENDENT TAXPAYERS - LIMITED DEDUCTION PER 63(c)(5)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Dependent with zero earned income - minimum deduction"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 0
        max_age: 20
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 500  # dependent_minimum = $500

    - name: "Dependent with low earned income - formula below minimum"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 100
        max_age: 20
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 500  # min($500, max($500, $500 + $100 + $250)) = min($500, $850) = $500 floor

    - name: "Dependent with moderate earned income - formula applies"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 1_000
        max_age: 18
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 1_750  # min($3000, max($500, $500 + $1000 + $250)) = min($3000, $1750) = $1750

    - name: "Dependent with high earned income - capped at basic"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 5_000
        max_age: 22
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000  # min($3000, $500 + $5000 + $250) = min($3000, $5750) = $3000

    - name: "Dependent aged 65 with earned income - gets both dep and aged additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 2_000
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_500  # dep_deduction = min($3000, $2750) = $2750, plus $750 aged = $3500

    - name: "Dependent blind with earned income - gets both dep and blind additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 1_500
        max_age: 20
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000  # dep_deduction = min($3000, $2250) = $2250, plus $750 blind = $3000

    # ============================================================================
    # INELIGIBLE TAXPAYERS - ZERO DEDUCTION PER 63(c)(6)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Ineligible single filer - zero deduction"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 40
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
      expect: 0

    - name: "Ineligible joint filer aged and blind - still zero"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 70
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
      expect: 0  # Ineligibility overrides all other calculations

    - name: "Ineligible dependent - zero deduction"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 2_000
        max_age: 20
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
      expect: 0

    # ============================================================================
    # EDGE CASES AND BOUNDARY VALUES
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Zero age (newborn) - no elderly additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 0
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Dependent with earned income exactly at minimum"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 0
        max_age: 16
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 500  # Just the minimum

variable standard_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/63/c/5#dependent_standard_deduction
    - 26/63/c/2#basic_standard_deduction
    - 26/63/f#additional_standard_deduction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 63(c)(5): Use dependent limitation if applicable
    if is_dependent:
        basic = dependent_standard_deduction
    else:
        basic = basic_standard_deduction
    # Section 63(c)(6): Ineligible filers get 0, others get basic + additional
    if is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
        return 0
    return basic + additional_standard_deduction
  tests:
    # ============================================================================
    # BASIC STANDARD DEDUCTION BY FILING STATUS (modular version)
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Modular: Single filer basic deduction"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 35
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "Modular: Joint filer basic deduction"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 45
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "Modular: Head of household basic deduction"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 40
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 4_400

    # ============================================================================
    # ELDERLY (65+) - ADDITIONAL AMOUNTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Modular: Single elderly - unmarried additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_750  # 3000 + 750

    - name: "Modular: Joint elderly - married additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 68
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_600  # 5000 + 600

    # ============================================================================
    # BLIND - ADDITIONAL AMOUNTS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Modular: Single blind - unmarried additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 30
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_750  # 3000 + 750

    - name: "Modular: Joint blind - married additional"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 40
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 5_600  # 5000 + 600

    # ============================================================================
    # BOTH ELDERLY AND BLIND
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Modular: Single elderly and blind - both additionals"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 72
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 4_500  # 3000 + 750 + 750

    - name: "Modular: Joint elderly and blind - both married additionals"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 65
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 6_200  # 5000 + 600 + 600

    # ============================================================================
    # DEPENDENT TAXPAYERS
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Modular: Dependent zero income - minimum"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 0
        max_age: 17
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 500

    - name: "Modular: Dependent with earned income"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 1_200
        max_age: 19
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 1_950  # min(3000, max(500, 500 + 1200 + 250)) = min(3000, 1950) = 1950

    - name: "Modular: Dependent capped at basic"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: true
        earned_income: 10_000
        max_age: 21
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
      expect: 3_000  # Capped at basic_single

    # ============================================================================
    # INELIGIBLE
    # ============================================================================
    - name: "Modular: Ineligible returns zero"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 40
        any_blind: false
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
      expect: 0

    - name: "Modular: Ineligible elderly blind still zero"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: JOINT
        is_dependent: false
        max_age: 70
        any_blind: true
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
      expect: 0

documents.title: Basic Standard Deduction
documents.text:
(c)(2) Basic standard deduction.-- For purposes of paragraph (1), the
basic standard deduction is--
(A) 200 percent of the dollar amount in effect under subparagraph (C)
for the taxable year in the case of--
(i) a joint return, or
(ii) a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)),
(B) $4,400 in the case of a head of household (as defined in
section 2(b)), or
(C) $3,000 in any other case.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 63(c)(2), annually adjusted per (c)(4)

text: """
(c)(2) Basic standard deduction.-- For purposes of paragraph (1), the
basic standard deduction is--
(A) 200 percent of the dollar amount in effect under subparagraph (C)
for the taxable year in the case of--
(i) a joint return, or
(ii) a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)),
(B) $4,400 in the case of a head of household (as defined in
section 2(b)), or
(C) $3,000 in any other case.
"""

# 63(c)(2)(A): Joint return or surviving spouse
parameter basic_joint:
  description: "Basic standard deduction for married filing jointly or surviving spouse"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/63/c/4
  values:
    1988-01-01: 5_000
  tests:
    - name: "Base statutory amount 1988"
      period: 1988
      expect: 5_000

# 63(c)(2)(B): Head of household
parameter basic_head_of_household:
  description: "Basic standard deduction for head of household filing status"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/63/c/4
  values:
    1988-01-01: 4_400
  tests:
    - name: "Base statutory amount 1988"
      period: 1988
      expect: 4_400

# 63(c)(2)(C): Single or married filing separately
parameter basic_single:
  description: "Basic standard deduction for single or married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/63/c/4
  values:
    1988-01-01: 3_000
  tests:
    - name: "Base statutory amount 1988"
      period: 1988
      expect: 3_000

variable basic_standard_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Basic Standard Deduction"
  description: "Basic standard deduction amount based on filing status per 26 USC 63(c)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 63(c)(2)(A): Joint return or surviving spouse
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY or filing_status == QUALIFYING_WIDOW:
      return basic_joint
    # 63(c)(2)(B): Head of household
    if filing_status == HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD:
      return basic_head_of_household
    # 63(c)(2)(C): Single or married filing separately
    return basic_single
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer (base 1988)"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 3000
    - name: "Married filing jointly (base 1988)"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Head of household (base 1988)"
      period: 1988-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: 4400

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 63(c)(4)
documents.text:
(4) Adjustments for inflation.-- In the case of any taxable year
beginning in a calendar year after 1988, each dollar amount contained
in paragraph (2)(B), (2)(C), or (5) or subsection (f) shall be
increased by an amount equal to--
(A) such dollar amount, multiplied by
(B) the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3)
for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by
substituting for 'calendar year 2016' in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof--
(i) 'calendar year 1987' in the case of the dollar amounts contained
in paragraph (2)(B), (2)(C), or (5)(A) or subsection (f), and
(ii) 'calendar year 1997' in the case of the dollar amount contained
in paragraph (5)(B).
If any increase under this paragraph is not a multiple of $50, such
increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 63(c)(4)

text: """
(4) Adjustments for inflation.-- In the case of any taxable year
beginning in a calendar year after 1988, each dollar amount contained
in paragraph (2)(B), (2)(C), or (5) or subsection (f) shall be
increased by an amount equal to--
(A) such dollar amount, multiplied by
(B) the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3)
for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by
substituting for 'calendar year 2016' in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof--
(i) 'calendar year 1987' in the case of the dollar amounts contained
in paragraph (2)(B), (2)(C), or (5)(A) or subsection (f), and
(ii) 'calendar year 1997' in the case of the dollar amount contained
in paragraph (5)(B).
If any increase under this paragraph is not a multiple of $50, such
increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.
"""

indexing_rule standard_deduction_inflation:
  description: "Cost-of-living adjustment for standard deduction amounts"
  base_year: 1987
  rounding: 50
  series: bls/chained_cpi_u

documents.title: Earned Income
documents.text:
(c)(5) Limitation on basic standard deduction in the case of certain
dependents.-- In the case of an individual with respect to whom a
deduction under section 151 is allowable to another taxpayer for a
taxable year beginning in the calendar year in which the individual's
taxable year begins, the basic standard deduction applicable to such
individual for such individual's taxable year shall not exceed the
greater of--
(A) $500, or
(B) the sum of $250 and such individual's earned income.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 63(c)(5)

text: """
(c)(5) Limitation on basic standard deduction in the case of certain
dependents.-- In the case of an individual with respect to whom a
deduction under section 151 is allowable to another taxpayer for a
taxable year beginning in the calendar year in which the individual's
taxable year begins, the basic standard deduction applicable to such
individual for such individual's taxable year shall not exceed the
greater of--
(A) $500, or
(B) the sum of $250 and such individual's earned income.
"""

# 63(c)(5)(A)(i): Minimum floor
parameter dependent_minimum:
  description: "Minimum standard deduction floor for dependents"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/63/c/4
  values:
    1988-01-01: 500
  tests:
    - name: "Base statutory amount 1988"
      period: 1988
      expect: 500

# 63(c)(5)(A)(ii): Earned income add-on
parameter dependent_earned_addon:
  description: "Amount added to dependent's earned income for standard deduction calculation"
  unit: USD
  indexed_by: statute/26/63/c/4
  values:
    1988-01-01: 250
  tests:
    - name: "Base statutory amount 1988"
      period: 1988
      expect: 250

input earned_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Taxpayer's earned income for dependent standard deduction calculation"
  default: 0

variable dependent_standard_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/63/c/2#basic_standard_deduction
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Dependent Standard Deduction"
  description: "Limited standard deduction for individuals claimed as dependents per 26 USC 63(c)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 63(c)(5)(A): Greater of minimum or (earned income + addon)
    earned_plus = earned_income + dependent_earned_addon
    dependent_amount = max(dependent_minimum, earned_plus)
    # Cannot exceed the regular basic standard deduction
    return min(dependent_amount, basic_standard_deduction)
  tests:
    - name: "No earned income 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        earned_income: 0
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 1300
    - name: "Low earned income 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        earned_income: 500
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 1300

documents.title: Ineligible for Standard Deduction
documents.text:
(c)(6) Certain individuals, etc., not eligible for standard deduction.--
In the case of--
(A) a married individual filing a separate return where either spouse
itemizes deductions,
(B) a nonresident alien individual, or
(C) an individual making a return under section 443(a)(1) for a
period of less than 12 months on account of a change in his annual
accounting period,
the standard deduction shall be zero.
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 63(c)(6)

text: """
(c)(6) Certain individuals, etc., not eligible for standard deduction.--
In the case of--
(A) a married individual filing a separate return where either spouse
itemizes deductions,
(B) a nonresident alien individual, or
(C) an individual making a return under section 443(a)(1) for a
period of less than 12 months on account of a change in his annual
accounting period,
the standard deduction shall be zero.
"""

variable is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Ineligible for Standard Deduction"
  description: "Whether taxpayer is ineligible for standard deduction per 26 USC 63(c)(6)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 63(c)(6)(A): MFS where spouse itemizes
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY and spouse_itemizes:
      return True
    # 63(c)(6)(B): Nonresident alien
    if is_nonresident_alien:
      return True
    # 63(c)(6)(C): Short tax year - not modeled (rare edge case)
    return False
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer eligible"
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        spouse_itemizes: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
      expect: false
    - name: "MFJ eligible"
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        spouse_itemizes: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
      expect: false
    - name: "MFS spouse does not itemize"
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        spouse_itemizes: false
        is_nonresident_alien: false
      expect: false
    - name: "MFS spouse itemizes - ineligible"
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        spouse_itemizes: true
        is_nonresident_alien: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Nonresident alien - ineligible"
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        spouse_itemizes: false
        is_nonresident_alien: true
      expect: true

documents.title: Itemized Deductions
documents.text:
(d) Itemized deductions.— For purposes of this subtitle, the term
'itemized deductions' means the deductions allowable under this
chapter other than—
(1) the deductions allowable in arriving at adjusted gross income, and
(2) the deduction for personal exemptions provided by section 151.
documents.code:
text: """
(d) Itemized deductions.— For purposes of this subtitle, the term
'itemized deductions' means the deductions allowable under this
chapter other than—
(1) the deductions allowable in arriving at adjusted gross income, and
(2) the deduction for personal exemptions provided by section 151.
"""
input itemized_deductions:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Itemized Deductions"
  description: "Deductions allowable under IRC Chapter 1 other than AGI deductions or personal exemptions per 26 USC 63(d)"
  default: 0

variable itemized_taxable_income_deductions:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Itemized Deductions"
  description: "Sum of allowable itemized deductions per 26 USC 63(d)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum all itemized deduction components
    # Note: casualty_loss_deduction omitted pending Section 165 implementation
    medical = medical_expense_deduction      # 213: Exceeds 7.5% AGI floor
    salt = salt_deduction                    # 164: Capped at $10K (TCJA)
    interest = interest_deduction            # 163: Mortgage + investment
    charity = charitable_deduction           # 170: Subject to AGI limits
    return medical + salt + interest + charity
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No itemized deductions (all zero)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 0
        salt_deduction: 0
        interest_deduction: 0
        charitable_deduction: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Medical expenses only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 5_000
        salt_deduction: 0
        interest_deduction: 0
        charitable_deduction: 0
      expect: 5000
    - name: "SALT deduction only (capped at $10K)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 0
        salt_deduction: 10_000
        interest_deduction: 0
        charitable_deduction: 0
      expect: 10000
    - name: "Mortgage interest only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 0
        salt_deduction: 0
        interest_deduction: 8_000
        charitable_deduction: 0
      expect: 8000
    - name: "Charitable contributions only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 0
        salt_deduction: 0
        interest_deduction: 0
        charitable_deduction: 3_000
      expect: 3000
    - name: "All itemized deductions combined"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 5_000
        salt_deduction: 10_000
        interest_deduction: 8_000
        charitable_deduction: 3_000
      expect: 26000
    - name: "Substantial medical and SALT deductions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 8_500
        salt_deduction: 10_000
        interest_deduction: 6_500
        charitable_deduction: 2000
      expect: 27000

variable total_itemized_deductions:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Itemized Deductions"
  description: "Alias for itemized_taxable_income_deductions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return itemized_taxable_income_deductions
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Total alias reflects itemized deductions (zero)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 0
        salt_deduction: 0
        interest_deduction: 0
        charitable_deduction: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Total alias reflects itemized deductions (nonzero)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medical_expense_deduction: 5_000
        salt_deduction: 10_000
        interest_deduction: 8_000
        charitable_deduction: 3_000
      expect: 26000

documents.title: Ineligible for Standard Deduction
documents.text:
(e) Election to itemize.—
(1) In general.— Unless an individual makes an election under this
subsection for the taxable year, no itemized deduction shall be
allowed for the taxable year. For purposes of this subtitle, the
determination of whether a deduction is allowable under this chapter
shall be made without regard to the preceding sentence.
(2) Time and manner of election.— Any election under this subsection
shall be made on the taxpayer's return, and the Secretary shall
prescribe the time and manner of such election.
(3) Change of election.— Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary,
a change of election with respect to itemized deductions for any
taxable year may be made after the filing of the return for such
year. If the spouse of the taxpayer filed a separate return for
any taxable year corresponding to the taxable year of the taxpayer,
the change shall not be allowed unless, in accordance with such
regulations—
(A) the spouse makes a change of election with respect to itemized
deductions, for the taxable year covered in such separate return,
consistent with the change of election made by the taxpayer, and
(B) the taxpayer and spouse consent to the assessment (within such
period as may be agreed on with the Secretary) of any deficiency,
to the extent attributable to such change of election, even
though at the time of the filing of such consent the assessment
of such deficiency would otherwise be prevented by the operation
of any law or rule of law.
documents.code:
text: """
(e) Election to itemize.—
(1) In general.— Unless an individual makes an election under this
subsection for the taxable year, no itemized deduction shall be
allowed for the taxable year. For purposes of this subtitle, the
determination of whether a deduction is allowable under this chapter
shall be made without regard to the preceding sentence.
(2) Time and manner of election.— Any election under this subsection
shall be made on the taxpayer's return, and the Secretary shall
prescribe the time and manner of such election.
(3) Change of election.— Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary,
a change of election with respect to itemized deductions for any
taxable year may be made after the filing of the return for such
year. If the spouse of the taxpayer filed a separate return for
any taxable year corresponding to the taxable year of the taxpayer,
the change shall not be allowed unless, in accordance with such
regulations—
(A) the spouse makes a change of election with respect to itemized
deductions, for the taxable year covered in such separate return,
consistent with the change of election made by the taxpayer, and
(B) the taxpayer and spouse consent to the assessment (within such
period as may be agreed on with the Secretary) of any deficiency,
to the extent attributable to such change of election, even
though at the time of the filing of such consent the assessment
of such deficiency would otherwise be prevented by the operation
of any law or rule of law.
"""

input is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Ineligible for Standard Deduction"
  description: "Whether taxpayer is ineligible for standard deduction (e.g., NRA, MFS spouse itemizes)"
  default: false

variable deduction_choice:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Deduction Choice (Standard or Itemized)"
  description: "The deduction amount taxpayer elects to use per 26 USC 63(e)"
  imports:
    - 26/63/c#standard_deduction
    - 26/63/d#itemized_taxable_income_deductions
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # The deduction choice is the maximum of standard and itemized deductions
    # (unless ineligible for standard deduction)
    std = standard_deduction
    itemized = itemized_taxable_income_deductions
    if is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
      return itemized
    return max(std, itemized)

variable uses_standard_deduction:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Uses Standard Deduction"
  description: "Whether the taxpayer uses standard deduction vs itemizing per 26 USC 63(e)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Taxpayer uses standard deduction if:
    # 1. Eligible for standard deduction (63(c)(6)), AND
    # 2. Standard deduction >= itemized deductions
    # If ineligible (MFS spouse itemizes, NRA, etc.), must itemize
    if is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
      return False
    std = standard_deduction
    itemized = itemized_taxable_income_deductions
    # Optimal behavior: choose standard if >= itemized
    return std >= itemized
  default: True
  tests:
    - name: "Standard deduction preferred when >= itemized deductions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 10_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Standard deduction equal to itemized deductions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 10_000
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 10_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Itemized deductions preferred when > standard deduction"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 10_000
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 14_600
      expect: false
    - name: "Cannot use standard deduction (MFS spouse itemizes)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 5_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Must itemize even when standard deduction is higher"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        standard_deduction: 20_000
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 8_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Eligible and chooses standard deduction (zero itemized)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 0
      expect: true

variable taxable_income_deductions:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Deductions from Taxable Income"
  description: "The deduction amount used (standard or itemized) per 26 USC 63"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    std = standard_deduction
    itemized = itemized_taxable_income_deductions
    # If ineligible for standard deduction, must use itemized
    if is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction:
      return itemized
    # Optimal behavior: use larger of the two
    return max(std, itemized)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Uses standard deduction when larger"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 10_000
      expect: 14600
    - name: "Uses itemized deductions when larger"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 10_000
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 14_600
      expect: 14600
    - name: "Equal standard and itemized deductions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 12_500
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 12_500
      expect: 12500
    - name: "Cannot use standard deduction - must use itemized"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 10_000
      expect: 10000
    - name: "Ineligible for standard deduction - itemized even if standard higher"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: true
        standard_deduction: 20_000
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 8_000
      expect: 8000
    - name: "Eligible taxpayer with zero itemized deductions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 0
      expect: 14600
    - name: "High itemized deductions (combined components)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 26_000
      expect: 26000
    - name: "Eligible taxpayer choosing standard with minimal itemized"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_ineligible_for_standard_deduction: false
        standard_deduction: 14_600
        itemized_taxable_income_deductions: 5_000
      expect: 14600

documents.title: Additional Standard Deduction
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 63(f)

text: """
(f) Aged or blind additional amounts.--
(1) Additional amounts for the aged.-- The taxpayer shall be entitled
to an additional amount of $600--
(A) for himself if he has attained age 65 before the close of his
taxable year, and
(B) for the spouse of the taxpayer if the spouse has attained age
65 before the close of the taxable year and an additional exemption
is allowable to the taxpayer for such spouse under section 151(b).
(2) Additional amount for blind.-- The taxpayer shall be entitled
to an additional amount of $600--
(A) for himself if he is blind at the close of the taxable year, and
(B) for the spouse of the taxpayer if the spouse is blind as of the
close of the taxable year and an additional exemption is allowable
to the taxpayer for such spouse under section 151(b).
(3) Higher amount for certain unmarried individuals.-- In the case of
an individual who is not married and is not a surviving spouse,
paragraphs (1) and (2) shall be applied by substituting "$750"
for "$600".
"""

variable additional_standard_deduction:
  imports:
    - 26/63/f/1#additional_aged_unmarried
    - 26/63/f/1#additional_aged_married
    - 26/63/f/2#additional_blind_unmarried
    - 26/63/f/2#additional_blind_married
    - 26/63/f/1#aged_threshold
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Additional Standard Deduction"
  description: "Additional standard deduction amounts for aged and blind taxpayers per 26 USC 63(f)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 63(f)(3): "married" includes surviving spouse per statute text
    is_married = (filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY) or (filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY) or (filing_status == QUALIFYING_WIDOW)
    # Select amounts based on marital status
    if is_married:
      aged_amount = additional_aged_married
      blind_amount = additional_blind_married
    else:
      aged_amount = additional_aged_unmarried
      blind_amount = additional_blind_unmarried
    # 63(f)(1): Primary taxpayer aged 65+
    if age >= aged_threshold:
      primary_aged = aged_amount
    else:
      primary_aged = 0
    # 63(f)(2): Primary taxpayer blind
    if is_blind:
      primary_blind = blind_amount
    else:
      primary_blind = 0
    # Spouse additions (joint filers only)
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY and spouse_age >= aged_threshold:
      spouse_aged = aged_amount
    else:
      spouse_aged = 0
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY and spouse_is_blind:
      spouse_blind_add = blind_amount
    else:
      spouse_blind_add = 0
    return primary_aged + primary_blind + spouse_aged + spouse_blind_add
  tests:
    - name: "Single under 65 not blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        age: 40
        is_blind: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single aged 65+ 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        age: 67
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1950
    - name: "Single blind under 65 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        age: 50
        is_blind: true
      expect: 1950
    - name: "Single aged and blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        age: 70
        is_blind: true
      expect: 3900
    - name: "MFJ neither aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        age: 55
        spouse_age: 52
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "MFJ one spouse aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        age: 67
        spouse_age: 60
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 1550
    - name: "MFJ both spouses aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        age: 68
        spouse_age: 66
        is_blind: false
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 3100
    - name: "MFJ both aged and one blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        age: 70
        spouse_age: 68
        is_blind: true
        spouse_is_blind: false
      expect: 4650
    - name: "MFJ both aged and both blind 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        age: 72
        spouse_age: 70
        is_blind: true
        spouse_is_blind: true
      expect: 6200
    - name: "Head of household aged 2024"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
        age: 66
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1950
    - name: "MFS aged 2024 (uses married amount)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        age: 66
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1550
    - name: "Surviving spouse aged 2024 (uses married amount)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: QUALIFYING_WIDOW
        age: 67
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1550
    - name: "Single aged 2023"
      period: 2023-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        age: 66
        is_blind: false
      expect: 1850

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 63(f)(1)
documents.code:
# Reference: IRC Section 63(f)(1), (f)(3)

text: """
