documents.title: Total Refundable Credits
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from total_refundable_credits.rac ----

# 26 USC Section 6401 - Total Refundable Credits
#

text: """
Section 6401(b) defines "excessive credits" as credits that exceed tax
"""
variable total_refundable_credits:
  imports:
    - 26/32/a/1#earned_income_credit
    - 26/24/d/1/B#additional_child_tax_credit
    - 26/25A/a#education_credits_refundable
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Refundable Credits"
  description: "Sum of refundable credits that can generate refunds per 26 USC Section 6_401"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum all refundable credits
    # These are NOT limited by tax liability and can create refunds
    return earned_income_credit + additional_child_tax_credit + education_credits_refundable
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "All three refundable credits present"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income_credit: 3_500
        additional_child_tax_credit: 1_700
        education_credits_refundable: 1_000
      expect: 6_200
    - name: "Only EITC, no other credits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income_credit: 7_830
        additional_child_tax_credit: 0
        education_credits_refundable: 0
      expect: 7_830
    - name: "Only ACTC, no other credits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income_credit: 0
        additional_child_tax_credit: 3_400
        education_credits_refundable: 0
      expect: 3_400
    - name: "Only education credit refundable"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income_credit: 0
        additional_child_tax_credit: 0
        education_credits_refundable: 1_000
      expect: 1_000
    - name: "No refundable credits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income_credit: 0
        additional_child_tax_credit: 0
        education_credits_refundable: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Maximum credits scenario"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        earned_income_credit: 7_830
        additional_child_tax_credit: 5_100
        education_credits_refundable: 1_000
      expect: 13_930

documents.title: Pre-2019 Divorce Agreement
documents.text:
(a) General rule.—Gross income includes amounts received as alimony
or separate maintenance payments.
(b) Alimony or separate maintenance payments defined.—For purposes of
this section—
(1) In general.—The term 'alimony or separate maintenance payment'
means any payment in cash if—
(A) such payment is received by (or on behalf of) a spouse under
a divorce or separation instrument,
(B) the divorce or separation instrument does not designate such
payment as a payment which is not includible in gross income
under this section and not allowable as a deduction under
section 215,
(C) in the case of an individual legally separated from his spouse
under a decree of divorce or of separate maintenance, the payee
spouse and the payor spouse are not members of the same household
at the time such payment is made, and
(D) there is no liability to make any such payment for any period
after the death of the payee spouse and there is no liability
to make any payment (in cash or property) as a substitute for
such payments after the death of the payee spouse.
(c) Payments to support children.—
(1) In general.—Subsection (a) shall not apply to that part of any
payment which the terms of the divorce or separation instrument
fix (in terms of an amount of money or a part of the payment) as
a sum which is payable for the support of children of the payor
spouse.
documents.code:
text: """
(a) General rule.—Gross income includes amounts received as alimony
or separate maintenance payments.
(b) Alimony or separate maintenance payments defined.—For purposes of
this section—
(1) In general.—The term 'alimony or separate maintenance payment'
means any payment in cash if—
(A) such payment is received by (or on behalf of) a spouse under
a divorce or separation instrument,
(B) the divorce or separation instrument does not designate such
payment as a payment which is not includible in gross income
under this section and not allowable as a deduction under
section 215,
(C) in the case of an individual legally separated from his spouse
under a decree of divorce or of separate maintenance, the payee
spouse and the payor spouse are not members of the same household
at the time such payment is made, and
(D) there is no liability to make any such payment for any period
after the death of the payee spouse and there is no liability
to make any payment (in cash or property) as a substitute for
such payments after the death of the payee spouse.
(c) Payments to support children.—
(1) In general.—Subsection (a) shall not apply to that part of any
payment which the terms of the divorce or separation instrument
fix (in terms of an amount of money or a part of the payment) as
a sum which is payable for the support of children of the payor
spouse.
"""

# 26 USC 71(a) - Alimony income inclusion rate
parameter alimony_income_inclusion_rate:
  description: "Rate at which alimony received is includible in gross income"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2019-01-01: 1.0
    2000-01-01: 1.0

input is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Pre-2019 Divorce Agreement"
  description: "Whether alimony is received under a divorce or separation instrument executed before 2019"
  default: false

input alimony_received:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Alimony Received"
  description: "Total alimony or separate maintenance payments received during the tax year"
  default: 0

variable alimony_income:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Tax Unit Taxable Alimony Income"
  description: "Total alimony includible in gross income for the tax unit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per TCJA: Only pre-2019 divorce instruments result in includible alimony income
    if not is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement:
        return 0
    # Per 26 USC 71(a): Alimony received is gross income for pre-2019 agreements
    # The alimony_income_inclusion_rate parameter confirms inclusion rules by year
    # but the controlling factor is the agreement date, not the tax year
    return alimony_received * alimony_income_inclusion_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Pre-2019 agreement, full inclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement: true
        alimony_received: 24_000
      expect: 24_000
    - name: "Post-2018 agreement, no inclusion"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement: false
        alimony_received: 36_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Pre-2019 agreement, no alimony received"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        is_pre_2019_divorce_agreement: true
        alimony_received: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Taxable Unemployment Compensation
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 85 - Unemployment Compensation

(a) General rule.—In the case of an individual, gross income includes unemployment
compensation.

(b) Exceptions.—
(1) Amounts excluded.—Gross income does not include any amount of unemployment
compensation which, pursuant to section 104(a)(1), is not includible in gross income.

(c) Unemployment compensation defined.—For purposes of this section, the term
"unemployment compensation" means any amount received by an individual under an
unemployment compensation law of the United States or of any State, or under any
other law (whether foreign or domestic) which provides unemployment benefits in
connection with the loss of employment.
"""

variable unemployment_in_agi:
  imports: [26/85/a#unemployment_compensation]
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Taxable Unemployment Compensation"
  description: "Unemployment compensation included in gross income per 26 USC Section 85"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum unemployment compensation from all members of the tax unit
    # Post-2020: Full amount is included in gross income
    return sum(members.unemployment_compensation)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person with unemployment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members: [{unemployment_compensation: 2_400}]
      expect: 2400
    - name: "Two earners with unemployment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members: [{unemployment_compensation: 3_000}, {unemployment_compensation: 1_500}]
      expect: 4500
    - name: "No unemployment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members: [{unemployment_compensation: 0}]
      expect: 0
    - name: "Multiple members, some without unemployment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        members: [{unemployment_compensation: 2_400}, {unemployment_compensation: 0}]
      expect: 2400

documents.title: Unemployment Compensation
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 85(a) - General Rule

(a) General rule.—In the case of an individual, gross income includes
unemployment compensation.

Definition of unemployment compensation per Section 85(c):
The term "unemployment compensation" means any amount received by an individual under an
unemployment compensation law of the United States or of any State, or under any other
law (whether foreign or domestic) which provides unemployment benefits in connection with
the loss of employment. This includes:
- Federal unemployment insurance (UI)
- State unemployment insurance
- Railroad unemployment compensation
- Trade adjustment assistance (TAA)
- Other government-sponsored unemployment benefits
"""

# Unemployment compensation is 100% included in gross income post-2020
parameter unemployment_inclusion_rate:
  description: "Fraction of unemployment compensation included in gross income"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1.0
    2023-01-01: 1.0
    2022-01-01: 1.0
    2021-01-01: 1.0
    2020-03-27: 1.0

input unemployment_compensation:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Unemployment Compensation"
  description: "Unemployment compensation received per 26 USC Section 85(a)"
  default: 0

variable person_unemployment_included:
  imports:
    - 26/85/a#unemployment_compensation
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Unemployment Compensation Included in Income"
  description: "Amount of unemployment compensation included in gross income per 26 USC 85(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Full unemployment compensation is included in income
    return unemployment_compensation * unemployment_inclusion_rate
  tests:
    - name: "Unemployment fully included"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {unemployment_compensation: 6_000}
      expect: 6000
    - name: "No unemployment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {unemployment_compensation: 0}
      expect: 0
    - name: "High unemployment benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {unemployment_compensation: 15_000}
      expect: 15000
    - name: "Federal pandemic unemployment assistance (high amount)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {unemployment_compensation: 3_600}
      expect: 3600

documents.title: Excluded Unemployment Compensation
documents.text:
26 USC Section 85(b) - Exceptions

(b) Exceptions.--
(1) Amounts excluded.--Gross income does not include any amount of unemployment
compensation which, pursuant to section 104(a)(1), is not includible in gross income.

Note: Section 104(a)(1) excludes amounts received under workmen's compensation acts
as compensation for personal injuries or sickness. This exception is narrow and
applies only when unemployment compensation is received in lieu of workers'
compensation benefits.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 85(b) - Exceptions

(b) Exceptions.--
(1) Amounts excluded.--Gross income does not include any amount of unemployment
compensation which, pursuant to section 104(a)(1), is not includible in gross income.

Note: Section 104(a)(1) excludes amounts received under workmen's compensation acts
as compensation for personal injuries or sickness. This exception is narrow and
applies only when unemployment compensation is received in lieu of workers'
compensation benefits.
"""

# 26 USC 85(b)(1) - Excluded unemployment compensation
# This exception applies when unemployment compensation is received under
# circumstances described in section 104(a)(1) (workers' compensation exclusion)

variable unemployment_exclusion:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Excluded Unemployment Compensation"
  description: "Unemployment compensation excluded from gross income per 26 USC 85(b)(1) and 104(a)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Most unemployment compensation is fully taxable
    # This exclusion applies only to amounts that qualify under section 104(a)(1)
    # which covers workers' compensation for personal injury/sickness
    # In practice, this is a very narrow exception
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No exclusion for typical unemployment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {}
      expect: 0

documents.title: Receives Unemployment Compensation
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 85(c) - Unemployment Compensation Defined

(c) Unemployment compensation defined.--For purposes of this section, the term
"unemployment compensation" means any amount received by an individual under--
(1) an unemployment compensation law of the United States or of any State, or
(2) any other law (whether foreign or domestic) which provides unemployment
benefits in connection with the loss of employment.

This includes:
- Federal unemployment insurance (UI)
- State unemployment insurance (SUTA)
- Railroad unemployment compensation (RRUC)
- Trade adjustment assistance (TAA) benefits
- Pandemic unemployment programs (PUA, PEUC, FPUC)
- Extended unemployment benefits
- Foreign unemployment benefits
"""

# 26 USC 85(c) - Definition of unemployment compensation
# This section defines the scope of what constitutes "unemployment compensation"
# for purposes of including it in gross income under section 85(a)

input is_unemployment_compensation:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Unemployment Compensation"
  description: "Whether income received qualifies as unemployment compensation per 26 USC 85(c)"
  default: false

documents.title: Total Social Security Benefits Received
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 86 - Inclusion of Social Security Benefits in Income

(a) In general.—Except as otherwise provided in this section, gross income includes
Social Security benefits.

(b) Amounts excluded.—In the case of an individual, gross income does not include
Social Security benefits received...

(c) Determination of modified adjusted gross income and combined income.—
(1) Modified adjusted gross income.—For purposes of this section, the term "modified
adjusted gross income" means adjusted gross income (within the meaning of section 62)
increased by the sum of the following items:
(A) interest not otherwise includible in gross income under section 103,
(B) one-half of the taxpayer's self-employment taxes (within the meaning of section 1401),
(C) the net operating loss carryback allowed for the taxable year, and
(D) the amount allowable as a deduction under section 217.

(2) Combined income.—For purposes of this section, the term "combined income" means
the sum of adjusted gross income, the tax-exempt interest, and one-half of the
taxpayer's self-employment tax.

(d) Definitions.—
(1) Social security benefit.—The term "social security benefit" means any amount
received by the taxpayer as a pension or annuity under the Social Security Act.
"""

# 26 USC 86(c)(1)(A) - Base amount for single/HOH
parameter base_amount_single:
  description: "Base amount for single and head of household filers"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 25_000
    2023-01-01: 25_000
    2022-01-01: 25_000
    2021-01-01: 25_000
    2020-01-01: 25_000

# 26 USC 86(c)(1)(B) - Base amount for joint filers
parameter base_amount_joint:
  description: "Base amount for married filing jointly and qualifying widow(er)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 32_000
    2023-01-01: 32_000
    2022-01-01: 32_000
    2021-01-01: 32_000
    2020-01-01: 32_000

# 26 USC 86(c)(1)(C) - Base amount for MFS (zero threshold)
parameter base_amount_mfs:
  description: "Base amount for married filing separately"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0
    2023-01-01: 0
    2022-01-01: 0
    2021-01-01: 0
    2020-01-01: 0

# 26 USC 86(a)(1) - Tier 1 inclusion rate (50%)
parameter tier1_rate:
  description: "Fraction of benefits subject to tier 1 taxation"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 0.5
    2023-01-01: 0.5
    2020-01-01: 0.5

input tax_unit_social_security:
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Social Security Benefits Received"
  description: "Sum of Social Security and tier 1 railroad retirement benefits received by tax unit members per 26 USC Section 86(d)"
  default: 0


variable combined_income:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Combined Income"
  description: "Modified AGI plus one-half of self-employment taxes and tax-exempt interest per 26 USC 86(c)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Simplified: combined income = AGI + 1/2 self-employment tax + tax-exempt interest
    # For now, using just AGI as proxy; should include tax-exempt interest and SE tax
    return adjusted_gross_income
  tests:
    - name: "Basic combined income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 50_000}
      expect: 50000
    - name: "Zero income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {adjusted_gross_income: 0}
      expect: 0


variable taxable_social_security_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/86#tax_unit_social_security
    - 26/1#filing_status
    - 26/86#combined_income
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Taxable Social Security Benefits"
  description: "Portion of Social Security benefits included in taxable income per 26 USC 86(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Get base amount based on filing status per 86(c)(1)
    if filing_status == SINGLE:
        base_amount = base_amount_single
    elif filing_status == HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD:
        base_amount = base_amount_single
    elif filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
        base_amount = base_amount_joint
    elif filing_status == QUALIFYING_WIDOW:
        base_amount = base_amount_joint
    else:  # MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        base_amount = base_amount_mfs

    # Combined income above base amount
    excess = max(0, combined_income - base_amount)

    # Tier 1: Lesser of 50% of benefits or 50% of excess over base
    half_benefits = tier1_rate * tax_unit_social_security
    half_excess = tier1_rate * excess
    tier1_taxable = min(half_benefits, half_excess)

    # Tier 2: Additional taxation (simplified - full implementation needed)
    # Under IRC 86(c)(2)(A), if combined income exceeds second threshold,
    # up to 85% of benefits may be taxable
    tier2_amount = 0

    return min(tax_unit_social_security, tier1_taxable + tier2_amount)
  tests:
    - name: "Below threshold (single, no tax)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 20_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 15_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "At threshold (single, no tax)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 25_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 15_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Tier 1 partial taxation (single)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 35_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 12_000
      expect: 5000  # min(6000, 5000) = 5000
    - name: "Tier 1 half benefits (single)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 60_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 10_000
      expect: 5000  # min(5000, 17500) = 5000
    - name: "Joint filers below threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        combined_income: 30_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 16_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Joint filers tier 1 partial"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        combined_income: 40_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 14_000
      expect: 4000  # min(7000, 4000) = 4000
    - name: "Joint filers significant income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
        combined_income: 60_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 18_000
      expect: 9000  # min(9000, 14000) = 9000
    - name: "Married filing separately (zero base)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
        combined_income: 5_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 8_000
      expect: 2500  # min(4000, 2500) = 2500
    - name: "High income benefits all taxable"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 100_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 20_000
      expect: 10000  # min(10000, 37500) = 10000


variable taxable_social_security:
  imports:
    - 26/86#taxable_social_security_amount
    - 26/86#tax_unit_social_security
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "Taxable Fraction of Social Security"
  description: "Portion of Social Security benefits included in taxable income (as a percentage)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if tax_unit_social_security == 0:
        return 0
    return taxable_social_security_amount / tax_unit_social_security
  tests:
    - name: "No benefits, zero rate"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tax_unit_social_security: 0
        taxable_social_security_amount: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "All benefits taxable (100%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tax_unit_social_security: 10_000
        taxable_social_security_amount: 10_000
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Half benefits taxable (50%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tax_unit_social_security: 10_000
        taxable_social_security_amount: 5_000
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "No benefits taxable (0%)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tax_unit_social_security: 10_000
        taxable_social_security_amount: 0
      expect: 0.0

documents.title: Tier 1 Taxable Social Security
documents.text:
26 USC Section 86(a) - Social Security Benefits in Gross Income

(a) In general.--
(1) Inclusion.--
(A) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in this section, gross income
for the taxable year of any taxpayer described in subparagraph (B) (without
regard to subparagraph (B)(iii)) includes social security benefits in an
amount equal to the lesser of--
(i) one-half of the social security benefits received during the taxable
year, or
(ii) one-half of the excess described in subparagraph (C).

(B) Taxpayers to whom this subsection applies.--A taxpayer is described in
this subparagraph if--
(i) the sum of (I) the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for
the taxable year, plus (II) one-half of the social security benefits
received during the taxable year, exceeds the base amount.

(C) Excess.--The excess described in this subparagraph is the excess of--
(i) the sum described in subparagraph (B)(i), over
(ii) the base amount.
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 86(a) - Social Security Benefits in Gross Income

(a) In general.--
(1) Inclusion.--
(A) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in this section, gross income
for the taxable year of any taxpayer described in subparagraph (B) (without
regard to subparagraph (B)(iii)) includes social security benefits in an
amount equal to the lesser of--
(i) one-half of the social security benefits received during the taxable
year, or
(ii) one-half of the excess described in subparagraph (C).

(B) Taxpayers to whom this subsection applies.--A taxpayer is described in
this subparagraph if--
(i) the sum of (I) the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for
the taxable year, plus (II) one-half of the social security benefits
received during the taxable year, exceeds the base amount.

(C) Excess.--The excess described in this subparagraph is the excess of--
(i) the sum described in subparagraph (B)(i), over
(ii) the base amount.
"""

# 26 USC 86(a)(1) - Tier 1 Social Security inclusion
# Up to 50% of benefits may be taxable if combined income exceeds base amount

parameter tier1_inclusion_rate:
  description: "Maximum percentage of Social Security benefits includible under tier 1"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1984-01-01: 0.50

parameter tier2_inclusion_rate:
  description: "Maximum percentage of Social Security benefits includible under tier 2"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1994-01-01: 0.85

variable tier1_taxable_ss:
  imports:
    - 26/86#tax_unit_social_security
    - 26/86/b#combined_income
    - 26/86#base_amount_single
    - 26/86#base_amount_joint
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Tier 1 Taxable Social Security"
  description: "Amount of Social Security benefits taxable under tier 1 (50% threshold) per 26 USC 86(a)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Determine base amount by filing status
    if filing_status in [MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY, QUALIFYING_WIDOW]:
        base = base_amount_joint
    else:
        base = base_amount_single

    # Excess over base amount per 86(a)(1)(C)
    excess = max(0, combined_income - base)

    # Tier 1 amount is lesser of:
    # (i) 50% of SS benefits, or
    # (ii) 50% of excess over base amount
    half_benefits = tier1_inclusion_rate * tax_unit_social_security
    half_excess = tier1_inclusion_rate * excess

    return min(half_benefits, half_excess)
  tests:
    - name: "Below base amount - no tax"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 20_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 12_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Above base - limited by excess"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 30_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 20_000
      expect: 2500  # min(10000, 2500)
    - name: "Above base - limited by benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
        combined_income: 50_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 10_000
      expect: 5000  # min(5000, 12500)

documents.title: Combined Income for Social Security Taxability
documents.code:
text: """
(b) Combined income
For purposes of this section, the term "combined income" means the sum of-
(1) the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for such taxable year, plus
(2) one-half of the social security benefits received during the taxable year.
"""

parameter ss_fraction:
  description: "Fraction of Social Security benefits added to combined income"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1984-01-01: 0.5

variable combined_income:
  imports:
    - 26/86/b#modified_agi
    - 26/86#tax_unit_social_security
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Combined Income for Social Security Taxability"
  description: "Modified AGI plus one-half of Social Security benefits per 26 USC Section 86(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per Section 86(b)(1), combined income = MAGI + 0.5 * SS benefits
    return modified_agi + (ss_fraction * tax_unit_social_security)
  tests:
    - name: "Combined income with zero SS benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        modified_agi: 30_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 0
      expect: 30_000
    - name: "Combined income adds half of SS benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        modified_agi: 30_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 20_000
      expect: 40_000  # 30_000 + 0.5 * 20_000
    - name: "Typical retiree with moderate SS benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        modified_agi: 25_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 24_000
      expect: 37_000  # 25_000 + 0.5 * 24_000
    - name: "High SS benefit recipient"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        modified_agi: 50_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 45_000
      expect: 72_500  # 50_000 + 0.5 * 45_000
    - name: "Zero MAGI with SS benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        modified_agi: 0
        tax_unit_social_security: 36_000
      expect: 18_000  # 0 + 0.5 * 36_000
    - name: "Maximum SS benefit scenario"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        modified_agi: 100_000
        tax_unit_social_security: 58_000
      expect: 129_000  # 100_000 + 0.5 * 58_000 (max SS ~$4,873/mo in 2024)


variable modified_agi:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/103#tax_exempt_interest
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Modified Adjusted Gross Income for Social Security Taxability"
  description: "AGI plus tax-exempt interest for determining taxable portion of Social Security benefits per 26 USC Section 86(b)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per Section 86(b)(1)(A) and IRS Publication 915:
    # MAGI = AGI + tax-exempt interest
    return adjusted_gross_income + tax_exempt_interest
  tests:
    - name: "MAGI with zero tax-exempt interest"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 50_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
      expect: 50_000
    - name: "MAGI with municipal bond interest"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 45_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 5_000
      expect: 50_000  # 45_000 + 5_000
    - name: "Retiree with significant tax-exempt interest"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 30_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 15_000
      expect: 45_000  # 30_000 + 15_000
    - name: "Zero AGI with tax-exempt interest only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        tax_exempt_interest: 20_000
      expect: 20_000
    - name: "High income taxpayer with modest tax-exempt interest"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 150_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 8_000
      expect: 158_000  # 150_000 + 8_000
    - name: "Taxpayer with substantial muni bond portfolio"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 75_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 25_000
      expect: 100_000  # 75_000 + 25_000

documents.title: Base Amount for Social Security Taxation
documents.code:
text: """
26 USC Section 86(c) - Base Amount and Adjusted Base Amount

(c) Base amount and adjusted base amount.--For purposes of this section--

(1) Base amount.--The term "base amount" means--
(A) except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, $25,000,
(B) $32,000 in the case of a joint return, and
(C) zero in the case of a taxpayer who--
(i) is married as of the close of the taxable year (within the meaning
of section 7703) but does not file a joint return for such year, and
(ii) does not live apart from his spouse at all times during the taxable year.

(2) Adjusted base amount.--The term "adjusted base amount" means--
(A) except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, $34,000,
(B) $44,000 in the case of a joint return, and
(C) zero in the case of a taxpayer described in paragraph (1)(C).
"""

# 26 USC 86(c)(1) - Base amount (tier 1 threshold)
# These are the thresholds for the 50% inclusion tier

parameter base_amount_single:
  description: "Base amount for single filers (tier 1 threshold)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1984-01-01: 25_000

parameter base_amount_joint:
  description: "Base amount for joint filers (tier 1 threshold)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1984-01-01: 32_000

parameter base_amount_mfs_living_together:
  description: "Base amount for MFS living with spouse (zero)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1984-01-01: 0

# 26 USC 86(c)(2) - Adjusted base amount (tier 2 threshold)
# These are the thresholds for the 85% inclusion tier

parameter adjusted_base_amount_single:
  description: "Adjusted base amount for single filers (tier 2 threshold)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1994-01-01: 34_000

parameter adjusted_base_amount_joint:
  description: "Adjusted base amount for joint filers (tier 2 threshold)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1994-01-01: 44_000

parameter adjusted_base_amount_mfs_living_together:
  description: "Adjusted base amount for MFS living with spouse (zero)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1994-01-01: 0


variable base_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Base Amount for Social Security Taxation"
  description: "Base amount threshold for tier 1 Social Security taxation per 26 USC 86(c)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
        return base_amount_joint
    elif filing_status == QUALIFYING_WIDOW:
        return base_amount_joint
    elif filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
        # MFS living with spouse gets zero threshold
        # TODO: Add check for living apart (would get $25k threshold)
        return base_amount_mfs_living_together
    else:
        return base_amount_single
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 25_000
    - name: "Joint filer base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
      expect: 32_000
    - name: "MFS living together base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
      expect: 0
    - name: "Head of household base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
      expect: 25_000


variable adjusted_base_amount:
  imports:
    - 26/1#filing_status
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Adjusted Base Amount for Social Security Taxation"
  description: "Adjusted base amount threshold for tier 2 Social Security taxation per 26 USC 86(c)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY:
        return adjusted_base_amount_joint
    elif filing_status == QUALIFYING_WIDOW:
        return adjusted_base_amount_joint
    elif filing_status == MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY:
        return adjusted_base_amount_mfs_living_together
    else:
        return adjusted_base_amount_single
  tests:
    - name: "Single filer adjusted base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: SINGLE
      expect: 34_000
    - name: "Joint filer adjusted base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
      expect: 44_000
    - name: "MFS adjusted base amount"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        filing_status: MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
      expect: 0

documents.title: Section 26 USC § 911(a)
documents.code:
text: |
  In general, a qualified individual may elect to exclude from gross income
  the foreign earned income of such individual.

input foreign_earned_income_exclusion:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: Foreign Earned Income Exclusion
  description: Amount of foreign earned income excluded from gross income per 26 USC 911(a)
  default: 0

documents.title: Age
documents.code:
text: """
every individual who is... (A) is aged, blind, or disabled
Per 42 USC 1382c(a)(1)(A), "aged" means attained age 65
"""

input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Age in years"
  default: 0

input is_us_citizen:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is US Citizen"
  description: "Whether person is a US citizen"
  default: false

input is_qualified_alien:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Qualified Alien"
  description: "Whether person is a qualified alien for SSI purposes"
  default: false

input has_eligible_spouse:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Eligible Spouse"
  description: "Whether person has SSI-eligible spouse"
  default: false

input countable_resources:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Countable Resources"
  description: "Total countable resources for SSI"
  default: 0

parameter age_threshold:
  description: "Age threshold for SSI aged category"
  values:
    1974-01-01: 65
  label: "SSI Age Threshold"

parameter resource_limit_individual:
  description: "SSI resource limit for individual"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 2000
  label: "SSI Resource Limit (Individual)"

parameter resource_limit_couple:
  description: "SSI resource limit for couple"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 3_000
  label: "SSI Resource Limit (Couple)"

variable age_requirement:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SSI categorical eligibility"
  description: "Individual is aged (65+), blind, or disabled per 42 USC 1_382(a)(1)(A)"
  formula: return age >= age_threshold
  default: False
  tests:
    - name: "Age below threshold (64 years old)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 64
      expect: false
    - name: "Age at threshold (exactly 65 years old)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 65
      expect: true
    - name: "Age above threshold (72 years old)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 72
      expect: true
    - name: "Newborn (age 0)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 0
      expect: false
    - name: "Very high age (100 years old)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 100
      expect: true


variable citizenship:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SSI residency eligibility"
  description: "Is resident of the United States per 42 USC 1_382c(a)(1)(B)"
  formula: return is_us_citizen or is_qualified_alien
  default: False
  tests:
    - name: "US citizen"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_citizen: true
        is_qualified_alien: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Qualified alien"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_citizen: false
        is_qualified_alien: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Both US citizen and qualified alien"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_citizen: true
        is_qualified_alien: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Neither citizen nor qualified alien"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_citizen: false
        is_qualified_alien: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Income exclusions: US citizen pathway"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_citizen: true
        is_qualified_alien: false
      # Verifies that citizenship is sufficient without qualified alien status
      expect: true


variable resource_test:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  unit: USD
  label: "SSI resource eligibility"
  description: "Resources do not exceed limit per 42 USC 1_382(a)(3)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if has_eligible_spouse:
        limit = resource_limit_couple
    else:
        limit = resource_limit_individual
    return countable_resources <= limit
  default: False
  tests:
    - name: "Individual with zero resources"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 0
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      # $0 is well below individual limit of $2,000
      expect: true
    - name: "Individual with resources below limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 1_500
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      # $1,500 is below individual limit of $2,000
      expect: true
    - name: "Individual with resources at limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 2000
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      # $2,000 equals individual limit, should pass
      expect: true
    - name: "Individual with resources exceeding limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 2001
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      # $2,001 exceeds individual limit of $2,000
      expect: false
    - name: "Individual with high resources exceeding limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 5_000
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      # $5,000 far exceeds individual limit
      expect: false
    - name: "Couple with zero resources"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 0
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      # $0 is well below couple limit of $3,000
      expect: true
    - name: "Couple with resources below limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 2_500
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      # $2,500 is below couple limit of $3,000
      expect: true
    - name: "Couple with resources at limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 3_000
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      # $3,000 equals couple limit, should pass
      expect: true
    - name: "Couple with resources exceeding limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 3_001
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      # $3,001 exceeds couple limit of $3,000
      expect: false
    - name: "Resource limit boundary: individual just over"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        countable_resources: 2000.01
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      # Tests precise boundary condition for individual
      expect: false

  unit: USD
  label: "SSI applicable FBR"
  description: "FBR after living arrangement reduction per 42 USC 1_382(a)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if has_eligible_spouse:
        return fbr_couple
    return fbr_individual
  tests:
    - name: "Individual without spouse receives individual FBR"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      expect: 943

    - name: "Individual with eligible spouse receives couple FBR"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      expect: 1_415

    - name: "Individual FBR for 2023"
      period: 2023-01
      inputs:
        has_eligible_spouse: false
      expect: 914

    - name: "Couple FBR for 2023"
      period: 2023-01
      inputs:
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      expect: 1_371

    - name: "Default has_eligible_spouse is false"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {}
      expect: 943

    - name: "Couple rate is higher than individual rate"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_eligible_spouse: true
      expect: 1_415

documents.title: SSI General Income Exclusion
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from income_exclusions.rac ----

# 42 USC 1382a(b) - Income Exclusions
#

text: """
(b)(2): "the first $20 of any income" (general exclusion)
(b)(4): "if the individual... is blind or disabled, the first $65
of earned income... plus one-half of the remainder
"""

input general_exclusion:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SSI General Income Exclusion"

  default: 20

variable income_exclusions:
  entity: Person
  period: Month

  unit: USD
  label: "SSI total countable income"

  formula: return general_exclusion
  tests:
    - name: "Default general exclusion"
      period: 2024-01

    - name: "Custom exclusion amount"
      period: 2024-01

      expect: 25  # Uses provided exclusion value
    - name: "Zero exclusion"

    - name: "Higher exclusion for special case"

    - name: "Fractional exclusion amount"

documents.title: Total Resources
documents.text:
(a) In determining the resources of an individual... there shall
be excluded--
(1) the home
(2) household goods, personal effects, and an automobile
(3) property of a trade or business essential for self-support
(5) life insurance... aggregate face value does not exceed $1,500
(9) amounts set aside for burial up to $1,500
(10) burial spaces for the individual and spouse
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from resource_exclusions.rac ----

# 42 USC 1382b(a) - Resources Excluded from SSI Counting
#

text: """
(a) In determining the resources of an individual... there shall
be excluded--
(1) the home
(2) household goods, personal effects, and an automobile
(3) property of a trade or business essential for self-support
(5) life insurance... aggregate face value does not exceed $1,500
(9) amounts set aside for burial up to $1,500
(10) burial spaces for the individual and spouse
"""

input total_resources:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total Resources"
  description: "Total value of all resources"
  default: 0

input primary_residence_value:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Primary Residence Value"
  description: "Value of primary residence (excluded from SSI)"
  default: 0

input household_goods_value:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Household Goods Value"
  description: "Value of household goods and personal effects"
  default: 0

input automobile_value:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Automobile Value"
  description: "Value of one automobile"
  default: 0

input designated_burial_funds:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Designated Burial Funds"
  description: "Funds set aside for burial expenses"
  default: 0

input has_eligible_spouse:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Eligible Spouse"
  description: "Whether person has SSI-eligible spouse"
  default: false

input life_insurance_face_value:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Life Insurance Face Value"
  description: "Total face value of life insurance policies"
  default: 0

input life_insurance_cash_value:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Life Insurance Cash Value"
  description: "Cash surrender value of life insurance policies"
  default: 0

parameter burial_funds_limit_individual:
  description: "Maximum burial funds exclusion for individual"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1974-01-01: 1_500
  label: "SSI Burial Funds Limit (Individual)"

parameter burial_funds_limit_couple:
  description: "Maximum burial funds exclusion for couple"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1974-01-01: 3_000
  label: "SSI Burial Funds Limit (Couple)"

parameter life_insurance_limit:
  description: "Maximum face value of life insurance to qualify for exclusion"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1974-01-01: 1_500
  label: "SSI Life Insurance Face Value Limit"

variable resource_exclusions:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SSI countable resources"
  description: "Total resources minus exclusions per 42 USC 1_382b(a)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with total resources
    total = total_resources
    # Exclude home (1)
    after_home = total - primary_residence_value
    # Exclude household goods and one automobile (2)
    after_goods = after_home - household_goods_value - automobile_value
    # Exclude qualifying burial funds up to limit (9)
    if has_eligible_spouse:
        burial_limit = burial_funds_limit_couple
    else:
        burial_limit = burial_funds_limit_individual
    burial_exclusion = min(designated_burial_funds, burial_limit)
    after_burial = after_goods - burial_exclusion
    # Exclude life insurance if face value <= $1,500 (5)
    if life_insurance_face_value <= life_insurance_limit:
        life_exclusion = life_insurance_cash_value
    else:
        life_exclusion = 0
    after_life = after_burial - life_exclusion
    return max(0, after_life)
  tests:
    - name: "Home exclusion - primary residence fully excluded"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        total_resources: 350_000
        primary_residence_value: 300_000
        household_goods_value: 0
        automobile_value: 0
        designated_burial_funds: 0
        has_eligible_spouse: false
        life_insurance_face_value: 0
        life_insurance_cash_value: 0
      expect: 50_000

    - name: "Household goods and automobile excluded"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        total_resources: 25_000
        primary_residence_value: 0
        household_goods_value: 5_000
        automobile_value: 12_000
        designated_burial_funds: 0
        has_eligible_spouse: false
        life_insurance_face_value: 0
        life_insurance_cash_value: 0
      expect: 8_000

    - name: "Burial funds exclusion - individual at limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        total_resources: 10_000
        primary_residence_value: 0
        household_goods_value: 0
        automobile_value: 0
        designated_burial_funds: 1_500
        has_eligible_spouse: false
        life_insurance_face_value: 0
        life_insurance_cash_value: 0
      expect: 8_500

    - name: "Burial funds exclusion - couple at limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        total_resources: 15_000
        primary_residence_value: 0
        household_goods_value: 0
        automobile_value: 0
        designated_burial_funds: 3_000
        has_eligible_spouse: true
        life_insurance_face_value: 0
        life_insurance_cash_value: 0
      expect: 12_000

    - name: "Life insurance excluded when face value under limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        total_resources: 5_000
        primary_residence_value: 0
        household_goods_value: 0
        automobile_value: 0
        designated_burial_funds: 0
        has_eligible_spouse: false
        life_insurance_face_value: 1_000
        life_insurance_cash_value: 500
      expect: 4_500

    - name: "Life insurance NOT excluded when face value exceeds limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        total_resources: 5_000
        primary_residence_value: 0
        household_goods_value: 0
        automobile_value: 0
        designated_burial_funds: 0
        has_eligible_spouse: false
        life_insurance_face_value: 2_000
        life_insurance_cash_value: 500
      expect: 5_000

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 1396(a)(2)
documents.text:
(14) INCOME DETERMINED USING MODIFIED ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.--
(A) In general.-- ...the State shall determine income eligibility
for medical assistance... using modified adjusted gross income...
documents.code:
text: """
(14) INCOME DETERMINED USING MODIFIED ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.--
(A) In general.-- ...the State shall determine income eligibility
for medical assistance... using modified adjusted gross income...
"""
variable income_methodology:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/103#tax_exempt_interest
    - 26/86#taxable_social_security
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with AGI (26 USC 62)
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    # Add tax-exempt interest (26 USC 103)
    exempt_interest = tax_exempt_interest
    # Add non-taxable Social Security benefits
    total_ss = social_security_benefits
    taxable_ss = taxable_social_security
    nontaxable_ss = max(0, total_ss - taxable_ss)
    # Foreign earned income exclusion (26 USC 911)
    # TODO: Add foreign_earned_income_exclusion when implemented
    return agi + exempt_interest + nontaxable_ss
  tests:
    - name: "Zero income baseline"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 0
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        social_security_benefits: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "AGI only with no adjustments"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 3_500
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        social_security_benefits: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
      expect: 3_500
    - name: "AGI plus tax-exempt interest"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 2_500
        tax_exempt_interest: 500
        social_security_benefits: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
      expect: 3_000
    - name: "AGI plus non-taxable Social Security"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 1_200
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        social_security_benefits: 1_800
        taxable_social_security: 800
      # MAGI = 1200 + 0 + (1800 - 800) = 1200 + 1000 = 2200
      expect: 2_200
    - name: "All MAGI components combined"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 2_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 300
        social_security_benefits: 1_500
        taxable_social_security: 500
      # MAGI = 2000 + 300 + (1500 - 500) = 2000 + 300 + 1000 = 3300
      expect: 3_300
    - name: "Fully taxable Social Security adds nothing"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 4_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 200
        social_security_benefits: 1_000
        taxable_social_security: 1_000
      # MAGI = 4000 + 200 + (1000 - 1000) = 4000 + 200 + 0 = 4200
      expect: 4_200

documents.title: Modified Adjusted Gross Income (MAGI) for Medicaid
documents.text:
(14) INCOME DETERMINED USING MODIFIED ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.--
(A) In general.-- ...the State shall determine income eligibility
for medical assistance... using modified adjusted gross income...
documents.code:
text: """
(14) INCOME DETERMINED USING MODIFIED ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.--
(A) In general.-- ...the State shall determine income eligibility
for medical assistance... using modified adjusted gross income...
"""
variable income_methodology:
  imports:
    - 26/62/a#adjusted_gross_income
    - 26/103#tax_exempt_interest
    - 26/86#taxable_social_security
  entity: TaxUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Modified Adjusted Gross Income (MAGI) for Medicaid"
  description: "MAGI as determined under 42 USC § 1396d(b) for Medicaid eligibility, calculated as AGI plus tax-exempt interest, non-taxable Social Security benefits, and foreign earned income exclusions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with AGI (26 USC 62)
    agi = adjusted_gross_income
    # Add tax-exempt interest (26 USC 103)
    exempt_interest = tax_exempt_interest
    # Add non-taxable Social Security benefits
    # 42 CFR 435.603(e): add back SS that was excluded from gross income
    total_ss = social_security_benefits
    taxable_ss = taxable_social_security
    nontaxable_ss = max(0, total_ss - taxable_ss)
    # Add back foreign earned income exclusion (26 USC 911)
    foreign_exclusion = foreign_earned_income_exclusion
    return agi + exempt_interest + nontaxable_ss + foreign_exclusion
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "agi_only_no_additions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 3_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        social_security_benefits: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
      expect: 3_000

    - name: "agi_with_tax_exempt_interest"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 2_500
        tax_exempt_interest: 200
        social_security_benefits: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
      expect: 2_700

    - name: "agi_with_nontaxable_social_security"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 1_500
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        social_security_benefits: 1_800
        taxable_social_security: 500
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
      expect: 2_800

    - name: "agi_with_foreign_earned_income_exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 4_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 0
        social_security_benefits: 0
        taxable_social_security: 0
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 1_000
      expect: 5_000

    - name: "all_magi_components"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 3_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 150
        social_security_benefits: 2_000
        taxable_social_security: 800
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 500
      expect: 4_850

    - name: "fully_taxable_social_security"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        adjusted_gross_income: 5_000
        tax_exempt_interest: 100
        social_security_benefits: 1_200
        taxable_social_security: 1_200
        foreign_earned_income_exclusion: 0
      expect: 5_100

documents.title: Qualifies for enhanced FMAP
documents.text:
(VIII) who are described in subsection (k)(2)
(2) Newly eligible.--An individual is described in this paragraph if
such individual--
(A) is not under 19 years of age,
(B) is not described in subclause (I), (II), or (VII) of paragraph (1),
(C) is not described in any of clauses (i) through (v) of paragraph (10)(A)
(related to mandatorily covered groups other than newly eligible),
(D) is not entitled to or enrolled for benefits under part A or B of
title XVIII (Medicare), and
(E) has household income that does not exceed 133 percent of the
poverty line applicable to the size of the household.
documents.code:
text: """
(VIII) who are described in subsection (k)(2)
(2) Newly eligible.--An individual is described in this paragraph if
such individual--
(A) is not under 19 years of age,
(B) is not described in subclause (I), (II), or (VII) of paragraph (1),
(C) is not described in any of clauses (i) through (v) of paragraph (10)(A)
(related to mandatorily covered groups other than newly eligible),
(D) is not entitled to or enrolled for benefits under part A or B of
title XVIII (Medicare), and
(E) has household income that does not exceed 133 percent of the
poverty line applicable to the size of the household.
"""

parameter age_child_max:
  description: "Maximum age for child classification (exclusive)"
  unit: years
  values:
    2010-03-23: 19

parameter age_elderly_min:
  description: "Minimum age for elderly/Medicare classification (inclusive)"
  unit: years
  values:
    2010-03-23: 65

variable expansion:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Qualifies for enhanced FMAP"
  description: "Eligible for enhanced federal match under expansion"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be at least 19 (not under 19)
    if age < age_child_max:
        return False
    # Must be under 65 (not Medicare aged)
    if age >= age_elderly_min:
        return False
    return True
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "child_under_19_not_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 17
        age_child_max: 19
        age_elderly_min: 65
      expect: false

    - name: "young_adult_at_exactly_19_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 19
        age_child_max: 19
        age_elderly_min: 65
      expect: true

    - name: "working_age_adult_40_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 40
        age_child_max: 19
        age_elderly_min: 65
      expect: true

    - name: "adult_at_64_last_eligible_age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 64
        age_child_max: 19
        age_elderly_min: 65
      expect: true

    - name: "senior_at_exactly_65_not_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 65
        age_child_max: 19
        age_elderly_min: 65
      expect: false

    - name: "senior_over_65_not_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 72
        age_child_max: 19
        age_elderly_min: 65
      expect: false

documents.title: Preventive services exempt
documents.text:
42 USC § 1396o - Use of enrollment fees, premiums, deductions, cost-sharing, and similar charges

(a) Imposition of certain charges under plan in case of individuals described in section 1396a(a)(10)(A) or (E)

Subject to subsections (g), (i), and (j), the State plan shall provide that in the
case of individuals described in subparagraph (A) or (E)(i) of section 1396a(a)(10)
of this title who are eligible under the plan—
...
(3) any deduction, cost sharing, or similar charge imposed under the plan with
respect to other such individuals or other care and services will be nominal in amount
(as determined by the Secretary in regulations which shall, if such determination is
with respect to deductions, cost sharing, or similar charges imposed with respect to
eligible individuals described in subsection (b)(1), provide for differentials in such
nominal amounts based on the income of such individuals).

(b) Imposition of certain charges under plan in case of individuals other than those described in section 1396a(a)(10)(A) or (E)

Subject to subsections (g), (i), and (j), the State plan shall provide that in the
case of individuals other than those described in subparagraph (A) or (E)(i) of
section 1396a(a)(10) of this title...
documents.code:
text: """
42 USC § 1396o - Use of enrollment fees, premiums, deductions, cost-sharing, and similar charges

(a) Imposition of certain charges under plan in case of individuals described in section 1396a(a)(10)(A) or (E)

Subject to subsections (g), (i), and (j), the State plan shall provide that in the
case of individuals described in subparagraph (A) or (E)(i) of section 1396a(a)(10)
of this title who are eligible under the plan—
...
(3) any deduction, cost sharing, or similar charge imposed under the plan with
respect to other such individuals or other care and services will be nominal in amount
(as determined by the Secretary in regulations which shall, if such determination is
with respect to deductions, cost sharing, or similar charges imposed with respect to
