(b) Imposition of certain charges under plan in case of individuals other than those described in section 1396a(a)(10)(A) or (E)

Subject to subsections (g), (i), and (j), the State plan shall provide that in the
case of individuals other than those described in subparagraph (A) or (E)(i) of
section 1396a(a)(10) of this title...
"""

# Medicaid Cost Sharing - 42 USC § 1396o
# Nominal copayment amounts are defined by regulation at 42 CFR 447.54

# Federal maximum nominal copayment amount
# Per 42 CFR 447.54(a)(1): nominal copayments may not exceed $4 for services
# subject to periodic adjustment
parameter nominal_copayment_max:
  values:
    1982-01-01: 1.00  # Original nominal amount
    2003-01-01: 3.00  # Increased per DRA implementation
    2006-01-01: 4.00  # Current maximum per 42 CFR 447.54

# Copayment rate for individuals 100-150% FPL
parameter copayment_rate_100_150_fpl:
  values:
    2006-01-01: 0.10

# Copayment rate for individuals above 150% FPL
parameter copayment_rate_150_plus_fpl:
  values:
    2006-01-01: 0.20

# FPL threshold for nominal cost sharing tier
parameter nominal_tier_fpl_threshold:
  values:
    1982-01-01: 1.00

# FPL threshold for moderate cost sharing tier
parameter moderate_tier_fpl_threshold:
  values:
    2006-01-01: 1.50

# FPL threshold for premium eligibility
parameter premium_fpl_threshold:
  values:
    2006-01-01: 1.50

# Child age threshold for cost sharing exemption
parameter child_age_threshold:
  values:
    1982-01-01: 18

# Aggregate cost share limit as percentage of income
parameter aggregate_cost_share_limit:
  values:
    2006-01-01: 0.05

# Months per year (for annual calculations)
parameter months_per_year:
  values:
    1900-01-01: 12

variable medicaid_preventive_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Preventive services exempt"
  description: "Preventive services exempt from cost sharing per federal requirements"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Preventive services are exempt for most Medicaid populations
    # This includes immunizations, screenings, well-child visits
    return True
  default: True
  tests:
    - name: "Preventive services always exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {}
      expect: true

variable medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Child cost sharing exempt"
  description: "Children under age threshold exempt from cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(B): no cost sharing for individuals under 18
    return age < child_age_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Child under age threshold is exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 10
        child_age_threshold: 18
      expect: true
    - name: "Child at age threshold is not exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 18
        child_age_threshold: 18
      expect: false
    - name: "Infant is exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 0
        child_age_threshold: 18
      expect: true
    - name: "Teenager under threshold is exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 17
        child_age_threshold: 18
      expect: true
    - name: "Adult not exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 25
        child_age_threshold: 18
      expect: false

variable medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Pregnant cost sharing exempt"
  description: "Pregnant individuals exempt from cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(B): no cost sharing for pregnancy-related services
    return is_pregnant
  tests:
    - name: "Pregnant woman is exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_pregnant: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Non-pregnant woman not exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_pregnant: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Pregnant individual exempt regardless of age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_pregnant: true
      expect: true

variable medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Institutionalized cost sharing exempt"
  description: "Institutionalized individuals exempt from cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(A): no cost sharing for institutional services
    return is_institutionalized
  tests:
    - name: "Institutionalized person is exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_institutionalized: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Non-institutionalized person not exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_institutionalized: false
      expect: false

variable medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Hospice cost sharing exempt"
  description: "Hospice-enrolled individuals exempt from cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(D)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(D): no cost sharing for hospice care
    return is_hospice_enrolled
  tests:
    - name: "Hospice enrolled person is exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_hospice_enrolled: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Non-hospice person not exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_hospice_enrolled: false
      expect: false

variable medicaid_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Cost sharing exempt"
  description: "Individual exempt from all cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2): certain populations are exempt from cost sharing
    return (
        medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt or
        medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt or
        medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt or
        medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt
    )
  tests:
    - name: "Child exempt means cost share exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt: true
        medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Pregnant exempt means cost share exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt: true
        medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Institutionalized exempt means cost share exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt: true
        medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Hospice exempt means cost share exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt: true
      expect: true
    - name: "No exemptions means not cost share exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_child_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_pregnant_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_institutionalized_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_hospice_cost_share_exempt: false
      expect: false

variable medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Nominal cost sharing tier"
  description: "Individual qualifies for nominal cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(3)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(3): nominal cost sharing for individuals below 100% FPL
    return magi_income_pct_fpl < nominal_tier_fpl_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Income below 100% FPL qualifies for nominal tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 0.75
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
      expect: true
    - name: "Income at 100% FPL does not qualify for nominal tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.00
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
      expect: false
    - name: "Income above 100% FPL does not qualify"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.25
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
      expect: false
    - name: "Zero income qualifies for nominal tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 0.00
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
      expect: true

variable medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Moderate cost sharing tier"
  description: "Individual in 100-150% FPL tier per 42 USC 1396o-1(a)(3)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o-1(a)(3)(A): moderate cost sharing for 100-150% FPL
    return (
        magi_income_pct_fpl >= nominal_tier_fpl_threshold and
        magi_income_pct_fpl < moderate_tier_fpl_threshold
    )
  tests:
    - name: "Income between 100-150% FPL qualifies for moderate tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.10
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: true
    - name: "Income at 100% FPL threshold qualifies for moderate tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.00
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: true
    - name: "Income at 150% FPL threshold does not qualify"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.50
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Income below 100% FPL does not qualify for moderate tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 0.95
        nominal_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.00
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false

variable medicaid_higher_cost_share_tier:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Higher cost sharing tier"
  description: "Individual above 150% FPL tier per 42 USC 1396o-1(a)(3)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o-1(a)(3)(A)(ii): higher cost sharing above 150% FPL
    return magi_income_pct_fpl >= moderate_tier_fpl_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Income above 150% FPL qualifies for higher tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: true
    - name: "Income at 150% FPL threshold qualifies for higher tier"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.50
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: true
    - name: "Income below 150% FPL does not qualify"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.49
        moderate_tier_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false

variable medicaid_max_copayment_rate:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Rate
  label: "Maximum copayment rate"
  description: "Maximum copayment rate based on income tier per 42 CFR 447.52"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 CFR 447.52: copayment rates vary by income tier
    if medicaid_cost_share_exempt:
        return 0
    if medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier:
        return 0  # Nominal tier uses flat copayment, not rate
    if medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier:
        return copayment_rate_100_150_fpl
    if medicaid_higher_cost_share_tier:
        return copayment_rate_150_plus_fpl
    return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Cost share exempt pays zero copayment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: true
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_higher_cost_share_tier: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Nominal tier pays zero rate"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: true
        medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_higher_cost_share_tier: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Moderate tier pays 10% copayment rate"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier: true
        medicaid_higher_cost_share_tier: false
        copayment_rate_100_150_fpl: 0.10
      expect: 0.10
    - name: "Higher tier pays 20% copayment rate"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_higher_cost_share_tier: true
        copayment_rate_150_plus_fpl: 0.20
      expect: 0.20

variable medicaid_nominal_copayment:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Nominal copayment amount"
  description: "Nominal copayment for individuals below 100% FPL per 42 CFR 447.54"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 CFR 447.54: nominal copayments for individuals below 100% FPL
    if medicaid_cost_share_exempt:
        return 0
    if medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier:
        return nominal_copayment_max
    return 0  # Higher tiers use rate-based copayment, not nominal
  tests:
    - name: "Cost share exempt pays zero nominal copayment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: true
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: true
        nominal_copayment_max: 4
      expect: 0
    - name: "Nominal tier pays federal maximum ($4)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: true
        nominal_copayment_max: 4
      expect: 4
    - name: "Moderate tier does not qualify for nominal copayment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_nominal_cost_share_tier: false
        medicaid_moderate_cost_share_tier: true
        nominal_copayment_max: 4
      expect: 0

variable medicaid_premium_applicable:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Premium applicable"
  description: "Whether premium can be charged per 42 USC 1396o(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(c): premiums only for certain populations above FPL threshold
    if medicaid_cost_share_exempt:
        return False
    # Protected categories cannot be charged premiums
    if medicaid_category in ("infant", "child_1_5", "child_6_18", "pregnant"):
        return False
    # Must be above premium threshold
    return magi_income_pct_fpl >= premium_fpl_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Cost share exempt cannot be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: true
        medicaid_category: "adult_expansion"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Infant cannot be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "infant"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Child 1-5 cannot be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "child_1_5"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Child 6-18 cannot be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "child_6_18"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Pregnant woman cannot be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "pregnant"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Expansion adult below 150% FPL cannot be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "adult_expansion"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.40
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false
    - name: "Expansion adult above 150% FPL can be charged premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "adult_expansion"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.60
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: true
    - name: "Expansion adult at 138% FPL (actual expansion threshold) cannot be charged"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_cost_share_exempt: false
        medicaid_category: "adult_expansion"
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 1.38
        premium_fpl_threshold: 1.50
      expect: false

variable medicaid_max_monthly_premium:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Maximum monthly premium"
  description: "Maximum premium that can be charged per 42 USC 1396o(c)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(c): premium amounts subject to state implementation
    # This is a placeholder - actual amounts vary by state and program
    if not medicaid_premium_applicable:
        return 0
    return 0  # State-specific implementation required
  tests:
    - name: "Premium not applicable means zero premium"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_premium_applicable: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Premium applicable with default implementation"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        medicaid_premium_applicable: true
      expect: 0

variable medicaid_monthly_cost_share_limit:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Monthly cost sharing limit"
  description: "Maximum monthly cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o-1(e)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o-1(e)(1): aggregate cost sharing limited to 5% of income
    return magi_income * aggregate_cost_share_limit
  tests:
    - name: "No income means no cost sharing limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income: 0
        aggregate_cost_share_limit: 0.05
      expect: 0
    - name: "Low income household cost sharing limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income: 1_000
        aggregate_cost_share_limit: 0.05
      expect: 50
    - name: "Moderate income household cost sharing limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income: 2000
        aggregate_cost_share_limit: 0.05
      expect: 100
    - name: "Higher income household cost sharing limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income: 4_000
        aggregate_cost_share_limit: 0.05
      expect: 200

variable medicaid_annual_cost_share_limit:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Annual cost sharing limit"
  description: "Maximum annual cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o-1(e)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o-1(e)(1): annual limit is 12x monthly limit
    return medicaid_monthly_cost_share_limit * months_per_year
  tests:
    - name: "Annual limit is 12 times monthly limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medicaid_monthly_cost_share_limit: 50
        months_per_year: 12
      expect: 600
    - name: "Higher monthly limit results in higher annual"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medicaid_monthly_cost_share_limit: 200
        months_per_year: 12
      expect: 2400
    - name: "Zero monthly limit means zero annual"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        medicaid_monthly_cost_share_limit: 0
        months_per_year: 12
      expect: 0

variable medicaid_emergency_cost_share_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Emergency services exempt"
  description: "Emergency services exempt from cost sharing per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(D)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 1396o(a)(2)(D): emergency services always exempt from cost sharing
    return True
  tests:
    - name: "Emergency services always exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {}
      expect: true
    - name: "Emergency services exempt regardless of income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        magi_income_pct_fpl: 2.00
      expect: true

documents.title: CHIP Eligible (Any Pathway)
documents.text:
SEC. 2110. [42 U.S.C. 1397jj] DEFINITIONS.
(a) CHILD.--
(1) IN GENERAL.--Subject to paragraph (2), the term 'child' means an
individual under 19 years of age.
(b) TARGETED LOW-INCOME CHILD.--The term 'targeted low-income child' means
a child--
(1) who has been determined eligible by the State for child health
assistance under the State child health plan;
(2)(A) who is a low-income child, or
(B) is a child--
(i) whose family income... exceeds the medicaid applicable income
level..., but
(ii) does not exceed 50 percentage points above the medicaid
applicable income level...;
(3) who is not found to be eligible for medical assistance under
title XIX or... under a waiver...;
(4) who is not covered under a group health plan or under health
insurance coverage...
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from eligibility.rac ----

# 42 USC 1397aa-1397jj - CHIP Eligibility
#

text: """
SEC. 2110. [42 U.S.C. 1397jj] DEFINITIONS.
(a) CHILD.--
(1) IN GENERAL.--Subject to paragraph (2), the term 'child' means an
individual under 19 years of age.
(b) TARGETED LOW-INCOME CHILD.--The term 'targeted low-income child' means
a child--
(1) who has been determined eligible by the State for child health
assistance under the State child health plan;
(2)(A) who is a low-income child, or
(B) is a child--
(i) whose family income... exceeds the medicaid applicable income
level..., but
(ii) does not exceed 50 percentage points above the medicaid
applicable income level...;
(3) who is not found to be eligible for medical assistance under
title XIX or... under a waiver...;
(4) who is not covered under a group health plan or under health
insurance coverage...
"""

parameter max_age:
  description: "Maximum age for CHIP eligibility (child must be under this age)"
  unit: years
  values:
    1997-08-05: 19  # CHIP enacted by Balanced Budget Act of 1997

variable eligibility:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "CHIP Eligible (Any Pathway)"
  description: "Person eligible through any CHIP pathway based on age requirement"
  formula: return age < max_age
  tests:
    - name: "infant_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 0
      expect: true
    - name: "child_age_10_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 10
      expect: true
    - name: "teenager_age_17_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 17
      expect: true
    - name: "age_18_eligible_boundary"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 18
      expect: true  # Under 19, still eligible
    - name: "age_19_not_eligible_boundary"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 19
      expect: false  # At 19, no longer a child per statute
    - name: "adult_age_25_not_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 25
      expect: false

documents.title: Household Has CHIP Eligible
documents.text:
SEC. 2102. [42 U.S.C. 1397bb] STATE CHILD HEALTH PLANS.
(a) REQUIREMENTS.--A State child health plan shall include a description of--
(1) the extent to which... the plan meets... the requirements of
section 2103;
...
(b) GENERAL CONTENTS.--A State child health plan shall include a description,
consistent with subsection (a), of--
(1) the proposed type... of the plan...
(A) obtain health benefits coverage that meets the requirements of
section 2103 through--
(i) a separate child health program;
(ii) an expansion of coverage under the State's medicaid plan
under title XIX; or
(iii) a combination of both such program and expansion...
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from benefits.rac ----

# 42 USC 1397bb - State Child Health Plans: Benefits
#

text: """
SEC. 2102. [42 U.S.C. 1397bb] STATE CHILD HEALTH PLANS.
(a) REQUIREMENTS.--A State child health plan shall include a description of--
(1) the extent to which... the plan meets... the requirements of
section 2103;
...
(b) GENERAL CONTENTS.--A State child health plan shall include a description,
consistent with subsection (a), of--
(1) the proposed type... of the plan...
(A) obtain health benefits coverage that meets the requirements of
section 2103 through--
(i) a separate child health program;
(ii) an expansion of coverage under the State's medicaid plan
under title XIX; or
(iii) a combination of both such program and expansion...
"""
variable benefits:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  unit: USD
  label: "Household Has CHIP Eligible"
  description: "Household contains at least one CHIP-eligible person"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only calculate for eligible individuals
    if not is_chip_eligible:
        return 0
    # Get state-specific per-capita value if available
    # Otherwise use national average from calibration
    state = household.state_code
    # Per-capita spending varies by state from ~$2,000 to ~$5,000 annually
    # This includes medical, dental, vision, and administrative costs
    #
    # Note: Actual benefit value to individual may differ from spending due to:
    # - Adverse selection
    # - Provider reimbursement rates
    # - Utilization patterns
    # - Administrative overhead
    #
    # Using calibration data as best available estimate
    return per_capita_spending
  tests:
    - name: "household_not_chip_eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: false
        per_capita_spending: 3_500
      expect: 0
    - name: "household_chip_eligible_standard_spending"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_spending: 3_500
      expect: 3_500
    - name: "household_chip_eligible_low_cost_state"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_spending: 2_000
      expect: 2_000
    - name: "household_chip_eligible_high_cost_state"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_spending: 5_000
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "household_chip_eligible_zero_spending"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_spending: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "ineligible_household_ignores_spending"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: false
        per_capita_spending: 4_200
      expect: 0

INSURANCE.
...
(e) COST-SHARING.--
(1) DESCRIPTION; GENERAL CONDITIONS.--
(A) DESCRIPTION.--A State child health plan shall include a
description, consistent with this subsection, of the amount
(if any) of premiums, deductibles, coinsurance, and other
cost sharing imposed under the plan.
...
(3) LIMITATIONS ON COST SHARING.--
(A) CHILDREN IN FAMILIES WITH INCOME BELOW 150 PERCENT OF
POVERTY LINE.--In the case of children in a family... at or
below 150 percent of the poverty line... the State child
health plan may only impose premiums... that are not in
excess of the amounts of... premiums... permitted...
under section 1916...
(B) OTHER CHILDREN.--For children not described in subparagraph
(A), the State child health plan may not impose any form of
cost sharing... the cumulative amount of which exceeds
5 percent of a family's income for the year involved.
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from cost_sharing.rac ----

# 42 USC 1397cc - Coverage Requirements for CHIP: Cost Sharing
#

text: """
SEC. 2103. [42 U.S.C. 1397cc] COVERAGE REQUIREMENTS FOR CHILDREN'S HEALTH
INSURANCE.
...
(e) COST-SHARING.--
(1) DESCRIPTION; GENERAL CONDITIONS.--
(A) DESCRIPTION.--A State child health plan shall include a
description, consistent with this subsection, of the amount
(if any) of premiums, deductibles, coinsurance, and other
cost sharing imposed under the plan.
...
(3) LIMITATIONS ON COST SHARING.--
(A) CHILDREN IN FAMILIES WITH INCOME BELOW 150 PERCENT OF
POVERTY LINE.--In the case of children in a family... at or
below 150 percent of the poverty line... the State child
health plan may only impose premiums... that are not in
excess of the amounts of... premiums... permitted...
under section 1916...
(B) OTHER CHILDREN.--For children not described in subparagraph
(A), the State child health plan may not impose any form of
cost sharing... the cumulative amount of which exceeds
5 percent of a family's income for the year involved.
"""

parameter cost_sharing_exempt_threshold:
  description: "Income level (as % FPL) below which children are exempt from most cost-sharing"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2024-01-01: 150
    1997-01-01: 150

input is_chip_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "CHIP Eligible"
  description: "Whether household contains CHIP-eligible children"
  default: false

input medicaid_income_level:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  unit: %
  label: "Income as Percent of FPL"
  description: "Household income as a percentage of the federal poverty line"
  default: 0

variable cost_sharing:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  unit: USD
  label: "CHIP Affordable"
  description: "CHIP cost-sharing is within 5% of household income"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only applicable to CHIP-eligible persons
    if not is_chip_eligible:
        return False
    # Check income against cost-sharing exemption threshold
    income_pct_fpl = medicaid_income_level
    # Below 150% FPL: exempt from most cost-sharing
    return income_pct_fpl <= cost_sharing_exempt_threshold
  tests:
    - name: "Not CHIP eligible - cost sharing not applicable"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: false
        medicaid_income_level: 100
      expect: false
    - name: "CHIP eligible at 100% FPL - exempt from cost sharing"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        medicaid_income_level: 100
      expect: true
    - name: "CHIP eligible at 150% FPL - exactly at threshold (exempt)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        medicaid_income_level: 150
      expect: true
    - name: "CHIP eligible at 151% FPL - just above threshold (not exempt)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        medicaid_income_level: 151
      expect: false
    - name: "CHIP eligible at 200% FPL - above threshold (not exempt)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        medicaid_income_level: 200
      expect: false
    - name: "CHIP eligible at 0% FPL - well below threshold (exempt)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        medicaid_income_level: 0
      expect: true

documents.title: CHIP Eligible
documents.text:

to enable them to initiate and expand the provision of child health
assistance to uninsured, low-income children in an effective and

documents.code:
# ---- Merged from chip.rac ----

# 42 USC 1397aa-1397mm - Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP)
#

text: """
SEC. 2101. [42 U.S.C. 1397aa] PURPOSE; STATE CHILD HEALTH PLANS.
(a) PURPOSE.--The purpose of this title is to provide funds to States
to enable them to initiate and expand the provision of child health
assistance to uninsured, low-income children in an effective and
efficient manner...
"""
input is_chip_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "CHIP Eligible"
  description: "Whether household contains CHIP-eligible children (under 19, low-income, uninsured)"
  default: false

input per_capita_chip_benefit:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Per-Capita CHIP Benefit"
  description: "Annual per-capita CHIP benefit value (varies by state, typically $2,000-$5,000)"
  default: 0

variable chip:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  unit: USD
  label: "CHIP Coverage Gap Count"
  description: "Number of CHIP-eligible persons facing cost-sharing burden"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Not eligible: no benefit
    if not is_chip_eligible:
        return 0
    # Eligible: return per-capita benefit value
    return per_capita_chip_benefit
  tests:
    - name: "Ineligible household receives no benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: false
        per_capita_chip_benefit: 3_500
      expect: 0
    - name: "Eligible household with low state benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_chip_benefit: 2_000
      expect: 2_000
    - name: "Eligible household with average state benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_chip_benefit: 3_500
      expect: 3_500
    - name: "Eligible household with high state benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_chip_benefit: 5_000
      expect: 5_000
    - name: "Eligible household with zero benefit value"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: true
        per_capita_chip_benefit: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Ineligible household with high benefit value still receives nothing"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_chip_eligible: false
        per_capita_chip_benefit: 5_000
      expect: 0

documents.title: HCV Very Low Income Limit
documents.code:
# TODO: This file contains HCV eligibility content that may belong in other subsections.
# Section 1437f(a) is an authorization provision. Eligibility rules are in (c), (f), (o).
# See beads issue for restructuring.

text: """
The Secretary may enter into annual contributions contracts with
public housing agencies pursuant to which such agencies may enter
into contracts to make assistance payments to owners...
admissions must be "extremely low income" (30% AMI or below).
"""

parameter max_table_size:
  description: "Maximum household size with specific income limit in tables"
  unit: persons
  values:
    1937-01-01: 8

variable hcv_very_low_income_limit:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Very Low Income Limit"
  description: "50% of Area Median Income limit for HCV eligibility"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Income limit varies by household size
    # For sizes > max_table_size, add per-person amount
    limits = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.income_limits.very_low_income)
    additional = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.income_limits.very_low_income.additional_per_person)
    if household_size <= max_table_size:
        return limits[household_size]
    else:
        base = limits[max_table_size]
        extra_members = household_size - max_table_size
        return base + (additional * extra_members)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person 50% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 35_650
    - name: "Two person 50% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 40_750
    - name: "Four person 50% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 50_850
    - name: "Family of 8 50% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 8
      expect: 65_200

variable hcv_extremely_low_income_limit:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Extremely Low Income Limit"
  description: "30% of Area Median Income limit for targeting requirement"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    limits = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.income_limits.extremely_low_income)
    additional = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.income_limits.extremely_low_income.additional_per_person)
    if household_size <= max_table_size:
        return limits[household_size]
    else:
        base = limits[max_table_size]
        extra_members = household_size - max_table_size
        return base + (additional * extra_members)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person 30% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 21_390
    - name: "Two person 30% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 24_450
    - name: "Four person 30% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 30_510
    - name: "Family of 8 30% AMI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 8
      expect: 39_120

variable hcv_low_income_limit:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Low Income Limit"
  description: "80% of Area Median Income limit for continued occupancy"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    limits = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.income_limits.low_income)
    additional = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.income_limits.low_income.additional_per_person)
    if household_size <= max_table_size:
        return limits[household_size]
    else:
        base = limits[max_table_size]
        extra_members = household_size - max_table_size
        return base + (additional * extra_members)
  default: 0

variable hcv_income_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Income Eligible"
  description: "Whether household meets 50% AMI income eligibility for HCV"
  formula: return hcv_annual_income <= hcv_very_low_income_limit
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Single person eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person at limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 35_650
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person over limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 40_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Family of 4 eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        hcv_annual_income: 45_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4 ineligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        hcv_annual_income: 60_000
      expect: false

variable hcv_extremely_low_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Extremely Low Income"
  description: "Whether household is at or below 30% AMI for targeting purposes"
  formula: return hcv_annual_income <= hcv_extremely_low_income_limit
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Single person extremely low income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 20_000
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person at extremely low limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 21_390
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person over extremely low limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
      expect: false
    - name: "Family of 4 extremely low income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        hcv_annual_income: 25_000
      expect: true

variable hcv_family_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Family Composition Eligible"
  description: "Whether household constitutes a family under HCV rules"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # A family includes:
    # (1) Two or more persons who intend to share residency
    # (2) Single person who is elderly, disabled, displaced, or other
    #     category determined by PHA
    # (3) Remaining member of tenant family
    # For modeling, we assume any household constitutes a family
    # PHAs have discretion in family definitions
    if household_size >= 1:
        return True
    return False
  default: false

variable hcv_citizenship_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Citizenship/Immigration Eligible"
  description: "Whether at least one household member has eligible immigration status"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # At least one family member must be:
    # - U.S. citizen
    # - National
    # - Eligible immigrant (as defined in 42 USC 1436a)
    #
    # For modeling, we check for presence of eligible member
    if has_eligible_citizen_or_immigrant:
        return True
    return False
  default: false

variable hcv_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Eligible"
  description: "Whether household meets all HCV eligibility requirements"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must meet all eligibility requirements:
    # (1) Income eligibility (50% AMI)
    # (2) Family composition
    # (3) Citizenship/immigration status
    if hcv_income_eligible and hcv_family_eligible and hcv_citizenship_eligible:
        return True
    return False
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Single person, very low income, eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
        has_eligible_citizen_or_immigrant: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4, very low income, eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        hcv_annual_income: 45_000
        has_eligible_citizen_or_immigrant: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Income ineligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        hcv_annual_income: 80_000
        has_eligible_citizen_or_immigrant: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Citizenship ineligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 25_000
        has_eligible_citizen_or_immigrant: false
      expect: false
    - name: "All requirements not met"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        hcv_annual_income: 100_000
        has_eligible_citizen_or_immigrant: false
      expect: false

documents.title: HCV Child Care Deduction
documents.code:
# 24 CFR 5.609 & 5.611 - Annual Income and Deductions
#
variable hcv_childcare_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Child Care Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for child care expenses enabling work or education"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Deduction cannot exceed:
    # (1) Amount earned by family member enabled to work, OR
    # (2) Cost of care for children under 13 (or disabled children)
    # For modeling, we take the lesser of:
    # - Actual childcare expenses
    # - Employment income of the person enabled to work
    max_deduction = employment_income  # Cannot exceed income earned
    return min(childcare_expense, max_deduction)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No childcare expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        childcare_expense: 0
        employment_income: 20_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Childcare less than income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        childcare_expense: 5_000
        employment_income: 20_000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Childcare exceeds income - capped"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        childcare_expense: 25_000
        employment_income: 20_000
      expect: 20000
    - name: "No employment income - no deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        childcare_expense: 5_000
        employment_income: 0
      expect: 0

variable hcv_medical_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Medical Expense Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for medical expenses over 3% of income (elderly/disabled only)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only available to elderly or disabled families
    if not has_elderly_disabled:
        return 0
    # Threshold = 3% of annual gross income
    threshold_rate = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.deductions.medical.threshold_rate)
    threshold = hcv_annual_income * threshold_rate
    # Deduction = expenses over threshold
    excess = medical_expense - threshold
    return max(0, excess)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Not elderly/disabled - no deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        medical_expense: 5_000
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Elderly with expenses over threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expense: 2_000
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
      expect: 1100
    - name: "Elderly with expenses below threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expense: 500
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Disabled with high expenses"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expense: 10_000
        hcv_annual_income: 20_000
      expect: 9400

variable hcv_disability_assistance_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Disability Assistance Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for disability assistance expenses enabling work"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only available if:
    # (1) Expense is for attendant care or auxiliary apparatus
    # (2) Expense enables a family member to work
    # (3) Cannot exceed income earned by person enabled to work
    if not has_disability_expense:
        return 0
    # Deduction limited to income earned
    return min(disability_assistance_expense, employment_income)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No disability expense"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_disability_expense: false
        disability_assistance_expense: 0
        employment_income: 20_000
      expect: 0
    - name: "Expense less than income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_disability_expense: true
        disability_assistance_expense: 5_000
        employment_income: 20_000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Expense exceeds income - capped"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_disability_expense: true
        disability_assistance_expense: 25_000
        employment_income: 18_000
      expect: 18000
    - name: "No employment income - no deduction"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_disability_expense: true
        disability_assistance_expense: 5_000
        employment_income: 0
      expect: 0

variable hcv_monthly_adjusted_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Monthly Adjusted Income"
  description: "Monthly adjusted income for TTP calculation"
  syntax: python
  formula: return hcv_annual_adjusted_income / months_per_year
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No annual income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_adjusted_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Small annual income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_adjusted_income: 12_000
      expect: 1000
    - name: "Moderate annual income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_adjusted_income: 36_000
      expect: 3000
    - name: "Large annual income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_adjusted_income: 48_000
      expect: 4000

variable hcv_annual_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Annual Income"
  description: "Total annual gross income from all counted sources per 24 CFR 5.609(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum of all counted income sources for all family members
    # Major categories per 24 CFR 5.609(b)
    total = employment_income + self_employment_income
    total = total + social_security_benefits + ssi_benefits
    total = total + pension_income + annuity_income
    total = total + alimony_received + child_support_received
    total = total + regular_gifts_received + unemployment_benefits
    total = total + disability_benefits + workers_compensation
    total = total + welfare_assistance + interest_income
    total = total + dividend_income + net_rental_income
    return total
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Employment income only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employment_income: 24_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        social_security_benefits: 0
        ssi_benefits: 0
        pension_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        alimony_received: 0
        child_support_received: 0
        regular_gifts_received: 0
        unemployment_benefits: 0
        disability_benefits: 0
        workers_compensation: 0
        welfare_assistance: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        net_rental_income: 0
      expect: 24000
    - name: "Multiple income sources"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employment_income: 20_000
        self_employment_income: 0
        social_security_benefits: 12_000
        ssi_benefits: 0
        pension_income: 0
        annuity_income: 0
        alimony_received: 0
        child_support_received: 0
        regular_gifts_received: 0
        unemployment_benefits: 0
        disability_benefits: 0
        workers_compensation: 0
        welfare_assistance: 0
        interest_income: 0
        dividend_income: 0
        net_rental_income: 0
      expect: 32000
    - name: "All income sources"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        employment_income: 20_000
        self_employment_income: 5_000
        social_security_benefits: 10_000
        ssi_benefits: 0
        pension_income: 3_000
        annuity_income: 0
        alimony_received: 0
        child_support_received: 0
        regular_gifts_received: 1_000
        unemployment_benefits: 0
        disability_benefits: 0
        workers_compensation: 0
        welfare_assistance: 0
        interest_income: 100
        dividend_income: 0
        net_rental_income: 500
      expect: 39600

variable hcv_dependent_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Dependent Deduction"
  description: "Deduction of $480 per dependent family member"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Dependent = family member (other than head, spouse, or co-head) who is:
    # - Under 18 years old, OR
    # - A person with a disability, OR
    # - A full-time student
    deduction_per_dependent = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.deductions.dependent)
    return num_dependents * deduction_per_dependent
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No dependents"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_dependents: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "One dependent"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_dependents: 1
      expect: 480
    - name: "Two dependents"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_dependents: 2
      expect: 960
    - name: "Four dependents"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        num_dependents: 4
      expect: 1920

variable hcv_elderly_disabled_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Elderly/Disabled Deduction"
  description: "Deduction of $400 for elderly (62+) or disabled head/spouse"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Elderly family: head, spouse, or sole member is 62 years or older
    # Disabled family: head, spouse, or sole member has a disability
    deduction_amount = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.deductions.elderly_disabled)
    if has_elderly_disabled:
        return deduction_amount
    else:
        return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No elderly or disabled members"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Elderly family"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
      expect: 400
    - name: "Disabled family"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
      expect: 400

variable hcv_total_deductions:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Total Deductions"
  description: "Sum of all allowable deductions from annual income"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    total = hcv_dependent_deduction + hcv_elderly_disabled_deduction
    total = total + hcv_childcare_deduction + hcv_medical_deduction
    total = total + hcv_disability_assistance_deduction
    return total
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_dependent_deduction: 0
        hcv_elderly_disabled_deduction: 0
        hcv_childcare_deduction: 0
        hcv_medical_deduction: 0
        hcv_disability_assistance_deduction: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Dependent deduction only"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_dependent_deduction: 960
        hcv_elderly_disabled_deduction: 0
        hcv_childcare_deduction: 0
        hcv_medical_deduction: 0
        hcv_disability_assistance_deduction: 0
      expect: 960
    - name: "Dependent and elderly deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_dependent_deduction: 960
        hcv_elderly_disabled_deduction: 400
        hcv_childcare_deduction: 0
        hcv_medical_deduction: 0
        hcv_disability_assistance_deduction: 0
      expect: 1360
    - name: "All deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_dependent_deduction: 960
        hcv_elderly_disabled_deduction: 400
        hcv_childcare_deduction: 500
        hcv_medical_deduction: 300
        hcv_disability_assistance_deduction: 200
      expect: 2360

variable hcv_annual_adjusted_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Annual Adjusted Income"
  description: "Annual income minus all allowable deductions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    adjusted = hcv_annual_income - hcv_total_deductions
    return max(0, adjusted)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No income, no deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_income: 0
        hcv_total_deductions: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Income with no deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
        hcv_total_deductions: 0
      expect: 30000
    - name: "Income with partial deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_income: 30_000
        hcv_total_deductions: 1_360
      expect: 28640
    - name: "Income fully deducted"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_income: 1_360
        hcv_total_deductions: 1_360
      expect: 0
    - name: "Income exceeded by deductions"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        hcv_annual_income: 500
        hcv_total_deductions: 2_360
      expect: 0

documents.title: HCV Adjusted Income Contribution
documents.text:
The monthly assistance payment... shall be the amount by which the
rent (including the amount allowed for tenant-paid utilities) for
the dwelling unit... exceeds the greatest of--
(A) 30 percent of the monthly adjusted income of the family;
(B) 10 percent of the monthly income of the family; or
(C) if the family is receiving payments for welfare assistance...
the portion of such payments which is specifically designated
by such agency to meet the housing costs of the family.
documents.code:
text: """
The monthly assistance payment... shall be the amount by which the
rent (including the amount allowed for tenant-paid utilities) for
the dwelling unit... exceeds the greatest of--
(A) 30 percent of the monthly adjusted income of the family;
(B) 10 percent of the monthly income of the family; or
(C) if the family is receiving payments for welfare assistance...
the portion of such payments which is specifically designated
by such agency to meet the housing costs of the family.
"""
variable hcv_adjusted_income_contribution:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Adjusted Income Contribution"
  description: "Share of monthly adjusted income per 24 CFR 5.628(a)(1)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    rate = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.tenant_contribution.income_rate)
    return round(hcv_monthly_adjusted_income * rate)
  default: 0

variable hcv_gross_income_contribution:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Gross Income Contribution"
  description: "Share of monthly gross income per 24 CFR 5.628(a)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    rate = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.tenant_contribution.gross_income_rate)
    monthly_gross = hcv_annual_income / months_per_year
    return round(monthly_gross * rate)
  default: 0

variable hcv_welfare_rent:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Welfare Rent"
  description: "Welfare assistance portion designated for housing"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Welfare rent = portion of welfare designated for housing
    # Only applies if welfare agency designates housing portion
    return welfare_housing_portion
  default: 0

variable hcv_minimum_rent:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Minimum Rent"
  description: "PHA-determined minimum rent ($0-$50)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Using default minimum rent from parameters
    # PHAs may set lower (including $0) with hardship exemptions
    return parameter(gov.hud.hcv.tenant_contribution.minimum_rent.default)
  default: 50

variable hcv_total_tenant_payment:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Total Tenant Payment"
  description: "Monthly tenant contribution - greatest of 30% adjusted, 10% gross, welfare rent, or minimum rent"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 24 CFR 5.628, TTP = greatest of:
    # (A) Share of adjusted monthly income
    # (B) Share of monthly gross income
    # (C) Welfare rent (if applicable)
    # (D) Minimum rent
    ttp_adjusted = hcv_adjusted_income_contribution
    ttp_gross = hcv_gross_income_contribution
    ttp_welfare = hcv_welfare_rent
    ttp_minimum = hcv_minimum_rent
    # Take the greatest
    ttp = max(ttp_adjusted, ttp_gross)
    ttp = max(ttp, ttp_welfare)
    ttp = max(ttp, ttp_minimum)
    return ttp
  default: 0

variable hcv_tenant_rent_to_owner:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Tenant Rent to Owner"
  description: "Amount tenant pays directly to landlord"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Tenant rent = greater of:
    # (1) TTP - utility allowance, OR
    # (2) Gross rent - HAP
    # First calculate based on TTP
    rent_from_ttp = max(0, hcv_total_tenant_payment - utility_allowance)
    # If gross rent exceeds payment standard, tenant pays the excess
    excess_rent = max(0, gross_rent - payment_standard)
    rent_with_excess = rent_from_ttp + excess_rent
    return rent_with_excess
  default: 0

variable hcv_utility_reimbursement:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Utility Reimbursement"
  description: "Reimbursement when utility allowance exceeds TTP"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # If utility allowance > TTP, family receives the difference
    reimbursement = utility_allowance - hcv_total_tenant_payment
    return max(0, reimbursement)
  default: 0

documents.title: Base Voucher Bedroom Count
documents.code:
parameter base_voucher_bedroom_count:
  description: "Base bedroom count for head of household and spouse"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1998-10-21: 1
  label: "Base Voucher Bedroom Count"

parameter persons_per_bedroom:
  description: "Number of persons allowed per additional bedroom"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1998-10-21: 2
  label: "Persons Per Bedroom"

parameter max_bedroom_count:
  description: "Maximum bedroom count with specific payment standard"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1998-10-21: 5
  label: "Maximum Bedroom Count"

parameter rent_reasonableness_threshold:
  description: "Percentage of payment standard used for rent reasonableness comparison"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1998-10-21: 1.0
  label: "Rent Reasonableness Threshold"

variable hcv_voucher_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "HCV Voucher Size"
  description: "Number of bedrooms for voucher based on family composition"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # PHA subsidy standards determine bedroom size
    # Typical standards:
    # - Head of household and spouse: 1 bedroom
    # - Each 2 additional family members: 1 bedroom
    # - Children of opposite sex may share until certain age
    # Simplified formula for modeling:
    # Bedrooms = head_spouse_bedrooms + ceiling((members - base_voucher_bedroom_count) / persons_per_bedroom)
    if household_size <= base_voucher_bedroom_count:
        return head_spouse_bedrooms
    additional_members = household_size - base_voucher_bedroom_count
    additional_bedrooms = ceil(additional_members / persons_per_bedroom)
    return head_spouse_bedrooms + additional_bedrooms
  default: 1
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        head_spouse_bedrooms: 1
      expect: 1
    - name: "Couple (2 persons)"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        head_spouse_bedrooms: 1
      expect: 2
    - name: "Family of 4"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        head_spouse_bedrooms: 1
      expect: 3
    - name: "Large family of 6"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 6
        head_spouse_bedrooms: 1
      expect: 4

variable hcv_payment_standard:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Payment Standard"
  description: "Payment standard amount based on voucher bedroom size"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    voucher_size = hcv_voucher_size
    # Look up payment standard by bedroom size from parameter table
    standards = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.payment_standards.by_bedroom)
    additional = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.payment_standards.additional_per_bedroom)
    if voucher_size < max_bedroom_count:
        return standards[voucher_size]
    else:
        # For larger units, use max BR base + additional per bedroom
        base = standards[max_bedroom_count]
        return base + ((voucher_size - max_bedroom_count) * additional)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "1 bedroom payment standard"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_voucher_size: 1
      expect: 1200
    - name: "2 bedroom payment standard"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_voucher_size: 2
      expect: 1400
    - name: "3 bedroom payment standard"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_voucher_size: 3
      expect: 1800

variable hcv_gross_rent:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Gross Rent"
  description: "Contract rent plus utility allowance"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Contract rent = rent paid to owner
    # Utility allowance = PHA estimate of tenant-paid utilities
    return contract_rent + utility_allowance
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Rent only, no utilities"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        contract_rent: 1200
        utility_allowance: 0
      expect: 1200
    - name: "Rent with utility allowance"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        contract_rent: 1000
        utility_allowance: 150
      expect: 1150
    - name: "High rent with utilities"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        contract_rent: 1500
        utility_allowance: 200
      expect: 1700

variable hcv_housing_assistance_payment:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Housing Assistance Payment"
  description: "Monthly subsidy paid by PHA to landlord"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # First check eligibility
    if not hcv_eligible:
        return 0
    ttp = hcv_total_tenant_payment
    # HAP = lesser of:
    # (1) Payment standard minus TTP
    # (2) Gross rent minus TTP
    hap_from_standard = hcv_payment_standard - ttp
    hap_from_rent = hcv_gross_rent - ttp
    hap = min(hap_from_standard, hap_from_rent)
    # HAP cannot be negative
    return max(0, hap)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Not eligible - no HAP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_eligible: false
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
        hcv_total_tenant_payment: 400
      expect: 0
    - name: "Rent below payment standard"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_eligible: true
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
        hcv_total_tenant_payment: 400
      expect: 800
    - name: "Rent above payment standard"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_eligible: true
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1600
        hcv_total_tenant_payment: 400
      expect: 1000
    - name: "High TTP reduces HAP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_eligible: true
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
        hcv_total_tenant_payment: 1000
      expect: 200

variable hcv_rent_reasonable:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Rent Reasonable"
  description: "Whether rent is reasonable compared to market"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Rent reasonableness is determined by PHA comparison
    # to comparable market units. For modeling, we assume
    # rent is reasonable if within the reasonableness threshold of payment standard.
    reasonableness_limit = hcv_payment_standard * rent_reasonableness_threshold
    if hcv_gross_rent <= reasonableness_limit:
        return True
    return False
  default: True
  tests:
    - name: "Rent at payment standard - reasonable"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1400
      expect: true
    - name: "Rent below payment standard - reasonable"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
      expect: true
    - name: "Rent above payment standard - not reasonable"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_payment_standard: 1400
        hcv_gross_rent: 1500
      expect: false

variable hcv_initial_affordability_check:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "HCV Initial Affordability Check"
  description: "Whether family share is affordable at initial lease-up (40% limit)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    family_share = hcv_gross_rent - hcv_housing_assistance_payment
    max_share_rate = parameter(gov.hud.hcv.housing_assistance.maximum_family_share.at_initial_lease)
    max_share = hcv_monthly_adjusted_income * max_share_rate
    # Family share at move-in cannot exceed 40% of adjusted income
    if family_share <= max_share:
        return True
    return False
  default: True
  tests:
    - name: "Affordable - family share below 40%"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 800
        hcv_monthly_adjusted_income: 2000
      expect: true
    - name: "Affordable - family share at 40%"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 400
        hcv_monthly_adjusted_income: 2000
      expect: true
    - name: "Not affordable - family share exceeds 40%"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_gross_rent: 1500
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 400
        hcv_monthly_adjusted_income: 2000
      expect: false

variable hcv_family_payment:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Family Payment"
  description: "Total amount tenant pays (gross rent minus HAP)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Family pays: Gross rent - HAP
    # Or equivalently: TTP + any excess rent over payment standard
    family_share = hcv_gross_rent - hcv_housing_assistance_payment
    return max(0, family_share)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Standard family payment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_gross_rent: 1200
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 800
      expect: 400
    - name: "Full HAP covers rent"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_gross_rent: 800
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 800
      expect: 0
    - name: "High rent - higher family payment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_gross_rent: 1600
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 900
      expect: 700

variable hcv_payment_to_owner:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "HCV Payment to Owner"
  description: "HAP amount paid directly to landlord"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # HAP paid directly to owner
    # May be less than full HAP if utility allowance creates reimbursement
    hap = hcv_housing_assistance_payment
    # Payment to owner cannot exceed contract rent
    return min(hap, contract_rent)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "HAP less than contract rent"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 800
        contract_rent: 1200
      expect: 800
    - name: "HAP equals contract rent"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 1000
        contract_rent: 1000
      expect: 1000
    - name: "HAP exceeds contract rent - capped"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 1200
        contract_rent: 900
      expect: 900

variable hcv:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher"
  description: "Monthly Housing Choice Voucher benefit (Housing Assistance Payment)"
  formula: return hcv_housing_assistance_payment
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No benefit - ineligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Moderate benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 700
      expect: 700
    - name: "High benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        hcv_housing_assistance_payment: 1_150
      expect: 1150

documents.title: Household Receives SNAP
documents.text:
42 USC § 1758(b) - Free and Reduced-Price School Meals

Eligible children:
(1)(A)(i) Child from household with income at or below 130% FPL -> free meals
(1)(A)(ii) Child from household with income 130-185% FPL -> reduced-price meals
(b)(2)(C)(ii) Child in household receiving SNAP -> categorically eligible for free
(5) Foster children -> categorically eligible for free
(12)(A) Homeless, runaway, or migratory children -> categorically eligible for free
documents.code:
text: """
42 USC § 1758(b) - Free and Reduced-Price School Meals

Eligible children:
(1)(A)(i) Child from household with income at or below 130% FPL -> free meals
(1)(A)(ii) Child from household with income 130-185% FPL -> reduced-price meals
(b)(2)(C)(ii) Child in household receiving SNAP -> categorically eligible for free
(5) Foster children -> categorically eligible for free
(12)(A) Homeless, runaway, or migratory children -> categorically eligible for free
"""

# Inputs for household assistance programs (categorical eligibility)
input household_receives_snap:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Household Receives SNAP"
  description: "Whether any household member receives SNAP benefits"
  default: false

input household_receives_tanf:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Household Receives TANF"
  description: "Whether household receives TANF cash assistance"
  default: false

input household_receives_fdpir:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Household Receives FDPIR"
  description: "Whether household receives FDPIR benefits"
  default: false

# Inputs for special circumstances (categorical eligibility)
input is_foster_child:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Foster Child"
  description: "Whether person is a foster child in state care"
  default: false

input is_homeless:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Homeless"
  description: "Whether person is experiencing homelessness"
  default: false

input is_runaway_child:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Runaway Child"
  description: "Whether person is a runaway child"
  default: false

input is_migratory_child:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Migratory Child"
  description: "Whether person is a migratory/seasonal farm worker"
  default: false

input is_head_start_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Head Start Eligible"
  description: "Whether person is enrolled in Head Start"
  default: false

# Inputs for income-based eligibility
input household_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Size"
  description: "Number of persons in the household"
  default: 1

input household_gross_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Household Gross Income"
  description: "Total gross annual household income"
  default: 0

input attends_cep_school:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Attends CEP School"
  description: "Whether student attends school with Community Eligibility Provision"
  default: false

# Enums for meal tier classification
enum school_meal_tier:
  FREE: "Free meals (categorical eligibility, income <= 130% FPL, or CEP)"
  REDUCED: "Reduced-price meals (130% < income <= 185% FPL)"
  PAID: "Full-price meals (income > 185% FPL)"

# Federal Poverty Line Parameters (annual)
parameter school_meal_fpl_base:
  values:
    2025-01-01: 15_060
    2024-01-01: 14_580
  unit: USD
  period: Year
  label: "Annual FPL Base"
  description: "Annual Federal Poverty Level for 1-person household"

parameter school_meal_fpl_increment:
  values:
    2025-01-01: 5_380
    2024-01-01: 5_380
  unit: USD
  period: Year
  label: "FPL Additional Per Person"
  description: "Annual FPL increment per additional household member"

parameter free_meal_limit_pct_fpl:
  values:
    1977-01-01: 1.30
  unit: /1
  label: "Free Meal Income Limit"
  description: "Free meals for households at or below this percentage of FPL"

parameter reduced_price_limit_pct_fpl:
  values:
    1977-01-01: 1.85
  unit: /1
  label: "Reduced-Price Meal Income Limit"
  description: "Reduced-price meals for households up to this percentage of FPL"

# School Meal Subsidy Parameters (annual per student)
parameter school_meal_subsidy_free:
  values:
    2025-01-01: 1_680
    2024-01-01: 1_625
  unit: USD
  period: Year
  label: "Free School Meal Annual Value"
  description: "Annual value of free school meals (lunch + breakfast)"

parameter school_meal_subsidy_reduced:
  values:
    2025-01-01: 1_050
    2024-01-01: 1_025
  unit: USD
  period: Year
  label: "Reduced-Price School Meal Annual Value"
  description: "Annual value of reduced-price school meals (lunch + breakfast)"

# Helper variable to calculate FPL for household size
variable school_meal_fpl:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Federal Poverty Level"
  description: "Annual FPL for household based on size"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # FPL = base + increment per person beyond first
    extra_members = max(0, household_size - 1)
    return school_meal_fpl_base + (school_meal_fpl_increment * extra_members)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household"
      inputs: {household_size: 1}
      expect: 15060
    - name: "Family of 4"
      inputs: {household_size: 4}
      expect: 31200
    - name: "Large family of 8"
      inputs: {household_size: 8}
      expect: 47100


# ---- Merged from categorical.rac ----

# 42 USC 1758(b) - Categorical Eligibility for School Meals
#

text: """
income verification through "categorical eligibility" (direct certification).
(ii) A child... is a member of a household receiving assistance under
the supplemental nutrition assistance program authorized under the Food
and Nutrition Act of 2008... shall be considered automatically eligible
for free lunches and free breakfasts
(5) A child who is a member of a household... who is a foster child
whose care and placement is the responsibility of an agency that
administers a State plan under part B or E of title IV of the
Social Security Act
(12)(A) A child who is a member of a household that receives assistance
under a program funded by the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act...
a runaway child... or a migratory child...
(I) the supplemental nutrition assistance program authorized under
the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.)
"""
variable school_meal_snap_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Person in household receiving SNAP qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return household_receives_snap
  tests:
    - name: "Household receives SNAP"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Household does not receive SNAP"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_tanf_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Person in household receiving TANF qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return household_receives_tanf
  tests:
    - name: "Household receives TANF"
      inputs: {household_receives_tanf: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Household does not receive TANF"
      inputs: {household_receives_tanf: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_fdpir_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "FDPIR Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Person in household receiving FDPIR qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return household_receives_fdpir
  tests:
    - name: "Household receives FDPIR"
      inputs: {household_receives_fdpir: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Household does not receive FDPIR"
      inputs: {household_receives_fdpir: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_foster_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Foster Child Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Foster child qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return is_foster_child
  tests:
    - name: "Person is foster child"
      inputs: {is_foster_child: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Person is not foster child"
      inputs: {is_foster_child: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_homeless_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Homeless Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Homeless person qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return is_homeless
  tests:
    - name: "Person is homeless"
      inputs: {is_homeless: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Person is not homeless"
      inputs: {is_homeless: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_runaway_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Runaway Child Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Runaway child qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return is_runaway_child
  tests:
    - name: "Person is runaway child"
      inputs: {is_runaway_child: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Person is not runaway child"
      inputs: {is_runaway_child: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_migrant_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Migrant Child Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Migratory child qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return is_migratory_child
  tests:
    - name: "Person is migratory child"
      inputs: {is_migratory_child: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Person is not migratory child"
      inputs: {is_migratory_child: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_head_start_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Head Start Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Head Start enrollee qualifies for free meals"
  formula: return is_head_start_eligible
  tests:
    - name: "Person is Head Start eligible"
      inputs: {is_head_start_eligible: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Person is not Head Start eligible"
      inputs: {is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
