  label: "Categorically Eligible for School Meals"
  description: "Person qualifies for free meals via categorical pathway"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 42 USC 1758(b)(2)(C)(ii) - Program participation
    snap_eligible = school_meal_snap_categorically_eligible
    tanf_eligible = school_meal_tanf_categorically_eligible
    fdpir_eligible = school_meal_fdpir_categorically_eligible
    # 42 USC 1758(b)(5) - Foster children
    foster_eligible = school_meal_foster_categorically_eligible
    # 42 USC 1758(b)(12)(A) - Homeless, runaway, migrant
    homeless_eligible = school_meal_homeless_categorically_eligible
    runaway_eligible = school_meal_runaway_categorically_eligible
    migrant_eligible = school_meal_migrant_categorically_eligible
    # Section 9(b)(2)(A) - Head Start
    head_start_eligible = school_meal_head_start_categorically_eligible
    # Any categorical pathway qualifies
    return (snap_eligible or tanf_eligible or fdpir_eligible or
            foster_eligible or homeless_eligible or runaway_eligible or
            migrant_eligible or head_start_eligible)
  tests:
    - name: "SNAP household"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: true, household_receives_tanf: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_runaway_child: false, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "TANF household"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: true, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_runaway_child: false, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Foster child"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, is_foster_child: true, is_homeless: false, is_runaway_child: false, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Homeless youth"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: true, is_runaway_child: false, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Runaway child"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_runaway_child: true, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Migratory worker child"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_runaway_child: false, is_migratory_child: true, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "No categorical eligibility"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_runaway_child: false, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_cep_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "CEP School Meal Eligibility"
  description: "Student attends school with Community Eligibility Provision (all students get free meals)"
  formula: return attends_cep_school
  tests:
    - name: "Attends CEP school"
      inputs: {attends_cep_school: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Does not attend CEP school"
      inputs: {attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_directly_certified:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Directly Certified for School Meals"
  description: "Person qualifies via data-matchable categorical program"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Direct certification includes categorical eligibility pathways
    # that can be verified through data matching (SNAP, TANF, FDPIR, foster, homeless, migrant)
    # but NOT Head Start (which requires separate documentation)
    snap = school_meal_snap_categorically_eligible
    tanf = school_meal_tanf_categorically_eligible
    fdpir = school_meal_fdpir_categorically_eligible
    foster = school_meal_foster_categorically_eligible
    homeless = school_meal_homeless_categorically_eligible
    migrant = school_meal_migrant_categorically_eligible
    return snap or tanf or fdpir or foster or homeless or migrant
  tests:
    - name: "SNAP household is directly certifiable"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: true, household_receives_tanf: false, household_receives_fdpir: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_migratory_child: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Head Start only is not directly certifiable"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, household_receives_fdpir: false, is_foster_child: false, is_homeless: false, is_migratory_child: false, is_head_start_eligible: true}
      expect: false
    - name: "Foster child is directly certifiable"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_receives_tanf: false, household_receives_fdpir: false, is_foster_child: true, is_homeless: false, is_migratory_child: false}
      expect: true


# ---- Merged from free_eligibility.rac ----

# 42 USC 1758(b)(1)(A)(i) - Free School Meal Eligibility
#

text: """
(A)(i) except as provided in clause (ii), a child shall be served a
free lunch if the household income is at or below 130 percent of the
applicable family size income level contained in the nonfarm income
poverty guidelines prescribed by the Office of Management and Budget
"""
variable free_meal_income_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Free Meal Income Eligible"
  description: "Household income at or below 130% FPL qualifies for free meals"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Get household's gross annual income
    # Get Federal Poverty Level for household size
    fpl = school_meal_fpl
    # Calculate income ratio to FPL
    if fpl > 0:
      income_ratio = household_gross_income / fpl
    else:
      income_ratio = 0
    # Free meal eligibility: at or below 130% FPL
    return income_ratio <= free_meal_limit_pct_fpl
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Family of 1, income 100% FPL"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 15_060}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 1, income 130% FPL (at threshold)"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 19_578}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 1, income 140% FPL (above threshold)"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 21_084}
      expect: false
    - name: "Family of 4, income 100% FPL"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 31_200}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4, income 130% FPL (at threshold)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 40_560}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4, income 185% FPL (above free, should be reduced)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 57_720}
      expect: false


# ---- Merged from reduced_eligibility.rac ----

# 42 USC 1758(b)(1)(A)(ii) - Reduced-Price School Meal Eligibility
#

text: """
(ii) a child shall be served a reduced price lunch or breakfast,
as the case may be, if the household income is above 130 percent
but at or below 185 percent of the applicable family size income
level contained in the nonfarm income poverty guidelines
"""
variable reduced_meal_income_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Reduced-Price Meal Income Eligible"
  description: "Household income above 130% but at or below 185% FPL qualifies for reduced-price meals"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Get household's gross annual income
    # Get Federal Poverty Level for household size
    fpl = school_meal_fpl
    # Calculate income ratio to FPL
    if fpl > 0:
      income_ratio = household_gross_income / fpl
    else:
      income_ratio = 0
    # Reduced-price eligibility: above 130% but at or below 185% FPL
    above_free_threshold = income_ratio > free_meal_limit_pct_fpl
    at_or_below_reduced_threshold = income_ratio <= reduced_price_limit_pct_fpl
    return above_free_threshold and at_or_below_reduced_threshold
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Family of 1, income 130% FPL (at free boundary, not reduced)"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 19_578}
      expect: false
    - name: "Family of 1, income 140% FPL (in reduced range)"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 21_084}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 1, income 185% FPL (at reduced boundary)"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 27_861}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 1, income 200% FPL (above reduced)"
      inputs: {household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 30_120}
      expect: false
    - name: "Family of 4, income 130% FPL (at free boundary)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 40_560}
      expect: false
    - name: "Family of 4, income 160% FPL (in reduced range)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 49_920}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4, income 185% FPL (at reduced boundary)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 57_720}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4, income 200% FPL (above reduced)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 62_400}
      expect: false

variable school_meal_subsidized_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Eligible for Any Subsidized Meals"
  description: "Household eligible for free OR reduced-price meals"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Eligible for subsidies if they qualify for free or reduced meals
    free_eligible = free_meal_income_eligible
    reduced_eligible = reduced_meal_income_eligible
    return free_eligible or reduced_eligible
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Family of 4 at 100% FPL (free eligible)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 31_200}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4 at 160% FPL (reduced eligible)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 49_920}
      expect: true
    - name: "Family of 4 at 200% FPL (not eligible)"
      inputs: {household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 62_400}
      expect: false


# ---- Merged from subsidy.rac ----

# 42 USC 1751 et seq. - School Meal Subsidy Calculation
#
variable school_meal_subsidy_annual:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Annual School Meal Subsidy Value"
  description: "Annual value of school meal subsidy based on free/reduced tier"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Determine meal tier based on eligibility
    categorical = school_meal_categorically_eligible
    cep = school_meal_cep_eligible
    income_free = free_meal_income_eligible
    income_reduced = reduced_meal_income_eligible

    # Assign tier based on eligibility priority
    if categorical or cep or income_free:
      return school_meal_subsidy_free
    elif income_reduced:
      return school_meal_subsidy_reduced
    else:
      return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "SNAP household gets free meal subsidy"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: true, household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 30_000}
      expect: 1680
    - name: "Income-eligible family gets free meal subsidy"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 31_200}
      expect: 1680
    - name: "Reduced-price eligible family"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 49_920}
      expect: 1050
    - name: "Above reduced-price threshold gets no subsidy"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 62_400}
      expect: 0


# ---- Merged from tier.rac ----

# 42 USC 1758(b)(1) - School Meal Tier Determination
#
variable school_meal_tier_determination:
  entity: Person
  period: Year
  dtype: Enum[school_meal_tier]
  label: "School Meal Tier"
  description: "Determines whether child receives free, reduced-price, or full-price meals"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Check categorical and CEP eligibility (provides free meals)
    categorical = school_meal_categorically_eligible
    cep_school = school_meal_cep_eligible
    income_free = free_meal_income_eligible
    income_reduced = reduced_meal_income_eligible
    # Tier determination with precedence
    # 1. Categorical/CEP -> FREE
    if categorical or cep_school:
      return FREE
    # 2. Income <= 130% FPL -> FREE
    if income_free:
      return FREE
    # 3. 130% < Income <= 185% FPL -> REDUCED
    if income_reduced:
      return REDUCED
    # 4. Income > 185% FPL -> PAID
    return PAID
  default: PAID
  tests:
    - name: "SNAP household determined as FREE"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: true, household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 30_000, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: FREE
    - name: "CEP school student determined as FREE"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 30_000, attends_cep_school: true}
      expect: FREE
    - name: "Family at 100% FPL determined as FREE"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 31_200, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: FREE
    - name: "Family at 130% FPL (boundary) determined as FREE"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 40_560, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: FREE
    - name: "Family at 160% FPL determined as REDUCED"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 49_920, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: REDUCED
    - name: "Family at 185% FPL (boundary) determined as REDUCED"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 57_720, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: REDUCED
    - name: "Family at 200% FPL determined as PAID"
      inputs: {household_receives_snap: false, household_size: 4, household_gross_income: 62_400, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: PAID
    - name: "Foster child determined as FREE"
      inputs: {is_foster_child: true, household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 30_000, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: FREE
    - name: "Homeless youth determined as FREE"
      inputs: {is_homeless: true, household_size: 1, household_gross_income: 30_000, attends_cep_school: false}
      expect: FREE

documents.title: WIC Residency Eligibility
documents.text:
Persons eligible. - Subject to the availability of funds appropriated for
the fiscal year involved and subject to income eligibility standards
established by State agencies under paragraph (2)(A) for local agencies
or clinics to use in determining eligibility...
(1) participate in the program only pregnant women, breastfeeding women,
postpartum women, infants, and children who--
(A) are income eligible under clause (i) or (ii) of paragraph (2)(A); and
(B) are determined to be at nutritional risk by a competent professional
authority...
(3) A State agency may not deny services under this section to an otherwise
eligible applicant solely on the basis of the applicant's failure to meet
a residency requirement...
documents.code:
text: """
Persons eligible. - Subject to the availability of funds appropriated for
the fiscal year involved and subject to income eligibility standards
established by State agencies under paragraph (2)(A) for local agencies
or clinics to use in determining eligibility...
(1) participate in the program only pregnant women, breastfeeding women,
postpartum women, infants, and children who--
(A) are income eligible under clause (i) or (ii) of paragraph (2)(A); and
(B) are determined to be at nutritional risk by a competent professional
authority...
(3) A State agency may not deny services under this section to an otherwise
eligible applicant solely on the basis of the applicant's failure to meet
a residency requirement...
"""
variable eligibility:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  label: "WIC Residency Eligibility"
  description: "Whether applicant meets WIC residency requirement per 42 USC 1_786(d)(3) - no durational residency requirements permitted"
  formula: |
    # 42 USC 1786(d)(3) prohibits durational residency requirements
    # Person must only be physically present in the state where applying
    # This is typically captured by is_us_resident at federal level
    if is_us_resident:
        return True
    return False
  tests:
    - name: "US resident meets residency requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_resident: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Non-US resident does not meet residency requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_resident: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Recent immigrant physically present meets requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_resident: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Temporary visitor not meeting residency"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_resident: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Migrant worker physically present in state"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_us_resident: true
      expect: true

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 1786(d)(1)
documents.code:
text: """
(1) participate in the program only pregnant women, breastfeeding women,
postpartum women, infants, and children who--
(A) are income eligible under clause (i) or (ii) of paragraph (2)(A); and
(B) are determined to be at nutritional risk...
(3) "breastfeeding women" - up to 1 year postpartum if breastfeeding
(4) "child" - persons 1 through 4 years of age (up to 5th birthday)
(6) "infant" - persons under 1 year of age
(14) "postpartum women" - up to 6 months after pregnancy terminates
"""
variable categorical:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 42 USC 1786(b)(3): Breastfeeding women - up to 1 year postpartum
    # Takes priority over postpartum since it has longer eligibility period
    if is_breastfeeding and months_postpartum < postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding:
        return "breastfeeding_woman"
    # 42 USC 1786(d)(1): Pregnant women
    if is_pregnant:
        return "pregnant_woman"
    # 42 USC 1786(b)(14): Postpartum women - up to 6 months after pregnancy ends
    if is_postpartum and months_postpartum < postpartum_max_months_non_breastfeeding:
        return "postpartum_woman"
    # 42 USC 1786(b)(6): Infants - under 1 year of age
    if age < infant_max_years:
        return "infant"
    # 42 USC 1786(b)(4): Children - 1 through 4 years (up to 5th birthday)
    if age >= infant_max_years and age < child_max_years:
        return "child"
    # No WIC category applies
    return "none"
  tests:
    - name: "Breastfeeding woman within eligibility period"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_breastfeeding: true
        months_postpartum: 6
        postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding: 12
        is_pregnant: false
        is_postpartum: false
        age: 25
        infant_max_years: 1
        child_max_years: 5
      expect: "breastfeeding_woman"

    - name: "Pregnant woman receives pregnant category"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_breastfeeding: false
        months_postpartum: 0
        postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding: 12
        is_pregnant: true
        is_postpartum: false
        age: 30
        infant_max_years: 1
        child_max_years: 5
      expect: "pregnant_woman"

    - name: "Postpartum non-breastfeeding woman within 6 months"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_breastfeeding: false
        months_postpartum: 3
        postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding: 12
        postpartum_max_months_non_breastfeeding: 6
        is_pregnant: false
        is_postpartum: true
        age: 28
        infant_max_years: 1
        child_max_years: 5
      expect: "postpartum_woman"

    - name: "Infant under 1 year old"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_breastfeeding: false
        months_postpartum: 0
        postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding: 12
        is_pregnant: false
        is_postpartum: false
        age: 0
        infant_max_years: 1
        child_max_years: 5
      expect: "infant"

    - name: "Child between 1 and 5 years old"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_breastfeeding: false
        months_postpartum: 0
        postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding: 12
        is_pregnant: false
        is_postpartum: false
        age: 3
        infant_max_years: 1
        child_max_years: 5
      expect: "child"

    - name: "Adult over 5 years with no qualifying status"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_breastfeeding: false
        months_postpartum: 0
        postpartum_max_months_breastfeeding: 12
        is_pregnant: false
        is_postpartum: false
        age: 10
        infant_max_years: 1
        child_max_years: 5
      expect: "none"

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 1786(d)(2)
documents.text:
(2)(A) State agencies shall establish income eligibility standards to be
used in conjunction with the nutrition risk criteria in determining
eligibility of individuals for participation in the program.
(B) Income eligibility standards established by a State agency under
subparagraph (A)... shall be set at or below 185 percent of the poverty
income guidelines prescribed by the Office of Management and Budget...
(C) A member of a family shall be considered income eligible if the
family member... participates in... [SNAP, Medicaid, or TANF]
documents.code:
text: """
(2)(A) State agencies shall establish income eligibility standards to be
used in conjunction with the nutrition risk criteria in determining
eligibility of individuals for participation in the program.
(B) Income eligibility standards established by a State agency under
subparagraph (A)... shall be set at or below 185 percent of the poverty
income guidelines prescribed by the Office of Management and Budget...
(C) A member of a family shall be considered income eligible if the
family member... participates in... [SNAP, Medicaid, or TANF]
"""
variable income:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # FPL based on household size
    if household_size <= max_table_size:
        return fpl_monthly.by_household_size[household_size]
    # For sizes > max_table_size, add per-person amount
    base = fpl_monthly.by_household_size[max_table_size]
    additional = fpl_monthly.additional_per_person
    extra_members = household_size - max_table_size
    return base + (additional * extra_members)
  tests:
    - name: single_person_household_fpl
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        max_table_size: 8
        fpl_monthly.by_household_size: {1: 1_255, 2: 1_703, 3: 2_150, 4: 2_598, 5: 3_045, 6: 3_493, 7: 3_940, 8: 4_388}
        fpl_monthly.additional_per_person: 448
      expect: 1_255

    - name: family_of_four_fpl
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        max_table_size: 8
        fpl_monthly.by_household_size: {1: 1_255, 2: 1_703, 3: 2_150, 4: 2_598, 5: 3_045, 6: 3_493, 7: 3_940, 8: 4_388}
        fpl_monthly.additional_per_person: 448
      expect: 2_598

    - name: max_table_size_household_fpl
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 8
        max_table_size: 8
        fpl_monthly.by_household_size: {1: 1_255, 2: 1_703, 3: 2_150, 4: 2_598, 5: 3_045, 6: 3_493, 7: 3_940, 8: 4_388}
        fpl_monthly.additional_per_person: 448
      expect: 4_388

    - name: household_exceeds_max_table_size_by_one
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 9
        max_table_size: 8
        fpl_monthly.by_household_size: {1: 1_255, 2: 1_703, 3: 2_150, 4: 2_598, 5: 3_045, 6: 3_493, 7: 3_940, 8: 4_388}
        fpl_monthly.additional_per_person: 448
      expect: 4_836

    - name: large_household_exceeds_max_table_size
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 12
        max_table_size: 8
        fpl_monthly.by_household_size: {1: 1_255, 2: 1_703, 3: 2_150, 4: 2_598, 5: 3_045, 6: 3_493, 7: 3_940, 8: 4_388}
        fpl_monthly.additional_per_person: 448
      expect: 6_180

    - name: two_person_household_fpl
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        max_table_size: 8
        fpl_monthly.by_household_size: {1: 1_255, 2: 1_703, 3: 2_150, 4: 2_598, 5: 3_045, 6: 3_493, 7: 3_940, 8: 4_388}
        fpl_monthly.additional_per_person: 448
      expect: 1_703

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 1786(d)(3)
documents.code:
text: """
(C) A member of a family shall be considered income eligible if the
family member or a parent or caretaker of the participant participates
in the--
(i) supplemental nutrition assistance program established under the
Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.);
(ii) a State program funded under the program of block grants to
States for temporary assistance for needy families established
under part A of title IV of the Social Security Act; or
(iii) the program of medical assistance under title XIX of the
Social Security Act.
This is known as "adjunctive eligibility" - participation in SNAP,
"""
variable adjunctive:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Person or household receives SNAP benefits
    if receives_snap:
        return True
    if household.receives_snap:
        return True
    return False
  tests:
    - name: snap_recipient_eligible
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_snap: true
      expect: true

    - name: household_snap_eligible
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_snap: false
        household.receives_snap: true
      expect: true

    - name: no_snap_not_eligible
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_snap: false
        household.receives_snap: false
      expect: false

    - name: both_person_and_household_snap
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_snap: true
        household.receives_snap: true
      expect: true

    - name: person_snap_household_no_snap
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_snap: true
        household.receives_snap: false
      expect: true

    - name: neither_person_nor_household_snap
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_snap: false
        household.receives_snap: false
      expect: false

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 1786(f)
documents.text:
The Secretary shall prescribe by regulation... the supplemental foods to
be made available in the program under this section.
documents.code:
text: """
The Secretary shall prescribe by regulation... the supplemental foods to
be made available in the program under this section.
"""
variable food_package:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be WIC eligible to receive a food package
    if not is_wic_eligible:
        return "none"
    category = wic_category
    # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(1): Food Package III - Children ages 1-4
    if category == "child":
        return "III"
    # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(4): Food Package IV - Pregnant women
    if category == "pregnant_woman":
        return "IV"
    # Breastfeeding and postpartum women have multiple package options
    # based on breastfeeding intensity and duration
    # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(7): Food Package VII - Fully breastfeeding women
    if category == "breastfeeding_woman" and is_fully_breastfeeding:
        return "VII"
    elif category == "breastfeeding_woman":
        # Partially breastfeeding - Food Package IV
        return "IV"
    elif category == "postpartum_woman" and is_breastfeeding and is_fully_breastfeeding:
        # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(6): Food Package VI - Fully breastfeeding postpartum
        return "VI"
    elif category == "postpartum_woman" and is_breastfeeding:
        # Partially breastfeeding postpartum
        return "IV"
    elif category == "postpartum_woman":
        # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(5): Food Package V - Non-breastfeeding postpartum
        return "V"
    elif category == "infant" and is_fully_breastfed:
        # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(1): Package I - Fully breastfed infants
        return "I"
    elif category == "infant":
        # 7 CFR 246.10(c)(2): Package II - Formula-fed or partially breastfed
        return "II"
    else:
        return "none"
  default: "none"
  tests:
    - name: "Not WIC eligible returns no package"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: false}
      expect: "none"
    - name: "Child eligible receives Package III"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "child"}
      expect: "III"
    - name: "Pregnant woman eligible receives Package IV"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "pregnant_woman"}
      expect: "IV"
    - name: "Fully breastfeeding woman receives Package VII"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "breastfeeding_woman", is_fully_breastfeeding: true}
      expect: "VII"
    - name: "Partially breastfeeding woman receives Package IV"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "breastfeeding_woman", is_fully_breastfeeding: false}
      expect: "IV"
    - name: "Fully breastfeeding postpartum woman receives Package VI"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "postpartum_woman", is_breastfeeding: true, is_fully_breastfeeding: true}
      expect: "VI"
    - name: "Partially breastfeeding postpartum woman receives Package IV"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "postpartum_woman", is_breastfeeding: true, is_fully_breastfeeding: false}
      expect: "IV"
    - name: "Non-breastfeeding postpartum woman receives Package V"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "postpartum_woman", is_breastfeeding: false}
      expect: "V"
    - name: "Fully breastfed infant receives Package I"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "infant", is_fully_breastfed: true}
      expect: "I"
    - name: "Formula-fed infant receives Package II"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "infant", is_fully_breastfed: false}
      expect: "II"
    - name: "Invalid category returns no package"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "invalid"}
      expect: "none"


parameter priority_by_category:
  values:
    # TODO: add values

parameter priority_ranges:
  values:
    # TODO: add values

variable priority:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Priority assignment based on category
    # Using parameters lookup for priority values
    category = wic_category
    if category == "pregnant_woman":
        return priority_by_category.pregnant_woman
    if category == "breastfeeding_woman":
        return priority_by_category.breastfeeding_woman
    if category == "infant":
        return priority_by_category.infant
    if category == "child":
        return priority_by_category.child
    if category == "postpartum_woman":
        return priority_by_category.postpartum_woman
    return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Pregnant woman receives priority"
      inputs: {wic_category: "pregnant_woman"}
      expect: 1
    - name: "Unknown category returns 0"
      inputs: {wic_category: "unknown"}
      expect: 0

variable wic_priority_level:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if not is_wic_eligible:
        return 0
    category = wic_category
    # Priority assignment based on category
    # Using parameters lookup for priority values
    if category == "pregnant_woman":
        return priority_by_category.pregnant_woman
    if category == "breastfeeding_woman":
        return priority_by_category.breastfeeding_woman
    if category == "infant":
        return priority_by_category.infant
    if category == "child":
        return priority_by_category.child
    if category == "postpartum_woman":
        return priority_by_category.postpartum_woman
    return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Not WIC eligible has zero priority"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: false}
      expect: 0
    - name: "Pregnant woman receives priority by category parameter"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "pregnant_woman"}
      expect: 1
    - name: "Breastfeeding woman receives priority by category parameter"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "breastfeeding_woman"}
      expect: 2
    - name: "Infant receives priority by category parameter"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "infant"}
      expect: 3
    - name: "Child receives priority by category parameter"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "child"}
      expect: 4
    - name: "Postpartum woman receives priority by category parameter"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "postpartum_woman"}
      expect: 5
    - name: "Unknown category has zero priority"
      inputs: {is_wic_eligible: true, wic_category: "unknown"}
      expect: 0

variable wic_priority_description:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: String
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    priority = wic_priority_level
    if priority == 1:
        return "Priority I - High-risk pregnant/breastfeeding women and infants"
    if priority == priority_ranges.standard_min - 1:
        return "Priority II - Infants of WIC/Medicaid mothers"
    if priority == priority_ranges.high_max:
        return "Priority III - High-risk children"
    if priority == priority_ranges.standard_min:
        return "Priority IV - Pregnant/breastfeeding women and infants"
    if priority == priority_ranges.standard_max:
        return "Priority V - Children at dietary risk"
    if priority == priority_ranges.lower_min:
        return "Priority VI - Postpartum non-breastfeeding women"
    if priority == priority_ranges.lower_max:
        return "Priority VII - Homeless/migrant certification"
    return "Not eligible for WIC"
  tests:
    - name: "Priority level 1 returns Priority I description"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 1}
      expect: "Priority I - High-risk pregnant/breastfeeding women and infants"
    - name: "Priority level at standard_min returns Priority IV description"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 3}
      expect: "Priority IV - Pregnant/breastfeeding women and infants"
    - name: "Priority level at standard_max returns Priority V description"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 4}
      expect: "Priority V - Children at dietary risk"
    - name: "Priority level 0 returns not eligible message"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 0}
      expect: "Not eligible for WIC"
    - name: "Unknown priority level returns not eligible message"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 99}
      expect: "Not eligible for WIC"

variable is_wic_high_priority:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    priority = wic_priority_level
    return priority >= 1 and priority <= priority_ranges.high_max
  tests:
    - name: "Priority 1 is high priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 1}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 2 is high priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 2}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 3 is high priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 3}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 0 is not high priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 0}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 4 may be outside high priority range"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 4}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 5 is not high priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 5}
      expect: false

variable is_wic_standard_priority:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    priority = wic_priority_level
    return priority >= priority_ranges.standard_min and priority <= priority_ranges.standard_max
  tests:
    - name: "Priority 3 is standard priority (at standard_min)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 3}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 4 is standard priority (at standard_max)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 4}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 2 is not standard priority (below standard_min)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 2}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 5 is not standard priority (above standard_max)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 5}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 0 is not standard priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 0}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 1 is not standard priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 1}
      expect: false

variable is_wic_lower_priority:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    priority = wic_priority_level
    return priority >= priority_ranges.lower_min and priority <= priority_ranges.lower_max
  tests:
    - name: "Priority 5 is lower priority (at lower_min)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 5}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 6 is lower priority (at lower_max)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 6}
      expect: true
    - name: "Priority 4 is not lower priority (below lower_min)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 4}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 7 is not lower priority (above lower_max)"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 7}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 0 is not lower priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 0}
      expect: false
    - name: "Priority 3 is not lower priority"
      inputs: {wic_priority_level: 3}
      expect: false

A State to which a grant is made under section 603 of this title

documents.code:
text: """
(a) Participation rate requirements
(1) All families
A State to which a grant is made under section 603 of this title
for a fiscal year shall achieve the minimum participation rate...
"""

# Inputs for TANF work requirements
input is_tanf_single_parent:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Single Parent TANF Recipient"
  description: "Whether person is single parent head of TANF unit"
  default: false

input is_tanf_two_parent_family:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Two-Parent TANF Family"
  description: "Whether family is two-parent TANF unit"
  default: false

input receives_federal_childcare_assistance:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Federal Childcare"
  description: "Whether receiving federal childcare assistance"
  default: false

input has_child_under_1:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Child Under 1"
  description: "Whether person has child under age 1"
  default: false

input is_single_parent:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Single Parent"
  description: "Whether person is a single parent"
  default: false

input is_disabled_unable_to_work:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Disabled Unable to Work"
  description: "Whether person is disabled and unable to work"
  default: false

input is_caring_for_disabled_family_member:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Caring for Disabled Family Member"
  description: "Whether person is caring for a disabled family member"
  default: false

input is_pregnant:
  entity: Person

input pregnancy_trimester:

input has_high_school_diploma:
