# Parameters for work requirements
parameter young_child_age_threshold:
  description: "Age threshold for young child exemption"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 6
  label: "Young Child Age Threshold"

parameter hours_single_parent_young_child:
  description: "Weekly work hours for single parent with young child"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 20
  label: "Single Parent Young Child Work Hours"

parameter hours_single_parent:
  description: "Weekly work hours for single parent"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 30
  label: "Single Parent Work Hours"

parameter hours_two_parent:
  description: "Weekly work hours for two-parent families"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 35
  label: "Two-Parent Work Hours"

parameter hours_two_parent_with_childcare:
  description: "Weekly work hours for two-parent families with federal childcare"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 55
  label: "Two-Parent Work Hours (With Childcare)"

parameter weeks_per_month:
  description: "Average weeks per month for hour conversion"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 4.33
  label: "Weeks Per Month"

parameter teen_parent_max_age:
  description: "Maximum age for teen parent requirements"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 20
  label: "Teen Parent Maximum Age"

variable tanf_required_work_hours_weekly:
  entity: Person
  period: Week
  dtype: Integer
  unit: hours
  label: "TANF Required Weekly Work Hours"
  description: "Weekly work hours required for TANF participation based on family composition"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Not all TANF recipients have work requirements
    if tanf_work_requirement_exempt:
        return 0
    # 607(c)(1)(A): Single parent or caretaker with child under 6
    # Note: has_child_under_age is approximated with has_child_under_1
    if is_tanf_single_parent and has_child_under_1:
        return hours_single_parent_young_child
    # 607(c)(1)(B): General single parent requirement
    if is_tanf_single_parent:
        return hours_single_parent
    # 607(c)(2): Two-parent families
    if is_tanf_two_parent_family:
        # 607(c)(2)(B): Higher requirement if receiving federal child care
        if receives_federal_childcare_assistance:
            return hours_two_parent_with_childcare
        else:
            return hours_two_parent
    return 0
  default: 0

variable tanf_required_work_hours_monthly:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  unit: hours
  label: "TANF Required Monthly Work Hours"
  description: "Monthly work hours required (weekly hours * weeks_per_month)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Approximate monthly hours from weekly (52 weeks / 12 months)
    return round(tanf_required_work_hours_weekly * weeks_per_month)  # weeks_per_month ~= 4.33
  default: 0

variable tanf_hours_in_core_activities:
  entity: Person
  period: Week
  dtype: Integer
  unit: hours
  label: "TANF Core Work Activity Hours"
  description: "Hours in core work activities (unsubsidized employment, on-the-job training, etc.)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Core activities per 607(d):
    # (1) Unsubsidized employment
    # (2) Subsidized private sector employment
    # (3) Subsidized public sector employment
    # (4) Work experience
    # (5) On-the-job training
    # (6) Job search and job readiness (limited)
    # (7) Community service programs
    # (8) Vocational educational training (12-month limit)
    total = work_hours_unsubsidized + work_hours_subsidized_private
    total = total + work_hours_subsidized_public + work_hours_work_experience
    total = total + work_hours_on_the_job_training + work_hours_job_search_limited
    total = total + work_hours_community_service + work_hours_vocational
    return total
  default: 0

variable tanf_work_requirement_met:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Work Requirement Met"
  description: "Whether individual meets TANF work participation requirement"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Exempt individuals automatically meet requirement
    if tanf_work_requirement_exempt:
        return True
    required_hours = tanf_required_work_hours_monthly
    actual_hours = work_hours_monthly
    return actual_hours >= required_hours
  default: true

variable tanf_work_requirement_exempt:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Work Requirement Exempt"
  description: "Whether individual is exempt from TANF work requirements"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 607(c)(2)(B): Caring for child under 6 with unavailable child care
    # (This is an exemption from full hours, not from work entirely in most states)
    # States define most exemptions; common federal-recognized exemptions:
    # - Disabled (unable to work)
    # - Caring for disabled family member
    # - Pregnant (third trimester)
    # - Single parent with infant (varies by state, up to 12 months)
    # 607(b)(5): Single parent caring for child under 1
    # State may disregard from participation rate for up to 12 months lifetime
    if has_child_under_1 and is_single_parent:
        return tanf_infant_care_exemption_available
    if is_disabled_unable_to_work:
        return True
    if is_caring_for_disabled_family_member:
        return True
    if is_pregnant and pregnancy_trimester == 3:
        return True
    return False
  default: false

variable tanf_teen_parent_education_required:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Teen Parent Education Required"
  description: "Whether teen parent must attend school or education program"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Minor parent without diploma/GED must attend school
    if age < teen_parent_max_age and has_minor_child and not has_high_school_diploma:
        return True
    return False
  default: false

variable tanf_teen_parent_education_met:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Teen Parent Education Requirement Met"
  description: "Whether teen parent meets education/training requirement"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if not tanf_teen_parent_education_required:
        return True
    # Must be enrolled in school, GED, or alternative education
    if is_enrolled_in_school:
        return True
    if is_enrolled_in_ged_program:
        return True
    if is_enrolled_in_alternative_education:
        return True
    return False
  default: true

variable tanf_unit_work_requirement_met:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Unit Work Requirement Met"
  description: "Whether all non-exempt adults in TANF unit meet work requirements"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # All non-exempt adults must meet requirements
    # At least one adult must meet if two-parent family
    for adult in tanf_unit_adults:
        if not (tanf_work_requirement_met or tanf_work_requirement_exempt):
            return False
    return True
  default: true
  tests:
    # tanf_required_work_hours_weekly tests
    - name: "Single parent with young child requires reduced hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: false
      expect: 20
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_weekly

    - name: "Single parent without young child requires standard hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: false
      expect: 30
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_weekly

    - name: "Two-parent family requires 35 hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: false
        is_tanf_two_parent_family: true
        has_child_under_1: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: false
      expect: 35
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_weekly

    - name: "Two-parent family with childcare requires 55 hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: false
        is_tanf_two_parent_family: true
        has_child_under_1: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: true
      expect: 55
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_weekly

    - name: "Exempt individual requires zero hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
      expect: 0
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_weekly

    # tanf_required_work_hours_monthly tests
    - name: "Single parent monthly hours conversion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: false
      expect: 130
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_monthly

    - name: "Two-parent family with childcare monthly hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: false
        is_tanf_two_parent_family: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: true
      expect: 238
      variable: tanf_required_work_hours_monthly

    # tanf_hours_in_core_activities tests
    - name: "Only unsubsidized employment counted"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        work_hours_unsubsidized: 20
        work_hours_subsidized_private: 0
        work_hours_subsidized_public: 0
        work_hours_work_experience: 0
        work_hours_on_the_job_training: 0
        work_hours_job_search_limited: 0
        work_hours_community_service: 0
        work_hours_vocational: 0
      expect: 20
      variable: tanf_hours_in_core_activities

    - name: "Multiple core activities combined"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        work_hours_unsubsidized: 15
        work_hours_subsidized_private: 10
        work_hours_subsidized_public: 5
        work_hours_work_experience: 3
        work_hours_on_the_job_training: 2
        work_hours_job_search_limited: 4
        work_hours_community_service: 1
        work_hours_vocational: 0
      expect: 40
      variable: tanf_hours_in_core_activities

    - name: "All core activities at capacity"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        work_hours_unsubsidized: 10
        work_hours_subsidized_private: 8
        work_hours_subsidized_public: 7
        work_hours_work_experience: 5
        work_hours_on_the_job_training: 5
        work_hours_job_search_limited: 3
        work_hours_community_service: 2
        work_hours_vocational: 0
      expect: 40
      variable: tanf_hours_in_core_activities

    # tanf_work_requirement_met tests
    - name: "Person meets work requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: false
        work_hours_monthly: 130
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_met

    - name: "Person fails to meet work requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        receives_federal_childcare_assistance: false
        work_hours_monthly: 100
      expect: false
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_met

    - name: "Exempt person automatically meets requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_single_parent: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
        work_hours_monthly: 0
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_met

    # tanf_work_requirement_exempt tests
    - name: "Single parent with infant exemption available"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: true
        tanf_infant_care_exemption_available: true
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_exempt

    - name: "Single parent with infant but exemption used"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_single_parent: true
        has_child_under_1: true
        tanf_infant_care_exemption_available: false
      expect: false
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_exempt

    - name: "Disabled person exempted"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_disabled_unable_to_work: true
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_exempt

    - name: "Caring for disabled family member exempted"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_caring_for_disabled_family_member: true
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_exempt

    - name: "Pregnant in third trimester exempted"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_pregnant: true
        pregnancy_trimester: 3
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_exempt

    - name: "Pregnant in second trimester not exempted"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_pregnant: true
        pregnancy_trimester: 2
      expect: false
      variable: tanf_work_requirement_exempt

    # tanf_teen_parent_education_required tests
    - name: "Teen parent without diploma must attend education"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 18
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: false
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_required

    - name: "Teen parent with diploma no education required"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 18
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: true
      expect: false
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_required

    - name: "Adult without diploma no education requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 25
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: false
      expect: false
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_required

    # tanf_teen_parent_education_met tests
    - name: "Teen parent meets education via school enrollment"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 19
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: false
        is_enrolled_in_school: true
        is_enrolled_in_ged_program: false
        is_enrolled_in_alternative_education: false
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_met

    - name: "Teen parent meets education via GED program"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 20
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: false
        is_enrolled_in_school: false
        is_enrolled_in_ged_program: true
        is_enrolled_in_alternative_education: false
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_met

    - name: "Teen parent fails education requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 18
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: false
        is_enrolled_in_school: false
        is_enrolled_in_ged_program: false
        is_enrolled_in_alternative_education: false
      expect: false
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_met

    - name: "Non-teen parent always meets education requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 30
        has_minor_child: true
        has_high_school_diploma: false
        is_enrolled_in_school: false
      expect: true
      variable: tanf_teen_parent_education_met

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 607(a)
documents.text:
(a) Participation rate requirements
(1) All families
A State to which a grant is made under section 603 of this title
for a fiscal year shall achieve the minimum participation rate
specified in the following table for the fiscal year with respect
to all families receiving assistance under the State program...
documents.code:
text: """
(a) Participation rate requirements
(1) All families
A State to which a grant is made under section 603 of this title
for a fiscal year shall achieve the minimum participation rate
specified in the following table for the fiscal year with respect
to all families receiving assistance under the State program...
"""
variable work_requirements:
  entity: Family
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # 607(c)(1)(A): Single parent or head of household with child under threshold age
    has_young_child = any(children, child.age < child_under_age_threshold)
    if tanf_head_of_household and has_young_child:
        return work_activities_hours_reduced  # 20 hours/week
    # 607(c)(1)(B): General requirement - single parent families
    if tanf_head_of_household:
        return work_activities_hours_single_parent  # 30 hours/week
    # 607(c)(2): Two-parent families
    if tanf_two_parent_family:
        return work_activities_hours_two_parent  # 35 hours/week (55 if child care)
    return 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single parent with young child - reduced hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_head_of_household: true
        tanf_two_parent_family: false
        children:
          - age: 4
        child_under_age_threshold: 6
        work_activities_hours_reduced: 20
        work_activities_hours_single_parent: 30
        work_activities_hours_two_parent: 35
      expect: 20

    - name: "Single parent with older child - full hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_head_of_household: true
        tanf_two_parent_family: false
        children:
          - age: 10
        child_under_age_threshold: 6
        work_activities_hours_reduced: 20
        work_activities_hours_single_parent: 30
        work_activities_hours_two_parent: 35
      expect: 30

    - name: "Two-parent family - higher hours requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_head_of_household: false
        tanf_two_parent_family: true
        children:
          - age: 8
        child_under_age_threshold: 6
        work_activities_hours_reduced: 20
        work_activities_hours_single_parent: 30
        work_activities_hours_two_parent: 35
      expect: 35

    - name: "Non-TANF family - no work requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_head_of_household: false
        tanf_two_parent_family: false
        children:
          - age: 5
        child_under_age_threshold: 6
        work_activities_hours_reduced: 20
        work_activities_hours_single_parent: 30
        work_activities_hours_two_parent: 35
      expect: 0

    - name: "Single parent with child at threshold age - full hours"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_head_of_household: true
        tanf_two_parent_family: false
        children:
          - age: 6
        child_under_age_threshold: 6
        work_activities_hours_reduced: 20
        work_activities_hours_single_parent: 30
        work_activities_hours_two_parent: 35
      expect: 30

    - name: "Single parent with multiple children including young child"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_head_of_household: true
        tanf_two_parent_family: false
        children:
          - age: 2
          - age: 12
        child_under_age_threshold: 6
        work_activities_hours_reduced: 20
        work_activities_hours_single_parent: 30
        work_activities_hours_two_parent: 35
      expect: 20

documents.title: TANF Months Received
documents.text:
(b) Participation rate requirements
(5) Single parent with child under 1
(A) In general
A State may disregard from the determination of participation rates
under this section a single parent of a child under 1 year of age.

(7) No assistance for more than 5 years
(A) In general
A State to which a grant is made under section 603 shall not use
any part of the grant to provide assistance to a family that
includes an adult who has received assistance under any State
program funded under this part attributable to funds provided by
the Federal Government... for 60 months (whether or not consecutive)
after the date the State program... becomes effective

(B) Exception
Subparagraph (A) shall not apply with respect to a family if the
State determines that hardship circumstances exist...

(C) Hardship exception limitation
The average number of families with respect to which an exception
applies under subparagraph (B) for any fiscal year shall not
exceed 20 percent of the average monthly number of families to
which assistance is provided...
documents.code:
text: """
(b) Participation rate requirements
(5) Single parent with child under 1
(A) In general
A State may disregard from the determination of participation rates
under this section a single parent of a child under 1 year of age.

(7) No assistance for more than 5 years
(A) In general
A State to which a grant is made under section 603 shall not use
any part of the grant to provide assistance to a family that
includes an adult who has received assistance under any State
program funded under this part attributable to funds provided by
the Federal Government... for 60 months (whether or not consecutive)
after the date the State program... becomes effective

(B) Exception
Subparagraph (A) shall not apply with respect to a family if the
State determines that hardship circumstances exist...

(C) Hardship exception limitation
The average number of families with respect to which an exception
applies under subparagraph (B) for any fiscal year shall not
exceed 20 percent of the average monthly number of families to
which assistance is provided...
"""

# Inputs for time limits
input tanf_months_received:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "TANF Months Received"
  description: "Total months of federally-funded TANF assistance received"
  default: 0

input tanf_hardship_exception:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Hardship Exception"
  description: "Whether person qualifies for hardship exception per 607(b)(7)(B)"
  default: false

input is_minor:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Minor"
  description: "Whether person is under age 18"
  default: false

input is_adult_tanf_recipient:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Adult TANF Recipient"
  description: "Whether person is an adult receiving TANF assistance"
  default: false

# Parameters for time limits
parameter federal_time_limit_months:
  description: "Federal lifetime limit on TANF assistance for adults"
  unit: months
  values:
    1996-08-22: 60
  label: "Federal Time Limit"

parameter hardship_exemption_cap:
  description: "Maximum percentage of caseload that can receive hardship exemption"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1996-08-22: 0.20
  label: "Hardship Exemption Cap"

variable tanf_time_limit_reached:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Time Limit Reached"
  description: "Whether adult has reached the 60-month federal time limit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only adults are subject to time limits
    if not is_adult_tanf_recipient:
        return False
    # Check if months received meets or exceeds limit
    return tanf_months_received >= federal_time_limit_months
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Adult at exactly 60 months reaches limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 60
      expect: true

    - name: "Adult below 60 months has not reached limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 59
      expect: false

    - name: "Adult exceeding 60 months reached limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 72
      expect: true

    - name: "Minor never reaches time limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: false
        is_minor: true
        tanf_months_received: 100
      expect: false

    - name: "Adult at zero months has not reached limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 0
      expect: false

variable tanf_time_limit_eligible:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Time Limit Eligible"
  description: "Whether person can continue receiving federally-funded TANF"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Minors are always eligible (time limits apply to adults only)
    if is_minor:
        return True
    # Check if time limit reached
    if not tanf_time_limit_reached:
        return True
    # Hardship exception per 607(b)(7)(B)
    if tanf_hardship_exception:
        return True
    return False
  default: true
  tests:
    - name: "Adult under time limit is eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 30
        tanf_hardship_exception: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Adult at time limit without exception is ineligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 60
        tanf_hardship_exception: false
      expect: false

    - name: "Adult at time limit with hardship exception remains eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 60
        tanf_hardship_exception: true
      expect: true

    - name: "Minor always eligible regardless of months"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: true
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: false
        tanf_months_received: 120
        tanf_hardship_exception: false
      expect: true

    - name: "Adult exceeding limit with exception still eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 84
        tanf_hardship_exception: true
      expect: true

    - name: "Adult just below limit eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        is_adult_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_months_received: 59
        tanf_hardship_exception: false
      expect: true

variable tanf_months_remaining:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "TANF Months Remaining"
  description: "Months of federally-funded TANF assistance remaining"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Minors don't have limits
    if is_minor:
        return federal_time_limit_months
    remaining = federal_time_limit_months - tanf_months_received
    if remaining < 0:
        return 0
    return remaining
  default: 60
  tests:
    - name: "Full 60 months remaining with zero received"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        tanf_months_received: 0
      expect: 60

    - name: "30 months remaining after 30 received"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        tanf_months_received: 30
      expect: 30

    - name: "Zero months remaining at 60 received"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        tanf_months_received: 60
      expect: 0

    - name: "Zero months remaining when exceeding limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: false
        tanf_months_received: 72
      expect: 0

    - name: "Minor has full months available"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_minor: true
        tanf_months_received: 50
      expect: 60

documents.title: TANF Unit Adults
documents.code:
# Inputs for TANF sanctions
imports:
  - 42/607#tanf_work_requirement_exempt
  - 42/607#tanf_work_requirement_met

input tanf_unit_adults:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "TANF Unit Adults"
  description: "Count of adults in TANF unit"
  default: 1

input tanf_unit_size:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "TANF Unit Size"
  description: "Total persons in TANF unit"
  default: 1

input tanf_benefit_amount:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "TANF Benefit Amount"
  description: "TANF benefit amount (for calculating sanctions)"
  default: 0

input tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "TANF Benefit Before Sanctions"
  description: "TANF benefit amount before any sanctions applied"
  default: 0

input tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Uses Full-Family Work Sanction"
  description: "Whether state uses full-family sanction for work non-compliance"
  default: false

input cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Cooperating with Child Support"
  description: "Whether cooperating with child support enforcement"
  default: true

input is_tanf_recipient:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is TANF Recipient"
  description: "Whether person is receiving TANF"
  default: false

input tanf_irp_terms_met:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "IRP Terms Met"
  description: "Whether Individual Responsibility Plan terms are met"
  default: true

input tanf_sanction_level_input:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Sanction Level Input"
  description: "Current progressive sanction level (0-3)"
  default: 0

input child_care_unavailable_good_cause:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Child Care Unavailable"
  description: "Whether child care is unavailable as good cause"
  default: false

input domestic_violence_waiver:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Domestic Violence Waiver"
  description: "Whether domestic violence waiver applies"
  default: false

input temporary_illness:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Temporary Illness"
  description: "Whether temporary illness prevents work"
  default: false

input transportation_unavailable:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Transportation Unavailable"
  description: "Whether transportation is unavailable for work"
  default: false

input domestic_violence_risk:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Domestic Violence Risk"
  description: "Whether domestic violence risk exists"
  default: false

input child_support_not_in_child_interest:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Child Support Not in Interest"
  description: "Whether child support pursuit not in child's best interest"
  default: false

input conception_from_assault:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Conception from Assault"
  description: "Whether child conceived from rape or incest"
  default: false

parameter child_support_noncompliance_rate:
  description: "Minimum benefit reduction rate for child support non-cooperation"
  values:
    1996-01-01: 0.25
  label: "Child Support Sanction Rate"

variable tanf_work_good_cause:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Work Good Cause"
  description: "Whether good cause exists for work requirement non-compliance"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Federal regulations recognize good cause including:
    # - Child care unavailable (child under 6)
    # - Domestic violence
    # - Illness/incapacity (temporary)
    # - Transportation unavailable
    # - Other state-defined reasons
    if child_care_unavailable_good_cause:
        return True
    if domestic_violence_waiver:
        return True
    if temporary_illness:
        return True
    if transportation_unavailable:
        return True
    return False
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Child care unavailable is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: true
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Domestic violence is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: true
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Temporary illness is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: true
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Transportation unavailable is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: true
      expect: true
    - name: "No good cause when all conditions false"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: false

variable tanf_work_sanction_applicable:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_work_good_cause
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Work Sanction Applicable"
  description: "Whether work requirement sanction applies to individual"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sanction applies if:
    # - Required to participate in work activities
    # - Failed to participate without good cause
    # - Has been notified and given opportunity to cure
    if tanf_work_requirement_exempt:
        return False
    if tanf_work_requirement_met:
        return False
    # Sanction applies if not meeting requirement and no good cause
    return not tanf_work_good_cause
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Work sanction not applicable when exempt"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Work sanction not applicable when requirement met"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: true
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Work sanction applicable when not meeting requirement and no good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Work sanction not applicable with good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: true
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: false

variable tanf_work_sanction_amount:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_work_sanction_applicable
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "TANF Work Sanction Reduction"
  description: "Monthly benefit reduction due to work requirement non-compliance"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # States choose sanction approach:
    # 1. Pro-rata: Reduce by non-compliant adult's portion of benefit
    # 2. Full-family: Terminate entire family benefit
    # 3. Progressive: Escalate with repeated non-compliance
    # Count sanctioned adults
    sanctioned_adults = 1 if tanf_work_sanction_applicable else 0
    if sanctioned_adults == 0:
        return 0
    # Default to pro-rata sanction (adult portion of benefit)
    adult_share = tanf_benefit_amount * (sanctioned_adults / tanf_unit_size)
    return adult_share
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No work sanction when no one is sanctioned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        tanf_unit_size: 3
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Pro-rata sanction for one adult out of three"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        tanf_unit_size: 3
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: 200
    - name: "Pro-rata sanction for single adult"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 400
        tanf_unit_size: 1
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: 400

variable tanf_full_family_sanction_applies:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_work_sanction_applicable
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Full-Family Sanction"
  description: "Whether full-family sanction terminates entire benefit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # State-specific: Some states terminate entire benefit
    # for work non-compliance
    if not tanf_work_sanction_applicable:
        return False
    return tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Full-family sanction when state uses it and adult sanctioned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: true
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: true
    - name: "No full-family sanction when no adult sanctioned"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: true
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: false
    - name: "No full-family sanction when state does not use it"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: false
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
      expect: false

variable tanf_child_support_good_cause_exemption:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Child Support Good Cause"
  description: "Whether good cause exemption applies for child support cooperation"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Good cause includes:
    # - Risk of domestic violence
    # - Pursuit not in best interest of child
    # - Child conceived through rape or incest
    if domestic_violence_risk:
        return True
    if child_support_not_in_child_interest:
        return True
    if conception_from_assault:
        return True
    return False
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Domestic violence risk is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        domestic_violence_risk: true
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Child's best interest not served is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: true
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Conception from assault is good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: true
      expect: true
    - name: "No good cause when all conditions false"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: false

variable tanf_child_support_cooperation_met:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_child_support_good_cause_exemption
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Child Support Cooperation Met"
  description: "Whether unit cooperates with child support enforcement"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cooperation required unless good cause exemption
    if tanf_child_support_good_cause_exemption:
        return True
    return cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement
  default: true
  tests:
    - name: "Unit meets cooperation requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: true
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Unit fails cooperation requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Unit exempted from cooperation via good cause"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        domestic_violence_risk: true
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: true

variable tanf_child_support_sanction_amount:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_child_support_cooperation_met
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "TANF Child Support Sanction"
  description: "Benefit reduction for child support non-cooperation"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if tanf_child_support_cooperation_met:
        return 0
    # Federal minimum: At least 25% reduction
    return tanf_benefit_amount * child_support_noncompliance_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No sanction when cooperation requirement met"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: true
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "25% reduction for child support non-cooperation"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 400
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 100
    - name: "25% reduction applied to larger benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 1000
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 250

variable tanf_irp_required:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF Individual Responsibility Plan Required"
  description: "Whether Individual Responsibility Plan is required"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # States may require IRP as condition of benefits
    if is_tanf_recipient and not tanf_work_requirement_exempt:
        return True
    return False
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "IRP required for non-exempt TANF recipient"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
      expect: true
    - name: "IRP not required for exempt TANF recipient"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
      expect: false
    - name: "IRP not required for non-recipient"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_recipient: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
      expect: false

variable tanf_irp_compliance:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_irp_required
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "TANF IRP Compliance"
  description: "Whether individual complies with Individual Responsibility Plan"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if not tanf_irp_required:
        return True
    return tanf_irp_terms_met
  default: true
  tests:
    - name: "IRP compliance automatic when not required"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_recipient: false
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_irp_terms_met: false
      expect: true
    - name: "IRP compliance depends on terms when required"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_irp_terms_met: true
      expect: true
    - name: "IRP non-compliance when terms not met"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_tanf_recipient: true
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_irp_terms_met: false
      expect: false

variable tanf_sanction_level:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "TANF Sanction Level"
  description: "Current sanction level for progressive sanctions (0-3 typical)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Progressive sanctions typically:
    # Level 0: No sanction
    # Level 1: 25% reduction, 1 month minimum
    # Level 2: 50% reduction, 2 months minimum
    # Level 3: Full benefit, 3 months minimum or until compliance
    return tanf_sanction_level_input
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No sanction at level 0"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_sanction_level_input: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Level 1 sanction"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_sanction_level_input: 1
      expect: 1
    - name: "Level 3 sanction (full termination)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_sanction_level_input: 3
      expect: 3

variable tanf_total_sanction_amount:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_work_sanction_amount
    - 42/608#tanf_child_support_sanction_amount
    - 42/608#tanf_full_family_sanction_applies
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "TANF Total Sanctions"
  description: "Combined benefit reduction from all applicable sanctions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    work_sanction = tanf_work_sanction_amount
    child_support_sanction = tanf_child_support_sanction_amount
    # Full-family sanction supersedes other sanctions
    if tanf_full_family_sanction_applies:
        return tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions
    # Otherwise combine sanctions (capped at benefit amount)
    total = work_sanction + child_support_sanction
    return min(total, tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No total sanctions when no compliance issues"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: true
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 0
        tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions: 600
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Combined sanctions from work and child support"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions: 600
        tanf_unit_size: 3
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 350
    - name: "Full-family sanction overrides other sanctions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: true
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions: 600
        tanf_unit_size: 3
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 600

variable tanf_benefit_after_sanctions:
  imports:
    - 42/608#tanf_total_sanction_amount
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "TANF Benefit After Sanctions"
  description: "TANF benefit amount after applying all sanctions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    benefit = tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions
    sanctions = tanf_total_sanction_amount
    return max(0, benefit - sanctions)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Benefit unchanged when no sanctions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: true
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: true
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 0
        tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions: 600
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 600
    - name: "Benefit reduced by combined sanctions"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: false
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: false
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions: 600
        tanf_unit_size: 3
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 250
    - name: "Benefit reduced to zero by full-family sanction"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_work_requirement_exempt: false
        tanf_work_requirement_met: false
        cooperating_with_child_support_enforcement: true
        tanf_uses_full_family_work_sanction: true
        tanf_benefit_amount: 600
        tanf_benefit_amount_before_sanctions: 600
        tanf_unit_size: 1
        child_care_unavailable_good_cause: false
        domestic_violence_waiver: false
        temporary_illness: false
        transportation_unavailable: false
        domestic_violence_risk: false
        child_support_not_in_child_interest: false
        conception_from_assault: false
      expect: 0

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 608(a)
documents.code:
text: """
- 608(a)(1): Definition of "needy family" (state-defined)
"""
variable eligibility:
  imports:
    - 7/2014/a#snap_eligibility
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # States set their own need standards
    # Typical components (state parameters override these):
    # 1. Gross income test
    # 2. Net income test (after disregards)
    # 3. Resource/asset test
    gross_income_eligible = tanf_gross_income <= tanf_gross_income_limit
    net_income_eligible = tanf_countable_income <= tanf_need_standard
    resource_eligible = tanf_countable_resources <= tanf_resource_limit
    return gross_income_eligible and net_income_eligible and resource_eligible
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible family meeting all three tests"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_income: 1_500
        tanf_gross_income_limit: 2_000
        tanf_countable_income: 800
        tanf_need_standard: 1_000
        tanf_countable_resources: 1_500
        tanf_resource_limit: 2_000
      expect: true

    - name: "Ineligible due to gross income exceeding limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_income: 2_500
        tanf_gross_income_limit: 2_000
        tanf_countable_income: 800
        tanf_need_standard: 1_000
        tanf_countable_resources: 1_500
        tanf_resource_limit: 2_000
      expect: false

    - name: "Ineligible due to net income exceeding need standard"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_income: 1_500
        tanf_gross_income_limit: 2_000
        tanf_countable_income: 1_200
        tanf_need_standard: 1_000
        tanf_countable_resources: 1_500
        tanf_resource_limit: 2_000
      expect: false

    - name: "Ineligible due to resources exceeding limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_income: 1_500
        tanf_gross_income_limit: 2_000
        tanf_countable_income: 800
        tanf_need_standard: 1_000
        tanf_countable_resources: 2_500
        tanf_resource_limit: 2_000
      expect: false

    - name: "Eligible at exact threshold values"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_income: 2_000
        tanf_gross_income_limit: 2_000
        tanf_countable_income: 1_000
        tanf_need_standard: 1_000
        tanf_countable_resources: 2_000
        tanf_resource_limit: 2_000
      expect: true

    - name: "Ineligible with multiple tests failing"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_income: 3_000
        tanf_gross_income_limit: 2_000
        tanf_countable_income: 1_500
        tanf_need_standard: 1_000
        tanf_countable_resources: 3_000
        tanf_resource_limit: 2_000
      expect: false

documents.title: Section 42 USC § 608(b)
documents.code:
variable benefit_calculation:
  entity: TanfUnit
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return tanf_gross_earned_income + tanf_gross_unearned_income
  tests:
    - name: "No income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_earned_income: 0
        tanf_gross_unearned_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Earned income only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_earned_income: 1_500
        tanf_gross_unearned_income: 0
      expect: 1_500
    - name: "Unearned income only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_earned_income: 0
        tanf_gross_unearned_income: 800
      expect: 800
    - name: "Mixed income - low"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_earned_income: 500
        tanf_gross_unearned_income: 200
      expect: 700
    - name: "Mixed income - moderate"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_earned_income: 1_200
        tanf_gross_unearned_income: 400
      expect: 1_600
    - name: "Mixed income - high"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        tanf_gross_earned_income: 2_000
        tanf_gross_unearned_income: 1_000
      expect: 3_000

documents.code:
text: """
(2) Except as provided in paragraph (11), the State will make
payments only with respect to—
(A) households in which 1 or more individuals are receiving—
(i) assistance under the State program funded under part A of
title IV of the Social Security Act [TANF];
(ii) supplemental security income payments under title XVI of
the Social Security Act [SSI];
(iii) food stamps [SNAP] under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008;
(iv) payments under section 415, 521, 541, or 542 of title 38
[veterans benefits]; or
(B) households with incomes which do not exceed the greater of—
(i) 150 percent of the poverty level for such State; or
(ii) 60 percent of the State median income
"""

# 42 USC 8624(b) - LIHEAP Eligibility and Benefits
# Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program

# Inputs required for LIHEAP calculations
input household_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Size"
  description: "Number of persons in the household"
  default: 1

input annual_gross_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Annual Gross Income"
  description: "Total annual gross household income"
  default: 0

input receives_tanf:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives TANF"
  description: "Whether household member receives TANF benefits"
  default: false

input receives_ssi:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives SSI"
  description: "Whether household member receives SSI payments"
  default: false

input receives_snap:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives SNAP"
  description: "Whether household member receives SNAP benefits"
  default: false

input receives_veterans_benefits:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Veterans Benefits"
  description: "Whether household member receives VA pension/benefits under 38 USC 415/521/541/542"
  default: false

input has_elderly_member:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Elderly Member"
  description: "Whether household has a member age 60 or older"
  default: false

input has_disabled_member:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Disabled Member"
  description: "Whether household has a disabled member"
  default: false

input has_young_children:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Young Children"
  description: "Whether household has children under age 6"
  default: false

input annual_energy_costs:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Annual Energy Costs"
  description: "Total annual home energy costs"
  default: 0

# Federal Poverty Level parameters (annual, 48 contiguous states + DC)
# Source: HHS Poverty Guidelines
parameter fpl_base:
  values:
    2024-01-01: 15_060
    2023-01-01: 14_580
  unit: USD
  period: Year
  label: "Federal Poverty Level Base"
  description: "Annual FPL for 1-person household"

parameter fpl_additional_per_person:
  values:
    2024-01-01: 5_380
    2023-01-01: 5_140
  unit: USD
  period: Year
  label: "FPL Additional Per Person"
  description: "Annual FPL increment for each additional household member"

parameter fpl_percentage:
  values:
    1981-01-01: 1.50
  unit: /1
  period: Year
  label: "LIHEAP FPL Percentage"
  description: "Income limit as percentage of FPL (150%)"

# Calculated variables

variable liheap_fpl_annual:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "LIHEAP Annual FPL"
  description: "Annual Federal Poverty Level for household, scaled by size"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # FPL = base for 1 person + additional per person beyond 1
    extra_members = max(0, household_size - 1)
    return fpl_base + (fpl_additional_per_person * extra_members)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1}
      expect: 15_060
    - name: "Two-person household"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 2}
      expect: 20_440  # 15_060 + 5_380
    - name: "Three-person household"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 3}
      expect: 25_820  # 15_060 + (5_380 * 2)
    - name: "Four-person household"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 4}
      expect: 31_200  # 15_060 + (5_380 * 3)
    - name: "Large household (6 persons)"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 6}
      expect: 41_960  # 15_060 + (5_380 * 5)
    - name: "Prior year FPL (2023)"
      period: 2023
      inputs: {household_size: 1}
      expect: 14_580

variable liheap_income_limit:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "LIHEAP Income Limit"
  description: "Maximum income for LIHEAP eligibility (150% FPL)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return liheap_fpl_annual * fpl_percentage
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1}
      expect: 22_590  # 15_060 * 1.50
    - name: "Two-person household at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 2}
      expect: 30_660  # 20_440 * 1.50
    - name: "Three-person household at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 3}
      expect: 38_730  # 25_820 * 1.50
    - name: "Four-person household at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 4}
      expect: 46_800  # 31_200 * 1.50
    - name: "Large household (6 persons) at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 6}
      expect: 62_940  # 41_960 * 1.50
    - name: "Prior year income limit (2023)"
      period: 2023
      inputs: {household_size: 1}
      expect: 21_870  # 14_580 * 1.50

variable liheap_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "LIHEAP Categorically Eligible"
  description: "Categorical eligibility via TANF, SSI, SNAP, or VA benefits per 42 USC 8_624(b)(2)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 8624(b)(2)(A), households are eligible if any member receives:
    # (i) TANF, (ii) SSI, (iii) SNAP, or (iv) VA pension benefits
    return receives_tanf or receives_ssi or receives_snap or receives_veterans_benefits
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Receives TANF only"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {receives_tanf: true, receives_ssi: false, receives_snap: false, receives_veterans_benefits: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Receives SSI only"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {receives_tanf: false, receives_ssi: true, receives_snap: false, receives_veterans_benefits: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Receives SNAP only"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {receives_tanf: false, receives_ssi: false, receives_snap: true, receives_veterans_benefits: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Receives VA benefits only"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {receives_tanf: false, receives_ssi: false, receives_snap: false, receives_veterans_benefits: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Receives multiple benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {receives_tanf: true, receives_ssi: true, receives_snap: false, receives_veterans_benefits: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "No categorical benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {receives_tanf: false, receives_ssi: false, receives_snap: false, receives_veterans_benefits: false}
      expect: false

variable liheap_income_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "LIHEAP Income Eligible"
  description: "Income eligibility based on 150% FPL per 42 USC 8_624(b)(2)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 8624(b)(2)(B), income must not exceed 150% FPL
    # (or 60% state median income, but we use the FPL test as the baseline)
    return annual_gross_income <= liheap_income_limit
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Single person - income exactly at 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 22_590}
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person - income below 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 20_000}
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person - income just above 150% FPL"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 22_591}
      expect: false
    - name: "Four-person household - income at limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 4, annual_gross_income: 46_800}
      expect: true
    - name: "Four-person household - income over limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 4, annual_gross_income: 50_000}
      expect: false
    - name: "Zero income always eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 2, annual_gross_income: 0}
      expect: true

variable liheap_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "LIHEAP Eligible"
  description: "Overall LIHEAP eligibility per 42 USC 8_624(b)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Eligible if either:
    # (A) Categorically eligible via TANF/SSI/SNAP/VA benefits, OR
    # (B) Income does not exceed 150% FPL (or 60% state median income)
    return liheap_categorically_eligible or liheap_income_eligible
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Categorically eligible via SNAP, high income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 50_000
        receives_snap: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Income eligible, no categorical benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        annual_gross_income: 40_000
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Both categorical and income eligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 20_000
        receives_ssi: true
      expect: true
    - name: "High income, no categorical benefits - ineligible"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 50_000
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Single person at income threshold"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 22_590
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Large household with low income"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 6
        annual_gross_income: 35_000
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: true

variable liheap_priority_household:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "LIHEAP Priority Household"
  description: "Whether household qualifies for priority/enhanced benefits per 42 USC 8_624(b)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 42 USC 8624(b)(5), priority goes to households with:
    # (i) lowest incomes paying high proportion for energy
    # (ii) elderly members
    # (iii) disabled members
    # (iv) young children
    return has_elderly_member or has_disabled_member or has_young_children
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Household with elderly member"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: true, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Household with disabled member"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: false, has_disabled_member: true, has_young_children: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Household with young children"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: false, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: true}
      expect: true
    - name: "Household with multiple priority factors"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: true, has_disabled_member: true, has_young_children: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "No priority factors"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: false, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "All priority factors"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: true, has_disabled_member: true, has_young_children: true}
      expect: true

variable liheap_energy_burden:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "Energy Burden"
  description: "Ratio of energy costs to income, used in benefit targeting"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Energy burden = annual energy costs / annual income
    # High burden indicates priority for assistance
    if annual_gross_income <= 0:
      # Zero/negative income: cap burden at 1.0 (100%)
      return 1
    return min(1, annual_energy_costs / annual_gross_income)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Low energy burden (5%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_energy_costs: 2_500, annual_gross_income: 50_000}
      expect: 0.05
    - name: "Moderate energy burden (10%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_energy_costs: 3_000, annual_gross_income: 30_000}
      expect: 0.10
    - name: "High energy burden (20%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_energy_costs: 4_000, annual_gross_income: 20_000}
      expect: 0.20
    - name: "Very high energy burden (capped at 100%)"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_energy_costs: 5_000, annual_gross_income: 3_000}
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Zero income - maximum burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_energy_costs: 2_400, annual_gross_income: 0}
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Zero energy costs"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_energy_costs: 0, annual_gross_income: 40_000}
      expect: 0.0

documents.title: LIHEAP Energy Burden Factor
documents.text:
(5) the State will...provide, in a timely manner, that the highest level
of assistance will be furnished to those households which have the lowest
incomes and the highest energy costs or needs in relation to income,
taking into account family size, except that the State may not differentiate
in implementing this section between the households described in clauses
(2)(A) and (2)(B) of this subsection...
(A) ensure that the highest level of assistance will be provided to—
(i) households with the lowest incomes that pay a high proportion
of household income for home energy, taking into account
household size;
(ii) households containing the elderly;
(iii) households with disabled individuals; and
(iv) households with young children
documents.code:
text: """
(5) the State will...provide, in a timely manner, that the highest level
of assistance will be furnished to those households which have the lowest
incomes and the highest energy costs or needs in relation to income,
taking into account family size, except that the State may not differentiate
in implementing this section between the households described in clauses
(2)(A) and (2)(B) of this subsection...
(A) ensure that the highest level of assistance will be provided to—
(i) households with the lowest incomes that pay a high proportion
of household income for home energy, taking into account
household size;
(ii) households containing the elderly;
(iii) households with disabled individuals; and
(iv) households with young children
"""

parameter income_factor_weight:
  description: "Weight applied to income factor in benefit calculation"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 0.5

parameter burden_factor_weight:
  description: "Weight applied to energy burden factor in benefit calculation"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 0.5

parameter priority_multiplier:
  description: "Benefit multiplier for priority households"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 1.25

# NOTE: LIHEAP benefits are set by states, not a federal indexed value
# This is a placeholder for demonstration - actual amounts vary by state/year
parameter base_benefit_placeholder:
  description: "Placeholder base benefit amount (actual varies by state/year)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    1981-01-01: 500

parameter cooling_assistance_fraction:
  description: "Cooling assistance as fraction of total LIHEAP benefit"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 0.5

parameter income_factor_floor:
  description: "Minimum value for income factor in benefit calculation"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1981-01-01: 0.1

variable liheap_energy_burden_factor:
  imports: [42/8624/b#annual_gross_income, 42/8624/b#annual_energy_costs]
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "LIHEAP Energy Burden Factor"
  description: "Energy burden calculation per 42 USC 8_624(c)(5)(A)(i) - ratio of energy costs to income, used for benefit targeting"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Energy burden = energy costs / income
    # Handle zero income case
    if annual_gross_income <= 0:
        # If no income but has energy costs, burden is effectively infinite
        # Cap at 1.0 (100%) for calculation purposes
        return 1.0
    return min(1.0, annual_energy_costs / annual_gross_income)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Low income, high energy costs - high burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_gross_income: 15_000, annual_energy_costs: 3_000}
      expect: 0.2
    - name: "Moderate income, moderate energy costs"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_gross_income: 30_000, annual_energy_costs: 2_400}
      expect: 0.08
    - name: "High income, low relative energy costs"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_gross_income: 60_000, annual_energy_costs: 1_800}
      expect: 0.03
    - name: "Zero income - burden capped at 100%"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_gross_income: 0, annual_energy_costs: 2_000}
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Energy costs exceed income - capped at 100%"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_gross_income: 1_500, annual_energy_costs: 3_000}
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Zero energy costs - no burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {annual_gross_income: 25_000, annual_energy_costs: 0}
      expect: 0.0

variable liheap_income_factor:
  imports: [42/8624/b#annual_gross_income, 42/8624/b#liheap_income_limit]
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "LIHEAP Income Factor"
  description: "Income-based factor for benefit calculation - lower income yields higher factor"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Income factor: higher for lower incomes relative to income limit
    # Returns 1.0 for zero income, decreasing as income approaches limit
    if liheap_income_limit <= 0:
        return income_factor_floor
    ratio = annual_gross_income / liheap_income_limit
    # Factor = 1 - ratio, floored at minimum
    return max(income_factor_floor, 1 - ratio)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Zero income - maximum factor"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 0}
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Income at 50% of limit - factor 0.5"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 11_295}
      expect: 0.5
    - name: "Income at income limit - minimum factor"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 22_590}
      expect: 0.1
    - name: "Income above limit - floored at minimum"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 1, annual_gross_income: 30_000}
      expect: 0.1
    - name: "Four-person household at 25% of limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 4, annual_gross_income: 11_700}
      expect: 0.75
    - name: "Large household with very low income"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {household_size: 6, annual_gross_income: 6_294}
      expect: 0.9

variable liheap_combined_factor:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "LIHEAP Combined Benefit Factor"
  description: "Weighted combination of income and energy burden factors per 42 USC 8_624(c)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Combined factor = weighted average of income factor and energy burden factor
    # Per statute: target assistance to lowest incomes with highest energy burden
    return (income_factor_weight * liheap_income_factor) + (burden_factor_weight * liheap_energy_burden_factor)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Low income, high energy burden - high combined factor"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 5_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
      expect: 0.59
    - name: "Moderate income, moderate burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 15_330
        annual_energy_costs: 1_533
      expect: 0.30
    - name: "At income limit with low burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 22_590
        annual_energy_costs: 1_130
      expect: 0.075
    - name: "Zero income, high energy costs"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 0
        annual_energy_costs: 3_000
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Very low income, extreme energy burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        annual_gross_income: 5_000
        annual_energy_costs: 5_000
      expect: 0.90

variable liheap_priority_multiplier_applied:
  imports: [42/8624/b#liheap_priority_household]
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Rate
  unit: /1
  label: "LIHEAP Priority Multiplier Applied"
  description: "Benefit multiplier for priority households per 42 USC 8_624(c)(5)(A)(ii-iv)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Priority households receive enhanced benefits
    # Per 42 USC 8624(c)(5)(A): elderly, disabled, or young children
    if liheap_priority_household:
        return priority_multiplier
    return 1
  default: 1
  tests:
    - name: "Priority household with elderly - enhanced multiplier"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: true, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: false}
      expect: 1.25
    - name: "Priority household with disabled - enhanced multiplier"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: false, has_disabled_member: true, has_young_children: false}
      expect: 1.25
    - name: "Priority household with young children - enhanced multiplier"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: false, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: true}
      expect: 1.25
    - name: "Multiple priority factors - same multiplier"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: true, has_disabled_member: true, has_young_children: true}
      expect: 1.25
    - name: "Non-priority household - no enhancement"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: false, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: false}
      expect: 1.0
    - name: "Elderly and young children - enhanced"
      period: 2024
      inputs: {has_elderly_member: true, has_disabled_member: false, has_young_children: true}
      expect: 1.25

variable liheap_cooling_assistance:
  imports: [42/8624/b#liheap_eligible]
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "LIHEAP Cooling Assistance"
  description: "Home cooling assistance benefit per 42 USC 8_624(b)(1)(B) and (c)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Cooling assistance = base * combined_factor * priority_multiplier * cooling_fraction
    # Only eligible households receive benefits
    if not liheap_eligible:
        return 0
    base = base_benefit_placeholder
    factor = liheap_combined_factor
    priority = liheap_priority_multiplier_applied
    cooling = cooling_assistance_fraction
    return base * factor * priority * cooling
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible low-income priority household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 10_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
        has_elderly_member: true
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 184.38
    - name: "Eligible moderate-income non-priority"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 20_000
        annual_energy_costs: 1_600
