        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 54.45
    - name: "Categorically eligible via SNAP, low burden"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 50_000
        annual_energy_costs: 1_000
        receives_snap: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
      expect: 30.0
    - name: "Ineligible - income too high, no categorical benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 50_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Zero income with disabled member"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        annual_gross_income: 0
        annual_energy_costs: 3_000
        has_disabled_member: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_young_children: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 312.5
    - name: "Large family with young children at income limit"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 6
        annual_gross_income: 62_940
        annual_energy_costs: 3_147
        has_young_children: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 46.88

variable liheap_heating_assistance:
  imports: [42/8624/b#liheap_eligible]
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "LIHEAP Heating Assistance"
  description: "Home heating assistance benefit per 42 USC 8_624(b)(1)(A) and (c)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Heating assistance = base * combined_factor * priority_multiplier * (1 - cooling_fraction)
    # Heating gets the complement of cooling fraction
    if not liheap_eligible:
        return 0
    base = base_benefit_placeholder
    factor = liheap_combined_factor
    priority = liheap_priority_multiplier_applied
    heating_fraction = 1 - cooling_assistance_fraction
    return base * factor * priority * heating_fraction
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible low-income priority household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 10_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
        has_elderly_member: true
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 184.38
    - name: "Eligible moderate-income non-priority"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 20_000
        annual_energy_costs: 1_600
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 54.45
    - name: "Categorically eligible via SSI"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 40_000
        annual_energy_costs: 800
        receives_ssi: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
      expect: 27.5
    - name: "Ineligible household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 50_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Very low income with disabled member"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 5_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_500
        has_disabled_member: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_young_children: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 296.88
    - name: "Veterans benefits recipient"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 30_000
        annual_energy_costs: 1_500
        receives_veterans_benefits: true
        has_elderly_member: true
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
      expect: 57.81

variable liheap_total_assistance:
  imports: [42/8624/b#liheap_eligible]
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "LIHEAP Total Assistance"
  description: "Total LIHEAP assistance (heating + cooling) per 42 USC 8_624"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Total = heating + cooling, which equals base * combined_factor * priority_multiplier
    if not liheap_eligible:
        return 0
    return liheap_cooling_assistance + liheap_heating_assistance
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Total equals heating plus cooling"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 10_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
        has_elderly_member: true
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 368.75
    - name: "Non-priority eligible household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        annual_gross_income: 30_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_400
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 110.0
    - name: "Maximum benefit - zero income, high burden, priority"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        annual_gross_income: 0
        annual_energy_costs: 5_000
        has_disabled_member: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_young_children: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 625.0
    - name: "Ineligible - no benefits"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        annual_gross_income: 100_000
        annual_energy_costs: 3_000
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        has_young_children: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Family with young children"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 5
        annual_gross_income: 25_000
        annual_energy_costs: 2_000
        has_young_children: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
        receives_snap: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_veterans_benefits: false
      expect: 284.38
    - name: "TANF recipient priority household"
      period: 2024
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        annual_gross_income: 18_000
        annual_energy_costs: 1_800
        receives_tanf: true
        has_young_children: true
        has_elderly_member: false
        has_disabled_member: false
      expect: 200.78

documents.title: CCDF Benefit
documents.code:
# ---- Merged from benefit.rac ----

# 42 USC 9858c(c)(4) - CCDF Benefit (Child Care Subsidy)
#

parameter infant_max_months_center:
  description: "Maximum age in months for infant rate (center-based)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 18

parameter infant_max_months_home:
  description: "Maximum age in months for infant rate (home-based)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 24

parameter toddler_max_months_center:
  description: "Maximum age in months for toddler rate (center-based)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 24

parameter toddler_max_months_home:
  description: "Maximum age in months for toddler rate (home-based)"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 36

parameter preschool_max_years:
  description: "Maximum age in years for preschool rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 6

parameter months_per_year:
  description: "Number of months per year for monthly conversion"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1937-01-01: 12

parameter weekly_min_hours:
  description: "Minimum hours per week for weekly rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 30

parameter daily_min_hours:
  description: "Minimum hours per day for daily rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 6

parameter part_day_min_hours:
  description: "Minimum hours per day for part-day rate"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 3

parameter weeks_per_year:
  description: "Number of weeks per year for annualization"
  unit: /1
  values:
    1991-01-01: 52

variable benefit:
  entity: SPMUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CCDF Benefit"
  description: "Total annual CCDF child care benefit per 42 USC 9_858"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    age = this.age
    is_home_based = this.is_ccdf_home_based
    age_months = age * months_per_year
    # Age thresholds vary by provider type
    # Home-based care typically has different age group cutoffs
    # Infant: under infant_max_months (center) or (home)
    if (age_months < infant_max_months_center and not is_home_based) or (age_months < infant_max_months_home and is_home_based):
        return CCDFAgeGroup.INFANT
    # Toddler: under toddler_max_months
    if (age_months < toddler_max_months_center and not is_home_based) or (age_months < toddler_max_months_home and is_home_based):
        return CCDFAgeGroup.TODDLER
    # Preschooler: under preschool_max_years
    if age < preschool_max_years:
        return CCDFAgeGroup.PRESCHOOLER
    # School-age: preschool_max_years and above
    return CCDFAgeGroup.SCHOOL_AGE
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Infant (12 months) in center-based care"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 1
        is_ccdf_home_based: false
      expect: INFANT
    - name: "Infant (18 months) in center-based care at threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 1.5
        is_ccdf_home_based: false
      expect: INFANT
    - name: "Toddler (20 months) in center-based care"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 1.666
        is_ccdf_home_based: false
      expect: TODDLER
    - name: "Infant (20 months) in home-based care"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 1.666
        is_ccdf_home_based: true
      expect: INFANT
    - name: "Toddler (24 months) in home-based care at threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 2
        is_ccdf_home_based: true
      expect: TODDLER
    - name: "Preschooler (3 years) in any care type"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 3
        is_ccdf_home_based: false
      expect: PRESCHOOLER
    - name: "Preschooler (5 years) near maximum age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 5
        is_ccdf_home_based: true
      expect: PRESCHOOLER
    - name: "School-age (6 years) at preschool maximum"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 6
        is_ccdf_home_based: false
      expect: SCHOOL_AGE
    - name: "School-age (10 years) in any care type"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 10
        is_ccdf_home_based: true
      expect: SCHOOL_AGE


# ---- Merged from copayment.rac ----

# 42 USC 9858c(c)(4)(A) - CCDF Copayment (Sliding Fee Scale)
#

parameter smi_threshold_1:
  description: "First SMI bracket threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.5

parameter smi_threshold_2:
  description: "Second SMI bracket threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.65

parameter smi_threshold_3:
  description: "Third SMI bracket threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.75

parameter smi_threshold_4:
  description: "Fourth SMI bracket threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.85

parameter copay_rate_1:
  description: "Copay rate for income at or below first SMI threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.05

parameter copay_rate_2:
  description: "Copay rate for income between first and second SMI threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.1

parameter copay_rate_3:
  description: "Copay rate for income between second and third SMI threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.15

parameter copay_rate_4:
  description: "Copay rate for income between third and fourth SMI threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.2

parameter copay_rate_5:
  description: "Copay rate for income above fourth SMI threshold"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2015-01-01: 0.25

parameter maximum_percent_of_income:
  description: "Federal maximum copay as percentage of family income"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2014-09-30: 0.07

parameter minimum_weekly_fee:
  description: "Minimum copay fee per week"
  unit: USD
  period: Week
  values:
    2014-09-30: 1

variable copayment:
  imports:
  entity: SPMUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "CCDF Copay Amount"
  description: "Copayment amount per 42 USC 9858c(c)(4)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Get family income and poverty level
    family_income = this.ccdf_income
    poverty_level = this.spm_unit_fpg
    # Families at or below poverty level should have copay waived
    # per 42 USC 9858c(c)(4)(A)(i)
    if family_income <= poverty_level:
        return 0
    # Income in excess of poverty level
    income_above_fpl = max(family_income - poverty_level, 0)
    # Federal maximum copay guidance: 7% of family income
    max_copay_rate = maximum_percent_of_income
    # Calculate copay as percentage of income above FPL
    # This is a simplified federal framework
    # States typically use more complex sliding scales with brackets
    #
    # Common state approaches:
    # - Flat percentage of income above FPL (e.g., 10-35%)
    # - Bracketed schedules based on income ranges
    # - Per-child fees based on income level
    # Using income-based sliding scale (simplified)
    # Higher income = higher copay percentage
    income_to_smi = this.ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio
    # Graduated copay rate based on income level
    # (States set their own rates; this is illustrative)
    if income_to_smi <= smi_threshold_1:
        copay_rate = copay_rate_1   # First threshold or below
    elif income_to_smi <= smi_threshold_2:
        copay_rate = copay_rate_2   # Between first and second threshold
    elif income_to_smi <= smi_threshold_3:
        copay_rate = copay_rate_3   # Between second and third threshold
    elif income_to_smi <= smi_threshold_4:
        copay_rate = copay_rate_4   # Between third and fourth threshold
    elif income_to_smi > smi_threshold_4:
        copay_rate = copay_rate_5   # Above fourth threshold
    # Annual copay based on income above FPL
    calculated_copay = income_above_fpl * copay_rate
    # Apply maximum copay cap (7% of total income per federal guidance)
    max_copay = family_income * max_copay_rate
    # Ensure minimum fee (e.g., $1/week typical)
    min_annual_fee = minimum_weekly_fee * weeks_per_year
    # Copay is minimum of calculated and max, but at least the minimum fee
    copay_before_floor = min(calculated_copay, max_copay)
    return max(copay_before_floor, min_annual_fee)
  tests:
    - name: "Family at poverty level - copay waived"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 20_000
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.5
      expect: 0
    - name: "Family below poverty level - copay waived"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 15_000
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.4
      expect: 0
    - name: "Income at 50% SMI (lowest bracket)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 35_000
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.5
      expect: 750
    - name: "Income at 65% SMI (second bracket)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 45_500
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.65
      expect: 2550
    - name: "Income at 75% SMI (third bracket)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 52_500
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.75
      expect: 4875
    - name: "Income at 85% SMI (fourth bracket) - maximum allowed"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 59_500
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.85
      expect: 7900
    - name: "Income above 85% SMI (ineligible bracket)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 70_000
        spm_unit_fpg: 20_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 1.0
      expect: 4900
    - name: "Low income with 7% cap applied"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        ccdf_income: 30_000
        spm_unit_fpg: 18_000
        ccdf_income_to_smi_ratio: 0.45
      expect: 2100


# ---- Merged from eligibility.rac ----

# 42 USC 9858 - Child Care and Development Fund (CCDF) Eligibility
#

parameter maximum_age:
  description: "Standard maximum age for CCDF eligibility"
  unit: year
  values:
    1990-01-01: 13

parameter maximum_age_with_disability:
  description: "Maximum age for CCDF eligibility with disability"
  unit: year
  values:
    1990-01-01: 19

parameter smi_income_limit_pct:
  description: "State Median Income threshold for CCDF income eligibility"
  unit: /1
  values:
    2014-09-30: 0.85

variable eligibility:
  imports:
  entity: SPMUnit
  period: Year
  dtype: Integer
  unit: USD
  label: "Number of CCDF Eligible Children"
  description: "Count of children eligible for CCDF in the assistance unit"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    age = this.age
    # Standard age limit: under 13
    standard_limit = maximum_age
    # Extended limit for children with disabilities: under 19
    disability_limit = maximum_age_with_disability
    # Check if child has a disability
    has_disability = this.is_disabled
    # Age eligible if under standard limit, or under disability limit with disability
    if has_disability:
        age_limit = disability_limit
    elif not has_disability:
        age_limit = standard_limit
    return age < age_limit
  tests:
    - name: "Infant (6 months) eligible - standard age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 0
        is_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Toddler (2 years) eligible - standard age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 2
        is_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Preschooler (5 years) eligible - standard age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 5
        is_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "School-age (12 years) eligible - standard age"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 12
        is_disabled: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 13 ineligible - exceeds standard limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 13
        is_disabled: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 14 ineligible unless disabled"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 14
        is_disabled: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Age 14 eligible with disability"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 14
        is_disabled: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 18 eligible with disability - below 19 limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 18
        is_disabled: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Age 19 ineligible even with disability - exceeds limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        age: 19
        is_disabled: true
      expect: false


# ---- Merged from index.rac ----

# 42 USC 9858 - Child Care and Development Fund (CCDF)
#

documents.title: Household Member Count
documents.code:
#
# Defines what constitutes a "household" for ACP eligibility purposes.

text: """
47 USC 1752(a)(2) - Household Definition

(2) Eligible household.— The term "eligible household" means,
regardless of whether the household or any member of the household
receives support under subpart E of part 54 of title 47, Code of
Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation), a household in
which at least 1 member—
(A) meets the qualifications...
"""

# Household composition inputs for ACP

input household_member_count:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Member Count"
  description: "Number of individuals in the household"
  default: 1

input household_address_residential:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Residential Address"
  description: "Whether household has a residential address (not commercial)"
  default: true

input household_single_subscription:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Single Subscription Household"
  description: "Whether household receives only one ACP benefit (per address rule)"
  default: true

variable acp_valid_household:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Valid Household"
  description: "Whether the group qualifies as a household for ACP purposes per 47 USC 1752(a)(2)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be a residential address with at least one member
    # Only one ACP benefit per household address
    return household_member_count >= 1 and household_address_residential and household_single_subscription
  default: true
  tests:
    - name: "Valid single-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_member_count: 1
        household_address_residential: true
        household_single_subscription: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Valid multi-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_member_count: 4
        household_address_residential: true
        household_single_subscription: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Invalid - non-residential address"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_member_count: 2
        household_address_residential: false
        household_single_subscription: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Invalid - duplicate subscription at address"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_member_count: 2
        household_address_residential: true
        household_single_subscription: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Invalid - zero members"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_member_count: 0
        household_address_residential: true
        household_single_subscription: true
      expect: false

documents.title: Household Size
documents.code:
# Inputs for ACP eligibility
input household_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Size"
  description: "Number of persons in household"
  default: 1

input gross_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Gross Income"
  description: "Monthly gross household income"
  default: 0

input is_on_tribal_land:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "On Tribal Land"
  description: "Whether household is located on Tribal land"
  default: false

input receives_snap:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives SNAP"
  description: "Whether any member receives SNAP"
  default: false

input receives_medicaid:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Medicaid"
  description: "Whether any member receives Medicaid"
  default: false

input receives_ssi:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives SSI"
  description: "Whether any member receives SSI"
  default: false

input receives_section_8:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Section 8"
  description: "Whether any member receives Section 8 housing"
  default: false

input receives_veterans_pension:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Veterans Pension"
  description: "Whether any member receives Veterans Pension"
  default: false

input receives_pell_grant:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Pell Grant"
  description: "Whether any member receives Federal Pell Grant"
  default: false

input receives_free_school_meals:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Free School Meals"
  description: "Whether any member receives free school meals"
  default: false

input receives_reduced_price_school_meals:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Reduced Price Meals"
  description: "Whether any member receives reduced price school meals"
  default: false

input receives_wic:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives WIC"
  description: "Whether any member receives WIC"
  default: false

input receives_fdpir:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives FDPIR"
  description: "Whether any member receives Food Distribution on Indian Reservations"
  default: false

input receives_bia_general_assistance:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives BIA General Assistance"
  description: "Whether any member receives BIA general assistance"
  default: false

input receives_tribal_tanf:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Tribal TANF"
  description: "Whether any member receives Tribal TANF"
  default: false

input receives_head_start:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives Head Start"
  description: "Whether any member receives Head Start"
  default: false

# Parameters
parameter acp_standard_benefit:
  description: "Standard monthly ACP benefit"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-04-01: 0
    2021-11-15: 30
  label: "ACP Standard Benefit"

parameter fpg_limit:
  description: "FPL percentage limit for ACP eligibility"
  values:
    2021-11-15: 2.0
  label: "ACP FPL Limit"

parameter months_per_year:
  description: "Months per year for annual conversion"
  values:
    2021-11-15: 12
  label: "Months Per Year"

parameter fpl_base:
  description: "Annual FPL base for 1-person household"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 15_060
    2023-01-01: 14_580
  label: "FPL Base"

parameter fpl_additional_per_person:
  description: "Annual FPL additional per person"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-01-01: 5_380
    2023-01-01: 5_140
  label: "FPL Additional Per Person"

variable acp_categorically_eligible:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_school_meal_eligible
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_pell_grant_eligible
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_wic_eligible
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_lifeline_categorical_eligible
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_tribal_program_eligible
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Categorically Eligible"
  description: "Eligible through any qualifying program per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)(B)-(F)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return acp_school_meal_eligible or acp_pell_grant_eligible or acp_wic_eligible or acp_lifeline_categorical_eligible or acp_tribal_program_eligible
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Categorically eligible through SNAP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_snap: true
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Categorically eligible through free school meals"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: true
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Categorically eligible through tribal program"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: true
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Not categorically eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: false

variable acp_eligible:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_income_eligible
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_categorically_eligible
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Eligible"
  description: "Overall Affordable Connectivity Program eligibility per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Check if program is active (benefit amount > 0)
    if acp_standard_benefit <= 0:
    return false
    # Eligible if income-based OR categorically eligible
    return acp_income_eligible or acp_categorically_eligible
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Income eligible when program active"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 2000
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Categorically eligible when program active"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        gross_income: 5_000
        receives_snap: true
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Ineligible (over income and no categorical)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 5_000
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Program inactive (benefit=$0)"
      period: 2024-04
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 2000
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Both income and categorical eligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 3_000
        receives_snap: true
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
        receives_pell_grant: false
        receives_wic: false
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true

variable acp_fpl_threshold:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACP FPL Income Limit"
  description: "200% of Federal Poverty Level for household size per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    extra_members = max(0, household_size - 1)
    annual_fpl = fpl_base + (fpl_additional_per_person * extra_members)
    # Return monthly threshold at 200% FPL
    return (annual_fpl * fpg_limit) / months_per_year
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 2510
    - name: "Two person household threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 3429.17
    - name: "Three person household threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
      expect: 4348.33
    - name: "Four person household threshold"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 5267.5
    - name: "Large household (10 persons)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 10
      expect: 10555


variable acp_income_eligible:
  imports: [47/1752/a/6#acp_fpl_threshold]
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Income Eligible"
  description: "Household income at or below 200% FPL per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Use gross income per 47 CFR 54.400(f)
    return gross_income <= acp_fpl_threshold
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Single person at threshold (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 2_510
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person below threshold (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 2000
      expect: true
    - name: "Single person above threshold (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 2_511
      expect: false
    - name: "Four person family at threshold (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 5267.5
      expect: true
    - name: "Four person family well below threshold (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 3_500
      expect: true
    - name: "Four person family above threshold (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 5_500
      expect: false
    - name: "Zero income (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 0
      expect: true

variable acp_lifeline_categorical_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Lifeline Categorical Eligibility"
  description: "Eligible through Lifeline qualifying program participation per 47 CFR 54.409(b)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Lifeline qualifying programs per 47 CFR 54.409(b)
    return receives_snap or receives_medicaid or receives_ssi or receives_section_8 or receives_veterans_pension
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "SNAP recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_snap: true
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Medicaid recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: true
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
      expect: true
    - name: "SSI recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: true
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Section 8 recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: true
        receives_veterans_pension: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Veterans Pension recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Multiple programs (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_snap: true
        receives_medicaid: true
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
      expect: true
    - name: "No qualifying programs (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_snap: false
        receives_medicaid: false
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_section_8: false
        receives_veterans_pension: false
      expect: false

variable acp_on_tribal_land:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Household on Tribal Land"
  description: "Household located on Tribal land for enhanced benefit per 47 USC 1_752(a)(7)"
  formula: return is_on_tribal_land
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Household on tribal land"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_on_tribal_land: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Household not on tribal land"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_on_tribal_land: false
      expect: false


variable acp_pell_grant_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Pell Grant Eligibility"
  description: "Eligible through Federal Pell Grant receipt per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)(C)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # At least one member received Pell Grant in current award year
    return receives_pell_grant
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Household with Pell Grant recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_pell_grant: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Household without Pell Grant recipient (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_pell_grant: false
      expect: false


variable acp_school_meal_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP School Meal Eligibility"
  description: "Eligible through free or reduced price school lunch/breakfast per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # At least one member approved for free or reduced price meals
    return receives_free_school_meals or receives_reduced_price_school_meals
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Household with free school meal recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_free_school_meals: true
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Household with reduced price meal recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Household with both free and reduced meals (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        receives_free_school_meals: true
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Household with no school meals (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_free_school_meals: false
        receives_reduced_price_school_meals: false
      expect: false


variable acp_tribal_program_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Tribal Program Eligibility"
  description: "Eligible through tribal-specific programs per 47 CFR 54.409(b)(4)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return receives_fdpir or receives_bia_general_assistance or receives_tribal_tanf or receives_head_start
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "FDPIR recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_fdpir: true
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "BIA general assistance recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: true
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Tribal TANF recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: true
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Head Start recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Multiple tribal programs (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        receives_fdpir: true
        receives_bia_general_assistance: true
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: true
    - name: "No tribal programs (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_fdpir: false
        receives_bia_general_assistance: false
        receives_tribal_tanf: false
        receives_head_start: false
      expect: false


variable acp_wic_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP WIC Eligibility"
  description: "Eligible through WIC participation per 47 USC 1_752(a)(6)(E)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # At least one member receives WIC
    return receives_wic
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "WIC recipient (eligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_wic: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Non-WIC recipient (ineligible)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        receives_wic: false
      expect: false

documents.title: Broadband Monthly Charge
documents.text:
...a monthly discount...in an amount equal to such amount charged,
but not more than $30, or, if an internet service offering is
provided to an eligible household on Tribal land, not more than $75.
documents.code:
input broadband_monthly_charge:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Broadband Monthly Charge"
  description: "Monthly charge for broadband service"
  default: 0

parameter months_per_year:
  description: "Months per year for annual conversion"
  values:
    2021-11-15: 12
  label: "Months Per Year"

parameter standard_benefit:
  description: "Standard monthly ACP benefit"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-04-01: 0
    2021-11-15: 30
  label: "ACP Standard Benefit"

parameter tribal_benefit:
  description: "Tribal land monthly ACP benefit"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2024-04-01: 0
    2021-11-15: 75
  label: "ACP Tribal Benefit"

variable acp_annual_benefit:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/7#acp_benefit
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACP Annual Benefit"
  description: "Annualized ACP benefit for household"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum monthly benefits across the year
    # Note: ACP benefit ended April 2024
    return acp_benefit * months_per_year
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Standard monthly benefit annualized"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 50
      expect: 360
    - name: "Tribal benefit annualized"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 80
      expect: 900
    - name: "No benefit when ineligible"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 30
      expect: 0
    - name: "Program inactive (zero benefit)"
      period: 2024-04
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 50
      expect: 0

# 47 USC 1752(a)(7) - ACP Monthly Benefit Amount
#

text: """
...a monthly discount...in an amount equal to such amount charged,
but not more than $30, or, if an internet service offering is
provided to an eligible household on Tribal land, not more than $75.
"""
variable acp_benefit:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_eligible
    - 47/1752/a/7#acp_max_benefit
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACP Monthly Benefit"
  description: "Monthly discount equal to amount charged, up to maximum per 47 USC 1_752(a)(7)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be eligible to receive benefit
    if not acp_eligible:
      return 0
    # Benefit is lesser of actual charge or maximum benefit
    # "in an amount equal to such amount charged, but not more than..."
    return min(broadband_monthly_charge, acp_max_benefit)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Charge less than standard benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 20
      expect: 20
    - name: "Charge exceeds standard benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 50
      expect: 30
    - name: "Charge equals standard benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 30
      expect: 30
    - name: "Charge less than tribal benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 50
      expect: 50
    - name: "Charge exceeds tribal benefit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 100
      expect: 75
    - name: "Ineligible household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        broadband_monthly_charge: 30
      expect: 0


variable acp_max_benefit:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_on_tribal_land
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACP Maximum Monthly Benefit"
  description: "Maximum monthly benefit: $75 on Tribal land, $30 otherwise per 47 USC 1_752(a)(7)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    if acp_on_tribal_land:
      return tribal_benefit
    return standard_benefit
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Standard benefit (not on tribal land)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_on_tribal_land: false
      expect: 30
    - name: "Tribal benefit (on tribal land)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_on_tribal_land: true
      expect: 75
    - name: "Program ended (zero benefit)"
      period: 2024-04
      inputs:
        is_on_tribal_land: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Program ended on tribal land (zero benefit)"
      period: 2024-04
      inputs:
        is_on_tribal_land: true
      expect: 0

documents.title: Enrolled in ACP
documents.text:
(3) LIMITATION.—An eligible household may receive only 1 affordable
connectivity benefit under this section.
documents.code:
text: """
(3) LIMITATION.—An eligible household may receive only 1 affordable
connectivity benefit under this section.
"""

input is_enrolled_in_acp:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Enrolled in ACP"
  description: "Whether household is already enrolled in ACP with another provider"
  default: false

variable acp_already_receiving:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Already Receiving Benefit"
  description: "Household already enrolled in ACP with another provider"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Input variable tracked via National Lifeline Accountability Database
    return is_enrolled_in_acp
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Household already enrolled in ACP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_enrolled_in_acp: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Household not enrolled in ACP"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_enrolled_in_acp: false
      expect: false


variable acp_enrollment_eligible:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_eligible
    - 47/1752/b#acp_already_receiving
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Enrollment Eligible"
  description: "Eligible to enroll in ACP (meets requirements and not already receiving)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be eligible for ACP
    if not acp_eligible:
      return false
    # Cannot already be receiving benefit
    if acp_already_receiving:
      return false
    return true
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible and not already receiving"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_enrolled_in_acp: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Eligible but already receiving from another provider"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        is_enrolled_in_acp: true
      expect: false


# ---- Merged from acp_total_value.rac ----

# 47 USC 1752 - Total ACP Value
#
variable acp_total_value:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/7#acp_annual_benefit
    - 47/1752/b/5#acp_device_subsidy
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Total ACP Value"
  description: "Total annual value of ACP benefits (broadband + device)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Annual broadband benefit + one-time device subsidy (if eligible)
    return acp_annual_benefit + acp_device_subsidy
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Only broadband benefit (no device)"
      inputs:
        acp_annual_benefit: 360
        acp_device_subsidy: 0
      expect: 360
    - name: "Broadband and device subsidy"
      inputs:
        acp_annual_benefit: 360
        acp_device_subsidy: 100
      expect: 460
    - name: "Device subsidy only"
      inputs:
        acp_annual_benefit: 0
        acp_device_subsidy: 100
      expect: 100
    - name: "No benefits"
      inputs:
        acp_annual_benefit: 0
        acp_device_subsidy: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Tribal benefit with device"
      inputs:
        acp_annual_benefit: 900
        acp_device_subsidy: 100
      expect: 1000

documents.title: Connected Device Copay
documents.text:
(5) Connected device.--
(A) In general.--A participating provider may be reimbursed under this section
for the cost of a connected device if the charge to such eligible household for
such connected device is more than $10 but less than $50.
(B) Limitation.--A reimbursement under subparagraph (A) shall be not more than
$100 per connected device and shall be provided to not more than one connected
device per eligible household.
documents.code:
text: """
(5) Connected device.--
(A) In general.--A participating provider may be reimbursed under this section
for the cost of a connected device if the charge to such eligible household for
such connected device is more than $10 but less than $50.
(B) Limitation.--A reimbursement under subparagraph (A) shall be not more than
$100 per connected device and shall be provided to not more than one connected
device per eligible household.
"""

# Parameters for device subsidy
parameter acp_device_min_copay:
  description: "Minimum copay for connected device per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)(A)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2021-11-15: 10

parameter acp_device_max_copay:
  description: "Maximum copay for connected device per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)(A)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2021-11-15: 50

parameter acp_device_max_reimbursement:
  description: "Maximum reimbursement per device per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)(B)"
  unit: USD
  values:
    2021-11-15: 100

# Input for device copay
input connected_device_copay:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Connected Device Copay"
  description: "Amount household pays for connected device"
  default: 0

# Input for prior device receipt
input has_received_acp_device:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Received ACP Device"
  description: "Whether household has previously received ACP-subsidized device"
  default: false

variable acp_device_copay_valid:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Device Copay Valid"
  description: "Device copay is more than $10 but less than $50 per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)(A)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Copay must be > $10 and < $50 per (b)(5)(A)
    return connected_device_copay > acp_device_min_copay and connected_device_copay < acp_device_max_copay
  default: false


variable acp_device_received:
  entity: Household
  period: Year
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Device Already Received"
  description: "Whether household has previously received subsidized connected device per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)(B)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Input variable - tracked externally via National Lifeline Database
    return has_received_acp_device
  default: false


variable acp_device_eligible:
  imports:
    - 47/1752/a/6#acp_eligible
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "ACP Connected Device Eligible"
  description: "Eligible for connected device subsidy per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be ACP eligible per (a)(6)
    if not acp_eligible:
      return false
    # Check if program is active
    if acp_device_max_reimbursement <= 0:
      return false
    # Cannot have already received a device per (b)(5)(B)
    if acp_device_received:
      return false
    # Copay must be in valid range per (b)(5)(A)
    if not acp_device_copay_valid:
      return false
    return true
  default: false


variable acp_device_subsidy:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "ACP Connected Device Subsidy"
  description: "One-time subsidy up to $100 for connected device per 47 USC 1_752(b)(5)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be eligible for device subsidy
    if not acp_device_eligible:
      return 0
    # Subsidy is up to $100 per (b)(5)(B)
    return acp_device_max_reimbursement
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Eligible household with valid copay"
      inputs:
        acp_eligible: true
        connected_device_copay: 25
        has_received_acp_device: false
      expect: 100
    - name: "Copay too low (under $10)"
      inputs:
        acp_eligible: true
        connected_device_copay: 5
        has_received_acp_device: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Copay too high (over $50)"
      inputs:
        acp_eligible: true
        connected_device_copay: 60
        has_received_acp_device: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Already received device"
      inputs:
        acp_eligible: true
        connected_device_copay: 25
        has_received_acp_device: true
      expect: 0
    - name: "Not ACP eligible"
      inputs:
        acp_eligible: false
        connected_device_copay: 25
        has_received_acp_device: false
      expect: 0

documents.title: SNAP Eligible
documents.text:
7 USC 2014(a) - Eligible Households

(a) Eligible households.— Participation in the supplemental nutrition
assistance program shall be limited to those households whose incomes
and other financial resources, held singly or in joint ownership, are
determined to be a substantial limiting factor in permitting them to
obtain a more nutritious diet.
documents.code:
text: """
7 USC 2014(a) - Eligible Households

(a) Eligible households.— Participation in the supplemental nutrition
assistance program shall be limited to those households whose incomes
and other financial resources, held singly or in joint ownership, are
determined to be a substantial limiting factor in permitting them to
obtain a more nutritious diet.
"""

# 7 USC 2014(a) - General SNAP Eligibility Framework
# This subsection establishes the general principle that eligibility
# is limited to households with income/resource constraints.
# Specific tests are defined in other subsections:
# - (c) income tests
# - (g) resource limits
# - (j) categorical eligibility

imports:
  - 7/2014/c#snap_gross_income_eligible
  - 7/2014/c#snap_net_income_eligible
  - 7/2014/g#snap_resource_eligible
  - 7/2014/j#snap_categorically_eligible

variable snap_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP Eligible"
  description: "Whether household meets all SNAP eligibility requirements per 7 USC 2014"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 7 USC 2014(a): eligibility based on income and resources
    # Per 7 USC 2014(j): categorical eligibility bypasses some tests
    if snap_categorically_eligible:
        # Categorically eligible households bypass gross income and resource tests
        # but must still pass net income test in most states
        return snap_net_income_eligible
    # Regular eligibility: must pass all three tests
    return snap_gross_income_eligible and snap_net_income_eligible and snap_resource_eligible
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Regular household passes all three tests"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        snap_categorically_eligible: false
        snap_gross_income_eligible: true
        snap_net_income_eligible: true
        snap_resource_eligible: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Regular household fails gross income test only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        snap_categorically_eligible: false
        snap_gross_income_eligible: false
        snap_net_income_eligible: true
        snap_resource_eligible: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Regular household fails net income test only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        snap_categorically_eligible: false
        snap_gross_income_eligible: true
        snap_net_income_eligible: false
        snap_resource_eligible: true
      expect: false
    - name: "Regular household fails resource test only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        snap_categorically_eligible: false
        snap_gross_income_eligible: true
        snap_net_income_eligible: true
        snap_resource_eligible: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Categorical eligibility bypasses gross/resource tests"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        snap_categorically_eligible: true
        snap_gross_income_eligible: false
        snap_net_income_eligible: true
        snap_resource_eligible: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Categorical eligibility still requires net income test"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        snap_categorically_eligible: true
        snap_gross_income_eligible: true
        snap_net_income_eligible: false
        snap_resource_eligible: true
      expect: false

documents.title: Household Size
documents.text:
(2) households... shall have... gross income that does not exceed
130 percent of the poverty line... and net income that does not
exceed 100 percent of the poverty line
(2) Elderly and disabled exemption from gross income test
documents.code:
text: """
(2) households... shall have... gross income that does not exceed
130 percent of the poverty line... and net income that does not
exceed 100 percent of the poverty line
(2) Elderly and disabled exemption from gross income test
"""

input household_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Size"
  description: "Number of persons in the SNAP household"
  default: 1

input has_elderly_disabled:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Elderly or Disabled Member"
  description: "Whether household has member 60+ or disabled"
  default: false

input gross_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Gross Income"
  description: "Total gross monthly income before deductions"
  default: 0

imports:
  - 7/2014/e#snap_net_income

parameter fpl_base:
  values:
    2024-01-01: 1_255
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "Federal Poverty Level Base"
  description: "Monthly FPL for 1-person household"

parameter fpl_additional_per_person:
  values:
    2024-01-01: 440
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "FPL Additional Per Person"
  description: "Monthly FPL increment for each additional person"

parameter gross_income_limit_pct:
  values:
    1977-01-01: 1.30
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Gross Income Limit"
  description: "Gross income must be at or below this percentage of FPL"

parameter net_income_limit_pct:
  values:
    1977-01-01: 1.00
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Net Income Limit"
  description: "Net income must be at or below this percentage of FPL"

variable snap_fpl_monthly:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Monthly FPL"
  description: "Monthly Federal Poverty Level for household, scaled by size"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # FPL = base for 1 person + additional per person beyond 1
    extra_members = max(0, household_size - 1)
    return fpl_base + (fpl_additional_per_person * extra_members)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 1}
      expect: 1255  # Base only
    - name: "Two-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 2}
      expect: 1695  # 1255 + 440
    - name: "Four-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 4}
      expect: 2575  # 1255 + (440 * 3)

variable snap_gross_income_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP Gross Income Eligible"
  description: "Whether household passes 130% FPL gross income test (elderly/disabled exempt)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 2014(c)(2): Elderly/disabled exempt from gross income test
    if has_elderly_disabled:
        return True
    gross_limit = snap_fpl_monthly * gross_income_limit_pct
    return gross_income <= gross_limit
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Income at 130% FPL limit for 1-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 1, gross_income: 1631.50, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true  # 1255 * 1.30 = 1631.50
    - name: "Income exceeds 130% FPL for 1-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 1, gross_income: 1_632, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "Income exceeds limit but household has elderly/disabled"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 1, gross_income: 5_000, has_elderly_disabled: true}
      expect: true  # Categorical exemption
    - name: "4-person household at 130% FPL limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 4, gross_income: 3347.50, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true  # 2575 * 1.30 = 3347.50
    - name: "4-person household exceeds limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 4, gross_income: 3_348, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: false

variable snap_net_income_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP Net Income Eligible"
  description: "Whether household passes 100% FPL net income test after deductions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    net_limit = snap_fpl_monthly * net_income_limit_pct
    return snap_net_income <= net_limit
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Net income at 100% FPL limit for 1-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 1, snap_net_income: 1_255, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Net income exceeds 100% FPL for 1-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 1, snap_net_income: 1_256, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "Net income at 100% FPL limit for 2-person household"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 2, snap_net_income: 1_695, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true  # 1255 + 440
    - name: "Net income below limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 3, snap_net_income: 1_000, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Zero net income"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {household_size: 2, snap_net_income: 0, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true

documents.code:

  - 7/2014/e/4#snap_child_support_deduction

parameter standard_deduction_schedule:

  unit: USD
  period: Month
  values:
    2024-10-01: [200, 211, 247, 283]
    2023-10-01: [198, 208, 244, 279]
    2022-10-01: [193, 197, 230, 263]
    2021-10-01: [177, 184, 215, 246]

parameter excess_shelter_rate:

parameter earned_income_deduction_rate:

  unit: /1

parameter shelter_deduction_cap:
  description: "Maximum shelter deduction for non-elderly/disabled households"
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Shelter Deduction Cap"
  values:
    2024-10-01: 672
    2023-10-01: 624
    2022-10-01: 597
    2021-10-01: 586

variable snap_total_deductions:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Total Deductions"
  description: "Sum of all SNAP income deductions"
  formula: return snap_pre_shelter_deductions + snap_shelter_deduction
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person, no deductions"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        earned_income: 0
        gross_income: 0
        shelter_costs: 0
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 200
    - name: "Family of 4 with earned income only"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        earned_income: 1_000
        gross_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 0
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 483
    - name: "Family of 4 with earned income and shelter no cap"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        earned_income: 1_000
        gross_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 500
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 633
    - name: "Family of 4 with earned income and shelter at cap"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        earned_income: 1_000
        gross_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 1_500
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 1155

variable snap_standard_deduction:
  imports: [26/1#cut]
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Standard Deduction"
  description: "Monthly standard deduction based on household size"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Standard deduction varies by household size: 1-3 same, 4, 5, 6+ maximum
    # Use cut() to look up amount from schedule by household size
    return cut(household_size, standard_deduction_schedule)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person standard deduction"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 200
    - name: "Two person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 200
    - name: "Three person household (same as 1-2)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
      expect: 200
    - name: "Four person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 211
    - name: "Five person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 5
      expect: 247
    - name: "Large household (6+)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 6
      expect: 283
    - name: "Large household (8 persons)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 8
      expect: 283
    - name: "Prior year 2023"
      period: 2023-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 208
    - name: "Prior year 2022"
      period: 2022-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 197

variable snap_earned_income_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Earned Income Deduction"
  description: "20% of gross earned income deducted before other calculations"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return earned_income * earned_income_deduction_rate
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No earned income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        earned_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Small earned income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        earned_income: 100
      expect: 20
    - name: "Average earned income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        earned_income: 1_000
      expect: 200
    - name: "High earned income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        earned_income: 3_000
      expect: 600
    - name: "Very high earned income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        earned_income: 5_000
      expect: 1000

variable snap_pre_shelter_deductions:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Pre-Shelter Deductions"
  description: "Sum of all deductions before excess shelter calculation"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Sum all deductions that apply before shelter
    return snap_earned_income_deduction + snap_standard_deduction + snap_dependent_care_deduction + snap_child_support_deduction + snap_medical_expense_deduction
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Only standard deduction"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        earned_income: 0
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 200
    - name: "Earned income and standard deduction"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        earned_income: 500
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 300
    - name: "All deductions combined"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        earned_income: 1_000
        dependent_care_expenses: 200
        child_support_paid: 150
        medical_expenses: 100
      expect: 650
    - name: "Large household with multiple deductions"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        earned_income: 2000
        dependent_care_expenses: 300
        child_support_paid: 200
        medical_expenses: 150
      expect: 1261

variable snap_adjusted_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Adjusted Income"
  description: "Gross income minus pre-shelter deductions, used for shelter calculation"
  formula: return max(0, gross_income - snap_pre_shelter_deductions)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No income, standard deduction only"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 0
        earned_income: 0
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Income exceeds deductions"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 1_000
        earned_income: 500
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 700
    - name: "Deductions exceed income (capped at zero)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 500
        earned_income: 500
        dependent_care_expenses: 100
        child_support_paid: 50
        medical_expenses: 100
      expect: 0
    - name: "Family of 4, moderate income and deductions"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 1_500
        earned_income: 1_000
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 1189

variable snap_shelter_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Shelter Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for shelter costs exceeding 50% of adjusted income"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 2014(e)(6)(A): Excess = shelter costs - 50% of adjusted income
    adjusted = snap_adjusted_income
    excess = shelter_costs - (adjusted * excess_shelter_rate)
    if excess <= 0:
        return 0
    # Section 2014(e)(6)(C): No cap for elderly/disabled households
    if has_elderly_disabled:
        return excess
    # Section 2014(e)(6)(B): Cap for non-elderly/disabled households
    return min(excess, shelter_deduction_cap)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No shelter costs"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 1_000
        earned_income: 500
        shelter_costs: 0
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Shelter below 50% of adjusted income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 1_000
        earned_income: 500
        shelter_costs: 200
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Shelter at 50% adjusted, no deduction"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 1_000
        earned_income: 500
        shelter_costs: 350
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Shelter exceeds 50%, below cap"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 1_200
        earned_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 600
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 110
    - name: "Shelter excess exceeds cap"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 2000
        earned_income: 2000
        shelter_costs: 1_500
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 672
    - name: "Elderly/disabled, excess above cap still applies"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 1_500
        earned_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 2000
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 1000
    - name: "Shelter deduction cap prior year 2023"
      period: 2023-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 2000
        earned_income: 2000
        shelter_costs: 1_500
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 624

variable snap_net_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Net Income"
  description: "Monthly income after all SNAP deductions, used for benefit calculation"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    return max(0, snap_adjusted_income - snap_shelter_deduction)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No income at all"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 0
        earned_income: 0
        shelter_costs: 0
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single person with low income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 400
        earned_income: 200
        shelter_costs: 300
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single person moderate income and housing"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 1_000
        earned_income: 800
        shelter_costs: 400
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 360
    - name: "Family of 4 standard case"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 1_500
        earned_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 700
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 0
        child_support_paid: 0
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 288
    - name: "Family of 4 with full deductions"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 2000
        earned_income: 1_600
        shelter_costs: 900
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        dependent_care_expenses: 150
        child_support_paid: 100
        medical_expenses: 50
      expect: 0

  entity: Household

  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Dependent Care Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for dependent care expenses necessary for work or training"
  syntax: python

    # Section 2014(e)(3): Actual dependent care costs necessary for work/training

  label: "SNAP Child Support Deduction"
