documents.code:
text: """
(5) that portion of actual costs of medical expenses in excess of $35 per month,
for any elderly or disabled member, including transportation costs necessary
to secure medical treatment or services
"""

input has_elderly_disabled:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Elderly or Disabled Member"
  description: "Whether household has member 60+ or disabled"
  default: false

input medical_expenses:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Medical Expenses"
  description: "Monthly out-of-pocket medical expenses for elderly/disabled members"
  default: 0

parameter medical_expense_threshold:
  values:
    1977-01-01: 35
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Medical Expense Deduction Threshold"
  description: "Monthly threshold above which medical expenses are deductible"

variable snap_medical_expense_deduction:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Medical Expense Deduction"
  description: "Deduction for medical expenses over $35/month for elderly/disabled members"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Only available for elderly/disabled households
    if not has_elderly_disabled:
        return 0
    # Section 2014(e)(5): Deduct expenses in excess of threshold
    excess = medical_expenses - medical_expense_threshold
    return max(0, excess)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: non_elderly_disabled_household_no_deduction
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        medical_expenses: 200
      expect: 0

    - name: elderly_disabled_expenses_below_threshold
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expenses: 25
      expect: 0

    - name: elderly_disabled_expenses_at_threshold
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expenses: 35
      expect: 0

    - name: elderly_disabled_expenses_above_threshold
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expenses: 100
      expect: 65

    - name: elderly_disabled_high_medical_expenses
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expenses: 1_000
      expect: 965

    - name: elderly_disabled_zero_expenses
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        has_elderly_disabled: true
        medical_expenses: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Bank Account Balances
documents.text:
(1) The Secretary shall prescribe the types and allowable amounts of financial
resources (liquid and nonliquid assets) an eligible household may own...

documents.code:
text: """
(1) The Secretary shall prescribe the types and allowable amounts of financial
resources (liquid and nonliquid assets) an eligible household may own...
(1)(B) ...increased for households with elderly or disabled members
"""

input bank_accounts:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Bank Account Balances"
  description: "Total balance in checking and savings accounts"
  default: 0

input cash_on_hand:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Cash on Hand"
  description: "Physical cash not deposited in bank accounts"
  default: 0

input stocks:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Stocks Value"
  description: "Fair market value of stocks"
  default: 0

input bonds:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Bonds Value"
  description: "Fair market value of bonds"
  default: 0

input other_financial_assets:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Other Financial Assets"
  description: "Value of other non-exempt financial assets"
  default: 0

input vehicle_fair_market_value:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Vehicle Fair Market Value"
  description: "Fair market value of countable vehicle(s)"
  default: 0

input has_elderly_disabled:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Elderly or Disabled Member"
  description: "Whether household has member 60+ or disabled"
  default: false

parameter vehicle_exclusion:
  description: "Fair market value exclusion for one vehicle"
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Vehicle Exclusion"
  values:
    1977-01-01: 4_650

parameter resource_limit:
  description: "Resource limit for non-elderly/disabled households"
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Resource Limit"
  values:
    2024-10-01: 2_750
    2023-10-01: 2_750
    2022-10-01: 2_500

parameter resource_limit_elderly_disabled:
  description: "Resource limit for households with elderly/disabled members"
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  label: "SNAP Resource Limit (Elderly/Disabled)"
  values:
    2024-10-01: 4_250
    2023-10-01: 4_250
    2022-10-01: 3_750

variable snap_countable_resources:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Countable Resources"
  description: "Total countable resources for SNAP after applying exclusions"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Start with liquid assets
    liquid = bank_accounts + cash_on_hand
    # Add non-exempt financial assets
    financial = stocks + bonds + other_financial_assets
    # Section 2014(g)(2)(B): One vehicle excluded up to fair market value limit
    vehicle_excess = max(0, vehicle_fair_market_value - vehicle_exclusion)
    return liquid + financial + vehicle_excess
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Liquid assets only, no vehicle"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 1_000, cash_on_hand: 500, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 0}
      expect: 1500
    - name: "Vehicle within exclusion limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 500, cash_on_hand: 0, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 4_650}
      expect: 500  # Vehicle not counted (at exclusion limit)
    - name: "Vehicle exceeds exclusion by $500"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 0, cash_on_hand: 0, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 5_150}
      expect: 500  # Only excess above $4,650 counts
    - name: "All asset types combined"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 1_000, cash_on_hand: 200, stocks: 500, bonds: 300, other_financial_assets: 400, vehicle_fair_market_value: 5_000}
      expect: 2700  # 1000+200+500+300+400+350 vehicle excess

variable snap_resource_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP Resource Eligible"
  description: "Whether household's countable resources are within SNAP limits"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 2014(g)(1)(B): Higher limit for elderly/disabled households
    if has_elderly_disabled:
        limit = resource_limit_elderly_disabled
    else:
        limit = resource_limit
    return snap_countable_resources <= limit
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Regular household at resource limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 2_750, cash_on_hand: 0, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 0, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true  # At $2,750 limit
    - name: "Regular household exceeds resource limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 2_751, cash_on_hand: 0, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 0, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "Elderly/disabled household at higher limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 4_250, cash_on_hand: 0, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 0, has_elderly_disabled: true}
      expect: true  # At $4,250 limit
    - name: "Elderly/disabled household exceeds higher limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 4_251, cash_on_hand: 0, stocks: 0, bonds: 0, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 0, has_elderly_disabled: true}
      expect: false
    - name: "Regular household well below limit"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {bank_accounts: 1_000, cash_on_hand: 500, stocks: 300, bonds: 200, other_financial_assets: 0, vehicle_fair_market_value: 0, has_elderly_disabled: false}
      expect: true

input disaster_declaration_date:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Disaster Declaration Date"
  description: "Date of disaster declaration (YYYYMMDD format)"
  default: 0

variable snap_disaster_resource_exclusion:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Disaster Resource Exclusion"
  description: "Resources excluded from SNAP calculations during disaster per 7 USC 2014(h)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Disaster assistance is typically excluded from countable resources
    if disaster_affected:
        return disaster_assistance_received
    return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Disaster-affected household excludes assistance"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        disaster_affected: true
        disaster_assistance_received: 5000
      expect: 5000
    - name: "Non-disaster household no exclusion"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        disaster_affected: false
        disaster_assistance_received: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Disaster-affected no assistance"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        disaster_affected: true
        disaster_assistance_received: 0
      expect: 0

documents.title: Receives SSI
documents.text:
7 USC 2014(j) - Categorical Eligibility

(j) Categorical eligibility.—
(1) General rule.— Subject to the limitations in subsection (i) and
section 2015(d)(4)(I) and (j)(5), a household shall be considered to
be a categorically eligible household if all members of the household
receive or are authorized to receive—
(A) assistance under a State program funded under part A of title
IV of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 601 et seq.) [TANF], or
(B) supplemental security income benefits under title XVI of the
Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1381 et seq.) [SSI], or
(C) general assistance under State programs that confer equivalent
benefits.
documents.code:
text: """
7 USC 2014(j) - Categorical Eligibility

(j) Categorical eligibility.—
(1) General rule.— Subject to the limitations in subsection (i) and
section 2015(d)(4)(I) and (j)(5), a household shall be considered to
be a categorically eligible household if all members of the household
receive or are authorized to receive—
(A) assistance under a State program funded under part A of title
IV of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 601 et seq.) [TANF], or
(B) supplemental security income benefits under title XVI of the
Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1381 et seq.) [SSI], or
(C) general assistance under State programs that confer equivalent
benefits.
"""

# 7 USC 2014(j) - Categorical Eligibility for SNAP
# Households receiving certain assistance are categorically eligible

input receives_ssi:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives SSI"
  description: "Whether any household member receives Supplemental Security Income per 2014(j)(1)(B)"
  default: false

input receives_tanf:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives TANF"
  description: "Whether household receives TANF cash assistance per 2014(j)(1)(A)"
  default: false

input receives_general_assistance:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Receives General Assistance"
  description: "Whether household receives state/local General Assistance per 2014(j)(1)(C)"
  default: false

variable snap_categorically_eligible:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP Categorically Eligible"
  description: "Whether household is categorically eligible per 7 USC 2014(j)"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Per 7 USC 2014(j)(1): households receiving TANF, SSI, or GA are
    # categorically eligible and bypass gross income and resource tests
    return receives_ssi or receives_tanf or receives_general_assistance
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "Household with no categorical eligibility"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_general_assistance: false
      expect: false
    - name: "Household receives SSI only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_ssi: true
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_general_assistance: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Household receives TANF only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: true
        receives_general_assistance: false
      expect: true
    - name: "Household receives General Assistance only"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
        receives_general_assistance: true
      expect: true
    - name: "Household receives both SSI and TANF"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs:
        receives_ssi: true
        receives_tanf: true
        receives_general_assistance: false
      expect: true

documents.title: Age
documents.code:
input age:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Age"
  description: "Age in years"
  default: 0

input is_disabled:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Disabled"
  description: "Whether person has a qualifying disability"
  default: false

input is_pregnant:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Is Pregnant"
  description: "Whether person is currently pregnant"
  default: false

input has_dependent_child:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Dependent Child"
  description: "Whether person is responsible for a dependent child"
  default: false

input work_hours_monthly:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Monthly Work Hours"
  description: "Hours worked per month"
  default: 0

input in_snap_employment_training:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "In SNAP E&T Program"
  description: "Whether enrolled in SNAP Employment & Training program"
  default: false

parameter abawd_min_age:
  description: "Minimum age for ABAWD work requirements"
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  label: "ABAWD Minimum Age"
  values:
    1977-01-01: 18

parameter abawd_max_age:
  description: "Maximum age for ABAWD work requirements"
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  label: "ABAWD Maximum Age"
  values:
    2025-10-01: 54
    2024-10-01: 52
    2023-10-01: 50

parameter abawd_work_hours:
  description: "Required monthly work hours for ABAWD compliance"
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  label: "ABAWD Monthly Work Hours"
  values:
    1977-01-01: 80

variable is_snap_abawd:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Subject to SNAP ABAWD Requirements"
  description: "Whether individual is an Able-Bodied Adult Without Dependents subject to work requirements"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Section 2015(o)(2): Definition of ABAWD
    # - Aged 18-54 (as of 2025 phase-in per Fiscal Responsibility Act)
    # - Not disabled
    # - Not responsible for dependent child
    # - Not pregnant
    # - Not exempt from work registration
    in_age_range = age >= abawd_min_age and age <= abawd_max_age
    is_exempt = is_disabled or is_pregnant or has_dependent_child
    return in_age_range and not is_exempt
  default: false
  tests:
    - name: "25-year-old able-bodied no dependents (ABAWD subject)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 25, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "35-year-old with dependent child (exempt from ABAWD)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 35, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: true, has_dependent_child: false}
      expect: false  # Pregnant exemption
    - name: "45-year-old disabled (exempt from ABAWD)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 45, is_disabled: true, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "17-year-old below age range (exempt)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 17, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "55-year-old above age range (exempt)"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 55, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false}
      expect: false

variable snap_abawd_work_requirement_met:
  entity: Person
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "SNAP ABAWD Work Requirement Met"
  description: "Whether ABAWD individual meets 80 hour/month work requirement"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Not subject to ABAWD rules = automatically meets requirement
    if not is_snap_abawd:
        return True
    # Section 2015(o)(2): Must work 80+ hours/month
    # or participate in qualifying work program
    working = work_hours_monthly >= abawd_work_hours
    return working or in_snap_employment_training
  default: true
  tests:
    - name: "ABAWD individual meets work requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 30, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false, work_hours_monthly: 80, in_snap_employment_training: false}
      expect: true  # 80 hours meets requirement
    - name: "ABAWD individual exceeds work requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 30, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false, work_hours_monthly: 100, in_snap_employment_training: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "ABAWD individual below work hours but in E&T"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 30, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false, work_hours_monthly: 50, in_snap_employment_training: true}
      expect: true  # E&T fulfills requirement
    - name: "ABAWD individual fails work requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 30, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false, work_hours_monthly: 79, in_snap_employment_training: false}
      expect: false
    - name: "Non-ABAWD (age 60) automatically meets requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 60, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: false, work_hours_monthly: 0, in_snap_employment_training: false}
      expect: true
    - name: "Person with dependent child (exempt from ABAWD) meets requirement"
      period: 2024-01
      inputs: {age: 30, is_disabled: false, is_pregnant: false, has_dependent_child: true, work_hours_monthly: 0, in_snap_employment_training: false}
      expect: true

documents.title: Household Size
documents.text:
The value of the allotment... shall be equal to the cost of the
thrifty food plan... reduced by an amount equal to 30 per centum
of the household's income
documents.code:
text: """
The value of the allotment... shall be equal to the cost of the
thrifty food plan... reduced by an amount equal to 30 per centum
of the household's income
"""

input household_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Size"
  description: "Number of persons in the SNAP household"
  default: 1

imports:
  - 7/2014/e#snap_net_income
  - 7/2014/a#snap_eligible

parameter max_allotment_schedule:
  description: "SNAP maximum allotment by household size, for use with cut()"
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  values:
    2024-10-01: [292, 536, 768, 975, 1158, 1390, 1536, 1756]
    2023-10-01: [291, 535, 766, 973, 1155, 1386, 1532, 1751]
    2022-10-01: [281, 516, 740, 939, 1116, 1339, 1480, 1691]

parameter max_schedule_size:
  description: "Maximum household size with specific allotment in schedule"
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  values:
    1977-01-01: 8

parameter additional_per_person:
  description: "USDA adds this amount for each person beyond 8 in the SNAP household."
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  values:
    2024-10-01: 220
    2023-10-01: 219
    2022-10-01: 211

parameter minimum_benefit_max_size:
  description: "Maximum household size eligible for minimum benefit"
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  values:
    1977-01-01: 2

parameter minimum_amount:
  description: "USDA guarantees this minimum monthly benefit for 1-2 person SNAP households."
  unit: USD
  period: Month
  values:
    2024-10-01: 23
    2023-10-01: 23
    2022-10-01: 23
    2014-10-01: 16

parameter contribution_rate:
  description: "Household contribution as share of net income"
  unit: /1
  period: Month
  values:
    1977-01-01: 0.30

variable snap_max_allotment:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Maximum Allotment"
  description: "Maximum monthly SNAP benefit based on Thrifty Food Plan for household size"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Maximum allotments by household size (48 states + DC)
    # Sizes 1-8 have specific amounts; beyond max_schedule_size, add per-person increment
    if household_size <= max_schedule_size:
        # Look up from schedule (index = size - 1)
        return max_allotment_schedule[household_size - 1]
    else:
        # Beyond max schedule size: base amount + additional per extra member
        base = max_allotment_schedule[max_schedule_size - 1]
        extra_members = household_size - max_schedule_size
        return base + (additional_per_person * extra_members)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 292
    - name: "Two person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 536
    - name: "Three person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
      expect: 768
    - name: "Four person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 975
    - name: "Five person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 5
      expect: 1158
    - name: "Six person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 6
      expect: 1390
    - name: "Seven person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 7
      expect: 1536
    - name: "Eight person household (max schedule)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 8
      expect: 1756
    - name: "Nine person household (base + 1 person)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 9
      expect: 1976
    - name: "Ten person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 10
      expect: 2196
    - name: "Large household (15 persons)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 15
      expect: 3316
    - name: "Prior year 2023 single person"
      period: 2023-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 291
    - name: "Prior year 2023 family of 4"
      period: 2023-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 973

variable snap_expected_contribution:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Expected Contribution"
  description: "Expected household contribution toward food costs (30% of net income)"
  formula: return round(snap_net_income * contribution_rate)
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "No net income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 0
      expect: 0
    - name: "Small net income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 100
      expect: 30
    - name: "Moderate net income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        snap_net_income: 500
      expect: 150
    - name: "Large net income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        snap_net_income: 1_000
      expect: 300
    - name: "Very large net income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 6
        snap_net_income: 2_500
      expect: 750
    - name: "Rounding test (0.4 cents rounds down)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 1
      expect: 0
    - name: "Rounding test (0.5 cents rounds to nearest)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 333.33
      expect: 100

variable snap_calculated_benefit:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Calculated Benefit"
  description: "SNAP benefit calculated as maximum allotment minus expected contribution"
  formula: return snap_max_allotment - snap_expected_contribution
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person, no contribution"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 0
      expect: 292
    - name: "Single person with contribution"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 100
      expect: 262
    - name: "Family of 4, low contribution"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        snap_net_income: 500
      expect: 825
    - name: "Family of 4, high contribution"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        snap_net_income: 1_500
      expect: 525
    - name: "Benefit reduced to zero by contribution"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        snap_net_income: 1_000
      expect: -8

variable snap_minimum_benefit:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Minimum Benefit"
  description: "Minimum monthly SNAP benefit for 1-2 person households"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Minimum benefit only applies to households at or below minimum_benefit_max_size
    if household_size <= minimum_benefit_max_size:
        return minimum_amount
    else:
        return 0
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Single person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 23
    - name: "Two person household"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 23
    - name: "Three person household (no minimum)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
      expect: 0
    - name: "Four person household (no minimum)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
      expect: 0
    - name: "Large household (no minimum)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 10
      expect: 0
    - name: "Prior year 2014"
      period: 2014-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
      expect: 16
    - name: "Prior year 2014 two person"
      period: 2014-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
      expect: 16

variable snap_allotment:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "SNAP Allotment"
  description: "Final monthly SNAP benefit amount"
  syntax: python
  formula: |
    # Must be eligible to receive benefits
    if not snap_eligible:
        return 0
    # Apply minimum benefit floor for 1-2 person households
    benefit = max(snap_calculated_benefit, snap_minimum_benefit)
    # Cannot exceed maximum allotment
    return max(0, min(benefit, snap_max_allotment))
  default: 0
  tests:
    - name: "Ineligible household due to income/resources"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 5_000
        earned_income: 5_000
        shelter_costs: 0
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 0
    - name: "Single person, zero net income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 0
        earned_income: 0
        shelter_costs: 0
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 292
    - name: "Single person, high income (still eligible, minimum benefit)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 1
        gross_income: 1_200
        earned_income: 1_200
        shelter_costs: 500
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 23
    - name: "Two person household, low income (minimum benefit)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 1_000
        earned_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 600
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 23
    - name: "Family of 4, moderate income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 1_500
        earned_income: 1_500
        shelter_costs: 700
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 545
    - name: "Family of 4, higher income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 4
        gross_income: 2_200
        earned_income: 2_000
        shelter_costs: 1_000
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 342
    - name: "Categorical eligibility via TANF with high income"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 2
        gross_income: 2_000
        earned_income: 2_000
        shelter_costs: 800
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 4_000
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: true
      expect: 23
    - name: "Three person household standard case"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 3
        gross_income: 1_200
        earned_income: 1_000
        shelter_costs: 600
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 668
    - name: "Large household (8 persons)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 8
        gross_income: 3_000
        earned_income: 3_000
        shelter_costs: 1_400
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 1_256
    - name: "Very large household (15 persons)"
      period: 2024-10
      inputs:
        household_size: 15
        gross_income: 5_000
        earned_income: 5_000
        shelter_costs: 2_000
        has_elderly_disabled: false
        bank_accounts: 0
        receives_ssi: false
        receives_tanf: false
      expect: 1_795

documents.title: Household Size
documents.code:
#
# This is the top-level SNAP benefit variable that returns the final allotment
# after eligibility checks and benefit calculations.
#
# Citations:
# - 7 USC 2011-2036 (Food and Nutrition Act of 2008)
# - 7 USC 2014 - Eligibility disqualifications
# - 7 USC 2017 - Value of allotment

imports:
  - 7/2017/a#snap_allotment
  - 7/2014/a#snap_eligible
  - 7/2017/a#snap_max_allotment
  - 7/2017/a#snap_expected_contribution
  - 7/2017/a#snap_calculated_benefit
  - 7/2017/a#snap_minimum_benefit
  - 7/2014/e#snap_net_income
  - 7/2014/c#snap_gross_income_eligible
  - 7/2014/c#snap_net_income_eligible
  - 7/2014/g#snap_resource_eligible
  - 7/2014/g#snap_countable_resources

input household_size:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Integer
  label: "Household Size"
  description: "Number of persons in the SNAP household"
  default: 1

input gross_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Gross Income"
  description: "Total gross monthly income before deductions"
  default: 0

input earned_income:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Earned Income"
  description: "Monthly gross earned income from employment"
  default: 0

input shelter_costs:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Shelter Costs"
  description: "Monthly housing costs including rent/mortgage, utilities, property taxes"
  default: 0

input has_elderly_disabled:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Boolean
  label: "Has Elderly or Disabled Member"
  description: "Whether household has member 60+ or disabled"
  default: false

input bank_accounts:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
  unit: USD
  label: "Bank Account Balances"
  description: "Total balance in checking and savings accounts"
  default: 0

input cash_on_hand:
  entity: Household
  period: Month
  dtype: Money
